Description: We are looking for a visual designer to help us redefine the future of work and communicate complex ideas in a simple and visually appealing way.At Friday, we believe the future of work is a more flexible work environment and that remote work is only the tip of the iceberg. We’re building software to give people awareness and visibility into what’s going on at work, regardless of where the team is based. Remote teams love the software and 87% of our users say it improves the remote work experience.Think of Friday as a digital work planner or a sidekick to workplace chat tools like Slack or Microsoft Teams. The software bundles the best practices of remote teams and makes it easy for any team to roll these work habits out in less time and with less stress. This is especially important as millions of people were forced to work remotely due to Covid-19. The software is used by leading teams at Twitter, Red Hat, EA, and more.About the RoleWe seek an independent, self-motivated designer who can take initiative and work autonomously. You will report directly with the CEO and work directly with a product/ux designer on visual and creative projects that share the story about the software and how our customers use it. Think of this role like a creative director, but more hands on.Responsibilities: Create product overview videos (visual animation, storytelling, post-production, etc) that will be used to educate our audience and teach important product concepts Create fun and visually appealing illustrations that will be used on our marketing website and throughout the product Educate customers and users about remote work through explainer videos and other visual assets like ebooks, blog posts, and more Maybe help us launch a podcast?For this role, we are looking for a breadth of visual design skills due to the variety of projects you would be responsible for. We’d really like someone who has an interest in video/animation/illustration.Requirements Portfolio of work you’d be willing to share Ability to work autonomously Strong aesthetic skills with the ability to combine various colors, fonts and layouts Ability to meet deadlines while working on team projectsOther things you should know about the roleThe role is flexible, but some of these projects can be accelerated if we meet up in-person, especially for the first-part of the program.

Description: About Oncorus:Oncorus, Inc. (Cambridge, MA) is an early-stage biotechnology company developing a next-generation oncolytic virus immunotherapy platform to treat cancer. We are seeking a highly motivated, skilled, and enthusiastic co-op to join our Analytical Development team within the CMC department. The successful candidate will contribute to Oncorus’ programs by supporting the testing and characterization of our viral and synthetic drug products. This position provides an excellent opportunity to learn a wealth of new techniques and concepts while contributing to the development of promising new cancer therapies.Analytical Development Co-Op:The co-op will be expected to execute experiments independently, collect data, and report on their findings in a well-planned and coordinated manner. The co-op will assist with the development of chromatography methods, light scattering techniques, and plate-based assays to characterize lipid nanoparticles. In addition, the co-op will work cross-functionally to support process development efforts. Strong organizational skills and the ability to work effectively within a team environment are required.The ideal candidate will be flexible and willing to learn on the fly and should be excited by technical challenges and the ability to grow as a scientist.Responsibilities and Opportunities:· Develop chromatographic methods to characterize nucleic acids and lipids· Refine light scattering techniques to characterize nanoparticles· Optimize plate-based assays for high-throughput analysis of drug products· Collaborate with upstream and downstream teams to support process development and product characterization· Support routine analytical testing work as needed· Document work in an electronic laboratory notebook and report findings to the team in presentation format· Assist with regular maintenance of mammalian cell lines, critical laboratory reagents and troubleshooting of advanced equipmentOur Ideal Candidate:· Currently a 2nd or 3rd year student enrolled in a 4 or 5 year undergraduate program in Chemical/Biochemical Science or Engineering· Previous hands-on laboratory experience a plus (particularly with HPLC, DLS, or fluorescence assays)· Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word· Pays close attention to detail and keeps careful laboratory notes concurrently as work is performed· Displays a high degree of maturity, honesty, trust and integrity· Self-starter who can learn on the job and volunteer to tackle jobs to help the team· Demonstrates the ability to work well in a team environment

Description: Software Engineer, Back End - Boston (Remote)About the RoleTeikametrics is looking for a software engineer with strong computer science fundamentals and a background in application development.Feature teams at Teikametrics currently focus on Python-powered Flask APIs servicing data out of Postgres, which is in turn filled from Snowflake tables, in turn filled by DBT. We also have a 'functional-first' Scala stack with cats, fs2, akka-http, and slick. These back ends power a front-end that uses TypeScript with React and Redux.At Teikametrics, you will: Write code primarily in React and contribute to our web application’s front end. Become an essential member of a team of ~3-6 engineers, frequently pair programming. Learn, grow, and receive mentorship from individual members of your diverse and talented engineering team. Actively contribute to our development roadmap and to the evolution of our software platform. Collaborate and communicate with our other development teams. Read and review pull requests. Participate in planning meetings, retros, and other scrum meetings.Qualified candidates should have: Experience with Python. Knowledge of and experience with databases (especially SQL/RDBMS experience). Experience with writing code that interfaces with the database layer. Experience writing well designed and testable code and writing effective unit and integration tests. Passion for working with a small team of world-class developers, solving challenging problems. A desire to work in a collaborative environment focusing on continuous learning; participating in tech talks, code review, and some pair programming.Nice to have: Experience Scala, Java, Haskell, or related languages. Experience with functional programming. Experience with our React or TypeScript.ABOUT TEIKAMETRICSAt Teikametrics, we’re building an operating system to optimize every aspect of a retailer's business -- from advertising to inventory to pricing. We optimize billions of transactions for thousands of entrepreneurs and brands around the world selling on Amazon and other marketplaces. The Teikametrics Retail Optimization Platform uses proprietary econometrics and machine-learning data models packaged in a simple SaaS interface. We combine our best in class technology with coaching and support from our world-class teams based remotely and in Boston, MA, Seattle, WA, Tel Aviv, Israel and Bengaluru, India. We are looking for people who can excel, add value to our mission, and thrive in a demanding start-up environment.

Position: Dunn Lab Co-Op Research Assistant (Brain Health Initiative)
Location: Nationwide United States Boston, Massachusetts United States
Targeted Academic Majors: Bouve College of Health Sciences, College of Science, College of Social Science & Humanities
Workplace Type: Remote work is permitted when public health concerns dictate, Primarily remote work
Desired Skills: Quantitative and Qualitative Analysis, Clinical Research, Data Entry, Literature Reviews, Attention to Detail, Collaborative Working, Scientific Writing, Brain Research, Databases
Description: The Dunn Lab (http://www.thedunnlab.com/) is looking to hire a highly motivated and enthusiastic co-op Research Assistant (RA) to support ongoing efforts of the Brain Health Initiative (BHI) (https://brainhealthinitiative.org). The Dunn lab is based in the Psychiatric and Neurodevelopmental Genetics Unit (PNGU) within the Center for Genomic Medicine and Department of Psychiatry. We are a multidisciplinary team of researchers from a range of fields, including epidemiology, public health, genetics, education, neurology, psychiatry, and psychology. In the lab, we use interdisciplinary approaches to better understand the social and genetic factors that influence the etiology of mood disorders, with an emphasis on depression among women, children, and adolescents. The goal of our work is to identify the causal mechanisms underlying risk for mood disorders, develop population-based strategies for prevention, and target these strategies to “sensitive periods,” or developmental stages in the course of the lifespan when the brain is highly “plastic” and therefore when experience, including exposure to childhood adversity, can have lasting impacts. To do this, we analyze genetic and other types of data collected from individuals across the globe, including longitudinal studies that follow children from the time of their birth.The BHI Pilot Study is a cross-sectional web-based study, comprised of an online survey and cognitive games, launched in August 2020 to adult residents in Lakewood Ranch, Florida. The study assesses risk and protective factors related to brain health, and COVID-19 experiences influencing mental and physical health outcomes. Data will be used to write manuscripts and inform future clinical interventions to promote brain health and prevent brain related illness.Under the direction of Dr. Erin Dunn, the Principal Investigator of the lab, the RA will be responsible for conducting literature searches, assisting in data management and data analysis tasks, preparing papers for submission to scholarly journals, preparing materials for conference presentations, and attending BHI and Dunn Lab meetings. Other duties may include: drafting reports and presentations for stakeholders and funders, and developing marketing materials to raise awareness about the BHI.Candidates must have good quantitative skills, an ability to work well in a collaborative environment, fluency with all modes of communication in English, and strong writing skills. Interest in psychiatric disorders, brain health, mental health, and/or adversity/traumatic stress preferred. Candidates will gain experience working in all phases of the research process, ranging from study design to analysis and interpretation of results. Opportunities for co-authorship of manuscripts and presentation of results at scholarly conferences will be available.

Description: LightRiver Software’s industry-leading netFLEX® telecommunications management system simplifies and improves the operation of transport networks. It seamlessly integrates several technologies and multi-generational equipment from multiple vendors with real-time Fault, Configuration, Accounting, Performance and Security management. We are looking to add to our talented development team with individuals ready to take on the challenges of the evolving telecommunications industry. As a team member, you will be responsible for full stack development including testing, implementation, and maintenance. You will have the opportunity to add and enhance features on a large-scale, mature software application. New features can include new communication protocols such as REST with JSON data structures to managing new Dense wavelength division multiplexing (DWDM) switches.LightRiver seeks an Associate Software Developer to join our growing team located in the updated BellWorks (https://bell.works) building in Holmdel, NJ. Bell Works is there-imagination of the historic former Bell Labs building. Today, the building is a one-of-a-kind destination for business and culture, complete with a blossoming ecosystem of technology, traditional offices, retail, dining, hospitality, and much more.Essential FunctionsThe netFLEX application is a scalable LINUX application written in C language, which utilizes many LINUX features such as inter-process communications (IPC), network protocols, and databases (both relational and networking). The cloud-based GUI is presented in HTML5 and JavaScript.- Knowledge of LINUX/UNIX and C language is required.- Knowledge of Apache, HTML, JavaScript, CGI, telecommunications, protocols, and databases is a plus.- Strong communication skills are needed for working with the development team and for customer facing assignments.- Understanding of software testing procedures and methodologies. The Agile Software Development approach will be utilized.- The ability to work independently and be self-directed.- Strong attention to detail.Education and Experience- Bachelor of Science Degree in Computer Science or related degree.- 1-3 years of experience developing software.Other Requirements- Satisfactory results of drug screen and background check.

Description: The Future Talent Program features Cooperative (Co-op) education that lasts up to 6 months and will include one or more projects. These opportunities in our Research Division can provide you with great development and a chance to see if we are the right company for your long-term goals.Our Company's Exploratory Science Center in Cambridge provides a unique experience to contribute to our Company's drug discovery efforts at one of the earliest stages of the process. To this end, we strive to create a fast-paced, nimble, and flexible environment of mutual respect, creativity, invention, and teamwork. Co-op students will be part of a highly collaborative and innovative scientific culture with the ultimate goal of learning new biology, chemistry, and technology that drives therapeutic development. Students will be exposed to software engineering, immunology, microbiology, chemical biology, synthetic chemistry, and bioactive discovery both within the Exploratory Science Center and other our sites across the country. With access to our Company's proven global Research & Development ( R&D) organization, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues while developing and expanding your career.This co-op position will involve the analysis and comparison of microbiome (16S rRNA) next generation sequencing data. The student will work in conjunction with a team of computational biologists and molecular biologists, to learn to effectively design and analyze microbiome experiments, develop and utilize code, and work with biological data and analytical tools. This co-op will be virtual.Required Education, Experience and Skills:Preferred Qualifications:We are a research-driven biopharmaceutical company. Our mission is built on the simple premise that if we “follow the science” that great medicines can make a significant impact to our world. We believe that a research-driven enterprise dedicated to world-class science can succeed by inventing medicine and vaccine innovations that make a difference for patients across the globe.Who we are …We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.What we look for …In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.INVENT.IMPACT.INSPIRE.

Description: Join the adventure!We are a well-funded biotech company with strong expertise in genomics, computational biology, machine learning, and discovery and development of innovative therapeutics. You will be working with computational biologists, data scientists, and experimental scientists to build our drug discovery platform.What you will doHelp discover new ways to use drugs to regulate the expression of disease-associated genes using techniques including:· NGS/Genomic data processing and quality assurance· Integrating multiple types of omics data· Building and optimizing predictive models of gene expression using machine learning methodsQualifications:· Graduate student, or undergraduate senior with strong experience· Proficient programming skills in R, Python, or Shell scripting· Bioinformatic background with course/work in machine learning, or computer science/machine learning background with course/work in biology and bioinformatics.About Camp4Founded in 2016 and focused on a core mission of realizing a world with ‘an effective treatment option for every patient,’ CAMP4 Therapeutics evolved from seminal discoveries made by company founders Dr. Richard Young and Dr. Leonard Zon, characterizing the ways in which dynamic cell signaling networks control the expression of genes. Operating at the intersection of genomics, computational biology and data sciences, CAMP4 has extended this foundational work, creating a unique Gene Circuitry PlatformTM to amplify the value of cellular and genetic insights to better understand how genes are controlled by signaling pathways in specific disease states. By generating proprietary 4D maps, CAMP4 can identify de-risked druggable targets, produce actionable insights and improve therapeutic predictability, potentially addressing hundreds of diseases and benefiting millions of patients globally.Find out more at www.camp4tx.com.

Position: Traverso Lab Assistant, Part-Time -  Dr. Zhang
Targeted Academic Majors: College of Engineering/Chemical Engineering, College of Engineering/Bioengineering
Workplace Type: Primarily on-site work
Description: This co-op in part time (20 hrs/week). In order to be fully registered at NU, students will have to enroll in a course while on co-op.Project Description:We are seeking a highly self-motivated and organized individual to work on a fast-paced interdisciplinary collaborative project in the Traverso Lab at Brigham and Women’s Hospital. The project focuses on developing novel biomaterials for implantable systems to better treat inflammatory bowel diseases in research and translational settings. Primary responsibilities include polymer synthesis and characterization, formulation of controlled release dosage forms, in vitro characterization of implantable systems (eg., HPLC, rheometer testing, ELISA, etc.), and preclinical evaluation of the systems in relevant small and large animal models (efficacy studies, pharmacokinetics, and toxicity, etc.). General responsibilities include operating lab equipment, conducting experiments, collecting data, recording and documenting experimental procedures and results, consulting scientific literature as needed, analyzing and summarizing results, and working with a multidisciplinary team of researchers.REQUIRED:· B.S./B.A. major in chemical engineering, biological/biomedical engineering, chemistry, pharmaceutical science or a field directly related to the work;· Commitment to producing accurate and high-quality data;· Experience of conducting tests following instructions and operating and maintaining technical instruments/equipment;· One or two years of prior experience working in a laboratory environment (at the undergraduate level is acceptable);· Strong organizational, time management and documentation skills;· Excellent analytical skills and strong communication and writing skills;· Proficient with analyzing, summarizing and reporting results;· Willingness to learn new scientific tools and techniques quickly;· Applicant will be trained to perform techniques in experiments, including techniques related to animal work. After sufficient training, the intern is expected to work independently with minimal supervision;· Awareness of basic safety requirements and ability to follow safety procedures and maintain a safe work environment.PREFERRED (whichever applies):· Relevant experience in novel drug delivery technologies (e.g., micro/nano particles, polymer coatings/matrices, and hydrogels).· Relevant experience with standard molecular, cell and animal techniques, including flow cytometry, PCR, tissue harvest and processing and other techniques as needed.· Relevant experience in polymer synthesis and characterization (e.g., free-radical polymerization, GPC, and 1H-NMR).· Relevant imaging experience, including scanning electron microscopy, fluorescence microscopy, and bright field microscopy.

Description: Come Join Analog Devices – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For the past 50 years, Analog Devices has been inventing innovative technologies that transform lives. Get hands-on experience working with the brightest minds to solve complex problems that matter: from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality to remote healthcare. Enjoy a culture that values aligned goals, balanced work-life priorities, continuous learning throughout your career and shared rewards. At ADI, we invest in you and succeed together because we believe that happy, healthy, intellectually-challenged people drive our growth and market leadership.ADI at a GlanceADI helps customers bridge the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that solve real-life problems and make the world smarter, healthier, greener and safer. With over $5 billion in revenue, ADI specializes in high-performance analog, mixed-signal, power, and digital signal processing (DSP) integrated circuits that sense, measure, interpret, connect, power, secure and transform how the world experiences the world around them.Analog Devices’ Aerospace and Defense group is seeking a highly motivated Intern/Co-op/Part-Time Employee for the role of RF & Microwave Engineering Intern. ADI’s Aerospace and Defense (ADEF) Module and Subsystem group designs RF/Microwave products ranging from 1GHz up to 70GHz for commercial, military, and space applications. Products include receivers, transmitters, low spur/phase noise synthesizers, high-power GaN amplifiers, and multifunction modules.In the role of RF & Microwave Engineering Intern, your immediate responsibilities will include to assist radio frequency engineers with evaluating, testing and analyzing application circuits, full 3D EM models and system level design and simulation – all under the close mentorship of various experienced engineers.Principal Job responsibilities may include:• Successful candidate will work with the RF systems engineering team to evaluate, characterize and test systems• The candidate will gain firsthand knowledge on how RF receivers and transmitters work and their components• The candidate will learn how to simulate and evaluate data using AWR, ADS, GENESYS, HFSS, etc.• The candidate will learn how to use lab equipment such as VNA, PNA, Power Sensors, Pre-amplifiers, Signal source generator, Couplers, etc.• At the system level, the candidate will have the opportunity to learn about various modes of operation of different transceivers, amplifiers and others.Qualifications:• Pursuing a BS or MS in Electrical Engineering• U. S. Citizenship Required.For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. Description: Co-op – Algorithm Co-op – Cambridge, MA – Jan 2021 (370851)Are you interested in a Co-op opportunity with Philips? We welcome individuals who are currently pursuing an undergraduate (BS) and/or graduate (MS) degree to participate in a 3-6 month paid co-op in Cambridge, MA. Through this role, you will gain meaningful, hands-on experience working for a Health-Tech company.In this role, you have the opportunity toHelp the Philips R&D take big steps in enhancing the capabilities of wearable medical devices from PhilipsYou are responsible for· Automating the test processes for a wearable sensor verification process· Model the feature based classification based on understanding of feature space· Creating test scripts in Matlab or Python to perform data gathering and analysis· Refining the existing design of experiments to verify wearable sensor functionality· Taking part in design of data gathering experiments towards next generation feature set· Taking part in design of optimal classifier towards next generation feature setYou are a part ofAlgorithm team that is part of wider R&D and Quality teams that work towards creating new innovative wearable medical devices; you will be expected to work closely with firmware, quality and electrical engineering teams to help the team move forward.To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience· BS student in EE, CS, BME, or Robotics (should have finished the freshman year) or· MS student in EE, CS, BME, or Robotics - preferred· Knowledge of Instrumentation, Sensors, DSP, and Signals and Systems or design of intelligent systems, automation, and robotics, machine learning for MS student· Ability to program in one Matlab, Python, or C/C++· Healthy and able to independently lift some of the heavy equipment’s/ mannikins etc· Be comfortable in English· Be able to work in Cambridge facility on a need-basis during experiment days· Be able to work from home on other daysIn return, we offer youThe ability to collaborate with, learn and grow from colleagues in a highly complex, global organization where you can use your strengths to help drive strategic business initiatives for Philips.  Additionally, we provide you a dynamic working environment in an innovative business, paired with a competitive salary, excellent benefits, and a supportive atmosphere where you can sharpen your talents with new challenges and career opportunities.· US work authorization is a precondition of employment. The company will not consider candidates who require sponsorship for a work-authorized visa.· Company relocation benefits will not be provided for this position. Candidates need to live within the territoryorwithin commuting distance to Cambridge, MA. Why should you join Philips?Working at Philips is more than a job. Description: GrubStreet is the leading literary arts center in the country. We are a hardworking and creative bunch, and pride ourselves on a warm and supportive work environment. GrubStreet is seeking a Youth & Community Programs Assistant co-op to be a vital part of our team. In this role, you will work with the programs team on day-to-day operations for classes and events that support writers at our HQ office as well as our community partner sites like the Boston Public Library branches. You'll directly support the team in its goals to make sure that high-quality arts programming is accessible to all. You'll help make sure that classes and events run smoothly while making sure all people feel welcome.CommunicationsLogisticsABOUT THE ORGANIZATIONGrubStreet, the largest creative writing center in the U.S., annually engages nearly 6,000 students, both teens and adults, in programs that range from two-hour workshops to year-long graduate level seminars at our downtown location, in Boston neighborhoods, and online. Our teachers are working artists who bring the highest quality instruction and mentorship to aspiring storytellers. We also host a major writing conference each year and public storytelling events. The education and networks we facilitate foster a richer local writing scene, with a strong focus on increasing opportunities for writers of color, low-income writers, and teen writers. Our programs eliminate common barriers to participation in the arts and lifelong learning, and build community among participants.We continue to increase scholarships and provide free writing programs (including bilingual classes) for adults and teens in low-income communities in Egleston, East Boston, and Mattapan.Our MissionWe believe that narrative transforms lives, builds bridges, and produces empathy. By rigorously developing voices of every type and talent, and by removing barriers to entry, GrubStreet fosters the creation of meaningful stories and ensures that excellent writing remains vital and relevant.GrubStreet is an equal opportunity employer. We provide a competitive salary and benefits package and a dynamic, collaborative work environment.Benefits and perks of working at GrubStreet:

Description: TO APPLY TO THIS POSITION, PLEASE SUBMIT YOUR APPLICATION HERE:The Spotify Voice NLU (Natural Language Understanding) team is hiring a Linguistics Co-Op student with strong technical skills. The Voice NLU team is a multi-functional agile team composed of ML engineers, NLP researchers, linguists, data scientists, data engineers, and backend engineers working together to build the next generation of language understanding technology for Spotify. We are enabling a more natural interaction paradigm, freeing people from the keyboard and the cognitive load of formulating written queries to drive their audio experience.The ideal candidate will be passionate about learning and applying Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques to enable all Spotify listeners to be expressive in how they ask to listen to audio content like music, podcasts, and more. This role will involve coming up with creative solutions to be able to identify and properly handle ambiguity in language, such as recognizing when contextual cues may have an effect on meaning. The ideal candidate will love diving into language data to uncover hidden patterns in speech and writing. Role will largely focus on the syntax and semantics, however a holistic approach taking the other theoretical linguistics areas (ie. phonetics, phonology, morphology, discourse and pragmatics) into account will be necessary.The Co-Op experienceThis is your chance to help craft the way the world listens, learn more about what we do, how we do it - and why that matters. We’re looking for enthusiastic current students with a passion for audio experiences and an ambition to go far. This isn't just any co-op, you’ll make an impact and play a real part in the success of Spotify, All over one unforgettable spring semester!If that’s you, tell us who you are, what you care about, and where you want to go.Our paid co-op last for 6 months and starts at the beginning of January.

Description: Greetings, students! We’re geared up here to offer another round of epic internship experiences in 2021. The internship program offers the opportunity to pause your studies for one summer and work side-by-side with Blizzard Entertainment employees in your area of interest, doing real work that oftentimes ends up in production. As such, we hold you to the same high standards as anybody else in the company.Just like our gameplay experiences, Blizzard internships are a fully immersive experience. We want interns who are enthusiastic about what they want to do for a living and excited to come in every day to learn and contribute in this hyper-creative atmosphere. Being fully engaged with our team also means communicating effectively and maintaining an open mind - one that is receptive to feedback and able to adapt and grow. Your hobbies and interests can also play in your favor. Passion for technology, gaming, game development, and an in-depth knowledge of Blizzard games, products, and services will always be a plus with us, regardless of the position you’re applying for. Be passionate about who you are, be into our industry, and be willing to go all-in and embrace this opportunity to the fullest!The Battle.net & Online Products organization is home to 300+ superpowered engineers, program managers, and designers focused on the technology that powers Blizzard Entertainment’s games. Whether you’re playing one of our titles, chatting with friends, or just shopping online, B&OP ensures that our players are immersed in engaging, exciting, and secure experiences. Blizzard Entertainment is looking for talented and enthusiastic interns to join the B&OP Design team.We value applicants with exceptional creativity, strong communication skills, the ability to think quickly, excellent problem-solving skills, and passion for delivering world-class software and entertainment experiences. Does the idea of working with teams that are delivering on the future product vision for Blizzard’s out of game experiences spark your imagination?QUEST OBJECTIVESAs a design intern on the Battle.net design team, you can help create and contribute to products used by millions of gamers worldwide.You’ll be working on the Battle.net desktop and mobile apps, the Shop website, our account management tools, our gamesites, and many more productsthat our players rely on to play their games and take part in Blizzard’s epic entertainment experiences.An intern’s workload may be UX or visual design focused depending on their interests, passions, and abilities.RESPONSIBILITIESQUEST REQUIREMENTSLEVEL REQUIREMENTSRECOMMENDED TALENTSQUEST ITEMSBlizzard Entertainment is a global company committed to growing our employees along with the business. We offer generous benefits and perks with an eye on providing true work / life balance. We’ve worked hard to foster an intensely collaborative and creative environment, a diverse and inclusive employee culture, and training and opportunity for professional growth. Our people are everything. Our core values are real, and our mission has never changed. We are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences…ever. Join us!  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminateon the basis ofrace, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Team Name:Battle.net & Online Products

Description: Northeastern University Co-op Student Internship in Immuno-Oncology and Cell TherapyAgenTus Therapeutics is a dynamic new start-up subsidiary developing an allogenic and off the shelf cell therapy product designed to supercharge the immune system to seek and destroy cancer. AgenTus is taking advantage of the unique expansion and anti-tumor proprieties of a rare immune cell population named Invariant Natural Killer T cells (iNKT). iNKT cells are also engineered to express chimeric antigen receptors (CARs) aiming to reinforce tumor targeting and killing. We aim to deliver cures to cancer patients around the world by leveraging our proprietary platforms for CAR discovery and developing unique allogeneic cell therapies. Together with our parent company, Agenus, we have a deep and diverse repertoire of immunotherapy treatments that can be used in combinations that will synergize to help the body’s immune system fight cancer.

We are developing novel first-in-class therapeutics targeted at natural killer (NK) cells and other cells of the innate immune system. These therapies are designed to counterbalance immune suppressive factors present in the tumor microenvironment and mobilize anti-cancer immune responses. Our molecules are expected to be potent as single agents as well as in treatment combinations with existing cancer immunotherapies. Our scientific founders are major figures in cancer biology and immunology and have launched Dragonfly to harness the power of the immune system to provide breakthrough cancer treatments for patients.

Description: The Future Talent Program features co-ops that last up to 6 months and will include one or more projects. These opportunities in our Research Division can provide you with great development and a chance to see if we are the right company for your long-term goals.Our company’s Neuroscience team is seeking motivated and technically skilled co-op students majoring in the biological sciences, pharmacology or bioengineering. The candidates should have strong interest in neuroscience and learning about Central Nervous System (CNS) drug discovery. Successful candidates will be able to work independently and will be expected to proactively collaborate with colleagues. Primary responsibilities include contributing to the execution of in vitro and/or in vivo experiment that may encompass establishing cell-based model systems, development of immunoassays and performing biochemical and immunohistochemical analysis of tissues to support the identification and validation of novel targets to treat CNS diseases. The candidate will be an active participant in the positive and critical scientific dialogue that supports our mission of drug discovery.The responsibilities of the Early Discovery Neuroscience team member include but are not limited to the following:Required Education and Experience:Preferred Experience and Skills:We are a research-driven biopharmaceutical company. Our mission is built on the simple premise that if we “follow the science” that great medicines can make a significant impact to our world. We believe that a research-driven enterprise dedicated to world-class science can succeed by inventing medicine and vaccine innovations that make a difference for patients across the globe.Who we are …We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.What we look for …In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.INVENT.IMPACT.INSPIRE.

Description: **MUST BE ELIGIBLE FOR CO-OP WORK STUDY OR BE WILLING TO TAKE THE POSITION UNPAID **Do you love learning about the natural world? Are you interested in science communication to students and the public? Would you like to spend the semester exploring the tidepools, handling aquaria animals, and working in a relaxed environment with both scientists and educators? Whether you envision life in a lab, in front of a classroom of students, or working daily in nature, this is the perfect co-op for you!GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES:ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:· Teach environmental education lessons, primarily with PreK-12 audiences, both in person and virtually· Develop and evaluate virtual STEM educational programming· Regularly maintain aquaria at the Marine Science Center· Develop promotional materials and messages for social media and other public relations activities· Maintain Outreach Program resources and equipment, ensuring that resources are stocked and ready for future programs and events· Assist faculty, staff, and/or graduate students with research-related tasks in a lab setting· Candidate must be able to lift 30-40 lbs (e.g., buckets of seawater) a couple of times a week and walk comfortably along a rocky shoreline· Perform other duties as requiredCOMPETENCIES:· Interest in marine science and environmental education· Interest and willingness to help with basic research tasks· Flexible and creative, willing to adapt to new learning environments and develop new ways to share information with students and the public· Proactive and a strong communicator; suggest and discuss any ideas to enhance and improve program efficacy and function· Organized and efficient; able to assess needs, identify objectives, and collect and record relevant information· Strong interpersonal skills· Able to effectively convey ideas and information in writing using language that is appropriate to both the complexity of the topic and the knowledge and understanding of the reader· Able to contribute to cohesive and results-oriented teams; recognize and encourage the behaviors that contribute to teamwork· Proficiency in computer skills, including experience with spreadsheets, presentation software, and word processingQUALIFICATIONS:· Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in marine biology, environmental science, biology, science education, or related· A basic knowledge of coastal and marine ecosystems of New England preferred· Experience in salt water aquaria maintenance preferred but not required· Experience and/or interest in working with youth· Flexibility to work occasional evening and weekend hours· Willingness to complete University certification in Laboratory Animal Medicine· Certification in First Aid and CPR preferred, or else a willingness to receive this trainingBENEFITS:· Excellent experience with many of the projects and people working at the MSC· Experience and training as environmental education instructor in virtual, classroom and field programs· Experience and training in planning, conducting, and evaluating marine education program· Opportunities to contribute to improvement of an education program· Fun days on the coast· Access to a shared computer to complete work assignments· Letters of recommendation provided upon successful completion of the internshipTRANSPORTATION:The position will be a hybrid of onsite and remote during Spring 2021, with 2 days per week on the Nahant campus. A fully remote option would be considered if needed. Position is located at Northeastern's Marine Science Center in Nahant, MA. A shuttle runs intermittently between the Boston and Nahant campuses, but many not run in all months, so alternative transportation is recommended.SALARY:The salary range listed applies to candidates who are eligible for co-op work study funding. Check with the Student Employment Office to determine your eligibility. We are happy to hire students who are not eligible, but the position will be unpaid. This position is classified as C-IV level pay rate.

We are responsible for understanding and improving marketing effectiveness, looking for ways to improve digital experience, merchandising, and content, and we are primary drivers of methodological and technological development and advocacy in relation to this work.With several members of the team already benefitting from Roux’s initial offerings for development, we are excited to work the other end of that relationship by bringing in a sharp, energetic individual with experiences to share and an appetite for making an impact via data analytical work.Responsibilities1. Generate business insights through complex and novel methods of data exploration2. Create models to understand trends and drive better decision making using large volumes of data from a variety of sources.3. Participate in the surfacing, definition, prioritization and execution of high-sophistication, high-potential data analysis and modeling efforts.4. Synthesize and present complex results to a wide audience at a variety of levels of the org and analytical sophistication with an eye to accompanying analytical expertise with appropriate business decision advocacy.5. Other related duties as assigned.Health and Safety RequirementEvery employee is responsible for contributing to a safe and healthy workplace. Employees are expected to be active participants in health and safety by following all safety policies and procedures, reporting unsafe conditions or at-risk behaviors to leadership, and conducting work in a safe manner. Those in a leadership role are also expected to model safe behaviors, evaluate risk, and ensure that risks are reduced to acceptable levels.Requirements· Currently pursuing BS/BA degree or graduate program· Strong communication and presentation skills with respect to delivery of technical results· Data-wrangling and munging capability in SQL, R, Excel and other standard processing, stream editing and analytical tools – experience through internships or co-ops a plus· Strong ETL-related skills and experience with working with data in DB2 and cloud environments· Familiarity with basic business concepts, retail industry interest a plus· Tableau a significant plusFrom coastal marsh to alpine forest, ecosystems depend on diversity to flourish. We believe the same is true in the workplace. That’s why L.L.Bean is an equal opportunity employer, committed to sustaining our strengths by welcoming all kinds of people.

Description: Important Job InformationPlease see full job description below.[YES ] Background check/CORI[YES ] Special InformationWelcome to the William H. Lincoln of Brookline!The William H Lincoln School is home to approximately 545 students in grades K ? 8. The Lincoln School is proud to affirm that their students represent 11 of 62 possible racial and ethnic combinations, as defined by the Massachusetts Department of Elementary and Secondary Education. The Lincoln student population represents 29 different countries, speaks 18 languages, and includes 9 family structures and 6 countries of origin, making up a truly diverse student population! Due to the prevalence of international students, the Lincoln School offers the Japanese English Language Learner program, and the Adaptive Learning Center to service students with disabilities as part of Brookline?s System Wide programs. The Lincoln School promotes academic achievement, social responsibility and good citizenship amongst its students and staff. To promote these values students have many opportunities to participate in academic, artistic and athletic experiences through the school including Chess Club, Intramural Sports, Lego Club, Continental Math League and the Drama Club. To help students become active citizens it is important for families to be involved in the education process which is why the Lincoln School collaborates with the Parent Teacher Organization (PTO) to offer a variety of events for the community. The school also reached out to many in need by having school-wide community service and social action initiatives. This past year the Lincoln School participated in a Walk for Haiti and raised funds for the Japanese disaster relief.In 2011 the Lincoln School students in grades 3, 5 and 7 partook in a bullying survey, which combined with the bullying prevention and interventions programs, provided both education and awareness to the concept of bullying.The responsibilities may be as follows:üAssist head teachers and school staff with K-8th grade childrenüTutor individual studentsüAssist with small and large group instruction as well as activities.üPerform general tasks for the principal's office and libraryüSupervise recess and lunch periodsInstructional Assistant Qualifications:üMust have an interest in children, education, and recreationüCPR and First Aid are preferredüTheoretical knowledge of childhood development is a plus.üFlexibility- being able to shift quickly from one assignment to anotherTransit directions to the school from Northeastern U campus:Northeastern University360 Huntington AveBoston, MA 02115(2.2 miles ? 10 minutes)1. Description: This role will integrate into a team designing and rolling out improvements to existing network and server infrastructure. They will gain firsthand experience with core tooling including Cisco and Meraki networking equipment, Linux and Windows servers, VMWare and Hyper-V. We will be tackling projects like network segmentation, redesigning our wireless networks, rolling out patching and automation systems, and replacing all the network gear in several sites across our system. Familiarity with standard concepts, practices, and procedures is helpful. The individual will lean on scripting languages to support the IT Systems team in automating certain activities and have the aptitude to learn new tools to support information and cyber security initiatives. They will work with project stakeholders daily. A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required.Primary Responsibilities:The following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Specific activities may change from time to time.As the Junior Network & System Admin Associate you will perform the following duties:· Assist with the management of a broad enterprise network comprising a mix of new and legacy equipment· Assist with the management of enterprise level storage and server systems including virtualization, storage systems and mission critical workloads.· Participate in designing and rolling out network segmentation for our 34 site system.· Participate in the design and execution of network equipment refresh projects at several sites.· Participate in the design and implementation of cloud based technologies to leverage new technologies to make our systems more reliable and efficient.· Assist with the development and roll out of automation technologies, like Ansible.Qualifications:· Basic understanding of core networking concepts like vlans and subnetting· Basic understanding of virtualization and storage systems is helpful· Having some personal aptitude is very helpful and there are extra points for homelabing/dormlabbing· Must be motivated, independent and self-sufficient. Description: Working in OPMIWe are an office devoted to problem-solving and creative thinking, and there are many opportunities for co-ops to participate in this exciting work. Co-ops will have the ability to participate in trainings, technical tours, conferences, and other learning opportunities as available. By the end of their co-op, they will have gained experience managing multiple concurrent projects, collaborating with multiple departments throughout the agency, and working with many datasets to answer a variety of real-world questions.What does working in OPMI during the pandemic look like?It is difficult to know with certainty what MassDOT and the MBTA’s telework situation will be for the Spring 2021 co-op cycle, but it’s likely that at least part of this co-op will be remote. There are no significant changes to the roles and responsibilities for this co-op position given that the work happens primarily on a computer. We will provide a laptop and accessories, as well as remote training and learning opportunities as part of the onboarding process.If we are working remotely, you are not required to be in Boston, and we can strive to accommodate time zone differences as needed. However, meetings will continue to be scheduled during normal 9-5 EST working hours.The entire interview process will happen remotely.Position SummaryThe Data Management Technical Analyst will be responsible for supporting projects across the MBTA and MassDOT agencies to improve the quality of our existing and newly-acquired data. Primary tasks include data quality control, documentation, and integration for our publically available datasets in the MBTA Open Data Portal. Additionally, interns in this position will also create and validate new datasets for publication in the Open Data Portal. The Data Management Technical Analyst will also support research and performance management projects led by OPMI.Some examples of previous projects undertaken by students in this position included:We are looking for a detail-oriented person who enjoys analyzing and finding quirks and problems in data. You do not need to have specific experience in data management systems, but an interest in data and analysis, a keen eye for potential problems, and an inquisitive mindset will be needed in order to thrive in this role.Job ResponsibilitiesQualifications and Requirements

Description: We are seeking a highly motivated Research Assistant to join our dynamic, highly interdisciplinary and collaborative team working to work in the lysosomal storage disease area. This student will gain valuable cell biology and assay development skills. Sigilon Therapeutics is a biopharmaceutical company creating functional cures for chronic diseases using Shielded Living Therapeutics. The Shielded Living Therapeutics product platform consists of novel engineered human cells that are encased in a proprietary immune-shielding matrix and placed in the body. These Shielded Living Therapeutics then produce therapeutic proteins in a programmable and durable fashion, without generating fibrosis or immune rejection. This position provides an outstanding training opportunity by working closely with discovery scientists across disciplines to advance pre-clinical research programs in a novel area of biology. The Research Assistant will be given their own project or set of tasks and received close guidance and mentorship from a Scientist-level supervisor.Responsibilities:· Design, generate, and maintain protein expressing stable cell lines· Demonstrate proficiency and regularly perform molecular biology techniques such as enzymatic assays, western blotting, ELISAs, MSD, and qPCR· Present findings at team meetings· Maintain good written records of laboratory procedures, results, and conclusionsWho are we looking for?· An enthusiastic and dedicated student that is interested in regenerative medicine and creating novel treatments· Laboratory skills in molecular biology, cell biology or related sciences are preferredWhat are we looking for?· Leading the way:A creative and dedicated scientist· Working together:A colleague to thrive on collaboration with our scientific teammates· Loving what you do:A team member with positive energy that is passionate about our missionWhat are we offering?· Exposure to pioneering science and the opportunity to help create therapeutics that will benefit the lysosomal storage disease patients· Unique opportunity to develop skills and deliver important experimental results at a small company· Manager & co-workers who are proven mentors and coaches· Membership within a growing, dynamic and collegial organizationRare Disease Co-opA co-op student in the Rare Disease group would have the ability to work with a Senior Scientist level supervisor and have the opportunity to learn cell and molecular biology techniques including: design and preparation of protein expressing plasmids, stable cell line generation, enzymatic assay design and validation, ELISA, MSD, and other industry skills. The candidate will be an integral member of a small, fast paced, research team and will receive close guidance and mentorship from a senior scientist level supervisor. The individual will be given their own project and set of tasks within a project and be an integral individual contributor. Projects will be designed based on (1) the current progress and challenges to the research program, and (2) the capabilities and ambition of the individual.

Description: The goal of the Datta laboratory is to address a core problem in neuroscience: how is the brain wired to extract information from the environment and convert that information into action? The main hypothesis of the laboratory is that we can gain leverage on this physiological problem ? and the related problem of how diseases disrupt brain function ? by studying neural circuits that underlie stimulus-driven innate behaviors. Given that olfaction is the primary sense used by most animals to communicate with their environment, we focus on characterizing those circuits that enable animals to detect and innately respond to scents from food, predators and mates. These circuits are highly constrained by evolution and exhibit stereotyped anatomic and genetic architectures, which significantly facilitates their experimental interrogation. Sensory information propagating through this hardwiring can drive complex behaviors (such as avoidance or sexual displays), alter neuroendocrine states and act as unconditioned stimuli to facilitate learning. We believe that tracing and manipulating the neural wiring that mediate innate behaviors will reveal fundamental and general principles about how information is meaningfully encoded in the brain, how that information is coupled to behavioral centers, and how the circuits which convey that information can dynamically adapt to a changing world. To structurally and functionally dissect olfactory circuits we deploy an interdisciplinary toolkit that includes both well-established techniques ? such as mouse genetics and behavioral analysis ? and emerging approaches ? such as two-photon laser scanning microscopy and optogenetics. We also actively develop new molecular and imaging tools for neural tracing and circuit analysis. These methods allow us to identify specific monomolecular odorants that drive genetically-programmed behaviors, to define peripheral receptors for these odorants, and to characterize the functional architecture of the neural circuits that translate the activation of a specific receptor in the nose into a particular behavioral response. These circuits include well-characterized peripheral components, such as the olfactory epithelium and olfactory bulb, which trigger activity in parts of the higher mammalian brain whose function is just now beginning to be explored, such as the piriform cortex, the cortical amygdala and olfactory tubercle. In addition to exploring how ethologically-relevant sensory information is encoded in all of these regions, we are actively interested in how this information is sent forward to brain areas such as the ventral striatum and hypothalamus, sites critical to the execution of innate behaviors, to learning and reward, and to the regulation of neuroendocrine status. Importantly, the areas of the cortex implicated in generating innate odor-driven behaviors play potential roles in a number of neural and psychiatric diseases (e.g. panic disorder, addiction). Our characterization of the circuitry that triggers innate odor-driven behaviors may therefore lead to insight into these serious diseases, as well as other disorders related to behavioral valence and motivation.

Sound knowledge of English.Programs and services offered by Bridge CulturesOnline workshops/webinarsStudents learn about the culture and multiple facets and influences on various aspects of life through conversations with people they would meet while in Bangalore. With a remote co-op, Bridge Cultures will enable these conversations virtually. We will organize 3 virtual webinars and workshops on various topics in context to cultural integration which will align with students’ professional and personal growth. Bridge Cultures will bring professionals from various domains and facilitate these interactive sessions.Few topics (not confined to) are listed below:· Social entrepreneurship· Know the city - food, culture, people· Leadership and Teamwork· Unconscious biases· Critical thinking· Influence of culture on design, education, outdoor education, experiential education· Sustainability· Mental health, emotional well-being· Impact of traveling on our personalitySelf-reflection session:Bridge Cultures believes that self-reflection is highly important and necessary to learn and grow, especially after working with a social enterprise on an impactful project. Out of many reasons, reflection is important because it:· Enables the individuals to process and make meaning of the experience· Fosters a better understanding of context. i.e. understanding how their work impacts the community and encourages more participation in future· Creates a sense of accomplishment· Enables the individuals to examine the effects of their behavior, discover ways to improve· Reinforces the feeling of empathy gained during the experience· Acknowledges the skills gained during the experience and builds confidenceFees and processProgram fees - USD $455· Co-op placement· Necessary documentation· Self-Reflection session· 2-3 online webinars/workshops on various topics· Review meetings during co-op to track progress· Social networkProcess:1. Students apply for various positions through NU works2. Bridge Cultures will send an email to the student to schedule a call3.   After the student’s response to that email, a call will be scheduled between the student, Ms. Aspa Papanastasiou (Associate Director, Global engagements at NU), and Bridge Cultures to ensure accountability from the student’s side4. Another call will be scheduled with Bridge Cultures (if needed) to understand the student’s interest, motivation, and expectations from the co-op5. Position: ROUTES/Beuning Lab Environmental Health Research Assistant
Targeted Academic Majors: Bouve College of Health Sciences/Health Science, College of Science, College of Science/Environmental Science, College of Science/Chemistry, College of Science/Cell and Molecular Biology, College of Science/Biology, College of Science/Biochemistry
Workplace Type: On-site work is preferred when public health concerns allow, Primarily on-site work
Work Authorization: United States Citizen, Legal Permanent Resident of US
Description: This ROUTES scholar will work with Dr. Beuning to develop an understanding of how cells respond to DNA damage. DNA damage is ubiquitous and can arise from many sources, including from ultraviolet light and other environmental sources such as pollution and foods. In all organisms there are overlapping pathways to identify and remove DNA damage. However, DNA damage can evade repair pathways and block or stall the process of copying DNA that is required for cell division, which is known as DNA replication. Disrupted DNA replication can lead to mutagenesis and can be lethal to a cell. A specialized family of DNA polymerases with the ability to copy damaged DNA contributes to DNA damage tolerance. Notably, these polymerases do not repair DNA, but rather allow DNA replication to continue in the presence of DNA damage. Individuals with defects in DNA pol eta, which copies DNA containing lesions that result from UV light, are predisposed to skin cancer.The scholar will research the specificity of DNA polymerases for different types of DNA damage, how dynamic interactions between “normal” DNA polymerases, specialized DNA polymerases, and other DNA replication proteins contribute to DNA damage tolerance, and which of the numerous cellular pathways contribute to tolerance to DNA damage. This will be accomplished using biochemical assays, biophysical methods, and molecular biology techniques. The exact project is flexible and will be based on discussion with the applicant. Through this work the Routes scholar will gain an understanding of modern problems and techniques in biochemistry and biotechnology research. The scholar will gain experience in experimental design including the use of appropriate controls. Research experiences include site-directed mutagenesis, molecular cloning, protein purification, biochemical assays, and characterization of cellular responses to DNA damaging agents and mutagens.Scholars are expected to have or be willing to develop excellent laboratory technique. They will be fully active members of the laboratory group, including attending group meetings, discussing research results, and reading and discussing the primary literature. The scholars will be expected to demonstrate creativity and critical thinking in designing experiments and analyzing results.To apply: Please submit a resume and a short cover letter addressing the following questions:1. ROUTES is an NIH-funded program designed to support students from underrepresented backgrounds in environmental health research. How does the diversity of your experiences and background inform your work or eligibility for ROUTES?2. Description: Arrowstreet Capital during COVID-19At Arrowstreet Capital, we continue hiring for full time, intern and co-op positions. Like many firms, due to the pandemic, all employees are currently working remotely. We are pleased to interview candidates for Spring of 2021 via video interview (starting October 22nd). Please note that if we are still working remotely in 2021, due to legal and tax considerations, Spring 2021 co-ops must have authorization to work in the United States and be physically situated in the United States during the duration of the program (January – June 2021). If we return to our offices during the Spring 2021 co-op program, our expectation is that co-ops will be able to be present in our offices with a reasonable amount of advance notice.Company OverviewArrowstreet Capital is a Boston-based systematic investment firm that manages global equity portfolios for institutional investors around the world. Our firm manages approximately $100 billion for over 200 client relationships.Co-op Program OverviewThe Arrowstreet Co-op Program provides an exciting opportunity to learn about the institutional asset management industry and Arrowstreet as a company while gaining deep experience within a specific function. The co-ops are highly valued members of the team and participate in team meetings, perform business-critical work and receive real-time, balanced feedback. They enjoy all the perks of being an employee at Arrowstreet, including a warm and friendly work environment and a relaxed, business-casual dress code. The co-ops across the organization come together on a regular basis to meet members of the firm’s leadership and to learn about all aspects of the investment management process.Job OverviewWe are looking for a Finance Co-op to support our Finance department while learning about a career in Accounting, Finance and Facilities. Our Finance and Facilities teams report to the CFO and critical functions we're requesting assistance with include: procurement, expense management, revenue management and Facilities support.ResponsibilitiesUnder support, guidance and supervision from Finance team members:QualificationsWe maintain a friendly, team-oriented environment and place a high value on professionalism, attitude and initiative.

Description: Job Overview:TIDE’s School Program aims to make children Agents of Change by providing awareness, knowledge, skills, and motivations for action, allowing them to maintain their own wellbeing – and that of their community and the planet – in an increasingly interconnected world. TIDE delivers a curriculum with modules focusing on conservation, energy, water, and waste management to children from 3rd to 8th grades. The curriculum is highly interactive and engaging with activities, DIY tools, and stimulating experiments, entertaining games, around the broad theme of sustainability.The intern is expected to contribute to the curriculum components, delivery, and branding.Job responsibilities:· Assist the School Program team in designing and conducting activities, games DIY tools focusing on energy, water, and waste· Create visually appealing information boards showcasing the work· Assist the team in need assessment, baseline assessment, and impact assessment on energy, water, and waste management in participating schools· Assist the team in documenting and reporting the impact of the School Program using tools like Google Data Studio, AutoCAD, Google Sketchup, Google Earth etc.Qualifications: Education level - Bachelors or master’s degree in education, environmental science, and sciences  Experience – Freshers welcome Personal characteristics – Good communicator, Passionate about sustainability Skills – Scientific thinking, Do-it-yourself skills for science & technology ideas, good with dataSkills gained at the end of the internship:· Deeper understanding of Sustainability in various contexts in India.· Empathy towards nature.· Improved storytelling techniques.· Improved design skills.Start date and duration:January 2021 to June 2021.Compensation and working hours (per week):Unpaid. 40 hours per week.Add-ons:The team at TIDE is a vibrant mixture of young minds and experienced leadership. It is a small organization that encourages out of the box, innovative thinking.Bangalore is a cosmopolitan city with great weather throughout the year and friendly people too. Bangalore is well connected to the rest of the country and is an ideal spot to start exploring India.About the organization:TIDE is a development organization that leverages technology for conserving the environment, creating livelihoods and addressing societal issues. Since inception, TIDE has developed/ adapted and transferred technology options like improved cookstoves, biogas, biomass gasification, biomass briquetting and energy audits. Our work aligns with Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of the UN, namely 3,5,7,11,12,13.2. Energy and resource conservation – Urban electricity conservation programs (VidyutRakshaka and VR lite) and School programs centered on sustainability.3. Gender & Livelihoods – Encompasses mobilization and awareness for rural women on innovative livelihoods, Women's Technology Park (WTP) as a hub for incubating rural, technology-based women's enterprises, Rural women leadership programs, and village development.Programs and services offered by Bridge CulturesOnline workshops/webinars:Students learn about the culture and multiple facets and influences on various aspects of life through conversations with people they would meet while in Bangalore. With a remote co-op, Bridge Cultures will enable these conversations virtually. We will organize 3 virtual webinars and workshops on various topics in context to cultural integration which will align with students’ professional and personal growth. Bridge Cultures will bring professionals from various domains and facilitate these interactive sessions.Few topics (not confined to) are listed below:· Social entrepreneurship· Know the city - food, culture, people· Leadership and Teamwork· Unconscious biases· Critical thinking· Influence of culture on design, education, outdoor education, experiential education· Sustainability· Mental health, emotional well-being· Impact of traveling on our personalitySelf-reflection session:Bridge Cultures believes that self-reflection is highly important and necessary to learn and grow, especially after working with a social enterprise on an impactful project. Out of many reasons, reflection is important because it:· Enables the individuals to process and make meaning of the experience· Fosters a better understanding of context. i.e. understanding how their work impacts the community and encourages more participation in future· Creates a sense of accomplishment· Enables the individuals to examine the effects of their behavior, discover ways to improve· Reinforces the feeling of empathy gained during the experience· Acknowledges the skills gained during the experience and builds confidenceFees and process:Inclusions:· Co-op placement· Necessary documentation· Self-Reflection session· 2-3 online webinars/workshops on various topics· Review meetings during co-op to track progress· Social networkProcess:1. Students apply for various positions through NU works2. Bridge Cultures will send an email to the student to schedule a call3.   After the student’s response to that email, a call will be scheduled between the student, Ms. Aspa Papanastasiou (Associate Director, Global engagements at NU), and Bridge Cultures to ensure accountability from the student’s side4. Another call will be scheduled with Bridge Cultures (if needed) to understand the student’s interest, motivation, and expectations from the co-op5. The student will pay the Program fees to Bridge Cultures ($455)6. Bridge Cultures will facilitate the call between student and the organization7. The organization will communicate their response to Bridge Cultures and the student8. If the student is selected, the organization will share the appointment/offer letter with Bridge Cultures9. Bridge Cultures will share the appointment letter with the student10. The student will start the co-op on the decided dates11. Bridge Cultures will facilitate virtual onboarding if necessary12. Bridge Cultures will facilitate 3 online sessions on various topics and organize 2 review meetings during the co-op13. Bridge Cultures will facilitate self-reflection session at the end of the co-opRefund policy:· If the student is not selected by the first organization interviewed for, Bridge Cultures will find another position with another organization. If the student is not selected there as well, 50% of the program fees will be refunded to the student· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op prior to confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 25% of the program fees (this is to factor the currency transaction charges that incurs to Bridge Cultures)· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op after receiving confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 75% of the program fees

Description: Medtronic is a leading medical device manufacturer, developing innovations in cardiac rhythm disease management, spinal and biologics, cardiovascular therapies, neuromodulation, diabetes, surgery, cardiac care, neuromodulation, and surgical technologies.The DevOps Software Engineer will work within the Medtronic R&D engineering team to develop and support the next generation robotic assisted surgical system right in downtown Boston's Seaport district. Your work contribution will have direct impact on tools used by dozens of engineers.The role entails having a growing understanding of technicalproject management, development, IT, and DevOps. This involves working in a fast-paced environment helping a development team integrate their work, develop C++/Python/Matlab supporting tools, control the build and development process, manage the build tool-chain for an array of target architectures, and help maintain the software development processes for large software teams.In addition, s/he will work alongside cross-functional engineering teams to assist with the evaluation and integration of other technologies into the MIS platform so hands-on embedded systems engineering experience and clear communication will be desired.How we work: We use Slack for much of our daily communication. We have a Windows laptop for corporate use and have a 2nd developer laptop loaded up with Ubuntu. We make use of many popular tools like Jira (tickets), Stash (Git repo), Bamboo (CI/CD pipeline, similar to Jenkins), Artifactory (build artifacts), Confluence (wiki). Our short-term team goals are (1) have better visibility into our business critical infrastructure and to better integrate Monitoring & Alerting tools, (2) orchestrate more of our infrastructure using Ansible, (3) build more custom API driven tools to support the various teams within R&D. There are 2 spots open for this position.COVID-19 related: Currently all co-ops are remote as are all full-time personnel. At this time, that will remain. As things change going forward a shift back into the office may occur but no one will be asked to go into the office that is not comfortable, so full-time remote work will be an available option. Also, all interviews will be conducted virtually.Skills we look for:Plus

Description: Lutron Electronics is a high growth, well-established leader in the lighting control industry. We use cutting edge technologies in innovative ways to improve the visual environment of residential and commercial buildings. New product development along with market creation and expansion continue to fuel our rapid growth. You have the opportunity to join us on the cusp of continued double-digit market growth per year.As a Lutron Engineering Co-op, you will work in a hands-on environment alongside more senior electrical and mechanical engineers, manufacturing and quality engineers and technicians. Involvement in the cross-functional team allows you to interact with many people from various departments. Using cutting-edge technology, co-ops apply engineering design to complex lighting and visual environment control systems. Our product development teams have responsibility for carrying the product from original design concepts through research and development to manufacturing finished products and systems.Mechanical Engineering co-ops work in a hands-on environment utilizing a variety of prototyping and testing technologies including 3D printing, heat transfer, plastic part development, mechanism design, ergonomics, advanced measurement and manufacturing techniques.We are always looking for opportunities to improve our products and implement new technologies as they apply to our business.If you have enjoyed your project-based classes, you will love the working environment at Lutron.New areas of development at Lutron include infrared and radio frequency communication systems, energy management systems, "smart home" systems, compact DC motor/planetary gear assemblies, and miniaturized energy management control products.We make every effort to give our co-ops real, impactful work. They are expected to learn to think and design like full time engineers and at the end of their term, they are given the opportunity to present their work to several senior members of our engineering team. A co-op position at Lutron offers you a chance to experience the business world first-hand and to learn how Lutron works as a company.You will have the opportunity to meet various people within many departments and to learn about the exciting career possibilities Lutron has to offer.We consider co-ops very valuable in our search for outstanding future members of our team and pride ourselves in providing outstanding work experiences to students from universities around the world.Previous co-ops have:· Designed, prototyped, and iterated on parts that are used in real products· Used 3D modeling and analysis tools to create and validate new mechanical designs· Designed and qualified assembly and testing fixtures used in high volume production environmentsThings you will learn about (If you don’t know about them already)· Sheet metal and injection molded part design· Rapid prototyping methods· Design of experiments· Brainstorming to solve mechanical and electrical problems· Layout of part drawings· Tolerance analysisQualifications:ME majors with a 3.2 minimum GPA and at least completed 4 semesters. We seek talented, success-minded people with the desire and ability to make things happen. We look for engineers with not only great understanding of the theory but the desire and ability to turn the theory into a tangible product. Teamwork and hands-on engineering greet you every day on the job.Position may be partially remote (2 days per week, 3 days in office).
