Description: Please apply online and on NUWOrksLearning does not only happen through training. Relationships are among the most powerful ways for people to learn and grow, and this is part of our HPE culture. In addition to working alongside talented colleagues, you will have many opportunities to learn through coaching and stretch assignment opportunities. You’ll be guided by feedback and support to accelerate your learning and maximize your knowledge. We also have a “reverse mentoring” program which allows us to share our knowledge and strengths across our multi-generation workforce.As part of the Experience Studio at Hewlett Packard Enterprise, you will be making our vision a reality. You will be a developer behind products integrating Grommet (http://grommet.io), Hewlett Packard Enterprise's most popular open-source project. Grommet is a class-leading ReactJS framework both within HPE and in the JavaScript open-source community. As an HPE UI/UX developer intern, you will be collaborating amongst small, agile, and high-caliber design teams with visibility at the highest levels of HPE. The broader Experience Studio team is responsible for the design and experience of HPE'sEverything-as-a-Serviceinitiative.If you have a proven sense of modern design and passion for developing rich, interactive web applications based on ReactJS, this is the opportunity for you! You will collaborate with product designers, user experience designers, researchers, engineers, our brand team, and 3rd party agencies to deliver modern experiences. You'll also be participating in research, planning, and contributing to web components that meet project needs and align with a design that mutually benefits both users and the business.ResponsibilitiesBonus Knowledge & SkillsQualifications:We offer:• A competitive salary and extensive social benefits• Diverse and dynamic work environment• Work-life balance and support for career development• An amazing life inside the element! Description: (REMOTE)Who is ServiceNow?Imagine your workday dominated less by emails and spreadsheets and more time given back to you to do your actual job. At ServiceNow, we are making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud-based platform and products streamline and simplify how work gets done across the enterprise. We are the fastest growing enterprise cloud software company in the world and was recently recognized on Fortune’s Future 50 list (https://fortune.com/future-50/2019/) For us, this is just the start.Who is Marketing at ServiceNow?Marketing is the engine room for growth at ServiceNow. We fuel the success of our customers, sales, and products. We have a customer-first mindset in all that we do. As a Marketing team, we are laser-focused on how we can connect with our customers by creating simple, sweet spot targeting, and by the positioning and packaging of our products and solutions. We help our customers gain the most value from our products by providing best practices, business cases and trainings.We also partner closely with Sales to build high-quality pipeline through targeted Marketing activities ranging from thought leadership, strategic and executive events, webinars, digital acquisition, SEO, and more!UX Research at ServiceNow UX Research at ServiceNow advances the organization’s understanding and insights about the interaction between users and our website so we can align the experiences we design with the way customers think, feel, and behave. The UX research program instills scientific theory, principles, data, and methods into the UX design practice that help us uncover opportunities to optimize the digital experience on servicenow.com and other external-facing websites.UX Research Co-Ops employ a variety of qualitative and quantitative methodologies to obtain measurements, feedback, and recommendations for our digital experiences. By doing so, they generate valuable insights that lead more innovative, intuitive and compelling user experiences. Our Co-Ops are responsible for following best-practice methodologies in order to obtain timely user/system insights that inform decision-making.UX Research Co-Ops interact regularly with our business, development, project/program management partners, designers, and executives to identify relevant research questions, design and implement insightful research studies, and disseminate and inspire action from the results. While our researchers are passionate about their methods and customer experience, they also possess the business tact to understand the impact of their efforts in a wider scope.What you’ll do in this roleWhat you’ll need to succeed in this role

Description: At Bose, better sound is just the beginning. We’re passionate engineers, developers, researchers, retailers, marketers … and dreamers. One goal unites us — to create products and experiences our customers simply can’t get anywhere else. We are driven to help people reach their fullest human potential. Creating technology to help people to feel more, do more, and be more. We are highly motivated and curious, and we come to work every day looking to solve real problems and make the best experiences for our customers possible.The Product Design studio at Bose is a dynamic and energetic environment that continually seeks to challenge our views about customer experiences. We work on a diverse portfolio of products from consumer electronics to enterprise and health products. We are looking for a User Research Co-Op to help us solve complex problems and create the best product experiences for our consumers.For this particular co-op, the focus would be on supporting our Health division, providing the chance to learn about human factors engineering (HFE) in the medical device space. The co-op will be able to learn HFE documentation, processes, and regulations, in addition to the nuances required to research medical devices that require FDA clearance. Description: (REMOTE)Who isServiceNow?Imagine your workday dominated less by emails and spreadsheets and more time given back to you to do your actual job. At ServiceNow, we are making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud-based platform and products streamline and simplify how work gets done across the enterprise. We are the fastest growing enterprise cloud software company in the world and was recently recognized on Fortune’s Future 50 list (https://fortune.com/future-50/2019/) For us, this is just the start.Who is Marketing at ServiceNow?Marketing is the engine room for growth at ServiceNow. We fuel the success of our customers, sales, and products. We have a customer-first mindset in all that we do. As a Marketing team, we are laser-focused on how we can connect with our customers by creating simple, sweet spot targeting, and by the positioning and packaging of our products and solutions. We help our customers gain the most value from our products by providing best practices, business cases and trainings.We also partner closely with Sales to build high-quality pipeline through targeted Marketing activities ranging from thought leadership, strategic and executive events, webinars, digital acquisition, SEO, and more!About the team:A best in class Product and Solutions Marketing team that creates authentic and connective storytelling to build trust and inspire customers to transform enterprises and employee experiences across the world. We are responsible for marketing strategy and connectedness through messaging and positioning, product and solution launches, sales and field enablement and execution of go-to-market.Successful Candidate will:o Market Analysis & Competitive Intelligence: Conduct primary and secondary competitive research, and maintain a current view of the competitive landscape by documenting customer uses cases, win stories and creating content and assetso Messaging: Participate in crafting narratives that communicate product positioning and value proposition to connect, inspire and help enterprise customers wino Launch: Support creation of compelling end-to-end GTM (Go-to-Market) content for launch including analyst and press communications, demand generation, digital/social engagement, and field readiness while ensuring consistency across different channels and regions to engage with and deliver to customers and partnerso Sales Enablement and Readiness: Assist with content, activities and manage tools/systems that drive sales productivity and results through training and coaching, and preparation to have value and solutions oriented conversationsRole Requirements:· Currently enrolled at an accredited University pursuing a bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing,Psychology, EnglishMajor, or a similar field· Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal· Strong quantitative skills, and ability to use metrics to drive decision making· Self-starter with initiative and attention to detail· Positive attitude, and growth mindset to be curious about what works, what doesn’t and why· Good relationship building skills· Agility and speed, able to work in a fast-paced environment

Description: SummaryBallast Lane Applications, LLC is seeking an experienced CS major to join our team as a Software Engineer in one (or more) of the following disciplines: Mobile, Front-end web, Back-end and/or Dev Ops. You would be located in Medellin, Colombia where the bulk of our multi-national team is located and work directly on projects for our US based clients. Ballast Lane Applications is headquartered in the Boston area.Company OverviewBallast Lane Applications was founded in 2011 and is a software design and development agency located in the Boston area with a team of project managers, developers, and testers in Medellin, Colombia. We build mobile and web applications (full-stack) for startups and scaling SMB businesses using a nearshore model that keeps costs attractive and the collaboration between teams close. We also have experience with Alexa skills, virtual reality, and image processing.Our clients hail from industries such as energy, retail, financial services, wellness and media verticals, and are from the Boston-area, New York, Texas, and Los Angeles. Ballast Lane is a key member of our clients' teams and works closely with all levels both business and technical.Position OverviewAs a software engineer, you will work on a client-related development project. Your incoming skills will determine whether you work on a mobile, web front end, or backend project, and your project could be related to a personal financial management app, a wellness app, or to an Internet of things (IoT) system. We work on many types of software platforms and you would join the project where your skills would be the best fit.You'll learn the ins and outs of sprint-based development and testing on a team with other developers, a project manager and product owner. You'll be assigned tickets that have a description of what needs to be done, and your code will be reviewed by a senior developer before being tested.Throughout the duration of the work, you will be given lots of hands-on guidance and support with almost daily check-ins.You could work extensively with Swift, Kotlin, React, NodeJS, Bitbucket, Jenkins, AWS, and Cypress. Your projects will give you the opportunity to have a big impact on the work that Ballast Lane does. Projects will be tied to important business objectives and will be put to into production.Ballast Lane is open to finding a full-time hire from the co-op program and would also consider a part-time work arrangement during the school year.Where You will WorkMedellin is the tech capital of Colombia and offers a rich culture, near perfect weather year-round and a vibrant environment. Colombia is the success story of South America and has almost completely shed its troubled past and is now the second strongest economy in South America, safe and friendly to foreigners who are working there.We have an office in the downtown district (El Poblado) with exactly the same conveniences and vibe you would find in Boston. Our team there is a mixture of Ex-Pats living in Colombia, Colombians and Venezuelans.The office language is English, but of course, everyone speaks Spanish as well so you could work on your language skills.Who You'll Work WithYou'll be directly managed by the COO, Wido de Vries, and you'll work with an integrated team of employees. Here are a few specific people you'll get to know pretty well:Larry Ehrhardt, Founder and CEOLarry is responsible for Ballast Lane's industry expertise, client relationships and firm development. He loves working with our long-term and new clients to build great products to engage customers, grow new businesses and create operational efficiencies. Equally, he enjoys building and supporting the Ballast Lane team that is so critical to our clients' success.He has a BA from Yale University, an MBA from the Darden School of Business and has completed computer science coursework at the Harvard Extension School where he was also a Teaching Fellow for Intro to Computer Science and Mobile Applications.Prior to founding the company, he led teams and initiatives in enterprise software, management consulting, and IT professional services.Wido de Vries, COOWido is a professional with a great drive to improve, using his analytical, change management and operational skills. He has experience in digital product development, online sales and service, market research, consultancy, and project and program management as well as in operational management within Digital Agencies, Health Insurance, P&C Insurance and Life & Pensions.Wido is responsible for the daily operations of the team in Medellin and for the overall delivery of the digital products. From start to finish, fromspecifications to deployment and support, Wido is supporting clients to make their digital dreams come through. Together with his team he has been responsible for the launch of 10s of new digital products.You can see the rest of the team on LinkedIn by searching for Ballast Lane Applications.Office Culture + Team DynamicsBallast Lane Applications does lots of client and team interaction via slack and in person meetings. We strive to structure the work so that each team member has clear tasks and deliverables, and a team to bounce ideas off of and get feedback. All our team members will interact directly with client personnel during design and review sessions.Most employees at Ballast Lane Applications work from 8am-6pm with an hour lunch break.There are definitely some fun perks to working at Ballast Lane Applications! Employees have the opportunity to work on their Spanish while pushing their coding skills, and they have access to a professional development shop where they learn the business of software development ? the approach, the process, the tools, and the team.When asked about what he enjoys most about working at Ballast Lane Applications, Larry said, "I love working with our clients to make something that is really important for their business."Who You AreYou have at least one co-op or internship under your belt, or equivalent work experience

Position: EY - Tax – Diversified Staff Group – Intern
Targeted Academic Majors: D'Amore-McKim School of Business/Finance, D'Amore-McKim School of Business/Business Administration, D'Amore-McKim School of Business/Accounting
Workplace Type: On-site work is preferred when public health concerns allow, Remote work is permitted when public health concerns dictate
Description: Tax – Diversified Staff Group – InternTo be considered for an interview at EY· You must first apply using your school’s online recruiting system for only one of our positionsThe work you will do as part of our Tax practice is fascinating, complex and technically challenging. In EY Tax, you’ll have the opportunity to help the world’s leading multinational organizations meet complex tax obligations around the world. You’ll get a unique glimpse deep inside a company’s business and become a trusted advisor, working collaboratively on a team that influences major business decisions.Our Diversified Staff Group model is all about providing our people with the skills, information and knowledge to take on some of the biggest challenges in taxation. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to spend time in a wide range of Tax service areas, covering everything from business, international, state and local, and transactions tax, to global compliance and reporting. After a few years developing into a broad-based tax professional, you will make an educated choice about which area of tax best aligns with your skills and interests, and with the support of industry-leading teams, there’s no better place to gain this experience.The opportunityYou can expect to develop a unique insight into our business, where you’ll build a network of relationships in an area that influences major business decisions every day. As the team continues to grow, so will you, and over time, you will become a well-rounded tax professional with broad experience in multiple areas of tax.Your key responsibilitiesYou will spend a large portion of your time directly engaged in complex compliance projects for our clients. This will be balanced with research, planning, and meetings with senior colleagues. EY focuses on a variety of industries, including but not limited to: automotive and transportation, consumer products, health and life sciences, media and entertainment, mining and metals, oil and gas, power and utilities, and technology. Additionally, we have differentially invested in an industry structure that focuses on financial services through our Financial Services Organization (FSO). Candidates electing to join the FSO will focus exclusively in financial services and will have opportunities to serve leading investment banks, retail and commercial banks, insurers and investment managers. Whichever you choose, you’ll find no shortage of opportunities to take on new challenges and responsibilities while discovering and developing your strengths and ambitions.How will I spend most of my time?Below are some examples of the meaningful work you will do in Tax from the moment you join us, with support and guidance from mentors and more senior team members:· Handling and supporting a wide variety of tax compliance processes· Assisting with tax due diligence on behalf of a private equity firm· Preparing tax returns for large, international clients· Working with audit teams to determine whether tax accounts are appropriate for financial statements· Researching tax code and writing memos for clients· Improving the tax effectiveness of supply chain structures· Developing and utilizing a diverse network of colleagues across the businessTo qualify for the role you must have· A predicted undergraduate degree in Accounting; graduate degree in Accounting or Taxation preferred; both supported by a strong academic record· A demonstrable plan for passing the CPA exam· Excellent English language communication skills· Expertise in time management, and the ability to adapt to change under pressure· Strong analytical and problem solving skills, and the confidence to translate complex information into insightful, actionable recommendations· A highly collaborative approach to work, and the personal integrity to support not only your team’s interests, but colleagues across a global business· Flexibility and willingness to travel as well as work in excess of standard hours when necessary· A driver’s license valid in the U.S.· Integrity within a professional environment· Developing and utilizing a diverse network of colleagues across the businessTo qualify for the Law Path you must have· A pre predicted undergraduate degree in accounting and JD, or a JD and LLM in Taxation· Membership or anticipated membership in a U.S. state bar or CPAIdeally, you’ll also have· Experience as an intern in any area of tax· Proven leadership skills· Experience working alongside colleagues at all levels of a business· For the Law Path, experience within a tax law clinic or tax law journal preferredWhat we look forWe’re interested in strong team players who support their colleagues in reaching their goals while also considering their own workload and development. We’re looking for people with a genuine passion for tax, and the future of tax, and are inspired to help the world’s leading multinational organizations meet complex tax obligations around the world. If you have the confidence to speak up and influence a team that affects big businesses worldwide, this role is for you.What working at EY offersIf you join EY full-time after your internship, we offeracompetitivecompensationpackage where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, a minimum of 18 days of paid time off plus 12 observed holidays and a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being.Plus, we offer:• Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the profession• Opportunities to develop new skills and progress in your career• Gained flexibility through two-way communication and commitment with your engagement teamsAbout EYAs a global leader in assurance, tax, strategy and transaction services and consulting services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.Make your mark. Apply todayEY provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Description: The Human Health & Performance Systems Group focuses on objective, technology-based human-centered solutions to measure, model and modify cognitive and physiological function for enhancement, sustainment, or recovery. This goal is accomplished through three broad technical areas: health and resilience monitoring, trauma care, and performance enhancement. Research in all areas includes capability gap analysis, advanced sensing, machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms, biologically-based modeling, prototyping, system integration, and field testing of systems to monitor the human state, predict outcomes, and intervene to improve health and performance. Typical goals include increasing physical, cognitive and psychological performance and resilience of end users in their operational environments; measuring, modeling, and modifying the brain to mitigate neurotrauma and neurodegeneration of end users after exposure; and developing human-machine interfaces for enhanced end user performance and communication within groups. This highly interdisciplinary group draws on skills from biology, physiology, cognitive science, neuroscience, psychology, biosignal processing, engineering, machine learning and artificial intelligence, computer science, physics, and medical research areas. Primary government sponsors and partners are in the Departments of Defense, Veterans Affairs, Homeland Security, NASA, the National Institutes of Health, and the National Science Foundation.Job Description:The Human Health & Performance Systems Group at MIT Lincoln Laboratory seeks a co-op student to support a diverse multidisciplinary team that is developing and prototyping novel capabilities for physiological and cognitive monitoring as well as AI-enabled medical devices. The main responsibilities of the individual include embedded programing with microcontrollers, mechanical design, rapid prototyping using 3D printers, and basic circuit design. Other aspects of the work include assistance with prototype testing and pilot data collection. The individual will work closely with experts in hardware and circuit design, signal and image processing, and algorithm development. Requirements:Candidates should be working toward or already have a BS or MS degree in one of the following or a related field: Mechanical Engineering, Bioengineering, Electrical Engineering, or Computer Science. Proficiency in MATLAB and SolidWorks is required. Experience in microcontrollers and one or more common programming languages such as C or Python is strongly desired. Knowledge of circuit design is a plus.

Description: About this unit:The cardiology/vascular surgery unit provides care for patients with a variety of dysrhythmias requiring pharmacological, and interventional support, like IVCD’s and pacemakers. The patient population includes patients having chest pain/anginal symptoms evaluated and treated. Heart Failure patients also receive care as part of the award winning “Get with the Guidelines” American heart Association program. Patients with peripheral vascular disease are also cared for using both surgical and interventional techniques. This is a dynamic, acute unit where Nursing is practiced at the highest level.Job responsibilities:Functioning under the direction of the Registered Nurse (RN) and as a member of the unit-based patient care team, the Patient Care Assistant (PCA) performs duties of direct and indirect patient care. The PCA is responsible for supporting the RN with clinical tasks, including, but not limited to glucometer, EKGs, and vital signs. The PCA is also responsible for supporting the RN tasks of daily patient hygiene and ensuring safe mobility assistance. Proper documentation of PCA tasks into the medical record is expected. In addition, the PCA is responsible for responding to the needs of patients and family members and takes a proactive role in the efficient operation of the unit.NRSG 2000, NRSG 2220/1 - Nursing Interventions and Assessment Lab, nursing medical/surgical clinical rotations.Currentlyenrolled in BSN program Public transportation from NU:GREAT CO-OP EXPERIENCE WITH STAFF THAT ENJOY TEACHING!

Description: Resumes will be reviewed October 5, apply before then to be considered.SpaceX was founded under the belief that a future where humanity is out exploring the stars is fundamentally more exciting than one where we are not. We are developing the technologies to make this possible, with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars.SPRING/SUMMER 2021 INTERNSHIP/CO-OPSpaceX seeks extraordinary students to join us for Spring/Summer 2021. As an intern, you will work closely with your mentor and other employees who will help you apply your knowledge and grow your skills on projects that have a significant impact. You’ll also get to have some fun and network with other interns and employees through optional social and professional events. If you’ve demonstrated a commitment to academic success and motivation to apply your knowledge outside of the classroom, you are a great candidate!Internships are available with a variety of engineering teams across the company including design, manufacturing and operations at Brownsville, TX; Cape Canaveral, FL; Hawthorne (Los Angeles), CA; Irvine, CA; McGregor (Waco), TX; and Redmond (Seattle), WA.BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:TEAM DESCRIPTIONS:AVIONICS: Designs, develops, manufactures, tests, analyzes and integrates all electronic hardware. This includes but is not limited to: power conversion units, analog and digital circuit boards, FPGA’s, communication system units and firmware as well as enclosure and wire harness development.BUILD RELIABILITY: Ensures quality production of assemblies and piece parts that flow into the production of the vehicle and proactively improve the vehicle reliability. This group develops standard tools, processes, methods, design adjustments and requirements to ensure production reliability.CUSTOMER OPERATIONS AND INTEGRATION: Serves as the main interface between technical teams and customers to ensure our missions are successful and timely. This group encompasses the Space Operations team, which focuses on revolutionizing spaceflight operations for cargo and crew Dragon missions, as well as future company missions. There are roles in product management, mission management, mission engineering and proposal development. FLIGHT RELIABILITY: Reviews and certifies the vehicle’s test and flight readiness. This team works to maintain safe, reliable practices during operations and to bridge operational and design challenges between test and launch. Flight Reliability interacts with the engineering, production, test and launch teams from the planning stage all the way to launch for the purpose of reviewing the vehicle configuration and status.LAUNCH ENGINEERING: Fly, recover, fly again. The Launch team works at our Florida launch sites, our South Texas facility and Hawthorne headquarters on our Falcon 9, Falcon Heavy and Starship launch vehicles. Teams within this organization include but are not limited to: Ground Operations, Payload & Vehicle Integration, Recovery Engineering, Fleet Management, Launch Site Systems and Development Test.MATERIALS ENGINEERING: Creates materials solutions to expand the capabilities of current vehicles and to push design boundaries for our future ones. They cover a wide range of materials disciplines from alloy development, large scale composite structures, additive manufacturing and traditional aerospace materials. This group’s work supports new designs, enabling re-usability of rockets and materials research focused on interplanetary travel.PRODUCTION: Leveraging best-practices from a wide variety of industries, SpaceX aims to scale its production rate beyond that of any other launch company in the world. The Production group provides hands-on experience in a fast-paced environment with cutting edge technology. This group includes but is not limited to: Launch Vehicle and Spacecraft Assembly, Industrial Engineering, Integration & Test, and Manufacturing Engineering.PROPULSION: Creates advanced rocket and spacecraft propulsion systems. This team designs, analyzes, builds and tests engines that will one day take humans to Mars. SpaceX currently builds more rocket engines than any other organization in the country. Furthermore, the design and performance parameters of SpaceX engines are notably recognized throughout the industry.PURCHASING: The SpaceX purchasing team is responsible for ensuring lowest product cost and risk through supplier management, strategic negotiations; spend analysis and continuous process improvement. An intern joining this team would expect to gain first-hand experience analyzing supplier and spend data, communicating with suppliers, purchasing direct and/or indirect goods or services, and support of various projects like creating and implementing new processes.SOFTWARE: Develops software used to design, develop, test and launch rockets, spacecraft and satellites. In addition to embedded software engineering, they also do simulations, distributed data management and develop analysis tools used in preparation for a launch. Their problem domains span embedded, fault tolerant, flight control, web, mobile, cloud and big data computing. The products that they develop run on low-power space computing platforms, mobile devices, desktop systems and in data centers.SUPPLY CHAIN: Improves and develops the business processes that enable SpaceX to design, build, launch and reuse the most advanced rockets in the world. Interns in this group will help innovate and improve efficiencies to ensure that the Supply Chain team is continuously evolving to meet its internal customer demands and to achieve SpaceX’s overall mission of sending humans to Mars.TEST OPERATIONS: SpaceX tests every engine, component and stage for development and flight at a 4,000-acre state-of-the-art rocket development facility in McGregor, Texas. Interns will receive the opportunity to take ownership of projects related to the systems and hardware used to prove out the next generation of American rockets.VEHICLE ENGINEERING: Designs, develops and qualifies hardware on all vehicles. This group partners with engineering and production teams to create innovative, mass-efficient vehicle and spacecraft structures. This group includes but is not limited to: propulsion components, structures engineering, in-space propulsion, integration & test, vehicle analysis, thermal & fluid analysis, life support systems and guidance navigation & control.ITAR REQUIREMENTS:To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about the ITARhere.SpaceX is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with SpaceX is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.Applicants wishing to view a copy of SpaceX’s Affirmative Action Plan for veterans and individuals with disabilities, or applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the application/interview process should notify the Human Resources Department at (310) 363-6000.

Description: Global Supply Chain Co-Op/Full-Time InternABOUT THE NESTAt bluebird, only two things matter - patients and our people. When you join the nest, you're not just landing a new gig, you become a part of a flock that's soaring to new heights. We’re 1100+ doers, thinkers and collaborators across 7 countries with a strong sense of our values and our purpose. Our innovation and sustainability are rooted in the diversity of our flock and results are achieved through cooperation and the incorporation of multiple points of view. This is personal and we approach every challenge with radical care. The time is now to rise up and recode the science, the systems, and the status quo.ABOUT THE FLOCKThe Global Supply Chain flock is all about getting stuff done, working collaboratively, and advancing our technology. As a part of our evolving and dynamic college program, you’ll have a chance to work with some of the brightest birds in the business, striving to make real impact for our patients and our people. Come gain experiential hands-on knowledge with a group of birds that loves rising to the challenge much as we do!HOW YOU’LL FLYWe seek a fun, entrepreneurial and highly motivated co-op / intern with a passion for international supply chain operations and information systems to lead and support a variety of projects within a unique and dynamic supply chain. In this role, you will have the opportunity to perform a range of tasks and support multiple compliance, logistics and planning activities. You will lead projects focused on standardizing and improving supply chain processes and implementing tools and technology to enhance data analytics and reporting.As a Global Supply Chain Co-Op/Full-Time Intern bird reporting to Michael Simon, you'll help to bring more patients their bluebird days by:· Providing direct support to Supply Chain leadership group (Trade Compliance, Transportation, Labeling, and Packaging Technologies).· Develop cross-functional understanding of the international supply chain and how international trade regulations impact the business· Revitalization, update and maintenance of the supply chain information systems for trade compliance, transportation, labeling and packaging technologies.· Develop, improve, and implement tools to support the analysis and visualization of compliance and transportation activities.· Assist in the development of process flow diagrams, standard operating procedures, and work instructions to improve standardization of supply chain processes.· Collaborate with leadership in the maintenance of internal compliance manuals and ensures that accurate and current process requirements are documented and maintained· Ongoing mentoring and training in a fast-paced, corporate environment· Other related tasks as neededWHAT YOU’LL BRINGYou’re the bird we’re looking for if you:· Have (Currently enrolled in a degree program at an accredited college or university, focused in business, life sciences, or law)· Display natural enthusiasm for learning· Exemplary collaboration/cross-functional skillset· Interest in international supply chain (Trade Compliance, Transportation, Labeling, and Packaging Technologies)· Proficient with Excel and knowledgeable with the Microsoft Office Suite and data visualization and analytic tools (Spotfire)· Background and experience in operations management, inventory management· Strong verbal and written skills; ability to provide focus and clarity; able to handle confidential information and material appropriately· Ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment where results are achieved through influence and the incorporation of multiple points of view· Independently motivated, detail oriented and good problem solving ability· bExcellent organizational skills, sufficient to multi-task in an extremely fast-paced environment with changing priorities· Possess the (Ability to work a six-month assignment, full-time – January 11 – June 25)· This position is 100% REMOTE.All our birds embrace the principles of the bluebird bio culture: b colorful, b cooperative, b yourself.bluebird bio is deeply committed to fostering an environment where diversity and inclusion are not only valued, but prioritized. We believe a diverse and inclusive community empowers us to act courageously, care deeply, and dream boldly to impact people in big ways. Diverse viewpoints bring diverse capabilities which strengthen our focus and fuel our growth.bluebird is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or any other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Description: Traverso Laboratory, Department of Medicine, Brigham and Women’s Hospital, Harvard Medical School, Part-time, 20 hours/weekProject Description:We have an opening for a co-op student (senior undergraduate/ M.Sc.) who is interested in doing research in the areas of mechanical/materials engineering, electrical engineering, biomedical engineering, robotics, and medical device development (12-16 months period). The outstanding candidate assists investigators in the Traverso Laboratory at Harvard Medical School to develop new biomedical devices and technologies such as drug delivery systems, smart pills and stents, soft actuators, and ingestible electronics for sensing and monitoring. Primary responsibilities include materials characterization, formulation, design/ prototyping using various types of polymers and biological materials, and chemical and analytical assays, utilizing both routine and specialized techniques.Examples of duties include formulation and mechanical/chemical characterization of polymeric/elastomeric materials; design/modelling with Solid Works, Abaqus, MATLAB; making prototypes including 3D printing, laser cutting, injection molding; preparing compounds with a micro-compounder and extruder; and in vitro work including dissection for prototype tissue interaction evaluation and setting up experiments with gastrointestinal tissue ex vivo; designing devices to be tested in large animals and analyzing pharmacokinetic studies.We are looking for intern students who are highly motivated, responsible, creative, critical thinkers, organized, and interested in a challenging, fast-paced, intellectually stimulating environment. Due to the interdisciplinary nature of our research, students with backgrounds in all disciplines of engineering and science including mechanical engineering and materials science, biomedical engineering, electrical engineering, chemistry, chemical and biomolecular engineering are strongly encouraged to apply. Students are expected to work closely with a research scientist in the laboratory.Contact: Interested candidates should send a curriculum vitae, transcript, along with a brief description of their research interests/experiences and start date availability (preferably in Winter 2021) to Dr. Sahab Babaee (sbabaee@mit.edu) and cc: Dr. Giovanni Traverso (PI) ctraverso@bwh.harvard.edu and Vanessa Fuentes (Program Manager) vgfuentes@bwh.harvard.edu.

Position: Smarter Dharma - Policy Research & Planning (Global, Remote)
Targeted Academic Majors: College of Arts, Media & Design, College of Professional Studies/Regulatory Affairs, College of Professional Studies/Global Studies and International Relations, College of Social Science & Humanities
Workplace Type: Primarily remote work
Description: Job Overview:Smarter Dharma is looking to expand its engagement with government institutions and think tanks in creating sustainable policy interventions in mainly hospitality and construction sectors. The Research Assistant will be one with an aptitude for policy with a willingness to learn and will proactively explore avenues for intervention keeping in line with the vision of the company.Responsibilities and Duties: Essential duties required to carry out this job. ○ Provide support for ongoing policy related projects through literature review, empirical research and data collection ○ Explore opportunities of collaboration with government institutions and think tanks ○ Explore available grants and reach out to relevant institutions ○ Be informed of and attend relevant workshops and seminars ○ Be informed of relevant regulatory structures in the policy arena Proficiency in statistical tools and methods i.e. data analysis, weighted averages, regression analysis; well versed in excel.Qualifications/relevant majors: Education level: Masters degree [Public Policy, Political economy, Developmental studies or Sustainability] Experience: Freshers/1-2 years of experience. Personal characteristics: Highly motivated with a willingness to learn Certifications: Any Sustainability program certification but not mandatoryAdd-ons:Smarter Dharma is a young team of highly motivated people from different backgrounds with an abiding interest in sustainability. The candidate will be in an atmosphere where there is ample scope for learning through interactions, research and on the field. Smarter Dharma follows a fairly flat structure with no hierarchy, creating a unique and inclusive work environment. We have set processes for smooth operations. We are also foodies and burn our calories by playing soccer!About the company:Smarter Dharma is a social enterprise operating spectrum-wide in the field of sustainability. We work at the intersection of societal welfare and environmental sustainability delivering financially viable solutions. We are motivated to facilitate the global efforts to transition to a circular economy by helping our clients shift from the ‘business-as-usual’ approach to one that entails efficient and sustainable business practices. We believe our diverse team possesses the complementary skill sets to help realize this goal.Programs and services by Bridge CulturesOnline workshops/webinars:Students learn about the culture and multiple facets and influences on various aspects of life through conversations with people they would meet while in Bangalore. With a remote co-op, Bridge Cultures will enable these conversations virtually. We will organize 3 virtual webinars and workshops on various topics in context to cultural integration which will align with students’ professional and personal growth. Bridge Cultures will bring professionals from various domains and facilitate these interactive sessions.Few topics (not confined to) are listed below:· Social entrepreneurship· Know the city - food, culture, people· Leadership and Teamwork· Unconscious biases· Critical thinking· Influence of culture on design, education, outdoor education, experiential education· Sustainability· Mental health, emotional well-being· Impact of traveling on our personalitySelf-reflection session:Bridge Cultures believes that self-reflection is highly important and necessary to learn and grow, especially after working with a social enterprise on an impactful project. Out of many reasons, reflection is important because it:· Enables the individuals to process and make meaning of the experience· Fosters a better understanding of context. i.e. understanding how their work impacts the community and encourages more participation in future· Creates a sense of accomplishment· Enables the individuals to examine the effects of their behavior, discover ways to improve· Reinforces the feeling of empathy gained during the experience· Acknowledges the skills gained during the experience and builds confidenceFees and process:Inclusions:· Co-op placement· Necessary documentation· Self-Reflection session· 2-3 online webinars/workshops on various topics· Review meetings during co-op to track progress· Social networkProcess:1. Students apply for various positions through NU works2. Bridge Cultures will send an email to the student to schedule a call3.   After the student’s response to that email, a call will be scheduled between the student, Ms. Aspa Papanastasiou (Associate Director, Global engagements at NU), and Bridge Cultures to ensure accountability from the student’s side4. Another call will be scheduled with Bridge Cultures (if needed) to understand the student’s interest, motivation, and expectations from the co-op5. The student will pay the Program fees to Bridge Cultures ($455)6. Bridge Cultures will facilitate the call between student and the organization7. The organization will communicate their response to Bridge Cultures and the student8. If the student is selected, the organization will share the appointment/offer letter with Bridge Cultures9. Bridge Cultures will share the appointment letter with the student10. The student will start the co-op on the decided dates11. Bridge Cultures will facilitate virtual onboarding if necessary12. Bridge Cultures will facilitate 3 online sessions on various topics and organize 2 review meetings during the co-op13. Bridge Cultures will facilitate self-reflection session at the end of the co-opRefund policy:· If the student is not selected by the first organization interviewed for, Bridge Cultures will find another position with another organization. If the student is not selected there as well, 50% of the program fees will be refunded to the student· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op prior to confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 25% of the program fees (this is to factor the currency transaction charges that incurs to Bridge Cultures)· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op after receiving confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 75% of the program fees

Description: To apply:1) submit your application through this NUworks site;Quality Engineering Co-ops acquire data analysis software skills and learn lab measurement tools. Gain understanding of machining, assembly, and test processes to identify sources of variation.Transmission Components Plant FunctionHow would you like to be able to tell your friends and family that you helped manufacture powertrain component's that are in vehicle's they drive every day? Well, that's what we do here, design and manufacture transmission and engine timing powertrain components for the auto industry.As a Quality Engineering Co-op in TC, you will learn and practice:Quality Engineering Co-ops enjoy a healthy balance of hands on and office work, and will interact with engineers from product and applications engineering, manufacturing engineering, and quality engineering, as well as a number of laboratory and manufacturing personnel in their daily activities.A Quality Engineering Co-op should be self-starting, highly motivated, and able to excel at a wide range of tasks with minimal supervision.BorgWarner Morse Systems is the world leader in automotive chain systems for engine timing and power transmission/torque transfer. Transforming vehicles to more fuel efficient, cleaner technologies requires a collaborative partner who understands the evolution of mechanical to electric systems. Our expertise in both provides the critical underpinnings of efficient and powerful propulsion. Integrating electronics into the mechanical system is the key to performance, packaging and cost. This is evidenced across a full line of our combustion, hybrid and EV products for light vehicles, medium & heavy duty vehicles as well as off-highway applications. We continually set global benchmarks for valve timing and drivetrain chain performance.We are a tier one supplier, which means we sell directly to the major automotive manufacturers, such as Ford, GM, and Chrysler. About 70% of the vehicles on the road have a Morse Systems product in it.We look forward to meeting students that have drive, initiative, and a "can do" attitude. We are seeking students that have excellent verbal and written skills, an understanding of engineering principles and a willingness and desire to learn. A methodical thought process to problem solving will be beneficial in this position, as is the ability to work independently or in a team setting. Co-ops must possess good analytical and deductive reasoning skills and computer literacy is necessary.You are receiving real, hands on knowledge that can be considered full-time experience on any resume. For that reason, we desire hard working, serious students.Co-ops at BorgWarner Morse Systems are more than just co-workers; they form incredible friendships. From picnics and lunches to kickball tournaments to hiking in Ithaca's gorges, our co-ops bond while networking. Co-ops experience a variety of tasks, regardless of department. While working side by side with other co-ops and engineers, our co-ops plan and run tests, improve upon current methods, and learn essential engineering skills.Situated at the southern tip of Cayuga Lake in New York State's Finger Lakes Region, Ithaca offers an amazing assortment of things to see and do for a smaller city in a rural environment. From its spectacular natural beauty to its world class educational and cultural opportunities, Ithaca presents a high level of sophistication and variety in its recreational offerings.

Description: Cedilla Therapeutics is a young company focused on harnessing intrinsic protein stability mechanisms to expand the reach of small molecule therapeutics. Targeting diseases caused by protein dysregulation, in ways that are distinct from other approaches, provides an opportunity to create unique and valuable new medicines for patients in need. This is an exciting opportunity to join a fast-paced start-up environment, and candidates who are keen experimentalists, enthusiastic, creative, and have a passion for drug discovery should apply.We are looking for a collaborative and enthusiastic co-op to join our Chemical Biology and Proteomics team. You will expand your skills in computational characterization of proteins and protein-small molecule interactions. We view the methods and workflows of bioinformatics and computational proteomics as central part of our research platform and are looking for a co-op with intellectual and scientific curiosity, flexibility, personal motivation and determination to help drive our target identification and drug discovery programs.We view you as a valuable member of our team. Contributions made during your co-op will be critical to the success of our endeavor. Those contributions may include:· Processing and analysis of mass spectrometry data· Analysis of protein structure and small molecule ligandability data· Generation of protein-centric databases· Generation of interactive web apps with ShinySome of the highlights of your background are:· Currently enrolled in a B.S. or M.S. program in bioinformatics, computer science or a biochemical field with experience in computational methods.· Knowledge of a programming language is required, R preferred.· Previous experience with Shiny apps would be favorably considered.· Basic understanding of mass spectrometry and proteomics would be recommended.· Excellent attention to detail and strong documentation skills are essential.· Prior experience at a biotech or pharmaceutical company would be desired but is not a must.To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter to Careers@Cedillatx.com

Description: Job Description:In this Co-op experience, the student would be exposed to a variety of mental health and psychiatry-related research activities, but with specific emphasis on supporting intervention development to improve the engagement of diverse families in treatment of ADHD and other child psychiatric conditions as part of Dr. Andrea Spencer's Revolutionizing Equal Access to Care and Health for ADHD (REACH) research group. The student’s support for these projects would cover a wide array of research-based responsibilities, which may include: participant recruitment; pre-screening and scheduling; conducting clinical scales; conducting semi-structured interviews with families; helping study coordinators in data collection; completing data entry and conducting data quality assurance checks; conducting literature reviews; supporting research protocol and regulatory logistics; assisting in IRB submissions; collaboration and cross coverage with fellow research assistant working on ADHD and care engagement research studies. Priority will be given to bilingual (Spanish/English) applicants who could perform the above research activities in Spanish and help translate study documents (e.g. recruitment flyers). Outstanding co-ops may have the opportunity to be involved in the analysis of quantitative and qualitative data, contribute to research manuscripts, and to present research at poster sessions and conferences.The co-op student will additionally be asked to assist on a study developing a parent skills intervention towards parents of adolescents with ADHD targeting parent-child communication. There is also the opportunity to assist on a longitudinal survey study being conducted to gain a deeper understanding of the ongoing impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the mental health of children age 5-12 and their families.The student may also gain clinical experience through multiple activities, which could include shadowing physicians (remotely), and conducting clinical assessments with human subjects as part of research protocols.The student will also be tasked with important administrative responsibilities, which may include:Other remote professional development opportunities include:Personal Qualities:Desirable Skills (not required):

Description: VACANCY NOTICE: CO-OP INTERNSHIP ON STATELESSNESS, NATIONALITY AND HUMAN RIGHTSThe Institute on Statelessness and Inclusion is recruiting an intern to assist with research and advocacy on statelessness, nationality and human rights. There is a position available in either our Netherlands office (located at Tilburg University in Tilburg) or our UK office (located at Middlesex University in London). In view of the current pandemic, it is also possible and may be required, depending on COVID-19 related travel guidance at the time, to work remotely. Applicants must have excellent analytical and writing skills in English. Applicants must be available for six months, commencing January 2021, and for 32-40 hours per week.The Institute on Statelessness and Inclusion (ISI) is the first and the only human rights NGO dedicated to working on statelessness at the global level. Our mission is to promote inclusive societies by realising and protecting the right to a nationality. Our work combines research, training, advocacy, creating knowledge tools, information-sharing and building strategic alliances. For more about our organisation and team, visit https://www.institutesi.org/about-us and to see what we are working on, browse the overview at https://www.institutesi.org/what-we-do.Description of the vacancyThe intern will be responsible for undertaking and assisting with desk research on topics in the field of statelessness, nationality and human rights. This may include, for example: compiling and analysing human rights documents such as those issued by UN treaty bodies or under the Universal Periodic Review mechanism; undertaking comparative analysis of law, policy or jurisprudence from different national legal systems; exploring the broader socio-political background to and context for ‘good practice’ law or policy reforms. In addition to desk research, the intern may also be required to liaise with partners within ISI’s international network to seek or share information (by email/skype/phone). The intern will input the findings of the research conducted into relevant ISI publications, advocacy, tools or strategic discussions. The intern may also be asked to directly draft or present (sections of) reports, factsheets or other materials using research findings.Required qualificationsApplicants must be enrolled in a relevant Northeastern University programme and have a keen interest in human rights, migration and nationality issues. Applicants must have good research and analytical skills, as well as excellent writing skills in English. Knowledge of other UN languages, in particular Arabic, is an asset, as is previous research experience. Applicants must be able to work independently and plan and execute research. ISI interns are given significant responsibility within their role and are treated as full members of the ISI team, so it is important that the successful applicant is reliable, shows initiative and has excellent inter-personal skills, including the ability to work within a team.Practical detailsThe intern expected to work a minimum of 32 hours per week for ISI, based in either the London or Tilburg office – even though it is also possible and may be required, depending on COVID-19 related travel guidance at the time, to work remotely. Exact working times are to be agreed upon commencement of contract. This is an unpaid position and the intern has no entitlement to any financial compensation nor reimbursement for commuting costs. To apply for this position, please submit your CV, letter of motivation outlining relevant interests, qualifications and experience and a writing sample to ISI by sending an email to Georgia Field, Outreach and Development Officer - Georgia.Field@institutesi.org.The deadline for applications is 1 November 2020. For further details on ISI’s mission, values, structure and areas of work, please visit www.institutesi.org.

Description: Traverso Laboratory, Department of Medicine, Brigham and Women’s Hospital, Full-time, 40 hours/weekThe student will contribute towards developing ultra long-term and triggerable drug delivery systems, including oral drug delivery systems that reside in the gastrointestinal tract for >1 month. Primary responsibilities include materials synthesisandphysicochemical characterization, in vitro testing of materials on cells/tissues and in vivo analyses in small and large animals. General responsibilities include operating lab equipment, conducting experiments, collecting data, recording and documenting experimental procedures and results, consulting scientific literature as needed, analyzing and summarizing results, and working with a multidisciplinary team of researchers.Job Requirements:REQUIRED:· B.S./B.A. major in biomedical engineering, material science, chemical engineering, bioengineering or a related field;· Commitment to producing accurate and high-quality data;· Experience of conducting tests following instructions and operating and maintaining technical instruments/equipment;· One or two years of prior experience working in a laboratory environment (at the undergraduate level is acceptable);· Strong organizational, time management and documentation skills;· Excellent analytical skills and strong communication and writing skills;· Willingness to learn new scientific tools and techniques quickly;· Applicant will be trained to perform techniques in experiments, including techniques related to animal work. After sufficient training, the intern is expected to work independently with minimal supervision;· Awareness of basic safety requirements and ability to follow safety procedures and maintain a safe work environment.PREFERRED (whichever applies):· Relevant experience in novel drug delivery technologies (e.g., micro/nano particles, polymer coatings/matrices, and hydrogels).· Relevant experience with standard molecular, cell and animal techniques, including flow cytometry, PCR, tissue harvest and processing and other techniques as needed.· Relevant experience in polymer synthesis and characterization techniques such as nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) / gel permeation chromatography (GPC) / scanning electron microscopy (SEM)/ rheology / differential scanning calorimetry (DSC) / dynamic light scattering (DLS), etc.Interested candidates should email: Dr. Vivian Feig vfeig@bwh.harvard.edu and cc: Dr. Giovanni Traverso (PI) ctraverso@bwh.harvard.edu and Vanessa Fuentes (Program Manager) vgfuentes@bwh.harvard.edu.

Description: Columbia Tech provides world-class product development, manufacturing, global fulfillment, and aftermarket services to a diversified group of capital equipment innovators in the medical, life sciences, energy, homeland security, robotics and automation, communications, 3-D printing, semiconductor, LED, water treatment, and food and beverage industries.Job SummaryThe Manufacturing Engineer ( I ) is responsible for developing high quality manufacturing processes for a wide variety of products, including all phases from production planning to final assembly. This individual will be responsible for transitioning products from internal (CT Engineering) and external (CT customers) CT manufacturing, and supporting those products once in routine production.Duties and Responsibilities· Evaluate manufacturing processes; applying knowledge of product design, fabrication, assembly, tooling, and materials; conferring with equipment vendors; soliciting observations from operators.· Develops manufacturing processes by studying product requirements; researching, designing, modifying, and testing manufacturing methods and equipment; conferring with equipment vendors.· Improves manufacturing efficiency by collecting data and working with more senior manufacturing engineers to analyze and plan staffing, work flow, space requirements, and equipment layout.· Assures product and process quality by designing basic to intermediate complexity testing methods; testing finished- product and process capabilities; establishing standards; confirming manufacturing processes.· Provides manufacturing decision-making information to management by calculating production, labor, and material costs; reviewing production schedules; estimating future requirements.· Prepares product and process reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.· Possesses a basic level of understanding or background in lean manufacturing, fixture design, part design, design for manufacturing and assembly practices.· Creates and maintains manufacturing records including Bills of Material, assembly and test procedures and work instructions, and test records.· Implements continuous product improvements aimed at improving reliability, design for manufacturability and assembly (DFMA), as dictated by customer needs and requests.· Keeps production and test equipment operational by coordinating maintenance and repair services; following manufacturer's instructions and established procedures; requesting special service.· Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies.· Support floor personnel in assembly for manufacture, troubleshooting documentation and design issues to resolution.· Support Program/Project Managers by providing technical assistance· Perform costing and /or estimates for product changes or new products.· Direct activities and provide guidance and oversight to manufacturing technicians.Qualifications·    Working toward Bachelor of Science in Engineering.· Working experience with CAD (SolidWorks preferred), MS Office, MS Project, and MRP/ERP systems.· Good technical aptitude and basic understanding of electro/mechanical assemblies.· May have basic knowledge of MRP/PDM; Epicor E9/10 and SW EPDM software experience a plus.· Basic knowledge of GT&D, inspection methods and tools.Note: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and/or skills required of all personnel so classified.

These positions include:- Costume Assistant- Assistant Stage Manager- Associate Producer- Overhire CarpentersBrown Box offers stipends for all positions. The stipend would depend on the position and whether touring is required. It could range from $300 - 1,000.To find out more information or apply, please reach out to Ashley.cabral@brownboxtheatre.orgAbout Us:We, at Brown Box, believe that all people deserve easy access to the arts and the community benefits that they foster. Brown Box Theatre Project’s mission is to break down barriers that separate the masses from live theatre by bringing the very best in performance, design, and collaboration to unconventional venues and underserved destinations to reach the widest audience possible. Description: Putnam is looking for top performers to join their firm. As an Associate Consultant Co-op you will gain insight into the strategic issues facing today's life sciences companies, as well as the specific challenges impacting the healthcare industry. The complexities of the industry provide an opportunity to gain comprehensive knowledge of both the science and business sides of healthcare. Co-ops work in case teams of 4-7 professionals led by a Manager or Partner. While responsibilities vary greatly from case to case, they are instrumental in developing the building blocks to identify critical issues, develop key analytical components, and ultimately, drive conclusions and recommendations. Through this process, Co-ops develop sound business and strategy fundamentals and a thorough understanding of solving complex business issues.Duties include:At Putnam, we pride ourselves on a team-based approach that is client focused and impact oriented. We serve many of the industry leaders, including all of the top 10 global biopharmaceutical companies. Almost all of our studies combine sophisticated quantitative analytics with significant qualitative fact-finding and synthesis to inform strategic decision-making. Our diverse casework spans portfolio prioritization, development pathway and resource optimization, market assessment, product pricing and launch strategies, market segment growth strategies, sales and marketing strategies, franchise development and patent expiration strategies. While the client-service core of our work can be demanding, we pride ourselves on the collegial, friendly and balanced environment at Putnam where consulting can be a long-term career option.Building on a long-track record of success Putnam is poised for a period of significant growth and we are looking for talented team-oriented individuals to help fuel this growth and benefit from the professional development opportunities it will create. Diversity, inclusion, and respect are at the heart of Putnam's culture. We believe that a diversity of backgrounds provides our consulting teams with a competitive advantage as we seek to develop innovative strategies in dynamic healthcare marketplaces around the globe. As we expand our team here at Putnam we are looking for individuals who share these values.A complete application includes:

Description: Job Overview:The storyboard developer will engage with stakeholders of chosen projects in each of the three focus areas of TIDE listed above and develop audiovisual material to showcase the work to a larger audience. The storyboard developer needs to be able to empathize with the stakeholders, pick out success stories and challenging stories and develop audiovisual communication material. The intended target audience is the wider world, specifically potential funders and partners for TIDE’s work.Responsibilities and Duties:· Understand TIDE’s philosophy, culture, and work ethos by reading and interacting with team· Choose projects in each of the focus areas for storyboarding in consultation with the team· Identify positive stories from the field· Develop narratives that bring out the baseline, impact, journey, and way forward· Create audiovisual material by working directly with stakeholders· Share learning with TIDE teamQualifications: Education level - Bachelors or Master’s degree (Social work, development studies, communication, gender studies) Experience – Freshers welcome Personal characteristics – Team player, good communicator, humble, creative Language and skills – Kannada oral communication skills preferred (but not necessary); photography and film making skills would be desirable.Skills gained at the end of the internship:· Techniques to capture stories· Interpersonal skills – talking to people from different backgrounds and age groups.· Awareness of various socio-economic issues prevailing in India.· Improved photography and filmmaking skills.Start date and duration:January 2021 to June 2021.Compensation and working hours (per week):Unpaid. 40 hours per weekAdd-ons:The team at TIDE is a vibrant mixture of young minds and experienced leadership. It is a small organization that encourages out of the box, innovative thinking.Bangalore is a cosmopolitan city with great weather throughout the year and friendly people too. Bangalore is well connected to the rest of the country and is an ideal spot to start exploring India.About the organization:TIDE is a development organization that leverages technology for conserving the environment, creating livelihoods, and addressing societal issues. Since inception, TIDE has developed/ adapted and transferred technology options like improved cookstoves, biogas, biomass gasification, biomass briquetting and energy audits. Our work aligns with Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of the UN, namely 3,5,7,11,12,13.2. Energy and resource conservation – Urban electricity conservation programs (VidyutRakshaka and VR lite) and School programs centered on sustainability.3. Gender & Livelihoods – Encompasses mobilization and awareness for rural women on innovative livelihoods, Women's Technology Park (WTP) as a hub for incubating rural, technology-based women's enterprises, Rural women leadership programs, and village development.Programs and services offered by Bridge CulturesOnline workshops/webinars:Students learn about the culture and multiple facets and influences on various aspects of life through conversations with people they would meet while in Bangalore. With a remote co-op, Bridge Cultures will enable these conversations virtually. We will organize 3 virtual webinars and workshops on various topics in context to cultural integration which will align with students’ professional and personal growth. Bridge Cultures will bring professionals from various domains and facilitate these interactive sessions.Few topics (not confined to) are listed below:· Social entrepreneurship· Know the city - food, culture, people· Leadership and Teamwork· Unconscious biases· Critical thinking· Influence of culture on design, education, outdoor education, experiential education· Sustainability· Mental health, emotional well-being· Impact of traveling on our personalitySelf-reflection session:Bridge Cultures believes that self-reflection is highly important and necessary to learn and grow, especially after working with a social enterprise on an impactful project. Out of many reasons, reflection is important because it:· Enables the individuals to process and make meaning of the experience· Fosters a better understanding of context. i.e. understanding how their work impacts the community and encourages more participation in future· Creates a sense of accomplishment· Enables the individuals to examine the effects of their behavior, discover ways to improve· Reinforces the feeling of empathy gained during the experience· Acknowledges the skills gained during the experience and builds confidenceFees and process:Inclusions:· Co-op placement· Necessary documentation· Self-Reflection session· 2-3 online webinars/workshops on various topics· Review meetings during co-op to track progress· Social networkProcess:1. Students apply for various positions through NU works2. Bridge Cultures will send an email to the student to schedule a call3.   After the student’s response to that email, a call will be scheduled between the student, Ms. Aspa Papanastasiou (Associate Director, Global engagements at NU), and Bridge Cultures to ensure accountability from the student’s side4. Another call will be scheduled with Bridge Cultures (if needed) to understand the student’s interest, motivation, and expectations from the co-op5. The student will pay the Program fees to Bridge Cultures ($455)6. Bridge Cultures will facilitate the call between student and the organization7. The organization will communicate their response to Bridge Cultures and the student8. If the student is selected, the organization will share the appointment/offer letter with Bridge Cultures9. Bridge Cultures will share the appointment letter with the student10. The student will start the co-op on the decided dates11. Bridge Cultures will facilitate virtual onboarding if necessary12. Bridge Cultures will facilitate 3 online sessions on various topics and organize 2 review meetings during the co-op13. Bridge Cultures will facilitate self-reflection session at the end of the co-opRefund policy:· If the student is not selected by the first organization interviewed for, Bridge Cultures will find another position with another organization. If the student is not selected there as well, 50% of the program fees will be refunded to the student· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op prior to confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 25% of the program fees (this is to factor the currency transaction charges that incurs to Bridge Cultures)· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op after receiving confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 75% of the program fees

Description: Job Description:EMD Serono's Bioinformatics group is looking for Coop students for Spring 2021. The selected candidate will work on several target discovery and biomarker development projects within the Immunology and/or Immuno-Oncology therapeutic areas.An ideal candidate has a strong background in data analytics, strong coding skills, and solid understanding of human molecular biology and immunology. The student should be familiar with R and ideally at least one other programming language (eg, Python, Perl or Java). Previous participation in research projects is highly desirable, as is some experience in RShiny app development. Students enrolled in Bioinformatics master's degree programs are strongly encouraged to apply, but students from computer science, data analytics, and related programs will be considered as well. Experience working in a Linux environment, AWS, and methodologies for reproducible research (e.g. git, markdown) would be an advantage.The student will carry out analyses to generate and verify hypotheses, create presentations with results, write reports, and present their findings to project teams. Computational work will include writing code to process large public (e.g. TCGA) and internal datasets and running analysis pipelines. For example, processing raw sequencing data (RNAseq, WES, miRNA, metabolomics), network and pathway analyses of gene expression or proteomics data, benchmarking new published algorithms and packages, designing novel analysis pipelines, creating classifiers with AI/ML methods, etc. Past projects have focused on sorted-cell RNASeq from Lupus patients, data from various single-cell technologies, text-mining, digital pathology, analysis of immuno-therapy effects on tumor models, and finding rational drug combinations.While specific projects will depend on the time of joining, a specific project plan will be developed for each student at the beginning of the co-op period. The student will learn how to address specific biological questions using different bioinformatics techniques as well as gain better understanding of drug development for auto-immune diseases and immuno-oncology. The student will also be able to participate in group and departmental meetings and seminars to learn about computational work at a pharmaceutical company and about all stages of drug development.The co-op program is designed to have candidates carry out impactful and reproducible research and develop interest/passion in different areas of data analytics/bioinformatics and to help improve programming and other skills. Our past alumni have become successful PhD students in top Universities, or bioinformaticians in prominent pharmaceutical companies with the help and training provided as a part of the program.Please, note that this coop will take place either remotely or on EMD Serono site regardless of the situation with COVID-19.
