Description: Summary:Mythic Therapeutics is a product-platform company that is pioneering a powerful protein engineering-focused approach to improving the effectiveness of antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs) and other antibody-based therapeutics. Our technology dramatically increases therapeutic potency without compromising safety, thereby unlocking the full potential of targeted therapies against a broad array of tumor targets. At Mythic, we focus on patient-centered science and are driven to leave a lasting impact on cancer care.As a member of our rapidly growing team, you will have the opportunity to work in an innovative and dynamic environment. We seek a motivated, solution-oriented individual to provide hands-on support for the discovery and development of Mythic’s therapeutic molecules. The ideal candidate will have a background in molecular biology, cell biology, protein biochemistry or related fields along with excellent organizational and oral/written communication skills. We offer an excellent training program in a collaborative environment where students will work under guidance of an experienced Scientist and contribute to discovery and characterization of engineered antibodies for ADCs.Responsibilities:As a key member of the R&D Team at Mythic Therapeutics, the Co-op student will:i) Perform molecular biology experiments such as cloning, western blotting, SDS-PAGE analysis and protein expression in mammalian cells and/or E.coli.ii) Perform and enable high throughput characterization of antibodies and proteins using binding, stability and functional assays.iii) Support key experiments by maintaining a broad range of cell lines and conducting cell-based bioassays using flow cytometry, biochemical assays, etc.iv) Analyze and interpret data, communicate results in oral and written form, maintain accurate and complete laboratory records.Qualifications and SkillsJob Location: 100 Beaver Street, Waltham MA 02453

Description: The Protein Engineering and Antibody Technologies (PEAT) department participates in the early phases of the discovery process for biologics. The Protein Engineering group applies molecular and cellular biology techniques to design and engineer expression plasmids for protein production in mammalian cells, and also to develop mammalian cell lines for various assays. The expressed proteins are primarily drug candidates, or tools and reagents needed for identification and characterization of drug candidates.The Molecular Biology group supports many pipeline projects for the development of antibody or antibody-like therapeutics, mainly in the ImmunoOncology, Oncology, and Immunology therapeutic areas. The major responsibilities include DNA cloning, restriction enzyme digestion, DNA fragment purification, ligation and transformation. Various plasmid purification procedures are used including methods for preparing DNA at the mini, maxi, and giga scales. PCR, qPCR for SNP analysis, and DNA sequence analysis are commonly employed. Tasks will include expression of proteins in mammalian cells, and detecting and analyzing protein expression by different methods, such as Octet, SDS-PAGE, and western blot. The student will maintain an electronic notebook to record experimental procedures and data.

Description: About UsSolidEnergy Systems is a Li-Metal Battery technology company. We manufacture the world’s lightest rechargeable cells at pilot scale for prototype demonstration and specialized aerospace markets. But our real future lies in the materials we supply—anodes and electrolyte—for mainstream markets such as consumer electronics and electric vehicles. We supply these to large Li-ion cell manufacturers to be integrated with a separator and cathode into full cells which can be customized for different applications including drones, consumer electronics, and electric vehicles.Because our anode and electrolyte materials are compatible with existing Li-ion cell manufacturing processes, we can achieve scalability by using existing infrastructure. This eliminates the need for costly infrastructure investment. It’s all part of our open ecosystem. Description: Product Development - Mechanical Engineer with a Medical Device Company in Newton, MAJanuary - June 2020About the Company: Dynocardia is a Newton, MA, and Cambridge, MA based company founded by a team of engineers and physicians from MIT and Tufts Medical School. Dynocardia is addressing a 100-year old challenge – the need for an accurate and continuous, non-invasive blood pressure monitor. This device will allow for predictive, remote patient monitoring, which will enable a continuum of critical care in hospitals and facilitate correct diagnosis and management of hypertension and other chronic diseases (telehealth).The NIH identified the need for a cNIBP monitor as a public health priority and funded Dynocardia to develop a fundamentally new way to measure BP with the first standalone and wearable cNIBP and other vital signs monitor, the ViTrack.We are looking for dynamic individuals who are interested in learning and applying their product development and testing skills in the medical devices industry.· BS or MS in Engineering (Mechanical, Biomedical, Electrical, and Computer sciences preferred)Years of Experience· 0-2+ years of experience with a Bachelor's degree· 0+ years of experience with a Master's degree or higherQualifications:Must have:An ideal candidate will be someone who matches the following minimum qualifications· Strong knowledge and hands-on experience with CAD design softwares ( Solidworks / Catia / Autocad)· Machine shop experience (3D printing, and basic machine tools handling)· Basic knowledge of programming languages: C++ / Python / Matlab.· Working knowledge of product design, development, and test practices.· Hands-on experience in building and testing experiment set-ups (not specific to any field).· Oral and written communication skills.· Ability to diligently follow documentation protocols and suggest improvements as required· Ability to work in a team environment.Nice to Have:· Experience with medical device testing and understanding of hardware and software systems.· Experience with data analysis and data presentation.· Experience with dFMEA and risk management practices.· Experience with medical device testing and understanding of FDA Quality System Regulations (QSR).· Able to handle multiple tasks/projects and manage priorities.· Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment. Experience with Agile and iterative development practices is a plus.· Self-motivated with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.· Knowledge of statistical methods· Knowledge of 3D modeling is a plusScope of Work:· Design and set-up Mock circulatory loop· CP2 design upgrades and fabrication· CP2 Assembly and testing· Gel fabrication· Creating SOPs, test protocols and other quality control documents· Assist in internal data collection

Description: Boston Medical Center (BMC) has long been a leader in recognizing that for our patients to be truly healthy, we cannot focus solely on their physical and mental wellbeing alone. We know that holistic health also requires us to not only address our patient's physical and mental health, but to also address their access to social support, such as food and housing insecurity, legal needs or employment. In particular, BMC has a long history of providing this holistic care to immigrant and refugee patients in various programs throughout many departments at BMC. In 2019, we launched the BMC Immigrant & Refugee Health Center (IRHC), a comprehensive, multidisciplinary Center thatunitesall of BMC's existing programs and expertiseintoone coordinated network of care, allowing us to serve our patients in a more holistic, coordinated, effective and efficient way. The key programs that comprise the IRHC include the Boston Center for Refugee Health and Human Rights (BCRHHR) in the Dept. of Psychiatry, the Immigrant and Refugee Health Program (IRHP) in the Dept. of General Internal Medicine (GIM) and the Women's Refugee Health Clinic in the Dept. of OBGYN, as well as other partners across the hospital who are experts in immigrant and refugee health.

Description: · Explore / develop advanced approaches for analysis of single-cell RNA- sequencing (scRNA-seq) and bulk RNA-seq experiments· Research and frame key questions to address scientific use cases· Identify / define appropriate data sets· Perform data analyses and visualizationsProject proposal – details tbd/subject to change!To advance towards the goal of identifying sub-populations of glioblastoma cell types which might be linked to more aggressive cancer, you will perform a literature review in collaboration with disease biology colleagues in the Oncology Disease Area. Description: We Grow Microgreens, LLC founded and operated by urban growers Lisa Evans and Tim Smith, specializes in growing highly nutritious microgreens, edible flowers and unique plants using sustainable growing practices.We Grow Microgreens, LLC expanded to almost an acre of land in Hyde Park conveyed by deed by the City of Boston in March of 2019. The couple built an aesthetically beautiful, water conserving and energy efficient glass greenhouse that melds into the fabric of a residential neighborhood. The couple selected a high-quality glass greenhouse for the farm that allows neighbors to see the lovely greenery during all months of the year. The glass greenhouse has translucent solar panels on part of the roof and two rainwater tanks collecting 7,000 gallons of rainwater so that the business can have a greater capacity of sustainable growing practices of microgreens, edible flower production and unique tropical plants resulting in increased yield and conservation of resources. The Farm includes a Community Preservation Act funded landscaped community walking path with wildlife attracting plantings designed by Landscape Architect Wes Wirth.The couple has been successful in winning eleven grants from the Massachusetts Department of Agriculture, the United States Department of Agriculture, Governor Baker and the City of Boston. They were awarded Microenterprise of the Year by the Small Business Administration in 2019.GENERAL JOB DESCRIPTIONThe farm is looking for an intern to assist with the sales and marketing of our growing urban farm. As our construction is nearing its final stages, we will be equipped to be up and running at full capacity soon and need to build a reliable customer base.There are multiple aspects of the farm that can become profitable, such as our microgreens, unique house plants, fruits and veggies from our raised beds, and on-site educational capacities. As former Boston Public School teachers, Tim and Lisa have over twenty years of combined teaching experience to create a thriving educational program at the Farm. The intern will help explore these options and work directly with Tim and Lisa to devise a suitable plan to market the business effectively.The intern will have a leading role in running We Grow Microgreens’ social media accounts and website. They will also be conducting market research on potential customer bases. Design skills are preferred but not required.The farm is looking for an undergrad or grad student studying in the field of marketing or sales. The ideal candidate is outgoing, self-directed and creative and has a passion for sustainable agriculture. The intern will work both independently and as part of a team. The intern will also assist in other areas of the farm such as harvesting microgreens, picking vegetables and flowers and general maintenance of the Farm.ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIESThe farm is currently in the final stages of construction and business building. A grant for the construction of 200 raised beds has recently been awarded, and the assembly of these will begin in the winter months. The intern will be expected at times to help with basic construction projects like these.We are attending farmer's markets throughout the winter months and need assistance in marketing these markets and our online pick-up services. You will have the opportunity to learn about marketing through social media in the agricultural and horticultural realms. You will get first hand marketing experience at farmer’ market and the farm’s farmstand by promoting and selling the products. Lastly, you will learn about growing microgreens and harvesting techniques.This is a start-up farm, so you will wear many hats. We welcome any suggestions in building our budding business.MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES1.Oversee a specialized marketing campaign on one aspect of the business, to be discussed with Tim and Lisa2. Conduct research on potential audiences and marketing campaigns3. Run the business’s social media accounts and website4. Build raised stone beds5. Build raised wood beds6. Grow microgreens and edible flowers7. Assist at Farmer's markets selling produce8. Assist at Farm-stand selling produce9. Collaborate with other individuals on the farm10. Be a role model for teen employees that already work on the farm11. Assist with selling microgreens at farmer's marketsQUALIFICATIONS FOR THE JOBCOMPENSATIONTo apply, please submit a resume, cover letter, and contact information for two references.Our website is www.wegrowmicrogreens.comFacebookInstagramFarm is located at21 Norton StreetHyde Park, MA 02136

Description: Company Description:Metalor Technologies USA is an international, Swiss-based group, with subsidiaries in 15 countries. It is a leading participant in the field of precious metals and advanced material.The Advanced Coatings Division (ACD), Powders and Flakes Business Unit is located in Attleboro, Massachusetts. We supply a comprehensive range of leading edge materials to meet the demanding requirements of the automotive, electrical, renewable energy (photovoltaics), and electronic industries. We produce precious metal powders and flakes with various particle sizes, surface areas, and morphologies by chemical, electrochemical, or mechanical means.The Attleboro facility has a staff of approximately 60 people, including Operators, Technicians, Chemists, Engineers, and Managers.Position Description:The Process Engineering Co-op position will be open to entry, intermediate, and advanced experience levels. Projects and assignments will be tailored to the individual's experience and comfort level, ranging from support work to full project management: in some instances the candidate will serve as a team member assisting Metalor employees with ongoing projects; in others the candidate will serve as team leader for his/her own projects. The Engineering team is very team-oriented and collaborative, and innovation is encouraged. Under the guidance of the Engineering Manager, the candidate will learn the various processes used at Metalor to produce silver powders and flakes, and gain valuable manufacturing experience, including exposure to R&D through Quality Control processing steps.The level of responsibility will be at the discretion of the Engineering Manager. The candidate will gain experience with industrial process-scale chemical reactions and manufacturing, distillation, R&D lab-scale chemical reactions and manufacturing, new product development, quality analysis, project management, and industrial controls and automation. The candidate will be fully trained in Environmental, Health, and Safety procedures before working in the production or laboratory environment. The Process Engineering Co-op will also have input and freedom to identify and pursue facility-wide or process scale improvement projects at his or her own discretion around in addition to planned projects.We are looking for motivated self starters, who are eager to learn. We want someone who can work well in a team, or independently when given adequate instruction. We are committed to serving as mentors for our Co-op students, and we expect the same level of commitment from them to their jobs here at Metalor. Co-ops will receive a large variety of valuable industrial training and experience, including hands-on involvement.Qualifications:Transportation:Metalor's Attleboro, MA facility is accessible by car or by commuter rail on the Boston-Providence line. The commuter rail stop is approximately a 5 minute walk from the facility.

Description: RequirementsEach year the MGH admits approximately 47,000 inpatients and handles almost 1.5 million visits in its extensive outpatient programs at the main campus and at its four health centers, in the Back Bay, Charlestown, Chelsea and Revere. Its emergency services handle over 88,000 visits annually. Each year the surgical staff performs more than 37,000 operations, and the MGH Vincent Obstetrics Service delivers more than 3,500 babies.The MGH conducts the largest hospital-based research program in the United States, with an annual research budget of nearly $463 million. It is the oldest and largest teaching hospital of Harvard Medical School, and nearly all of the hospital's active staff physicians are on the Harvard Medical School facultyIn March 1994, the MGH joined with Brigham and Women's Hospital to form Partners HealthCare System, Inc., an affiliation established to create an integrated health care delivery system providing excellent, cost-effective care while maintaining the hospital's historic dedication to teaching and research. In addition to the founding institutions, Partners HealthCare System now includes North Shore Medical Center, Newton-Wellesley Hospital and Faulkner Hospital. Partners' physician network, Partners Community HealthCare, Inc., currently includes more than 1,000 primary care physicians and 3,500 specialists. Partners also include home health agencies, McLean Hospital, a psychiatric facility in Belmont, Mass., and Spaulding Rehabilitation Hospital in Boston. Partners also are involved in a collaborative program for adult oncology with Dana-Farber Cancer Institute.

Targeted Academic Majors: Bouve College of Health Sciences, Bouve College of Health Sciences/Pharmacy, Bouve College of Health Sciences/Pharmacology, Bouve College of Health Sciences/Pharmaceutical Sciences, College of Science, College of Science/Chemistry, College of Science/Cell and Molecular Biology, College of Science/Biotechnology, College of Science/Biology, College of Science/Biochemistry, College of Science/Behavioral Neuroscience

Description: What sets us apart?At Acceleron we truly value the co-op program. Since 2007 we have employed 130+ co-ops, many of whom have returned as full time employees, five of which are currently part of the Acceleron team! In this mid-sized company you will have many opportunities to interact with cross-functional colleagues and executives and participate in fun company events. If you are looking to gain experience in a fast-paced biotech industry setting and develop professionally in a fun, dynamic environment, apply today for the opportunity to join our team!Quotes from previous co-ops:“I found the work to be fulfilling, and felt invested in what I was doing.”“I think my expectations were exceeded in that I was mentored by various people in my department as well as people on my team. I felt that I got guidance from all levels of the company.”Position Overview (Remote):This position will be part of the Clinical Pharmacology group focusing on pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics data to support pre-clinical and clinical studies of novel molecules. The focus for the candidate will be to learn concepts of pharmacokinetic/pharmacodynamic data analysis in drug discovery and development. The candidate will be involved in discussions related to clinical pharmacology study designs. The candidate will be responsible for literature mining to gain insights into clinical pharmacology related aspects of clinical trials, designs and their application in clinical development and summarizing the literature results into power point presentations. The candidate will also have the opportunity to develop department-specific standard operating procedures/work instructions, generation and development of templates related to clinical pharmacology analyses. The candidate will get to interact cross functionally across various departments, attend project team meetings and develop presentation skills. The candidate will be given one long term (2 to 3 months) project and multiple short-term projects (2 to 3-week duration) during candidate’s time at Acceleron.This position will be a great opportunity for someone who is interested in learning the concepts and applications of clinical pharmacology and not working in the laboratory. The candidate will learn biopharma drug development and making contributions to a variety of projects while interacting with people across the organization.Candidate Qualifications:· Willingness to understand and research literature related to pharmacokinetics/pharmacodynamis and associated mathematical concepts· We value enthusiasm for science, strong written and verbal communication skills, ability to learn quickly and work within a fast-moving teamAbout AcceleronAcceleron is a biopharmaceutical company dedicated to the discovery, development, and commercialization of therapeutics to treat serious and rare diseases. Acceleron’s leadership in the understanding of TGF-beta superfamily biology and protein engineering generates innovative compounds that engage the body's ability to regulate cellular growth and repair.Acceleron focuses its commercialization, research, and development efforts in hematologic and pulmonary diseases. In hematology, REBLOZYL® (luspatercept-aamt) is the first and only erythroid maturation agent approved inthe United StatesandEuropefor the treatment of anemia in certain blood disorders. REBLOZYL is part of a global collaboration partnership with Bristol Myers Squibb. The Companies co-promote REBLOZYL inthe United Statesand are also developing luspatercept for the treatment of anemia in patient populations of MDS, beta-thalassemia, and myelofibrosis. In pulmonary, Acceleron is developing sotatercept for the treatment of pulmonary arterial hypertension, having recently reported positive topline results of the Phase 2 PULSAR trial.For more information, please visitwww.acceleronpharma.com. Follow Acceleron on Social Media:@AcceleronPharmaandLinkedIn.Compensation: This is a paid position, rate varies based on experience

Description: This is a remote role based in Cambridge, MA.The GBS CICOE is responsible to support All functional groups at Biogen to establish a robust CI program within their functions, that drives productivity initiative/results and enables a culture of Continuous Improvement through the building of CI capability within the Organization.The team is also responsible for facilitating the development and supporting the deployment of an Enterprise wide CI Operating model, within each of the elements of the operating model, the CI COE Is responsible for the facilitation of the development on the frameworks to execute the 6 elements of the Operating model. Leading continuous improvement (CI) efforts and deploying lean methodologies across the site, as well as driving a continuous improvement culture within the organization. One of the elements that needs further development and growth is the element of ‘Master Tools and Methodologies’Project #1: Revamp the CICOE Sharepoint SiteProject Scope: While today's CICOE SP site has a very polished and Corporate Affairs aligned interface, the different subpages (aligned to the CI Operating Model) could do with a lot of development/ enhancement. This would include housing the CI Toolkit in a very easy to access interface, with user-friendly templates aligned to the CICOE Operating Model.Project #2: CI Training Materials Build OutProject Scope: As we expand the CI Training offering and create a CI Education Continuum from Novice to Expert, there is an opportunity to develop, coordinate & leverage expert resources (E.g. LinkedIn Learning) to model the learning experience over a maturity curve, leveraging a 70:20:10 framework [OTJ: Demonstration: Theory]. Development of the framework and building out and enhancing (existing) training materials would the scope of work.Key Learnings and Objectives (for the student)Three key learning objectives for the student are: 1) understanding of the Continuous Improvement Program at Biogen (Enterprise wide), 2) Learning the business through understanding needs of the different functions and regions of the organization 3) learning how continuous improvement program is deployed in a Biopharma manufacturing environment. This will involve learning about cultural change, business practices and governance, and operating model, elements and CI methodologies & tools. By working across functions, the student will also learn strong management, communication, and influence without authority skills.Outcomes and Values to the OrganizationDeliverables from this project will continue to evolve and mature the Enterprise program building capabilities to identify, prioritize, execute and measure the impact of a formal continuous improvement program. The student will work as part of the GBS CICOE focusing on bringing best practices of CI to fruition at all levels of the organization.To participate in the Biogen Internship Program, students must meet the following eligibility criteria:EducationEnrolled in a Bachelor’s degree (or in a current undergraduate program) in Industrial Engineering, Business Systems, Business or other related technical or business field.

Description: Seres Therapeutics is a dynamic biotechnology company in Cambridge MA pioneering innovative Ecobiotic® microbiome therapeutics. Seres recently had a successful Phase 3 clinical trial for treatment of recurrentClostridium difficileinfection, and has promising late clinical stage programs in Ulcerative Colitis. As such, we are well-positioned to become the first company to commercialize a new therapeutic modality comprising ecologies of commensal bacteria.Additionally, Seres has entered the clinic with multiple new product candidates in a range of therapeutic areas including immuno-oncology and inflammation to build upon its field-leading portfolio of intellectual property and know-how.Global microbiomes, Computational Microbiome Sciences Co-op Position:We are seeking a highly motivated co-op to assist in curating and pulling in-house public microbiome metagenomic data sets from different geographic regions, including both healthy subject data and data representing different disease areas of interest. The primary goal of this project is to assist CMS scientists at Seres in determining if and how drug products might engraft differently in differing geographic and cultural populations, and how this might impact drug efficacy. The student will work with scientists in Bioinformatics and CMS to curate and analyze public data sets, and predict how a complex drug products might impact non-US populations.This is an exciting opportunity for a co-op student to directly impact the first microbiome drug product with a positive Phase 3 clinical readout.Programming experience in R or python, and familiarity with a unix environment, strongly preferred.Key ResponsibilitiesQualifications

Description: Waters Corporation is seeking a motivated, independent, and strong technical contributor for the Chemical Engineering Co-Op position within the Instrument Development Group. This group, working closely with the Marketing Department, is responsible for the development of Modular Instruments and Integrated Systems for the Pharmaceutical, Biotechnology, Environmental, and Industrial marketplaces. These products are used routinely for the discovery and development of new medicines, biotech research, hazardous material identification, food and beverage production, and chemical manufacturing. This group has indirect collaboration with the quality, new product introduction, service, marketing and commercialization teams.Responsibilities1. Utilize Laboratory Tools such as Mass Spectrometry, Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM), Raman Spectrophotomer, ICP-MS, Keyence Microscopes, Material Testing Equipment, Thermal Chambers, and Pressure/Temperature Measuring Devices for Product Design and Failure AnalysisQualifications1. Currently seeking a technical degree in Chemical Engineering or related field.

Description: U.S. Citizenship is Required.We develop technology to meet the challenges of an increasingly congested and contested space domain. Our engineers design, prototype, operate, and assess systems that detect, track, identify, and characterize resident space objects. Given the potential for conventional conflict to extend to space, we conduct R&D on concepts and systems that will provide space mission resilience.The Advanced Capabilities and Technologies Group within the Space Systems and Technology Division develops technologies and techniques for space control, space surveillance missions, as well as terrestrial applications. The group's principal efforts involve the development of advanced satellite systems concepts, technologies and data exploitation methods. The group's current research activities span a broad range of topics, including novel visible and infrared optical systems, advanced image processing algorithms and techniques, and development of technologies for new space systems. The group is made up of researchers and technologists from a wide variety of disciplines including engineering, physics, astronomy and mathematics.The Advanced Capabilities and Technologies Group is currently seeking spring coop students to contribute to the development of small satellite payloads. The students will help develop initial system concepts, generate detailed mechanical designs and perform experiments. The students may also help with spacecraft environmental testing, part fabrication (machining, 3D printing), mechanical assembly and data post-processing.Requirements:Sophomore, Junior, Senior or graduate student in a relevant field such as Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Aerospace Engineering.Experience with Matlab, Solidworks (or other CAD packages) and LabView.Experience working with mechanical hardware including traditional fabrication, additive manufacturing and assembly.Experience with space systems, especially small satellite or CubeSat technology.Someone who likes to tinker and isn’t afraid to learn new subjects quickly.Minimum GPA 3.5Requisition ID: 30772For Benefits Information, click http://hrweb.mit.edu/benefitsMIT Lincoln Laboratory is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, disability status, or genetic information; U.S. citizenship is required.

Position: Smarter Dharma - Market research co-op (Global, remote)
Targeted Academic Majors: D'Amore-McKim School of Business/Marketing, D'Amore-McKim School of Business/Entrepreneurship and New Venture Management
Workplace Type: Primarily remote work
Description: About the company:Smarter Dharma is a social enterprise operating spectrum-wide in the field of sustainability. We work at the intersection of societal welfare and environmental sustainability delivering financially viable solutions. We are motivated to facilitate the global efforts to transition to a circular economy by helping our clients shift from the 'business-as-usual' approach to one that entails efficient and sustainable business practices. We believe our diverse team possesses complementary skill sets to help realize this goal.To ensure that students have a productive, safe and enjoyable co-op experience, Northeastern partnered with Bridge Cultures, an organization located in Bangalore. Sanam Jain, Founder & CEO of Bridge Cultures, facilitates the application and placement with Smarter Dharma, the pre-departure orientation, as well as, on the ground services including meals, housing and emergency assistance. Additionally, Linn Kloster, Northeastern alumna, has worked with Bridge Cultures and is available to converse with students interested in these opportunities. Linn can be contacted at linnkloster@gmail.com. A testament of Linn's experience can be found at the end of the job description.Project Title: Market ResearchJob position title: Marketing InternLocation: Online & remoteJob Overview:Smarter Dharma is a social enterprise working on behaviour change through implementation, education & policy change towards climate change and sustainability. We are looking for an independent & highly motivated individual who can work directly with the founding team to research on American markets for expansion and impact.Responsibilities and Duties: Online Market research & segmentation research Pre-sales audience researchReports To: Co-founderQualifications: Education level – Post graduate studies in marketing/ business Experience – 0-2 yearsSpecific skills / Personal skills:We are looking for someone who has an understanding of marketing & good analytical skills. The research undertaken will directly impact the strategies of the company with respect to setting up shop in North American markets.Internship start date: Immediate availability/ January-June 2021Duration: 4-6 monthsCompensation and working hours (per week): 40 hours a week, non paidAdd-ons:Smarter Dharma is a young team of highly motivated people from different backgrounds with an abiding interest in sustainability. The candidate will be in an atmosphere where there is ample scope for learning through interactions, research and on the field.Programs and services offered by Bridge CulturesOnline workshops/webinars:Students learn about the culture and multiple facets and influences on various aspects of life through conversations with people they would meet while in Bangalore. With a remote co-op, Bridge Cultures will enable these conversations virtually. We will organize 3 virtual webinars and workshops on various topics in context to cultural integration which will align with students’ professional and personal growth. Bridge Cultures will bring professionals from various domains and facilitate these interactive sessions.Few topics (not confined to) are listed below:· Social entrepreneurship· Know the city - food, culture, people· Leadership and Teamwork· Unconscious biases· Critical thinking· Influence of culture on design, education, outdoor education, experiential education· Sustainability· Mental health, emotional well-being· Impact of traveling on our personalityBridge Cultures believes that self-reflection is highly important and necessary to learn and grow, especially after working with a social enterprise on an impactful project. Out of many reasons, reflection is important because it:· Enables the individuals to process and make meaning of the experience· Fosters a better understanding of context. i.e. understanding how their work impacts the community and encourages more participation in future· Creates a sense of accomplishment· Enables the individuals to examine the effects of their behavior, discover ways to improve· Reinforces the feeling of empathy gained during the experience· Acknowledges the skills gained during the experience and builds confidenceFees and process:Program fees - USD $455Inclusions:· Co-op placement· Necessary documentation· Self-Reflection session· 2-3 online webinars/workshops on various topics· Review meetings during co-op to track progress· Social networkProcess:1. Students apply for various positions through NU works2. Bridge Cultures will send an email to the student to schedule a call3.   After the student’s response to that email, a call will be scheduled between the student, Ms. Aspa Papanastasiou (Associate Director, Global engagements at NU), and Bridge Cultures to ensure accountability from the student’s side4. Another call will be scheduled with Bridge Cultures (if needed) to understand the student’s interest, motivation, and expectations from the co-op5. The student will pay the Program fees to Bridge Cultures ($455)6. Bridge Cultures will facilitate the call between student and the organization7. The organization will communicate their response to Bridge Cultures and the student8. If the student is selected, the organization will share the appointment/offer letter with Bridge Cultures9. Bridge Cultures will share the appointment letter with the student10. The student will start the co-op on the decided dates11. Bridge Cultures will facilitate virtual onboarding if necessary12. Bridge Cultures will facilitate 3 online sessions on various topics and organize 2 review meetings during the co-op13. Bridge Cultures will facilitate self-reflection session at the end of the co-opRefund policy:· If the student is not selected by the first organization interviewed for, Bridge Cultures will find another position with another organization. If the student is not selected there as well, 50% of the program fees will be refunded to the student· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op prior to confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 25% of the program fees (this is to factor the currency transaction charges that incurs to Bridge Cultures)· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op after receiving confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 75% of the program feesWorking with Bridge Cultures allowed me to focus on my internship and get to know the culture and people where I was instead of having to spend too much energy on logistics. This helped me ease initial culture shock and really experience what this culture had to offer, in and outside my workplace. Through Bridge Cultures' network, I also met more like-minded people which made me feel quite at home in Bangalore over the course of my internship.During my stay the people at Bridge Cultures were also always available to me, to answer questions and organize activities I needed or wanted to do. Their staff was always friendly and went above and beyond to help. This removed a lot of stress and helped me feel safe. On a few occasions, they even helped me get to relevant doctors who I wouldn't have found on my own.In my opinion, Bangalore in itself is a wonderful place to co-op, with young professionals from the diversity of India as well as expats all around. It's a place where the rich traditions of India meet its modern, progressive, and innovative parts. I'm very grateful that Bridge Cultures helped me experience this as intimately and comfortably as possible and would recommend them to anyone considering working in India"

Description: And we’re looking for a Mechanical Testing Co-op!This is a great opportunity to work at a dynamic, young, and exciting company on the cutting edge of the display industry.This position is part of the Analytical Technology organization, responsible for the measurement of new ink films to be used in the next generation electronic paper display platforms. The position consists of two components. The first is conducting measurements on color, device performance and adhesion using a combination of off the shelf and in house built instrumentation using standardized operating procedures. The co-op will work with the full time lab staff to maintain the EO Lab and complete submitted testing by due dates. The second component of the position is to help with the development of new lab equipment and test methods. This position works closely with engineers and scientists from R&D, manufacturing and process development. The co-op will work with scientists and engineers to determine the best new experiment protocol, design and build instrumentation as required, initiate tests, and write new standard operating procedures. These tests are complex and involve multiple samples so excellent organizational skills are required and the co-op needs to manage his or her schedule for hundreds of samples at a time. The co-op will also prepare experimental display devices and subsystems and measure their mechanical, electrical, and optical properties. Requirements:· Familiarity with SolidWorks. Ability to design simple static and dynamic mechanisms. Good mechanical intuition.· Comfortable working with hand tools· Experience doing data analysis with Excel· Motivated self-starter. Works well independently and in teams. Good communication skills.· Good organization skills, attention to detail, and the capacity to manage own schedule· A GPA or 3.0 or higher· Local candidates only pleasePreferences:· Mechanical engineering or physics major or similar experience· Experience with mechanical testing equipment such as Instron· Familiarity with LabVIEW, JMP, SQL, programming· Flexibility with regard to schedule

Description: Software Engineer Co-opFreenome is hiring a Software Engineer Co-op to develop software to combat cancer and other age-related diseases. You will work as part of an interdisciplinary team of engineers and scientists building end-to-end solutions for our ML team and clinical and R&D labs.The Software Engineer Co-op develops information systems by studying operations, designing, developing and installing software solutions and supports and develops the software team. The ideal candidate will have the ability to prioritize well, communicate clearly, and have a consistent track record of delivery. They should have strong software and analytic skills and the ability to create innovative solutions with a willingness to express opinions and ideas.At Freenome, we’re building a multi-omics platform that ingests clinical-grade, high-dimensional, biological data for early cancer detection. We’re a diverse group of Engineers building tools and services which enable our Molecular and ML Scientists to turn great research into even better products. We will create actionable insights for health systems and will guide change for the way doctors think about early detection of colon cancer.As a member of a fast-growing team, you’ll participate on major projects and collaborate actively with our world-class team of engineers, scientists, designers, and product managers. You’ll build reliable, maintainable, scalable, and fault-tolerant backend services that enable the rapid growth of our business and our mission to save lives.Depending on your skills and our needs you'll be working on projects including ML platform development, job scheduler development, EMR system integration, and data CRUD operations and ETL. Our systems are built using the latest web software development technologies and methodologies.If you are passionate about being part of a strong engineering team while combating cancer we would love to speak with you!About FreenomeFreenome is on a mission to empower everyone with the tools they need to detect, treat, and ultimately prevent diseases.By applying advanced machine learning techniques to recent breakthroughs in genomic science, Freenome is developing simple blood tests to detect early-stage cancer and make treatments more effective. The company has raised $238 million from investors such as RA Capital, Polaris Partners, Perceptive Advisors, Andreessen Horowitz, funds and accounts advised by T. Rowe Price Associates, Inc., GV (formerly Google Ventures), Roche Venture Fund, Kaiser Permanente Ventures, American Cancer Society’s BrightEdge Ventures, Data Collective Venture Capital, Novartis and Verily Life Sciences (formerly Google Life Sciences).Our ScienceFreenome is building technology to gain an understanding of the body through several analytes derived from blood. These signals include cell-free DNA, methylation of cell-free DNA, cell-free RNA, circulating proteins, and immune profiling derived from thousands of prospective samples. By developing novel statistical learning methods and applying them to integrate various -omics datasets, Freenome is a leader in modeling specific biological mechanisms to capture disease dependent signatures such as gene expression, immune response, tumor burden, the tissue of origin, and 3D chromatin structure.By building comprehensive discovery datasets and modeling critical biological systems, Freenome is learning what biological changes are present within the blood between a variety of different disease states including cancer, autoimmune disorders, infections, drug response, and aging. With the combination of Freenome’s datasets, cross-functional technical expertise, and mission to uncover the biological truth, we seek to positively change the lives of millions through the early detection and early treatment of disease.OurCultureFreenomers are technical and creative, visionary and grounded, empathetic and passionate. We build teams around divergent expertise, which allows us to solve problems and uncover opportunities in unique ways. Freenomers are some of the most talented experts in their fields, coming together to advance healthcare one breakthrough at a time.We value empathy, integrity, and trust in one another. That means embracing other’s perspectives, those of our coworkers and those of the patients and communities we serve. It means knowing when to push, and when to listen. At Freenome, we give each other the benefit of the doubt in the belief that we’re all working as a team toward the same goals, and empower others to grow in a collaborative environment.What does a successful person look like at Freenome?Those who thrive at Freenome prioritize, manage, and execute their own goals in alignment with those of the company. They embrace our values of empathy, integrity, and trust, and hold themselves and their team accountable. They crave collaboration with brilliant minds from unfamiliar fields of study and believe that hiring and mentorship are fundamental to our success. Above all, they welcome and provide constructive feedback and criticism, trusting in the good intentions of others, and secure in the knowledge that embracing mistakes is the best way to learn and move on. For those who crave challenges, understudied problems, and the chance to see their work impact the lives of millions of people affected by cancer every year, there’s no better place to be.Freenome is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity in every way. Freenome does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law.

Description: The FirmVolcap Trading is an independent financial services boutique that currently belongs to Louis Capital Markets, a large inter-dealer broker with offices in London, Paris, Hong Kong, Israel, and New York City. Our goal is to become the preferred global partner for professional investors seeking multi-asset investment structuring solutions.At Volcap we provide investment structuring solutions to institutional, corporate and UHNW clients, as well as wealth managers, asset managers, and family offices in EMEA, Latin America and the Caribbean.On one hand we structure and manage private derivatives portfolios, and on the other hand, we structure and execute private transactions through a variety of investment vehicles. In this way, we help our clients structuring capital injections, private debt, loans, investment funds, among others.The RoleVolcap Trading is looking to expand its LatAm team, and is therefore looking to hire a trainee for a period of 6+ months with the possibility of hiring them as a full-time afterwards. On the derivatives end, the candidate will help the team with the generation and distribution of weekly trade ideas and axes for clients and prospects. They will also help pricing structured products with our investment banking counterparties, put together investment proposals and market research for clients, and generate reports on the performance of existing derivatives portfolios. On the other hand, the candidate will support the team with the creation of proposals for the structuring of investment vehicles, and participate on the execution of such transactions. Additionally, there are plenty of ad-hoc projects in which the candidate may be asked to participate in.The CandidateThe candidate must have:1. Professional proficiency in Spanish2. Proficiency in Microsoft Power Point and Excel3. Strong critical thinking and communication skills4. Attention to detail5. Ability to work independently and with our team to produce accurate, detailed work under pressure6. An interest in financial markets is a plus7. Professional proficiency in Portuguese is a plus8. VBA and programming skills are a plus9. Eligible for employment in the UK (without sponsorship) and willingness/ability to relocate to LondonCompensation commensurate with experience; in line with typical banking internships in UK.

Description: EMD Serono Research and Development institute is seeking a Research Assistant – (Co-op) for the Antibody Technologies ISCA Group.The co-op will join an Immunization, Sorting, Cellular Assays (ISCA) team that is responsible for High Throughput (HT) Screening of antibody from single B cell cloning, protein engineering and yeast display, and antibody characterization.The co-op will join an Immunization, Sorting, Cellular Assays (ISCA) team of the Protein Engineering and Antibody Technologies department (PEAT) in Billerica R&D campus for the discovery of therapeutic antibodies. The successful candidate will be part of the team responsible for antibody generation, screening and target binding. He/she will join a team which provides a variety of supports including large scale mammalian cell culture and cell cryopreservation, as well as developing and performing biochemical and immunological assays (High throughput FACS, High throughput DNA transient transfection, Octet, ELISA) for antibody generation, screening, and target binding. Other general responsibilities will include company safety and quality compliance, preparation of reagents, inventory, laboratory maintenance and organization, and documentation of experimental work in an electronic laboratory notebook and may present data in weekly group meetings.The candidate should preferably be a graduate (MS degree) in biology, immunology, molecular biology, biochemistry or other biological/biomedical sciences. Previous experience (coop) in cell culture, immunology or assay development is a plus. Candidates lacking experience in immunology but eager to learn in this area and under-graduates with previous coop experience are also encouraged.

Description: Oncorus, Inc. is a biotechnology company developing a best-in-class oncolytic virus platform with the aim of transforming outcomes for cancer patients. To date, Oncorus has been funded by established leaders in the biotechnology space such as MPM Capital, Oncology Innovation Fund (OIM), Deerfield Capital, Cowen Healthcare Investments, Perceptive Advisors and several others, in addition to strategic investors Celgene and Astellas. Oncorus is also a leader in corporate philanthropy and has taken a pledge to donate a portion of product sales to fund promising cancer research and to support cancer care in the developing world. We are located in Kendall Square, Cambridge, MA.The RoleWe are looking for a highly motivated and innovative candidate for a 6-month co-op role in our Molecular Biology group. This is a fantastic opportunity to make a significant impact in the next generation of immunotherapies. A successful candidate will be inquisitive about the science and capable of problem solving by consulting literature/colleagues, and the designing experiments to test resulting hypotheses.Day to Day Accountabilities and Opportunities· Clone and analyzed DNA constructs for expression and testing of therapeutic proteins.· RNA isolation and expression analysis by qRT-PCR.· Perform in vitro assays to confirm expression and activity of candidate therapeutic proteins (Western Blot, ELISA).· Maintain clear, accurate records of lab work and summarize results as needed in study reports.· Practice attention to detail and provide updates at team meetings.Our Ideal Candidate· Students majoring in biology, biochemistry, microbiology, or related majors.· Experience in molecular biology with hands-on skills in the manipulation of DNA including gel electrophoresis, restriction enzyme cloning, Gibson Assembly, mutagenesis, PCR including primer design, PCR cloning, qPCR.· Hands-on experience with DNA analysis software and CRISPR gene editing is highly desirable.· Experience in cell culture and virology a plus.· Ability to work as part of a cross-functional team.· Strong communication and organization skills, good working knowledge of MS office, data plotting and presentation.· Displays a high degree of maturity, honesty, trust and integrity. A curious individual who considers a scientific problem/question an opportunity for innovation and intellectual growth.· Previous co-op or intern experience preferred.Job Type: 6-month co-op.

Description: This is a 2nd or 3rd co-op role. Resumes will be reviewed the week of October 13Our World:The Jet Propulsion Laboratory is a NASA Federally Funded Research and Development Center (FFRDC) outside Los Angeles that develops and manages robotic spacecraft in the exploration of Earth, the solar system, and universe. It's a place where science, technology, and engineering intermix in unique ways. JPL currently has 20 spacecraft and 9 instruments conducting active missions across the universe.The Mission:The Mars 2020 Rover Mission Perseverance was launched in August of 2020 and it is on its way to Mars!Many other robotic planetary exploration missions and small R&D projects are also supported by JPL. These missions include the Clipper Europa orbiter, and the proposed Martian sample return to earth, as well as a proposed Europa lander/sampling missions. Bythe spring of 2021, Clipper Orbiter will be well into its manufacturing phase. Other proposed planetary surface sampling missions will be conducting significant amount of conceptual design, proof of concept and prototyping activity.The role:We are seeking candidates with interest, abilities, and experience in one or more of the following areas to assist our mechanical engineering teams with the development of JPL flight spacecraft, new technology, testbeds, and support equipmentAn inquisitive and curious nature, a strong work ethic, a creative streak, and a fun team player attitude are highly desirable attributes!The Perks:· You will be working with some of the smartest people on the planet, on a diverse team from around the country, on the most challenging projects in the solar system.· The opportunity to explore another corner of the country! Places like the San Gabriel Mountains, Hollywood, and Santa Monica are all within an hour of Pasadena.· JPL has a number of ways to get involved on-lab including two gyms, 17 recreational clubs, and softball leagues.       Co-ops are JPLers too! In addition to a competitive salary, co-op interns are entitled to JPL's full benefits package. This includes medical, dental and vision coverage, as well as vacation, holiday and sick pay.For those who qualify, relocation assistance and additional housing stipends are provided.

Description: (REMOTE)Who isServiceNow?Imagine your workday dominated less by emails and spreadsheets and more time given back to you to do your actual job. At ServiceNow, we are making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud-based platform and products streamline and simplify how work gets done across the enterprise. We are the fastest growing enterprise cloud software company in the world and was recently recognized on Fortune’s Future 50 list (https://fortune.com/future-50/2019/) For us, this is just the start.Who is Marketing at ServiceNow?Marketing is the engine room for growth at ServiceNow. We fuel the success of our customers, sales, and products. We have a customer-first mindset in all that we do. As a Marketing team, we are laser-focused on how we can connect with our customers by creating simple, sweet spot targeting, and by the positioning and packaging of our products and solutions. Description: We are currently hiring for our next Co-Op – Product Insights at our Samuel Adams Brewery in Boston, MA.*This position will be responsible for supporting consumer research for our Product Development team. Specifically, you will work with our Product Insights Manager in conducting internally run focus groups, interviews, and consumer feedback evaluations on new and current alcoholic beverages. You will also help manage and grow our newly developed consumer panels. You will help us gain competitive advantage by monitoring competitors and trends and reporting your findings.You will experience firsthand how consumer research plays a role in our Product Development process. You will also learn how to analyze and report on qualitative data in a meaningful, impactful way to influence business decisions.This position collaborates with Sensory, Product Development and the Brewery Tour Center & Tap Room teams, and includes the opportunity to work at Boston Brewery events and to help the Sensory team with additional testing.A highlight of the Product Insights Co Op role is an individual project in which the Co Op creates and executes on a topic they are passionate about, with the opportunity to present to the team.The brewery environment is fast paced but friendly, so the Co-Op should have good time management skills and strong work ethic, but also enjoy the comradery and fun team events with the brewery team.Time management and organizational skills are essential.Core Responsibilities:Product Insights· Grow and maintain internal and external consumer databases; including promoting participation, uploading new consumers in the database, and tracking consumer participation· Support internal consumer testing by creating screeners, help with scheduling, building questionnaires, day of set up and support, shipping products, data entry, note taking and report writing· Support external testing as needed· Gather feedback on Boston Beer products in the Tour Center and Tap Room when needed· Create SOP’s for newly completed processes and projectsCompetitor Landscape and TrendsCompetencies:· Commitment to Task· Problem Solving· Professionalism· Team Building· Communications· Multi-taskingProfessional Experience· Student must be 21 years of age· Market Research experience a plus· Classes in Marketing required· Working knowledge of Microsoft Office· Ability to work in a flexible and changing schedule· Must be able to lift (32) pounds*During COVID, the Product Insights co op will work both virtual and at the brewery based on safety and business needs.

Description: Lutron Electronics is a high growth, well-established leader in the lighting control industry. We use cutting edge technologies in innovative ways to improve the visual environment of residential and commercial buildings. New product development along with market creation and expansion continue to fuel our rapid growth. You have the opportunity to join us on the cusp of continued double-digit market growth per year.As a Lutron Engineering Co-op, you will work in a hands-on environment alongside more senior electrical and mechanical engineers, manufacturing and quality engineers and technicians. Involvement in the cross-functional team allows you to interact with many people from various departments. Using cutting-edge technology, co-ops apply engineering design to complex lighting and visual environment control systems. Our product development teams have responsibility for carrying the product from original design concepts through research and development to manufacturing finished products and systems.Electrical Engineering co-ops work in a multidisciplinary environment utilizing a variety of technologies including analog circuit design, RF communication, power electronics, digital circuit design, and color tuning.We are always looking for opportunities to improve our products and implement new technologies as they apply to our business.If you have enjoyed your project-based classes, you will love the working environment at Lutron.New areas of development at Lutron include radio frequency communication systems, energy management systems, "smart home" systems, miniaturized energy management control products, and power supplies for LED color control.We make every effort to give our co-ops real, impactful work. They are expected to learn how to think and design like full time engineers and at the end of their term, they are given the opportunity to present their work to several senior members of our engineering team. A co-op position at Lutron offers you a chance to experience the business world first-hand and to learn how Lutron works as a company.You will have the opportunity to meet various people within many departments and to learn about the exciting career possibilities Lutron has to offer.We consider co-ops very valuable in our search for outstanding future members of our team and pride ourselves in providing meaningful work experiences to students from universities around the world.Previous co-ops in our Boston, MA office have:· Tested and validated new product circuits on the bench using various engineering equipment· Debugged analog circuits and come up with solutions to address the problem· Designed, fabricated and assembled cutting edge lighting control PCBs· Invented methods of calibration for advanced lighting systems· Designed and set-up automated bench testingThings you will learn (If you don’t know them already)· Surface mount soldering skills· Advanced circuit debugging techniques· Using bench top equipment such as oscilloscope, waveform generator and power supply· Practical circuit design including schematic capture in Altium, layout implications, component selection and how to build a circuit that works under almost any conditionsQualifications:EE (hardware focused) majors with a 3.2 minimum GPA and at least 4 completed semesters. We seek talented, success-minded people with the desire and ability to make things happen. We look for engineers with not only great understanding of the theory but the desire and ability to turn the theory into a tangible product. Teamwork and hands-on engineering greet you every day on the job.Position may be partially remote (2 days per week, 3 days in office).

We are looking for someone with strong curiosity and work experience learning and mapping business processes to define and deliver projects for end users within the Procurement and Supply Chain team.In this role you will work closely with cross-functional team members from Procurement, Supply Chain Planning, Purchasing and Operations to develop new processes to improve the world-class Dell supply chain. You will be tasked with find innovative ways of improving our customer experience by focusing on lowering lead-times, and by helping impact our PNL by reducing exposure to excess and obsolete inventory.At Dell, our talented supply chain experts and benchmarked processes and capabilities are supporting the company’s transformation strategy. With in-house supply chain training and development programs that enable our team members to build their careers with us, we’ve built an environment where our team members feel inspired, connected and have the ability to succeed every day.− Analyze business processes & develop automation & solutions: deliver time savings or eliminate transactional tasks to allow end users to spend more time on strategic activities− Demonstrate expertise in analysis, business process improvement, and cross functional communications skills− Lead or support projects: Gather requirements, document as is and to be process flows, identify and communicate project scope, develop or test solutions, document and deploy solutions− Demonstrate Initiative: A curious self-starter who can figure out the next step and take the initiative to execute when appropriate− Be a team player: Work on cross-functional teams using Agile methodology− Data driven decision-making approach− Experience with advanced Excel, Tableau or Power BI, SQL, Visio− Strong English communication skills and ability to facilitate requirements and present findings− Ability to work effectively with cross functional teams in a collaborative, team environment− Ability to commute to and from Franklin, MACompany DescriptionWith more than 100,000 team members globally, we promote an environment that is rooted in the entrepreneurial spirit in which the company was founded. The company has also received many accolades from employer of choice to energy conservation. Our team members follow an open approach to technology innovation and believe that technology is essential for human success.Why work with us?-Life at Dell Technologies means collaborating with dedicated professionals with a passion for technology.-When we see something that could be improved, we get to work inventing the solution.-Our people demonstrate our winning culture through positive and meaningful relationships.-We invest in our people and offer a series of programs that enables them to pursue a career that fulfills their potential.-Our team members’ health and wellness is our priority as well as rewarding them for their hard work.Dell is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. The instrument and associated software allow for better accuracy, data integrity, speed to results along with automation. Description: Please see full job description below.[YES ] Background check/CORI[ YES] Special InformationThe John Pierce School of Brookline serves the Brookline Village neighborhood with approximately 700 students in grades K - 8. The Pierce School focuses on community, equity and achievement as the guiding principles for students, families and faculty alike. One third of the student population speaks English as a second language. The school is decorated with flags from over 70 countries, many of which are represented within the student populationThe Pierce School strives for academic excellence, which is evident in the school's achievements at the National Geographic's Annual Geography Bee, a town-wide math league, Math Counts for 7th and 8th graders and other standardized testing. The student community works to support various organizations and often participates in service days for organizations such as "Hope Found" a day to help at the Shattuck Shelter, Half-Way Day whose contributions go to the Brookline New Pathways Halfway House, or the Barakat organization supporting Afghan Women's Literacy.Students, staff and families collaborate to constantly give back to the community. Working with the Parent Teacher Organization (PTO), the Pierce School offers a variety of extra-curricular activities such as the Performing Arts program presenting two musicians each year, the annual Book Fair, Skate Night and the annual Pierce Picnic.The Pierce School is positioned in a campus-like formation, with classrooms in two separate buildings. Grades Kindergarten through 2nd and the 7th and 8th grades reside in the historical building. The main building, completed in 1974, has a more open classroom structure and houses the remaining grades. In 2005, the Pierce School celebrates its 150th anniversary year (1855-2005), making it one of the oldest Schools in Brookline.In 2011 the Pierce School students in grades 3, 5 and 7 partook in a bullying survey, which combined with the bullying prevention and interventions programs, provided both education and awareness to the concept of bullying.

Apply for this job if you are certain this hybrid work arrangement fits you,and you have the transportation to and from Natick, MA. This small company is adopting a hybrid work model for the forseable future to reduce the number of staff on-site.Position DetailsAllurion is seeking an intern or co-op to provide support for various R&D activities throughout the year. The candidate must have proficiency in mechanical engineering and/or material science, with strong analytical skills, effective communication skills, and a passion for hands-on problem solving. This position will take on projects to advance Allurion's product stack and manufacturing processes. Mentorship will be provided by a talented engineering team in a fast-paced, regulated, quality-controlled work environment. The co-op will be expected to utilize and strengthen skills in standard testing (Instron), data acquisition, material acquisition, experimentation, composition of technical documentation, 3D modeling (Solidworks), 3D printing (slic3r, FDM), statistics (Minitab), and development of test fixtures.This position is meant to provide value to Allurion while giving co-ops exposure to the tools, techniques, and lessons that can only be taught in a collaborative, quality-controlled engineering environment. A small company like Allurion offers exposure to a broader range of R&D activities than larger medical companies allow, although priorities can change in a moment's notice. One day you may be designing, 3D printing, and testing a fixture to improve a new manufacturing process, and the next you could be following a protocol to evaluate a next-generation material or structure through a series of standardized tests. Effective communication, honesty, and enthusiasm are strongly valued here at Allurion, and every voice, from the CEO to our technicians, is heard and taken seriously.Qualifications

Position: ROUTES Env. Engineering / Environmental Health Research Asst
Targeted Academic Majors: College of Engineering, College of Engineering/Environmental Engineering, College of Engineering/Civil Engineering, College of Science/Environmental Science
Workplace Type: On-site work is preferred when public health concerns allow, Primarily on-site work
Work Authorization: United States Citizen, Legal Permanent Resident of US
Description: People are increasingly aware of the thousands of chemicals that they are exposed to through their everyday activities including drinking water, their diet, the use of personal care products, and contact with chemical laden air and surfaces. Among the chemical classes that are currently causing the most concern among individuals and the public health community are per-and polyfluorinated alkyl substances (PFAS). Current methods for determining an individual's exposure are invasive, expensive, and must be performed by a health care professional. In addition, they only capture a snapshot of blood concentrations that may vary diurnally. A personal passive sampler that could slowly sample PFAS transferred across a person's skin could be used to collect PFAS concentrations more broadly across populations while providing time-averaged data.As a first step in developing trans-dermal personal passive samplers, the Fernandez lab is seeking a ROUTES scholar to research and source existing patches currently used to deliver pharmaceuticals. In addition, the scholar will design and prepare trans dermal patch sampler prototypes from polymer-resin composites in the laboratory. These composites will be tested in time-course experiments for their uptake kinetics and affinity for a set of frequently detected PFAS compounds. The scholar will be trained on sampler and water extraction techniques and the use of liquid chormatography/mass spectrometry for sample analyses.To apply: Please submit a resume and a short cover letter addressing the following questions:1. ROUTES is an NIH-funded program designed to support students from underrepresented backgrounds in environmental health research. How does the diversity of your experiences and background inform your work or eligibility for ROUTES?2. How do you see yourself applying your undergraduate training and experiences as a ROUTES Scholar after graduation (i.e. careers in research, education, government, industry, non-profit)?ROUTES: https://web.northeastern.edu/routes/

Description: Available units include medical/surgical, and possibly neuroscience intensive care unit, oncology, and cardiothoracic surgical stepdown unit, bariatric/colorectal surgical unit.Patient Care: Carries out routine tasks and procedures as taught: for example, routine hygiene, enemas, sitz baths, collection of selected specimens, warm moist and cold packs, universal precautions, and isolation techniques. Reports observations and pertinent communications with patients/families/significant others to the registered nurse in a timely manner. Maintains safety devices: for example, side rails, restraints, etc. Observes and reports any observation of patient being restrained. Assists with lifting, positioning, moving, and ambulating patients. Prepares patient for transport by wheelchair, stretcher, surglift, or on foot, as directed by the registered nurse. Assists with patient examinations; for example, physical, pelvic. Maintains patient safety, privacy and confidentiality at all times. Provides attention to patients requiring constant observation. Answers call lights and reports patients' concerns to the registered nurse. Assists with patient admitting, discharge, and transfer procedures. Assists with the care of the body after death. Applies simple clean dressings as directed by the registered nurse. Performs additional selected tasks as taught and assigned on individual units or special service areas. Unit Responsibilities: Distributes nourishment, serves delayed trays, records intake as indicated. Provides drinking water as permitted to patients. Maintains neat and clean patient units and specified service areas. Removes and cleans soiled equipment. Familiarity with Figma or Sketch, and Adobe Illustrator. You’re independent and self-driven, willing to see projects through from start to end with a strong attention to detail. Design experience in a professional setting from a previous co-op or internship preferred. Experience or interest in focus areas like user experience & consumer testing, or branding & illustration, a plus. A portfolio link is required for this co-op.The companyWell was founded to help every individual take control of their health, adding a layer of ease and empowerment to improve a system that’s badly broken. We’re an early stage, venture-backed startup focused on disrupting healthcare through a differentiated consumer experience and a world-class data & analytics engine to drive engagement and behavior change. Our product provides consumers with seamless digital experiences, concierge services, behavioral health, telemedicine, and care management to improve our users’ overall health.Check us out atWell.co Gain incredible design and strategy experience as we test, learn, and iterate. We launched our app publicly in January 2020 and are learning quickly from our pilot customers. You’ll be a valued member of our growing design team, owning projects and working closely with product managers, developers, and stakeholders. Sharpen not just your design skills, but your understanding of product development, including when and how to evolve a brand new product.OurNewton, MA office is accessible by bus, and not too far from the Green Line. Having a car is preferred, but not required — we have several carpools from different areas of Boston.Due to COVID-19, our office (including our current co-op) is working remotely. Returning to the office is preferred, COVID permitting.

Targeted Academic Majors: College of Science, College of Science/Cell and Molecular Biology, College of Science/Biotechnology
Workplace Type: On-site work is preferred when public health concerns allow, Remote work is permitted when public health concerns dictate, Primarily on-site work
Work Authorization: Authorized to work in the U.S.
Description: We are looking for Research Associate Co-op's for January 2021-June 2021Who you areYou are an ambitious, hard-working and curious individual majoring in biology, cell biology, biochemistry, molecular biology or related field.You have a passion for research, preferably with Independent research experience in a biological laboratory.You like working in a highly collaborative team environment on scientific problems that can have an impact on patients' lives.  What you will doResults of the work you do will help us decide which diseases to treat and which drugs to pursue.Help discover new ways to use drugs to regulate the expression of disease-associated genes using techniques including:· Primary human cell culture· RNA extraction and Gene expression analysis (qPCRs)· Protein and enzyme activity assays· Data analyses (Excel, PowerPoint, Prism)· Bioinformatic analysis· Programming in python or RWhy you should join us· Highly collaborative and welcoming environment where you will be integrated with the team· Work alongside globally diverse, high profile, talent that is excited about science· You will be hands-on, gaining experience with innovative lab and research techniques· Bright and energetic workspace right in the heart of Kendall Square· Fully stocked kitchen with an assortment of free snacks and beverages· Bi-weekly lunches provided, and company hosted events monthlyFounded in 2016 and focused on a core mission of realizing a world with ‘an effective treatment option for every patient,’ CAMP4 Therapeutics evolved from seminal discoveries made by company founders Dr. Richard Young and Dr. Leonard Zon, characterizing the ways in which cellular machinery controls the expression of genes. Operating at the intersection of genomics, computational biology and data sciences, CAMP4 has extended this foundational work, creating a unique platform to amplify the value of cellular and genetic insights to better understand how gene expression is controlled within the nucleus in specific disease states. Using next-gen sequencing and proprietary methods, CAMP4 can identify de-risked druggable targets, produce actionable insights and improve therapeutic predictability, potentially addressing hundreds of diseases and benefiting millions of patients globally.We sit at the intersection of technological innovation, emerging insight into basic gene control, and scientific ingenuity — uniquely positioned to build a self-sustaining, always innovating biotech company.

Targeted Academic Majors: College of Engineering
