Description: This is an excellent opportunity for a creative engineer to join an innovative product development team bringing technological advanced diagnostic testing to the veterinarian's office. At IDEXX, Co-ops join an innovative product development group that develops cutting edge medical instrumentation for the animal healthcare market.Please visit https://www.idexx.com/en/veterinary/products/analyzers to see some of the products developed by this engineering team.Co-ops are embedded with a design team and routinely engineer components that make their way into our commercial instruments. They will contribute to the design of several generations of prototypes of new analytic instruments with guidance from an assigned mentor. Co-ops are exposed to the complete product development environment and will learn what it takes to develop and launch a product into the marketplace.Typical activities for a Co-op include:· Developing CAD conceptual models that satisfy product requirements· Designing instrument components and completing the necessary work to bring to production· Designing jigs and assembly aids for the product manufacturing line· Designing and developing manufacturing test fixtures· Assisting engineers with DFMA of plastic tool parts· Completing finite element structural and fluidic analyses· Performing tolerance analysis of key sub-system assemblies· Completing CAD drawings and other product documentationIDEXX utilizes Solidworks CAD tools for product design supplemented by an array of analysis tools, FEA, CFD and DFMA and has a fully equipped engineering laboratory and in-house model shop for 3D printing and prototype manufacture. Co-ops will be immersed in this environment with the aim of contributing to the development effort while gaining valuable real-world design experience. Extensive use of Solidworks insures a high-level of competence at the conclusion of their time with IDEXX.This will be a full-time remote position which will result in a different experience then a typical Co-op experience with IDEXX. Some specific details include:· The necessary computer equipment and software will be supplied by IDEXX.· Co-ops will be able to prototype designs, have them 3D printed or machined at IDEXX, and shipped to their remote location.· Co-ops will be responsible for locating and furnishing their remote work environment and providing the required internet access.· Co-ops will participate in meetings and team related activities but will also be expected to work independently.RESPONSIBILITIES:· Perform ground-up design work on components and mechanisms for integration into diagnostic medical equipment.· Assist in design, development and test of diagnostic instruments from inception through transition to production in a team environment.· Develop concepts that satisfy challenging product requirements.· Assist engineers with material selection, design tradeoffs, thermal/mechanical analyses and tolerance studies.· Complete documentation of designs conforming to IDEXX documentation standards including detail and assembly drawings in Solidworks; bills of material; design review presentations; lab and analysis reports; manufacturing assembly drawings and work instructions.· Participates in brainstorming sessions to create new products and technologies.DESIRED SKILLS:· Creative and innovative individual· Ability to work independently· Self-motivated and able to take initiative· Some level of SolidWorks experience· Competent in Microsoft office products

Description: COMPANY OVERVIEWTakeda fosters a collaborative and stimulating work environment filled with opportunity and the chance to make a difference in people's lives. It is a workplace driven by integrity, one of Takeda’s long-held values that extends to both the patients we serve and our employees who develop and deliver medicines. Across our company, Takeda employees bring together diverse strengths that together create a stronger whole.As one of the world’s leading biopharmaceutical companies, Takeda is committed to bringing Better Health and a Brighter future to people worldwide. We aspire to bring our leadership in translating science into life-changing medicines to the next level, in our core focus areas; oncology, gastroenterology, neuroscience, rare diseases, plasma-derived therapies, and vaccines. The Greater Boston Area is headquarters to many of our Global and US business units.We are a passionate team doing important work that impacts patients’ lives. If you are driven to create better health and a brighter future, join us!OBJECTIVES:Co-Op student to join fast-paced Biotherapeutic Engineering Group discovering novel biologics for disease indications including Oncology, Gastroenterology, Neuroscience, and Rare Diseases.Position will provide bench work support to drug discovery in the processes of screening, sequencing, purifying, and expressing antibody-based biologics.Incumbent will need to learn or have prior experience utilizing techniques which may include cloning, PCR, Sequencing, ELISA and Flow Cytometry.ACCOUNTABILITIES:· Learn and/or perform standard basic proficiencies in lab work including pipetting, aseptic and sterile technique, knowledge of safe practices for hazardous chemicals and biohazardous materials· Molecular biology techniques including RNA isolation, PCR, cloning, and sequence analysis· Generating antibody libraries and selecting for antibodies to target proteins using proteins and cells· scientific discussionsEDUCATION, BEHAVIORAL COMPETENCIES AND SKILLS:· Open to current juniors or seniors (undergrad or graduate programs) and recent graduates· Previous laboratory-based research experience is preferred· General knowledge of cell biology· Excellent organizational skills and attention to details· Self-motivated, curious, independent and eager to learnADDITIONAL INCENTIVES THAT TAKEDA PHARMACEUTICALS OFFER:· Opportunity to take part in a global organization with state-of-the-art capabilities· Lunch and Learns (Leadership team and other dept members to present topics)· Great Location, about 1.5 miles from Campus (few stops on Bus Route 1)· Mentoring to take a more direct, intentional role with each Coop· Quality Conversations (goals/career track)· Potential to extend to 8 months and part time work· Cross-training (across four groups in Global Biologics)· Opportunity for poster session/final presentationsTRANSPORTATION:By Bus: Take the bus CT1 or bus 1, going towards Central square in Cambridge and get off at the "University Park" stop. Landsdowne street is across the streetBy T: Take the red line towards Alewife, get off at the "Central" stop. Walk on Mass Ave. towards Boston until youget toLandsdowne Street on the right.

Position: Thermofluids engineering co-op at an energy startup
Targeted Academic Majors: College of Engineering/Mechanical Engineering, College of Engineering/Chemical Engineering
Workplace Type: On-site work is preferred when public health concerns allow, Remote work is permitted when public health concerns dictate, Primarily on-site work
Description: CompanyMesodyne is a startup company commercializing a breakthrough technology initially developed at MIT. Mesodyne’s Light-Cell is a new class of power generator that provides efficient, silent, reliable, long-endurance power from any fuel and enables a 10X improvement in run time for UAVs, robots, wearables, and more. Mesodyne is developing products for the industrial, scientific, and defense sectors. Dr. Veronika Stelmakh, CEO and Dr. Walker Chan, CTO have been leading the company since they founded it in 2018. Based in Somerville MA, the company currently has 5 employees and you will be joining a growing, dynamic, and motivated team.Our engineering team has a strong maker/hacker culture: from blowing glass and forging knives to creating model airplanes, launching rockets, and restoring vintage analog synthesizers - we love building things and are excited to bring a new technology to the market that has the potential to revolutionize small power generation. If you have a portfolio of any DIY or fabrication projects, please share it in your application - we’d love to see your work!The company is co-located with several other companies at 15 Ward St. in Somerville, a 10-15 minute walk from the Green Line.PositionYou will work closely with the founders and other scientists and engineers to take a novel technology from the lab to the commercial marketplace. You will contribute a unique skillset to the team and will take ownership over your project and aspect of the generator.You will be responsible for the design and development of our high temperature microcombustor system. The microcombustor heats a novel photonic crystal material to incandescence, which radiates certain wavelengths of light that drive PV cells--converting fuel into electricity with no moving parts. Your work will focus on prototype development of combustors and heat exchangers operating in excess of 1000°C.QualificationsApplication ProcessAll interviews are conducted virtually.

Location: East Hanover, New Jersey United States
Targeted Academic Majors: Bouve College of Health Sciences/Pharmacy

Description: Co-op placement as a Clinical Trial Assistant at Novartis Institute for Biomedical Research Inc. (NIBRI) in Cambridge, MA, and Novartis Pharmaceuticals in East Hanover, NJ, in the department of Translational Medicine (two positions, one at each location). Translational Medicine works to bridge the gap between the pre-clinical and clinical phases of drug development. Promising compounds are selectively chosen from the discovery phase and developed in man.The Clinical Trial Assistant will provide support to Clinical Trial Leaders in Translational Medicine. The Clinical Trial Leader manages all aspects clinical trials. He/she is assigned to a trial 2-6 months before commencement and is responsible for protocol development, study site selection, case report form development, drug supply, clinical database activities, and study site training in protocol procedures. During the conduct of the trial, the main responsibility of the Clinical Trial Leader is to oversee the study execution. After completion of the study, the Clinical Trial Leader is responsible for close-out activities, data management and study report writing.As the Clinical Trial Assistant, the intern will be asked to perform a wide variety of tasks, which may include, but are not limited to:· Compiling trial registrations for the clinicaltrials.gov public disclosure website· Writing and editing trial protocols, working protocols, protocol amendments, protocol and amendment signature pages, and sections of study reports.· Creating trial site initiation PowerPoint presentations· Organizing critical trial-related documents into Trial Master Files· Reviewing Case Report Forms for protocol specifications· Reviewing Informed Consent Forms· Reviewing trial data and populating data tables· Attending and participating in different types of departmental and committee meetings· Assisting the Clinical Trial Leader to establish a fluid relationship between Novartis and the trial site(s)· Administrative tasks including e-mailing, printing, copying, faxing, filing and mailingAnother student provided this information:It's a great experience working for Novartis, a pharmaceutical company. The people are very friendly, always willing to help you out, and make this the best learning experience possible for you. The work itself is interesting- you are able to see the aspects of what goes on in the clinical trial process in a little more depth. Everything is near by- whether its restaurants, a movie theater, malls, etc. Public transportation is convienent if you want to go into the city and don't want to drive (local buses to Port Authority).

Description: Do you want to work for a fast-paced, rapidly growing firm that values culture, work-life balance and reputation above all? If so, StoneTurn could be the right fit for you.StoneTurn, a global advisory firm, assists companies, their counsel and government agencies on regulatory, risk and compliance issues, investigations and business disputes. We serve our clients from offices across the U.S., U.K., Germany, Brazil, and South Africa, assisted by a network of senior advisers around the world.StoneTurn’s leaders—partners and alumni of international public accounting and consulting firms, industry and government agencies—opted for a different professional services model. Our vision is to create a highly collaborative team of professionals who prefer “hands-on” client service and focus on forming long-term, trusted relationships.StoneTurn is seeking a Finance & Accounting Intern to join our operations team!Our growing company needs a reliable, organized Intern to join the team. In this role, you will be working collaboratively with the operations team at a litigation dispute consulting firm. You will add value to our team by having strong accounting and analytical skills, great attention to detail and honed sense for prioritization. This position requires you to be a person with strong interpersonal, communication and technical skills.Here are some of the basic responsibilities:· Record cash receipts from outstanding accounts receivables· Record accounts payable, schedule and prepare payments· Perform weekly cash reconciliations across global entities· Assist with timesheet and employee expense reports collection, review and posting to the general ledger· Comfort working with debits and credits and willingness to expand current skillset· Review subledger reports and compare for irregularities to the general ledger· Assist with preparation of monthly work-in-progress reports, drafting client invoices, coordinating edits from key individuals.· Work within work plans and coordinate the successful completion of routine, ad hoc, analyses and projects under supervision· Perform miscellaneous administrative duties as neededJob Requirements:· Bachelor’s degree in progress in a business/economics/accounting related field.· Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to multi-task.· Strong interpersonal and communication skills.· Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook) and the ability to learn new systems.· Must be able to handle and protect confidential information.· Ability to work independently, demonstrate initiative, work to and manage multiple deadlines.We offer competitive compensation and benefit packages.Applicants for employment in US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship by StoneTurn.StoneTurn provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or genetics.

Description: The Role:This position will work in a Process Characterization function in Technical Development to advance our understanding of the Lipid Nanoparticle formulation process. The position will develop novel capillary electrophoresis methods to explore characteristics of mRNA and lipid nanoparticles. The work will include HPLC, capillary electrophoresis, light scattering, and other techniques. Biology, Chemistry, Biochemistry, and Chemical engineering majors are encouraged to apply.Here’s What You’ll Do:Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table:Here’s What We’ll Bring to the Table:About Moderna:Moderna is advancing messenger RNA (mRNA) science to create a new class of transformative medicines for patients. mRNA medicines are designed to direct the body’s cells to produce intracellular, membrane or secreted proteins that can have a therapeutic or preventive benefit and have the potential to address a broad spectrum of diseases. The Company’s platform builds on continuous advances in basic and applied mRNA science, delivery technology and manufacturing, providing Moderna the capability to pursue in parallel a robust pipeline of new development candidates. Moderna is developing therapeutics and vaccines for infectious diseases, immuno-oncology, rare diseases, cardiovascular diseases, and autoimmune and inflammatory diseases, independently and with strategic collaborators.Headquartered in Cambridge, Mass., Moderna currently has strategic alliances for development programs with AstraZeneca, Plc. and Merck, Inc., as well as the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA), an agency of the U.S. Department of Defense, the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority (BARDA), a division of the Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response (ASPR) within the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) and the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI). Moderna has been ranked in the top ten of Science’s list of top biopharma industry employers for the past five years. To learn more, visit www.modernatx.com.Our Mission:Deliver on the promise of mRNA science to create a new generation of transformative medicines for patients.Moderna is a smoke-free, alcohol-free and drug-free work environment.Moderna is committed to equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to a person’s race, color, gender, age, religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation or any characteristic protected under applicable law. Moderna will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.

Description: Responsibilities and Duties:· Monitor and analyze data from impact assessment surveys of different regions under the Nourishing Schools programme· Recommend revisions to the overall programme roll-out to reach a greater impact with reduced costs and increased accuracy.· Data visualization and creating/co-authoring of academic and non-academic impact assessment reportsQualifications:· Major in Humanities, Social sciences, Data analytics· Thorough knowledge of Microsoft Excel and working knowledge of other Office products· Fluency in written and spoken EnglishRequired skills/Personal skills:· Strong execution capabilities· Attention to detail with strong analytical skills· Demonstrated problem-solving abilities and creativity· Ability to work collaboratively with people from different backgrounds· Self-motivation, ability to take ownership of programs and work with minimal supervision· Commitment to social change and strong ethical fiberSkills gained by the end of internship:· Data analytical skills· Creative thinking and problem-solving· Time management· CollaborationAdd-ons:Fluid workspace, Relaxed environment, Friendly and inspiring co-workers, chance to engage with ever-inspiring Ashoka fellows.About AshokaAshoka is the largest network of social entrepreneurs worldwide, with nearly 3,000 Ashoka Fellows in 70 countries putting their system-changing ideas into practice on a global scale. Founded by Bill Drayton in 1980, Ashoka has provided start-up financing, professional support services, and connections to a global network across the business and social sectors, and a platform for people dedicated to changing the world.About Nourishing SchoolsNourishing Schools has been designed by Ashoka India’s Health and Nutrition Initiative in partnership with various stakeholders. It aims to develop young changemakers aged between 9-14 years, who can take charge of their own nutrition and that of their communities. The broad objective is to develop a toolkit that enables schools to improve the nutrition of school children and communities.Ashoka has partnered with Ashoka Fellows and various organizations to roll out the Nourishing Schools program across India in over 200 schools.Optional services provided by Bridge CulturesStudents learn about culture and multiple facets and influences on various aspects of life through conversations with people they would meet while in Bangalore. With remote co-op, Bridge Cultures will enable these conversations virtually. We will organize 3 virtual webinars and workshops on various topics in context to cultural integration which will align with students’ professional and personal growth. Bridge Cultures will bring professionals from various domains and facilitate these interactive sessions.Few topics (not confined to) are listed below:· Social entrepreneurship· Know the city - food, culture, people· Leadership and Teamwork· Unconscious biases· Critical thinking· Influence of culture on design, education, outdoor education, experiential education· Sustainability· Mental health, emotional well-being· Impact of traveling on our personalitySelf-reflection session:Bridge Cultures believes that self-reflection is highly important and necessary to learn and grow, especially after working with a social enterprise on an impactful project. Out of many reasons, reflection is important because it:· Enables the individuals to process and make meaning of the experience· Fosters a better understanding of context. i.e. understanding how their work impacts the community and encourages more participation in future· Creates a sense of accomplishment· Enables the individuals to examine the effects of their behavior, discover ways to improve· Reinforces the feeling of empathy gained during the experience· Acknowledges the skills gained during the experience and builds confidenceInclusions - Program Fees (virtual):· Co-op placement· Necessary documentation· Self-Reflection session· 2-3 online webinars/workshops on various topics· Review meetings during co-op to track progress· Social network· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op prior to confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Mr. Richard Conley. Refund will be processed after deducting 25% of the program fees (this is to factor the currency transaction charges that incurs to Bridge Cultures)· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op after receiving confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Mr. Richard Conley. Refund will be processed after deducting 75% of the program fees

Description: (REMOTE)Who isServiceNow?Imagine your workday dominated less by emails and spreadsheets and more time given back to you to do your actual job. At ServiceNow, we are making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud-based platform and products streamline and simplify how work gets done across the enterprise. We are the fastest growing enterprise cloud software company in the world and was recently recognized on Fortune’s Future 50 list (https://fortune.com/future-50/2019/) For us, this is just the start.Who is Marketing at ServiceNow?Marketing is the engine room for growth at ServiceNow. We fuel the success of our customers, sales, and products. We have a customer-first mindset in all that we do. As a Marketing team, we are laser-focused on how we can connect with our customers by creating simple, sweet spot targeting, and by the positioning and packaging of our products and solutions. We help our customers gain the most value from our products by providing best practices, business cases and trainings.Our Account Based Marketing mission to help sales close larger deals faster is a business imperative, not just a marketing one. ServiceNow was founded on a simple product idea. 17 years later, with a rapid growth to over $4bn in revenue, we are changing the way we go to market.Our award-winning global ABM program, launched in 2018, signaled this move from a product-based selling model to an ‘outside-in’ value-based approach. Designed to accelerate our ability to win and grow contract value in a select number of large, strategic accounts, our ABM-as-a-Service model provides five key services:1. Developing deeper decision maker relationships2. Creating custom content3. Building key stakeholder awareness4. Securing meetings and accelerating pipeline5. Driving advocacy and adoptionSuccessful Candidate will:· Partnering with sales and marketing to develop and deliver account specific ABM plans that develop deep decision maker relationships, create brand awareness, secure meetings, accelerate pipeline and drive internal customer advocacy and adoption.· Plan and execute account-specific pipeline generation and acceleration programs targeting specific key contacts within an account.· Attend and participate in ongoing planning and review sessions with the sales teams and other key players, including customers, assigned to these accounts to ensure alignment and focus on strategy and objectives.· Work with industry marketing, the campaigns marketing team, and other internal teams to determine existing programs and assets that align with an account’s GTM plans and incorporate into overall plan.· Together with the global ABM team, work with internal design, digital teams and external agencies to develop content and assets for specific accounts and specific contacts within the accounts.· Track the effectiveness of campaigns through overall engagement, meetings booked, and pipeline generatedRoleRequirements:· Currently enrolled at an accredited University pursuing a bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing,Psychology, EnglishMajor, or a similar field· Hands on Marketing experience within the technology sector, working with one of the most innovative and fastest growing companies· Experience working in fast paced work environments, managing multiple projects simultaneously, balancing strategy and hands-on work and to thrive in an ambiguous dynamic environment· Global experience, incl an opportunity to learn about markets, trends, industries, buying behavior, channel/3rd party implications in emerging markets and get an appreciation and understanding for cultural differences· Experience planning and executing integrated marketing campaigns.· Learning to communicate cross-functionally, across marketing, sales and with senior management· Learn the importance of understand KPIs and how to report on success

Description: Radix is an early stage start-up building a next generation visual programming language and optimizing compiler that takes biotech procedures and compiles them to instructions that can be executed in a physical biology lab. Biologists describe their protocol in our front end language and our compiler and run-time system realize this in their physical lab. The user experience here is key because biologists shouldn’t need to be programmers to not have to spend 5 hours every day doing manual pipetting for hard to reproduce unoptimized minutia that isn’t innovative. We hope to accelerate biotech innovation like early compilers did for computing by enabling lab protocols to seamlessly operate and be optimized across physical labs. We have funding from some pretty cool people (YCombinator, Firstminute Capital, MIT's The Engine, and Nikesh Arora) and have multiple pilots in academic research labs and commercial biotech corporations, and this number is growing. We’re looking for pragmatic individuals who appreciate great interfaces and want to make a big difference for our users—biologists and lab workers and biology as a discipline, and enable them to have good tooling that simply abstracts away menial work.Nice to have:Radix is a exciting work environment. We care about each other. We’re also LGBTQ+, polyamoroy, kink, gender, minority, and most other things supporting. We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Description: Online workshops/webinars:Students learn about the culture and multiple facets and influences on various aspects of life through conversations with people they would meet while in Bangalore. With a remote co-op, Bridge Cultures will enable these conversations virtually. We will organize 3 virtual webinars and workshops on various topics in context to cultural integration which will align with students’ professional and personal growth. Bridge Cultures will bring professionals from various domains and facilitate these interactive sessions.Few topics (not confined to) are listed below:· Social entrepreneurship· Know the city - food, culture, people· Leadership and Teamwork· Unconscious biases· Critical thinking· Influence of culture on design, education, outdoor education, experiential education· Sustainability· Mental health, emotional well-being· Impact of traveling on our personalitySelf-reflection session:Bridge Cultures believes that self-reflection is highly important and necessary to learn and grow, especially after working with a social enterprise on an impactful project. Out of many reasons, reflection is important because it:· Enables the individuals to process and make meaning of the experience· Fosters a better understanding of context. i.e. understanding how their work impacts the community and encourages more participation in future· Creates a sense of accomplishment· Enables the individuals to examine the effects of their behavior, discover ways to improve· Reinforces the feeling of empathy gained during the experience· Acknowledges the skills gained during the experience and builds confidenceInclusions:· Co-op placement· Necessary documentation· Self-Reflection session· 2-3 online webinars/workshops on various topics· Review meetings during co-op to track progress· Social networkProcess:1. Students apply for various positions through NU works2. Bridge Cultures will send an email to the student to schedule a call3.   After the student’s response to that email, a call will be scheduled between the student, Ms. Aspa Papanastasiou (Associate Director, Global engagements at NU), and Bridge Cultures to ensure accountability from the student’s side4. Another call will be scheduled with Bridge Cultures (if needed) to understand the student’s interest, motivation, and expectations from the co-op5. The student will pay the Program fees to Bridge Cultures ($455)6. Bridge Cultures will facilitate the call between student and the organization7. The organization will communicate their response to Bridge Cultures and the student8. If the student is selected, the organization will share the appointment/offer letter with Bridge Cultures9. Bridge Cultures will share the appointment letter with the student10. The student will start the co-op on the decided dates11. Bridge Cultures will facilitate virtual onboarding if necessary12. Bridge Cultures will facilitate 3 online sessions on various topics and organize 2 review meetings during the co-op13. Bridge Cultures will facilitate self-reflection session at the end of the co-op· If the student is not selected by the first organization interviewed for, Bridge Cultures will find another position with another organization. If the student is not selected there as well, 50% of the program fees will be refunded to the student· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op prior to confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 25% of the program fees (this is to factor the currency transaction charges that incurs to Bridge Cultures)· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op after receiving confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 75% of the program fees

Description: About UsAt LogicBio, our mission is to develop medicines to durably treat rare diseases in patients with significant unmet medical needs using, GeneRide™, our proprietary technology platform. Recombinant adeno-associated virus (rAAV) is used to deliver GeneRide™ which enables the site-specific integration of a therapeutic transgene in a nuclease-free and promoterless approach by relying on the native process of homologous recombination to drive lifelong expression. Headquartered in Lexington, Mass., we are committed to developing medicines that will transform the lives of pediatric patients and their families.The OpportunityLogicBio is seeking a Co-Op to join our Analytics team. In this position, you will follow established standard operating procedures (SOPs) to perform molecular and biochemical based assays to characterize rAAV gene therapy vectors. Routine analysis of process development and pre-clinical grade materials will help drive development of the GeneRide™ gene editing technology platform.Primary Responsibilities· Perform analysis of gene editing vectors (qPCR, ddPCR, ELISA, SDS-PAGE, agarose gel electrophoresis)· Independently conduct assays for in-process and final products to determine product quality· Analyze data and record results in electronic lab notebook in a timely manner· Assist in further development of existing assays for improved performance· Write technical reports summarizing data· Prepare and deliver scientific presentations for internal useExperience & Skills· Experience with qPCR, ddPCR, ELISA, SDS-PAGE, and agarose gel electrophoresis is preferred· Mammalian cell culture experience is a plus· Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in following protocols is necessary· Must have strong organizational and communication skills· Strong desire to learn multiple techniques and willingness to provide support as required· Excellent interpersonal and collaborative skills, and the ability to work independently and effectively in a highly dynamic environment

Description: Company Profile:Founded in 1977, GMO is a private partnership committed to delivering superior investment performance and advice to our clients. We offer strategies where we believe we are positioned to add the greatest value for our investors. These include multi-asset class portfolios as well as dedicated equity, fixed income, and absolute return offerings, many of which employ the firm's proprietary 7-year asset class forecasting framework. Our client base is comprised primarily of institutions, including corporate and public defined benefit and defined contribution retirement plans, endowments, foundations, and financial intermediaries.GMO, whose sole business is investment management, employs approximately 500 people worldwide and is headquartered in Boston with offices in San Francisco, London, Amsterdam, Sydney, and Singapore. We manage roughly $70billion in client assets using a combination of top-down and bottom-up approaches that blend traditional fundamental insights with innovative quantitative methods to identify undervalued asset classes and securities. Our valuation-based approach embeds several key factors, including: a long-term investment horizon, discipline, conviction, and a commitment to research. Our research emphasizes not only identifying and exploiting pricing dislocations but also understanding the long-term drivers of return in the markets in which we invest. We are known for our candor in sharing our views with clients and for our willingness to take bold, differentiated positions when opportunities warrant.OverviewThe Pricing Group is responsible for ensuring the financial integrity of underlying investment portfolios managed by GMO by maintaining a strong internal control environment over the portfolio valuation and reporting process. As a co-op for GMO within this group, you will be supporting the team with an assortment of duties. These tasks may include everything from data compilationto assisting with the daily pricing functions on a variety of instruments.ResponsibilitiesIn this role the co-op will be exposed to many different security types, and will be provided with numerous beneficial learning opportunities. The Pricing Team interacts with various groups within GMO including Reconciliation, Trading, and Risk and Control, and the chosen candidate will intermingle with these teams as well. Contact with several of GMO's counterparties may be required, and this is a chance to develop both your written and verbal communication skills in a professional setting. After the completion of this experience, the co-op will have gained invaluable experience within an investment management firm.QualificationsIn order to be a successful candidate, the co-op must possess the following traits:

Description: Note: Students should apply to all positions for which they qualify both in NUworks and GM website:https://search-careers.gm.com/c/students-jobs?s=1Relocation assistance is available to candidates who meet eligibility requirements.Positions in various locations.To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won’t happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future.At General Motors we pride ourselves on designing, building and selling the world's best vehicles. We are seeking a new generation of visionaries to help launch bold engineering and business initiatives, and shape new directions for General Motors. As an intern or co-op student through our EXCEL (Exploring Careers through Experiential Learning) Program you will gain hands-on career specific experiences to maximize your real world potential.ResponsibilitiesSustainable Workplaces is charging ahead with a new mission! As part of our exciting program, you’ll gain first-hand experience working closely with leadership to support the fulllife-cycleof facility services beginning with site selection,followed by design and construction of manufacturing and office facilities. In the area of sustainability, we find opportunities to optimize energy, carbon, and water for GM facilities, including Energy Treasure Hunts. We also have other exciting opportunities that tie to our sustainability vision which would allow you to apply your knowledge to help identify and drive linking initiatives. You’ll develop an understanding of energy and sustainability dynamics in large automotive manufacturing and non-manufacturing operations as you work closely with the energy engineers, site utility managers and project managers implementing projects. There’s never been a more exciting time to join the Sustainable Workplaces team.We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

Description: Competitive Intelligence Analytics Co-opJanuary 11-June 25, 2021To be considered for this role, you MUST apply through the job board AND this link:https://grnh.se/5f2b2c4f2usIMPORTANT APPLICATION INFORMATION: WAYFAIR CO-OP PRIORITY DEADLINE OCTOBER 9All candidates who apply on or before October 9, and who advance in our interview process, will receive an offer decision from the team by November 6. After November 6, we will continue the interview process to fill any remaining roles not filled during the Priority Period.Are you looking to join a team that is developing truly cutting-edge capabilities? Are you excited about the opportunity to unlock the power of Big Data assets? Would you enjoy being part of developing one of Wayfair’s crucial competitive advantages? Are you excited about the opportunity to become a thought leader on Wayfair’s rapidly evolving competitive landscape?Competitive Intelligence focuses on optimizing Wayfair’s strategic positioning within the rapidly evolving competitive e-commerce landscape. This cross-functional and entrepreneurial team uses Big Data and advanced analytics capabilities to build analytical products and identify insights that impact every major business function at the company; the unique, external market perspective brought by this team complements our robust internal data asset to guide Wayfair in making more informed decisions.What You’ll Do:Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employers, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Description: SummaryGrubStreet, the nation’s leading creative writing center, is seeking a Marketing Assistant Co-op to be a vital part of our team. I loved working here because of how kind, welcoming, and encouraging the entire staff was towards me as I learned more about marketing and writing in general. Our teachers are working artists who bring the highest quality instruction and mentorship to aspiring storytellers. We also host a major writing conference each year and public storytelling events. The education and networks we facilitate foster a richer local writing scene, with a strong focus on increasing opportunities for writers of color, low-income writers, and teen writers. Description: The Trust for Public Land is a national nonprofit organization with a mission of creating parks and protecting Land for People, ensuring healthy, livable communities for generations to come. Working in collaboration with local communities, and with local, state, and federal public agencies, we help plan, fund, protect, and create parks and open spaces. We work in Boston, throughout New England, and across the U.S., with priority given to projects that advance health, equity, and climate resilience.The Trust for Public Land is working to ensure that everyone in urban America has a high-quality park or open space within a 10-minute walk of their home. In Boston, we're using participatory design and creative placemaking techniques to create and rehabilitate parks that meet local community needs, and help make neighborhoods more climate resilient though park-features that help mitigate urban heat island effects, and absorb storm water from increasingly heavy rains.

Description: We are seeking a responsible intern to join Gradiant in the field of membrane based water treatment. In this position, you will be expected to build, test and analyze membrane systems. You will get a chance to learn about water desalination and treatment systems with hands on experience on bench scale and pilot scale membrane systems. Please see the following job description.Job Summary:Build and test novel membrane systems. Responsibilities include but are not limited to design, build, operation and optimization of bench scale and pilot scale units. Candidate will utilize knowledge and competency in hydraulics, separations and analysis to construct, operate and troubleshoot. Candidate will integrate empirical data and theoretical equations into performance models for use in predicting, optimizing and controlling system performance. Successful development of these novel membrane systems could have significant benefit for global water supplies and environmental stewardship in multiple industrial and municipal sectors.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:· Design experiments to assess and optimize process performance.· Analyze the data obtained and provide recommendations for improvements or next phases of testing.· Diagnose and address issues that arise before and during tests.· Work closely with membrane vendors and equipment suppliers to ensure satisfactory performance, use, and maintenance of the system components.· Document system information, test data, results and recommendations in clear, concise reports for internal and external presentations.· Use models to optimize system design and operation.

Fulcrum’s proprietary patient-focused product engine is designed to systematically identify and validate cellular drug targets that can modulate gene expression to treat the root cause of genetically defined rare diseases. The Company has advanced losmapimod to Phase 2 clinical development for the treatment of facioscapulohumeral muscular dystrophy (FSHD) and is advancing losmapimod to Phase 3 for the treatment of COVID-19. Fulcrum also anticipates a regulatory filing in the second half of 2020 with FTX-6058 for the treatment of sickle cell disease.Job DescriptionWe are seeking a highly motivated individual to join the Fulcrum Therapeutics team to help develop drugs against devastating genetic diseases. Description: What sets us apart?At Acceleron we truly value the co-op program. Since 2007 we have employed 130+ co-ops, many of whom have returned as full time employees, five of which are currently part of the Acceleron team! In this mid-sized company you will have many opportunities to interact with cross-functional colleagues and executives and participate in fun company events. If you are looking to gain experience in a fast-paced biotech industry setting and develop professionally in a fun, dynamic environment, apply today for the opportunity to join our team!Quotes from previous co-ops:“I found the work to be fulfilling, and felt invested in what I was doing.”“I think my expectations were exceeded in that I was mentored by various people in my department as well as people on my team. I felt that I got guidance from all levels of the company.”Position Overview (Remote):This co-op will provide support to the Clinical Outsourcing and Clinical Data Management teams. The co-op will develop an understanding of clinical trial research through exposure, including but not limited, to the functions of the clinical outsourcing group and the clinical data management group.Job Responsibilities:· Assist with vendor selection process through support for RFP process, vendor contracting and budget review.· Assist outsourcing managers in managing vendor relationships through participation in status calls· Help implement processes for evaluating customer satisfaction with clinical vendors, and work with outsourcing managers to address any issues identified.· Work with outsourcing managers to build department capabilities, including development of processes and templates and a repository of vendors, in case of a new identified vendor need.· Assist with tracking of clinical trial progress including status updates reports, as requested· Assist with site level document review· Participates in study team data review; perform data review for quality issues and general data trends; generate queries as necessary· Assist in the development, handling, distribution, filing and archiving of essential documents in the Trial Master File (TMF)· May assist with and/or coordinate distribution of clinical trial supplies· Participate in clinical study teams, including attending required meeting, and interacts in a positive, professional manner· Prepare agendas, minutes, tracks action items and may present updates for trials progress· May assist in the preparation and review of study related documents; data management plan, guidelines for CRF completion, clinical-regulatory documents; including protocols, amendments, study initiation document (informed consent, etc.)· May involve with performing user acceptance testing of clinical database (CRF and edit checks), and other vendor databases as needed (e.g. Interactive Response Technology).· Assist in department operations: screens and acts on incoming phone calls and emails, coordinates mailings and courier/deliveries, filing, develops databases, etc.· Update calendars and coordinate local meetings; arrange travel, meeting arrangements, visitor accommodations; organize meeting rooms, including logistics, catering and equipment needs· Adhere to Clinical Standard Operating Procedures and Good Clinical Practice ICH Guidelines· Identify and escalate issues appropriately· Perform other work-related duties as assignedCandidate Qualifications:· Proficient in computer technology used in an office environment (Microsoft Office Suite; e.g. Word, Excel, Outlook, Viseo, and PowerPoint)· Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, and excellent written communication, oral communication, and organizational skills are requiredAbout AcceleronAcceleron is a biopharmaceutical company dedicated to the discovery, development, and commercialization of therapeutics to treat serious and rare diseases. Acceleron’s leadership in the understanding of TGF-beta superfamily biology and protein engineering generates innovative compounds that engage the body's ability to regulate cellular growth and repair.Acceleron focuses its commercialization, research, and development efforts in hematologic and pulmonary diseases. In hematology, REBLOZYL® (luspatercept-aamt) is the first and only erythroid maturation agent approved inthe United StatesandEuropefor the treatment of anemia in certain blood disorders. REBLOZYL is part of a global collaboration partnership with Bristol Myers Squibb. The Companies co-promote REBLOZYL inthe United Statesand are also developing luspatercept for the treatment of anemia in patient populations of MDS, beta-thalassemia, and myelofibrosis. In pulmonary, Acceleron is developing sotatercept for the treatment of pulmonary arterial hypertension, having recently reported positive topline results of the Phase 2 PULSAR trial.For more information, please visitwww.acceleronpharma.com. Follow Acceleron on Social Media:@AcceleronPharmaandLinkedIn.Compensation: This is a paid position, rate varies based on experience

Description: *To be considered, please apply using the link provided or by copying this link:https://putnam.referrals.selectminds.com/college/jobs/data-analyst-co-op-378Position Description:· Maintain up to date records on the companies, securities, and portfolios in the investment systems. This information will include new records as well as updates resulting from corporate actions such as mergers, stock splits, acquisitions, and spin-offs.· Be responsible for the maintenance of several Putnam databases used by the investment teams. This group receives large amounts of e mail requests (mostly internal, however some from third party sources). These email requests include: questions about securities (equities and bonds), requests for new security setups, and requests for security data to be changed.· Analyze the information on Putnam's security database, as well as other vendor sources such as Bloomberg. This individual will learn what data the vendors provide as well as understanding how the data is used by each of the business groups within the organization. This will require the ability to establish a relationship with the vendors and the ability to act as a liaison between various business groups and the vendors for any projects.· Resolve any security discrepancies identified via systematic edits and business controls or requests. This may require vendor contact and/or discussions with Putnam’s Investment Professionals.· Be responsible for the timely generation of a number of daily reports used by investment professionals in their daily activities.Desirable Qualifications:· A combination of Computer Science majors or Business Majors or concentration (Finance/Accounting/MIS) and concentrations preferred.· Aptitude for computer systems and programming/macro-writing is recommended.· Solid understanding of securities data· Knowledge of various Investment productsWork Schedule: Monday – Friday 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.About Putnam Investments:Since 1937, when George Putnam created a prudent mix of stocks and bonds in a single, professionally managed portfolio, we have championed the wisdom of the balanced approach. Today, we offer investors a world of equity, fixed-income, multi-asset, and absolute return portfolios so investors can pursue a range of financial goals. Our seasoned portfolio managers seek superior results over time, backed by original, fundamental research on a global scale. We believe in service excellence, in the value of experienced financial advice, and in putting clients first in everything we do.At Putnam we arecommittedto a diverseworkforceand takepositivesteps to ensureequal opportunityin our recruitment process. We also undertake to hire, develop and retain the most talented individuals by valuing the varied skills that you bring because we believe diversity fosters creativity and innovation.Candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, refugee, asylee, or lawful permanent resident

Description: Greetings, students! We’re geared up here to offer another round of epic internship experiences in 2021. The internship program offers the opportunity to pause your studies for one summer and work side-by-side with Blizzard Entertainment employees in your area of interest, doing real work that oftentimes ends up in production. As such, we hold you to the same high standards as anybody else in the company.Just like our gameplay experiences, Blizzard internships are a fully immersive experience. We want interns who are enthusiastic about what they want to do for a living and excited to come in every day to learn and contribute in this hyper-creative atmosphere. Being fully engaged with our team also means communicating effectively and maintaining an open mind - one that is receptive to feedback and able to adapt and grow. Your hobbies and interests can also play in your favor. Passion for technology, gaming, game development, and an in-depth knowledge of Blizzard games, products, and services will always be a plus with us, regardless of the position you’re applying for. Be passionate about who you are, be into our industry, and be willing to go all-in and embrace this opportunity to the fullest!QUEST OBJECTIVES· Our team values creativity, collaboration and a commitment to quality and we are searching for like-minded developers to add to our team of talented game makers. · Together we will learn, grow, and ultimately enjoy success as a team, overcoming new challenges together.· If you have a passion for game development and want to participate in the future of Blizzard, we would love to hear from you! QUEST REQUIREMENTS· Currently enrolled in a college or university· Returning for at least one more semester or quarter following the Summer 2021 internship· Able to work fulltime hours for 11 – 12 weeks at the Blizzard office indicated in this job posting between May 2021 – August 2021 or June 2021 – September 2021 (group dates depend on when you get out of school)· Authorized to work in the USQUEST ITEMS· Resume· Cover Letter· Portfolio and/or reel demonstrating relevant skills requiredINTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITIESLevel Design Intern, World of WarcraftOur Level Designers are hybrid designers and artists. They sculpt and mold the terrain of Azeroth, placing and framing the amazing assets created by our art teams to bring our world to life. They are the fulcrum between art and design, forging our gameplay experiences at the ground level.· Experience with sculpting 3D terrain in in-game engines. (Unreal, Lumberyard, etc)· Strong fundamental art skills.· Knowledge of World of Warcraft, and how we structure our zone experiences.Quest Design Intern, World of WarcraftOur Quest Designers are hybrid designers and tale tellers. They create memorable characters and stories, bringing them to life in the world of Azeroth working with Level Design, Narrative Design and more! You need to possess strong understanding of fun gameplay but also the ability to write memorable storylines that carry players through the gameplay.· Experience working on Game Design projects in a team setting.· Excellent written and verbal communications skills.· Experience working in a tool such as Unreal, Unity, or even the StarCraft editor.· Strong knowledge of World of Warcraft and what makes our quests fun.· Completed student or personal projects involving gameplay implementation, such as a quest in Skyrim.Game Design Intern, Unannounced ProjectThe ideal candidate will help with the creation of a broad array of content. You should have a passion for mobile gaming, a strong aptitude for critical thinking and analysis, outstanding people skills, boundless creativity and an earnest desire to learn and grow as a designer.· Conceptualize, design and implement game content, systems, and story· Ability to work well within a dynamic, cross-discipline, iterative team environment· Work smartly and efficiently on a time sensitive release schedule· Iterate and evolve designs based on player feedback· Champion Blizzard’s core values, especially “Commit to Quality”Blizzard Entertainment is a global company committed to growing our employees along with the business. We offer generous benefits and perks with an eye on providing true work / life balance. We’ve worked hard to foster an intensely collaborative and creative environment, a diverse and inclusive employee culture, and training and opportunity for professional growth. Our people are everything. Our core values are real, and our mission has never changed. We are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences…ever. Join us! We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Description: Development Sciences (DevSci) is a translational science organization that plays a critical role in Genentech Research and Early Development (gRED) as well as late stage development of our products at Roche. DevSci supports drug discovery and development projects across all therapeutic areas from discovery to launch and beyond. We are poised at a unique time when large volumes of complex and varied internal and external data for DevSci areas such as Biomarker, PK/PD, Diagnostics, Safety Assessment and Bio-analytical need to be readily accessible to ensure that swift interpretation and decision making can occur. These data impact decisions in ongoing preclinical and clinical programs, and provide key knowledge to inform new target discovery.The DevSci Informatics department is accountable for leading the strategy and execution around data lifecycle management, data standards, analytics infrastructure, ongoing data operations, and informatics systems for the DevSci organization. The co-op position will contribute to data management efforts that enable the critically-important scientific and development work in DevSci.We are developing a support model to streamline the operations of all the existing scientific applications. Our portfolio is pretty diversified in terms of technologies ranging from commonly used programming languages to third party tools implementation. We have both cloud and on premise hosted applications. This overall effort aims at establishing some effective monitoring tools and techniques for better availability of the applications. This framework should be scalable, and flexible to accommodate future application needs.Competencies and Qualifications:

Description: Please Note:  In Spring, this is a 6-month co-op.In Fall semester, this is a 4-month co-opWelcome to the Heath School of Brookline!The Heath School serves the Chesnut Hill neighborhoods of Brookline and is has a K-8 population of approximately 490 students. The Heath School focuses on instilling important core values into every student, these values are: Build Community, Communicate Respect, Work Hard and Strive for Excellence. Through these values the Heath school works at student achievement, teacher collaboration and equity. The school has an active Equity Team that is comprised of faculty, an active Parent Teacher Organization (PTO) and maintains a strong relationship with the METCO programs that allows students from around Boston to attend Brookline Schools. The Heath school faculty is proud recipients of prestigious grants and awards due to their excellence in teaching, both locally and nationally, including grants given to over 25 Health teachers last year. To ensure students are active citizens the Heath School supports activities that foster community such as the Student Council in grades 4-8, the Heath Family meetings in grades Pre-k ? 3 and many other school wide events throughout the year. All grades participate in community service including the annual Holiday Toy Drive and food drive for the Brookline Pantry organized by the student council. In 2011 the Heath School students in grades 3, 5 and 7 partook in a bullying survey, which combined with the bullying prevention and interventions programs, provided both education and awareness to the concept of bullying. In 2012 the Heath School began a building addition. The addition provides six extra classrooms, a multipurpose room, a library expansion and an enlarged cafeteria to the benefit of students and faculty alike.The responsibilities may be as follows:üAssist head teachers and school staff with K-8th grade childrenüTutor individual studentsüAssist with small and large group instruction as well as activities.üPerform general tasks for the principal's office and libraryüSupervise recess and lunch periodsInstructional Assistant Qualifications:üMust have an interest in children, education, and recreationüCPR and First Aid are preferredüTheoretical knowledge of childhood development is a plus.üFlexibility- being able to shift quickly from one assignment to anotherTransit directions to the school from Northeastern U campus:Northeastern University360 Huntington AveBoston, MA 021151. Walk to Hynes Convention Center StationAbout 14 mins (0.7 mi)Hynes Convention Center Station Stop ID: 701532. Green Line Light rail towards D - Riverside(17 mins, 7 stops)Reservoir Station Stop ID: 701753. Walk to Heath Elementary SchoolAbout 11 mins (0.5 mi)Heath Elementary School100 Eliot StChestnut Hill, MA 02467

Description: SolarKal is seeking a self-driven and motivated individual to help execute the company’s customer acquisition strategy in its crucial expansion phase. This is a rare opportunity to get hands-on experience in the cleantech/climate-tech sector and the burgeoning solar energy industry by working in a fast-growing early stage company with several accolades and awards under its belt (New York State 76West Renewable Energy Award Winner; Cleantech Open Finalist and Greentown Labs Incubator).The Sales Development Intern will work closely with the company’s senior leadership (COO & Director of Marketing) to support overall sales growth, working on a variety of activities such as direct client outreach, client analysis and research. This individual is responsible for optimizing and enhancing the existing sales pipeline in SolarKal’s CRM database as well as bringing new, qualified clients to SolarKal.About SolarKalFounded in 2015, SolarKal is the leading marketplace for commercial solar in the US, connecting organizations to solar energy providers who compete for their business. Over the past 5 years, SolarKal has advised on over $150M of solar projects across 15 states, serving as the procurement advisors of businesses, commercial real estate owners, and non-profits, in their switch to solar. SolarKal’s tech-driven solar procurement platform has over 150 solar providers that bid on projects from $200K-20M, and compares dozens of variables in a simple apples-to-apples format for the client. By working with SolarKal, our clients get access to a vast network of vetted solar companies that have completed thousands of projects with Fortune 500 companies. Job Description:The Sales Development Intern will have a variety of responsibilities, which include:· Research prospective customers to understand their needs and key stakeholders;· Understand the SolarKal value proposition and how to communicate it;· Prospect for new clients through targeted selling strategies encompassing calling, email, social engagement, and events;· Maintain an organized pipeline and activity records using SolarKal’s CRM;· Learn the ins and outs of the energy market and solar industry, and how SolarKal fits within it.Key QualificationsCandidates who qualify for this position will be ambitious, self-motivated and comfortable working in a small, partially remote, company environment.If you possess the following, we’d like to hear from you:· In pursuit of a Bachelors or Masters degree, or a recent graduate;· Experience in sales and/or communications, with a background in customer-facing conversations;· Naturally curious and have a strong desire to learn about solar energy, the sales process, the people and companies you’re prospecting, SolarKal’s services, and the renewable energy space;· An excellent communicator, with the uncanny ability to practice empathic communication, including a high degree of attentiveness to detail, as well as superhuman interpersonal skills;· Must be a detail-oriented, organized, self-starter, and have an ability to prioritize workload;· Demonstrated interest in sustainability and the environment;· Most importantly, a positive and “people” person! Working in a highly demanding and ever-changing startup environment, requires a “can do” approach.Job Benefits• Casual, entrepreneurial, comfortable, fun and proactive with an accountable, high performance, and results oriented work environment;• Access to senior leadership and ability to make an impact both internally, and for clients;• Potential for paid internship via State programs (NYSERDA and MassCEC) that SolarKal is familiar with navigating;• Be part of a fast-pace, fast-growing company with a proven track record;Work on something exciting, changing rapidly

Description: Global Resilience InstituteResearch Assistant DescriptionCompany Name: The Global Resilience Institute at Northeastern UniversityURL: https://globalresilience.northeastern.edu/Location: 177 Huntington Ave., Boston, MA 02115Type of Industry: ResearchJob Type: Full TimeEmployment Type: Research Assistant Co-Op – U.S.Wage: Approximately $16.00 - $19.00/hrGPA: 3.00 (minimum)Minimum Experience: 0 years(s)Job DescriptionDescription of Duties:The Research Assistant will support quantitative and qualitative research as part of the Global Resilience Institute’s ongoing long-term economic recovery and economic development work. This position will support the Institute’s Executive Director for Research and Associate Director for Research on projects which will analyze the social, economic, and physical characteristics of communities to identify priority areas for resilience-based economic development and devise strategies for implementing plans and projects. This work will also build on previously conducted research into the economic impacts of COVID-19 to help communities and regions align their economic development goals with the most pressing needs for long-term recovery.Specific research projects may include:· Supporting community engagement by identifying local experts, producing preparatory materials, and taking detailed notes of engagement activity for synthesis and analysis.· Gathering background research and performing analysis of projects/investments to determine their impact on resilience and identifying synergies between economic development solutions.· Assisting in the research, drafting, and editing of plans and strategies for building community and regional resilience in several communities, likely including Connecticut, Maine, and New Orleans, LA.· Undergraduate or Graduate with strong interest in community and economic resilience;· Background in public policy, economics, business strategy, or a similar field preferred;· Excellent verbal and written communication skills;· Experience conducting interdisciplinary research required; experience conducting community resilience and economic development research strongly preferred;· Experience supporting stakeholder interviews in a research environment;· Strong note taking abilities and proofreading and editing skills;· Experience synthesizing large amounts of information into concise briefings or other written and oral presentations;· Excellent organizational skills and ability to prioritize deadlines in fast-paced office environment;· Ability to stay focused and excel with minimal supervision;· High level of professionalism;· Microsoft Office skills – Experience with Outlook and OneNote strongly preferred; and· ArcMAP GIS experience strongly preferred but not requiredThe Global Resilience Institute is committed to informing and advancing societal resilience around the world. Individuals, communities, nations, and the systems they depend upon, can thrive only if they have the means to better withstand, recover from and adapt to the inevitable shocks and disruptive events of the 21st century. Our university-wide Institute is partnering with other leading academic research institutions, nonprofits and the public and private sectors to devise and apply practical, interdisciplinary innovations and solutions to resilience challenges.

Description: Summary of Position:The mission of the Boston Health Care for the Homeless Program (BHCHP) is to provide or assure access to the highest quality health care that centers equity and dignity for all individuals and families with an experience of homelessness in greater Boston. People experiencing homelessness are at a heightened risk for COVID-19. Widespread testing in shelters and other congregate settings has been a critical feature of BHCHP’s response to the novel coronavirus.As winter approaches, are looking for 1-2 Northeastern health sciences or nursing students (preferably in their second co-op rotation) to support our COVID-19 testing and other operations, such as contact tracing, as needed. Students will be trained to conduct COVID testing at office trailers rented by BHCHP in sites in Boston and participate with field teams conducting universal and surveillance testing at regular intervals on site at Boston shelters. Students will also test BHCHP and other staff as needed. Students will be invited to participate in COVID Testing meetings as well as numerous other trainings and educational opportunities offered at BHCHP including Grand Rounds and continuing education trainings. Students will play a key role in containing the spread of coronavirus among people experiencing homelessness and as well as gain valuable experience working in a health care setting that is nationally regarded for its care.· Screen patients presenting for testing for symptoms of COVID-19· Conduct nasal and nasopharyngeal tests· Follow infection control protocols· Enter data into EMR· Counsel patients on results and communicate any positive COVID-19 results· Arrange for transport of specimens as needed· Open or close testing site; clean up area and dispose of trash· Communicate with Operations Director or Medical Director of COVID Testing about any complicated cases· Supports Contact Tracing program as needed including phoning and interviewing close contacts using a protocol, arranging transport to testing sites, timely entry of data into database.· Administrative tasks as needed under the direction of the Operations Director.· EMT or CNA certification highly desirable· Excellent communication skills and ability to respond to concerns from patients or staff in a courteous and respectful manner, including when under stressful circumstances· Ability to manage confidential information with discretion and professionalism· Working knowledge and experience with electronic health records is strongly preferred· Bilingual English/Spanish, a plus· Flexibility in supporting other tasks, as needed· A demonstrated interest in working with underserved populations, including people with co-morbid psychiatric illness and substance use disorder· Ability to drive, with reliable access to a car is preferred – will travel to different sites· Able to lift 10 pounds on a regular basis· Able to lift 50 pounds occasionally· Able to stand for long periods of time· Able to climb stairs· Able to bend and stoop· Demonstrated interest in working with an undeserved populationAN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Description: In the Center for Cognitive and Brain Health we investigate the effects of lifestyle choices and health behaviors (e.g., physical activity, diet) and their physiological sequelae (e.g., fitness, adiposity) on brain and cognition. From a neuroimaging perspective, our interests lie in understanding how health influences brain and behavior as it relates to increased health and effective functioning for individuals across the lifespan.The Center for Cognitive & Brain Health, located in ISEC, runs a variety of studies that all examine the influence of exercise on brain health in different populations. We are seeking individuals to assist graduate students and postdocs in data collection for various study assessments. These measures include, but are not limited to, neuropsychological tasks, physical fitness testing, EEG collection, DXA scans, PWV tests, and other investigative tasks. Ideal candidates will have work experience demonstrating a high level of interest in this type of research. Candidates should have a strong work ethic and good communication skills. In addition, in light of the current pandemic, candidates should strongly consider that we work with vulnerable populations and take safety very seriously.Company Website: https://web.northeastern.edu/cbhlab/40 Hours/week, $15/hour

Position: Dunn Lab Co-op Research Assistant (Early Adversity)
Targeted Academic Majors: College of Arts, Media & Design, Bouve College of Health Sciences, College of Engineering, College of Science, College of Social Science & Humanities, D'Amore-McKim School of Business, Khoury College of Computer Sciences

Desired Skills: Biology, Data Analysis, Clinical Research, Data Entry, Research, Genetics, Qualitative Research, Interviewing, Brain Research
Description: The Dunn Lab (http://www.thedunnlab.com/) is looking to hire a highly motivated and enthusiastic co-op Research Assistant (RA) to support ongoing efforts on a number of studies. The lab is based in the Psychiatric and Neurodevelopmental Genetics Unit (PNGU) within the Center for Genomic Medicine and Department of Psychiatry. In the lab, we use interdisciplinary approaches to better understand the social and genetic factors that influence the etiology of mood disorders, with an emphasis on depression among women, children, and adolescents. The goal of our work is to identify the causal mechanisms underlying risk for mood disorders, develop population-based strategies for prevention, and target these strategies to “sensitive periods,” or developmental stages in the course of the lifespan when the brain is highly “plastic” and therefore when experience, including exposure to childhood adversity, can have lasting impacts. To do this, we analyze genetic and other types of data collected from individuals across the globe, including longitudinal studies that follow children from the time of their birth. We are a multidisciplinary team of researchers from a range of fields, including epidemiology, anthropology, biology, public health, genetics, education, neurology, psychiatry, and psychology. This position will focus on several research projects examining teeth as a potential biomarker for stress and adversity in young children.Under the direction of Dr. Erin Dunn, the Principal Investigator of the lab, the RA will be responsible for assisting various aspects of clinical research including study recruitment, data entry, administrative tasks, conducting literature searches, assisting in data management and data analysis tasks, preparing papers for submission to scholarly journals, and preparing materials for conference presentations.Candidates must be highly motivated, have an ability to work well in a collaborative environment, fluency with all modes of communication in English, and strong writing skills. Interest in psychiatric disorders and adversity/traumatic stress is a must. Candidates will gain experience working in all phases of the research process, ranging from study design to analysis and interpretation of results. Opportunities for co-authorship of manuscripts and presentation of results at scholarly conferences will be available.

Description: POSITION SUMMARY:Under the supervision of the Practice Manager, provides administrative support to physicians in a high-volume ambulatory clinic setting, functioning as the primary interface between patients and providers. Emphasis is placed on the ability to stay organized and to prioritize administrative tasks related to patient care. Role requires management of confidential patient information, scheduling patient appointments, answering phones with the highest level of customer service, checking patients in and out of appointments, collecting copayments, and helping to manage incoming information via phone and fax.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:-Perform administrative front desk duties with the highest level of customer service, including but not limited to greeting patients and families, checking patients in and out for services, collecting copayments, and ensuring proper referrals and authorizations/financial clearance in place for scheduled services. Collect and verify accurate information from patients, prioritizing and communicating to clinical staff as needed.-At end of visit, ensure proper follow-up services are scheduled at check out, and help provide patients with any post-appointment information or instructions requested by the physician and services team. Print and hand patient after visit summary report after scheduling follow-up visits, tests, and surgeries.-Obtain or prepare medical records in advance; ensure that all documents, including internal and external records, are in order and incorporated into electronic patient record in a timely fashion. If any item is missing prior to day of appointment, contact patient to obtain.-Help to triage incoming questions from patients via phone and fax; seek guidance from provider, clinical staff or Practice Manager as appropriate. This includes daily monitoring of incoming messages in the electronic medical record system; timely response is expected. Also assist with sending communications out to referring providers and patients as necessary (for example, prior visit notes to referring providers).-Provide support to other colleagues in the office; help to cover and fill in as needed if other staff members are out of office, per instruction from Practice Manager.-Monitors levels of administrative supplies at front desk and alerts Manager if orders need to be placed.
