Description: Job Overview:Empathy and sensitivity are the core values of Bridge Cultures. The on-going conflicts in the world based on cultural and race differences, unconscious biases, gender-based violence etc. are a result of less awareness, empathy, and sensitivity. This position will offer an opportunity to learn more about current happenings and conversations on the above-mentioned aspects. This position involves researching and developing content for blogs and social media posts to create awareness. Also, the student will get an insight into the digital marketing space as well.Responsibilities and Duties:· Define communication objectives for Bridge Cultures· Design and develop a communication strategy and implementation plan· Develop articles for blogs and relevant platforms based on the core values of Bridge Cultures· Develop content for social media according to the communication plan· Design creatives for social mediaQualifications:Required skills/Personal skills:Research, writing, developing concepts for social media content,Skills gained by the end of internship:Compensation (per month):· Unpaid position but we have you covered on the following:Working hours (per week):20 – 40 hours per week. Flexible.About the company:Bridge Cultures - A Northeastern University partner for global co-op in India, is a young social enterprise working towards building empathy and sensitivity in individuals across the globe. We believe that one of the best ways to inculcate these aspects into our lives is by experiencing another culture and working with social enterprises that address pressing issues of the globe. Thus, we do this by providing internship, volunteer, and learning opportunities with social enterprises in India. We facilitate cultural integration and immersion of the participants by providing pre-departure & on-arrival orientations and by building a community of students along with the locals of the city. This is to ensure a smoother transition and a comfortable stay in a foreign land. Bridge Cultures is working with an aim to create a global community of people from diverse backgrounds.Programs and services by Bridge CulturesOnline workshops/webinars:Students learn about the culture and multiple facets and influences on various aspects of life through conversations with people they would meet while in Bangalore. With a remote co-op, Bridge Cultures will enable these conversations virtually. We will organize 3 virtual webinars and workshops on various topics in context to cultural integration which will align with students’ professional and personal growth. Bridge Cultures will bring professionals from various domains and facilitate these interactive sessions.Few topics (not confined to) are listed below:· Social entrepreneurship· Know the city - food, culture, people· Leadership and Teamwork· Unconscious biases· Critical thinking· Influence of culture on design, education, outdoor education, experiential education· Sustainability· Mental health, emotional well-being· Impact of traveling on our personalitySelf-reflection session:Bridge Cultures believes that self-reflection is highly important and necessary to learn and grow, especially after working with a social enterprise on an impactful project. Out of many reasons, reflection is important because it:· Enables the individuals to process and make meaning of the experience· Fosters a better understanding of context. i.e. understanding how their work impacts the community and encourages more participation in future· Creates a sense of accomplishment· Enables the individuals to examine the effects of their behavior, discover ways to improve· Reinforces the feeling of empathy gained during the experience· Acknowledges the skills gained during the experience and builds confidenceProgram Inclusions:· Co-op placement· Necessary documentation· Self-Reflection session· 2-3 online webinars/workshops on various topics· Review meetings during co-op to track progress· Social networkProcess:1. Students apply for various positions through NU works2. Bridge Cultures will send an email to the student to schedule a call3.   After the student’s response to that email, a call will be scheduled between the student, Ms. Aspa Papanastasiou (Associate Director, Global engagements at NU), and Bridge Cultures to ensure accountability from the student’s side4. Another call will be scheduled with Bridge Cultures (if needed) to understand the student’s interest, motivation, and expectations from the co-op5. Bridge Cultures will share the appointment letter with the student6. The student will start the co-op on the decided dates7.  Bridge Cultures will facilitate virtual onboarding if necessary8. Bridge Cultures will facilitate 3 online sessions on various topics and organize 2 review meetings during the co-op9. Bridge Cultures will facilitate self-reflection session at the end of the co-op

Description: The Chemical Process Development Co-op will be responsible for hands-on development and scale-up of novel chemical syntheses and unit operations. The co-op student will work directly with experienced scientists and engineers in a research laboratory setting to perform experiments to optimize chemical syntheses. Possible areas of study may be optimization of reaction parameters, calorimetry, kinetics, heat transfer, selectivty, or product separation techniques such as crystallization.As a chemical engineering co-op at Nalas, you will have the opportunity to apply the fundamentals learned from your chemical engineering coursework to various process development activities in our lab. The coupling of the 'hands-on' laboratory environment with the application of chemical engineering principles will provide a strong technical foundation as you embark on your career. Your responsibilities at Nalas will include preparation of laboratory procedures, performance of laboratory experiments designed to assess chemistry/process characteristics (e.g. heat flow, mixing sensitivity, and kinetics), and completion and documentation of data analysis.Over the course of your internship or co-op you will have various opportunities to enhance your technical communication skills through technical report writing and oral presentations. We have a dynamic and growing workforce with dedicated team members. Our scientists and engineers will serve as mentors to guide you as you navigate the various projects and the technical challenges associated with each. You will also be expected to work independently on selected assignments. We are confident that you will find your co-op assignment at Nalas Engineering both stimulating and rewarding.

Description: This ROUTES scholar position will work with PROTECT Center with the project focused on the long-term goal to develop novel, sustainable, solar-powered and environmentally-friendly electrochemical technologies for remediation of contaminated groundwater, especially in karst regions of Puerto Rico. Puerto Rico has suffered from extensive water contamination due to industrial and medical waste which have led to adverse health outcomes in the population's men women and children. By using solar panels to apply low direct electric currents through electrodes in wells to manipulate groundwater chemistry by electrolysis the project will target contaminants like chlorinated solvents, specifically trichloroethylene (TCE), but the process will also be designed to treat other common groundwater contaminants and their mixtures. The goals are relevant to the EPA’s strategic plan for compliance and environmental stewardship, which strives for cleanup programs that use natural resources and energy efficiently, reduce negative impacts on the environment, minimize pollution at its source, and reduce waste to the greatest extent possible.The ROUTES scholar will conduct literature research on findings in the electrochemical groundwater remediation technologies as well as attend the webinars and seminars organized by PROTECT Center with the goal to expand knowledge in the field of Environmental Health. The scholar will conduct the laboratory scale experiments for the optimization of electrochemical remediation technologies developed by PROTECT Center (experiments design, setup and samples analysis) and the pilot scale experiments on the optimized remediation technologies (experiments design, setup and samples analysis). The scholar will also conduct analysis and evaluation of experimental data and assist with scientific papers preparation.To apply: Please submit a resume and a short cover letter addressing the following questions:1. ROUTES is an NIH-funded program designed to support students from underrepresented backgrounds in environmental health research. How does the diversity of your experiences and background inform your work or eligibility for ROUTES?2. How do you see yourself applying your undergraduate training and experiences as a ROUTES Scholar after graduation (i.e. careers in research, education, government, industry, non-profit)?ROUTES: https://web.northeastern.edu/routes/PROTECT: https://web.northeastern.edu/protect/

Description: AN ALL-ROUND EXPERIENCE: FROM SOCIAL MEDIA TO FUNDRAISING AND PROJECT MANAGEMENTLooking for an opportunity to get hands-on working experience with a nonprofit organization or NGO? Keen to help out with daily operations, communications, fundraising, project development, etc.? We have an exciting opportunity for you in Kenya on the shores of Lake Victoria.This organization provides education, food security, (health)care for over 300 vulnerable and orphaned children from the community and works towards an environment allowing people to thrive and fulfill their potential.This NGO Management Internship in Kenya provides you with an all-round working experience. One day you will support the design and implementation of development projects or create content for social media, and the next you will assist with fundraising, monitoring,and evaluation. A great internship if you are keen to use your skills and experience for a nonprofit organization and see the impact of your efforts on the ground.Your TasksYour role will be designed according to your skills, desired learning outcomes, and needs of the children. The tasks include:During the weekends or weeks off, you have free time to relax or take the opportunity to explore Kisumu, wider Kenya, and Eastern Africa. You can also initialize workshops or excursions with the kids, the staff or the wider community, or just spend time with the team and the children, play football, volleyball and so on.Good to knowThis organization was founded in 2015 and they aim to empower and inspire people to initiate the individual and societal transformation we want to see. They work towards an environment allowing people to thrive and fulfill their potential. It is their role to build the capacity of people and organizations they work with, build bridges between agents of change to co-create this environment.In January 2015 he made his promise come true. Together with his good friend Mathilde he started a long 5200km journey from South Africa to Kenya, crossing Zimbabwe, Zambia, Malawi, Tanzania and Uganda on their way, to raise awareness but also funds for the Educational Center. What started as a simple idea to help the Center and her children, turned into a big vision that evolved into the founding of this organization. They providefinancial support as well as helps the Centerto strengthen their capacity by consult in organizational development, designing and managing educational and development projects. Additionally, they also facilitate vocational training, alternative educational programs, and training of teachers.The Center now houses a children’s home, non-formal nursery and primary school and acts as a sponsor for high-school and university.Aside from education, the children are taught the ideals of respect and love, environmental awareness, social and economic empowerment.They also have 14 acres of farm, as well as livestock like cows, pigs, chickens, goats, sheep, fish and rabbits to provide an income.

Description: Company FunctionHarbourVest is an independent, global private markets investment specialist with more than 35 years of experience and more than $50 billion in assets under management. The Firm’s powerful global platform offers clients investment opportunities through primary fund investments, secondary investments, and direct co-investments in commingled funds or separately managed accounts. HarbourVest has more than 450 employees, including more than 100 investment professionals across Asia, Europe, and the Americas. This global team has committed more than $34 billion to newly-formed funds, completed over $19 billion in secondary purchases, and invested over $8 billion directly in operating companies. Description: We are seeking a skilled individual with strong communication and analytic abilities to work on program management, automation and analytics projects for a global Procurement team. We are looking for someone with strong curiosity and work experience learning and mapping business processes to define and deliver projects for end users within the Procurement team.At Dell, our talented supply chain experts and benchmarked processes and capabilities are supporting the company’s transformation strategy. Description: The Bioanalytical Sciences group at Alnylam is seeking a highly motivated co-op to join our team in Cambridge, MA to help advance novel RNAi programs from discovery to the clinic. Our group is responsible for designing, developing and implementing biologically relevant assays to support early drug development programs. The candidate will be responsible for executing assays and analyzing results to evaluate the pharmacodynamics or biological effects of Alnylam’s RNAi therapies using a variety of ligand binding assays and platforms (ELISA, MSD, Luminex, Quanterix). The candidate will also have the opportunity to learn other aspects of assay development with guidance from experienced colleagues. This is an exciting opportunity for an individual with interests in molecular biology or biochemistry to learn more about RNAi therapeutics and the drug development process, develop key laboratory techniques, and refine their communication and presenting skills in a fast paced, team-oriented environment.Learning Objectives· Learning Objective #2: Apply your knowledge of ligand binding assays to support the development and implementation of a novel assay for the group. Learn how to troubleshoot issues and evaluate assay performance.· Learning Objective #3: Learn the molecular basis behind the diseases that are being targeted with RNAi therapeutics at Alnylam, and how your assays or data are used to advance the RNAi therapeutic. Present your results to the group· Proficient with basic computer software (Excel, PPT, Word, etc)· Experience with basic lab procedures: pipetting, solution preparation· Organized with strong attention to detail· Highly motivated, dependable and ability to manage individual projects· Excellent communication skills, including preparation of lab reports and presentations· Minimum Grade point average of 3.2Benefits/Additional Information·  Alnylam Co-Ops are eligible for the T-Pass/public transit benefit· Office located in Cambridge, only 30 minute MBTA commute from campus.· Various lunch & learns, forums, and seminars hosted by the company, providing opportunities to gain greater knowledge of the pharmaceutical world and current research topics.· Collaborating with scientists and participating in team meetings

Description: Please apply online and on NUWorks.Joining HPE in an early career role is an excellent opportunity for a self-motivated, proactive individual to grow with us and help us drive our continued success globally. We are one of the largest technology companies in the world, operating in over 150 countries and market leading in several industries. We believe in partnership, innovation and taking action – our culture is what defines us as a company: how we act, how we treat others, and how we conduct business. In addition to working alongside great colleagues, you will have many opportunities to learn through coaching and stretch assignment opportunities. You’ll be guided by feedback and support to accelerate your learning and maximize your knowledge. We even have a “reverse mentoring” program which allows us to share our knowledge and strengths across our multi-generation workforce.Sounds like you? Then we have the right opportunity—we are looking for a Systems/ Software Engineering Intern to join us! Our engineers develop solutions using the latest technologies to ‘Make IT Simple’ for our customers. HPE is more than a hardware company, we are a global software development organization with a full suite of products ranging from an enterprise website getting millions of page views a week to a predictive analytics solution which can warn a customer of an issue before it happens. We're looking for hands-on, technically curious individuals that want to grow their abilities as software engineers in a large-scale, global development team with great opportunities to learn and develop. Peaked your interest? Apply today for this role!How you’ll make your mark:• You will work on a specific project critical to HPEs needs with opportunities to gain experience across a broad range of cutting edge technologies and across the full stack of software engineering challenges.• You can work within an existing Agile, software engineering project team and collaborate to help to solve problems within that team's focus• You'll learn about our software development practices and the latest tools used for software development and front-end technology - including Scrum and Kanban methodologies.• You can communicate effectively and be motivated to achieve results as part of your team.• You will be mentored by at least one senior member of the Engineering Team and will be working with a mix of IT professionals with a range of experienceAbout you:• You have a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Technology (or similar)• You have knowledge of Programming Languages –Java, Java Script, Python, C++, C, Shell Programming, Infrastructure/Operating Systems/Virtualization such as Windows, Linux, Docker, Swarm, Ansible and also development tools such as GitHub, Jenkins, Selenium• You have a basic understanding of Scrum and Kanban methodologies·• You are customer focused with excellent problem-solving skills• You are a strong verbal and written communicator with the ability to work well in teamsWhat we can offer you:Extensive benefits, a competitive salary and participation in the shared values and purpose that make Hewlett Packard Enterprise one of the world´s most attractive employers! At HPE, our goal is to provide equal opportunities, flexible work-life balance, and constantly evolving career growth.If you are looking for challenges in an exciting, supportive and international work environment, then we definitely want to hear from you. Continue the conversation by clicking apply now below, or directly via our Careers Portal at www.hpe.com/careers.Join us and make your mark!Find out more about us and follow us on:https://www.facebook.com/HPECareershttps://twitter.com/HPE_CareersHPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to diversity and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We do not discriminate and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global diverse team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together.

Description: The Quantitative Research team within the Asset Allocation group is looking for a talented and driven individual to join our quantitative infrastructure development efforts. The team is responsible for conducting research across various asset classes to inform portfolio management decisions, which involves maintaining and enhancing the firm’s proprietary 7-year asset class forecasting framework.The successful candidate will work with Asset Allocation Quant team directly on building data and model pipelines for fixed income, credit, and currency asset classes. He/she will gain insights into Asset Allocation forecasting methodology, will participate in various research meetings, and will be provided with opportunities to learn about and meet with other teams at GMO.Partner with AA Quant and Investment Data Solutions (IDS) teams to build out new data processing pipeline for fixed income and currency data that will ultimately feed into asset allocation forecast models. Pipeline collects raw data from third party sources and GMO’s central data warehouse and applies various stages of transformation so that the data can be readily utilized in model generation and analytics. Pipeline will embed data quality checks and, in some cases, apply data cleaning techniques. If time permits, the applicant will work to rewire existing model code to consume the new data and verify the correctness of the new model output.Company ProfileFounded in 1977, GMO is a private partnership committed to delivering superior investment performance and advice to our clients. We offer strategies where we believe we are positioned to add the greatest value for our investors. These include multi-asset class portfolios as well as dedicated equity, fixed income, and absolute return offerings, many of which employ the firm’s proprietary 7-year asset class forecasting framework. Our client base is comprised primarily of institutions, including corporate and public defined benefit and defined contribution retirement plans, endowments, foundations, and financial intermediaries.GMO, whose sole business is investment management, employs approximately 640 people worldwide and is headquartered in Boston with offices in San Francisco, London, Amsterdam, Sydney, and Singapore. We manage roughly $70 billion in client assets using a combination of top-down and bottom-up approaches that blend traditional fundamental insights with innovative quantitative methods to identify undervalued asset classes and securities. Our valuation-based approach embeds several key factors, including: a long-term investment horizon, discipline, conviction, and a commitment to research. Our research emphasizes not only identifying and exploiting pricing dislocations but also understanding the long-term drivers of return in the markets in which we invest. We are known for our candor in sharing our views with clients and for our willingness to take bold, differentiated positions when opportunities warrant.

Description: SummaryLyndra Therapeutics is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company that is making daily pills a thing of the past. Our team has developed the first ultra-long acting pill that lasts a week or longer and can provide a wide range of medicines in a familiar oral capsule form. Our near-term focus is on addressing unmet needs where compliance is a documented issue and weekly or monthly doses would improve medication adherence and health outcomes. Lyndra’s current pipeline includes therapies for Alzheimer’s disease, HIV, opioid use disorder and schizophrenia.We are seeking a motivated Co-Op to assist with research and development activities in the Analytical Research and Development group. The Analytical Research and Development group is an integral part of Lyndra Therapeutics. The group is responsible for developing, validating, and executing analytical methods, including HPLC, Dissolution / In Vitro Release, Gel Permeation Chromatography etc., for evaluation of the purity, potency, and in vitro release performance of Lyndra dosage forms. Members of the Analytical team work closely with cross functional teams to ensure that the products we manufacture meet specific quality and safety requirements. The Co-Op will report to an Analytical Scientist and work cross-functionally to gain experience across a variety of technical areas and operations.Job responsibilitiesSkills/Capabilities required

Description: Discover a new way of learning with Para La Tierra!Para La Tierra is searching for talented and hardworking research interns to take part in a remote internship, no matter where they are in the world! Our remote internship program provides students and graduates an opportunity to gain skills in research and project management, while earning on-the-job experience working with an NGO dedicated to having a positive impact on communities spread across the heart of South America.The program is designed to give our interns the opportunity to take control of their career development. From choosing their topic to presenting their results, our interns are in the driver seat!Learn from an award-winning conservation and research NGO based in Paraguay!Para La Tierra is dedicated to the conservation of fragile habitats in Paraguay through scientific research, community engagement, and environmental education. We are based in the beautiful city of Pilar - The City of Birds - and work across Southern Paraguay, from the expansive Ñeembucú Wetland Complex to the endangered Atlantic Forest.At Para La Tierra, we specialize in training students and graduates in the skills they need to take the next step in their career, either towards higher education or into the job market. Over the past decade, we have hosted over 1,500 interns, each of whom has made a tangible contribution to the conservation of the fragile species and understudied ecosystems of Paraguay.We are now very excited to offer remote learning opportunities designed to empower the next generation of conservationists, educators, and scientists!Learning outcomes:Whether your passion is for ecological research, community-based conservation, or social impact through education, PLT will make sure you are confident in the methodology needed to move your research forward.Para La Tierra charges interns in order to pay for our expert staff who will dedicate their time to coaching our interns throughout the project as well as to recover the costs invested into the research projects that were essential in the collection of the data being used in these projects. A small portion of the cost goes to support Para La Tierra's conservation and education projects in Paraguay.How to applyYou must be over 18 years old and have or be working towards a degree in a biology, environment or social sciences related subject. Conversational English is required. To apply please email your CV to paralatierra.py@gmail.com so we can start co-creating your project!Learn more at paralatierra.org/

Develop project management & decision making skills by managing a long-term project to reinforce engineering principles, technical skills, & data-analysis techniques.BorgWarner Morse Systems is the world leader in automotive chain systems for engine timing and power transmission/torque transfer. Transforming vehicles to more fuel efficient, cleaner technologies requires a collaborative partner who understands the evolution of mechanical to electric systems. Our expertise in both provides the critical underpinnings of efficient and powerful propulsion. Integrating electronics into the mechanical system is the key to performance, packaging and cost. This is evidenced across a full line of our combustion, hybrid and EV products for light vehicles, medium & heavy duty vehicles as well as off-highway applications. We continually set global benchmarks for valve timing and drivetrain chain performance. We are a tier one supplier, which means we sell directly to the major automotive manufacturers, such as Ford, GM, and Chrysler. About 70% of the vehicles on the road have a Morse Systems product in it.We look forward to meeting students that have drive, initiative, and a "can do" attitude. Description: Agency MissionMASS DEP is the state agency responsible for protecting human health and the environment by ensuring clean air and water, the safe management and disposal of solid and hazardous wastes, the timely cleanup of hazardous waste sites and spills, and the preservation of wetlands and coastal resources.DEP’s Diversity Vision and MissionThe Massachusetts Department of Environmental Protection in fulfilling its vision to advance diversity at the agency as we seek to hire, retain, and promote women and men from different racial, cultural, economic and ethnic backgrounds in support of an applicant’s sexual orientation or disability status. Through effective and fully compliant affirmative action and equal opportunity policies, MassDEP strives to attract members of groups traditionally underrepresented in the environmental field and to increase the number of minority and women applicants for its vacancies.Project DescriptionThis position will serve as a member of the Diversity Office and is responsible for administration and program coordination. The office and its members facilitate a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees and build on underrepresented personnel and administrators. Additionally, the diversity intern will provide appropriate and broadly defined diversity-related information that supports, fosters and maintains a diverse and inclusive environment for all staff at DEP.Essential Duties• Develop new methods to create a respectful and inclusive climate.• Assist with internship projects• Provide research and statistical data to quantify diversity related project outcomes• Provide logistical support to organizing events and meetings• Attending Career fairs to recruit diverse candidates for employment at DEP.• Corresponding with staff, volunteers, and committee members, including events announcements, meetings, etc.• Creating and distributing educational and promotional materials about diversity• Providing administrative support Providing social media supportKnowledge and Skills RequestedInterest and understanding of the need for a diverse and inclusive workforce.Microsoft suite, PowerPoint, excel and wordExperience using database and spreadsheetsInterest in social medialINTERPERSONAL SKILLS: written and oral communication skills; commitment to promoting a diverse inclusive environment and working effectively in a diverse environment.RELATED TRAVEL– POST COVID19: There may be opportunities to get involved with both local and region wide diversity related workshops and conferences.The Value of a MassDEP InternshipMassDEP’s Volunteer Internship Program creates a “win-win” experience by providing experiential learning for interns while allowing the agency to cultivate a professional, diverse pool of applicants for employment opportunities in the environmental field.MassDEP’s goal is to provide a growth-oriented opportunity for all interns. Interns will receive invaluable real-world experience, intellectual challenges, problem solving skills and contacts in their field of interest. Interns are considered an integral part of MassDEP.

Description: Akoya UX Researcher (Co-op)Meet the futureIf you are driven by curiosity and fascinated by innovative technology to solve large complex problems, then become part of a startup that is building a financial data access network. Akoya encourages a highly collaborative, fast-paced workplace and a fun environment. Come join us and be part of this exciting journey.Akoya offers a secure API-based data access network that creates a safer and more transparent way for consumers to grant access of their personal financial data to third party financial apps. The network acts as a bridge between financial institutions and data recipients, such as data aggregators/fintechs, and is available to the entire financial services industry.The RoleThe UX Researcher Co-OP will report to the Head of Design for Akoya and will work with the product and design team to generate usability studies and solicit data to help inform our direction. You will be responsible for the following:·The UX Researcher will be an integral part of the UX design team with a focus on conducting usability research· In this role, the UX Researcher will lead efforts to develop and execute research plans, methodologies and report findings to inform product design· The UX Researcher will work to create user requirements for Akoya clients and partners, helping transform unmet user needs into business opportunitiesSkills You Bring· The ideal candidate has a passion for user-centered research and design and has been exposed to various standard research methodologies· Knowledge of usability and user experience research tools and techniques (e.g. field research, heuristic reviews, benchmarking, card sorts, lo-fidelity prototyping methods, etc.)· Strong communication, critical thinking, and creative problem-solving skills required· Ability to communicate research results, graphically depict data, and justify methods and approaches—orally and in writing· Strong moderation skills and methods for group facilitation and consensus building· Related experience in another field such as human factors, interactive design, information architecture, and/or market research is a plus· Experience designing wireframes and creating interactive prototypes using related tools· Experience creating user personas and journey maps to support a user centered design methodology· Strong understanding of user interface design practices and principles

Description: (REMOTE)Who isServiceNow?Imagine your workday dominated less by emails and spreadsheets and more time given back to you to do your actual job. At ServiceNow, we are making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud-based platform and products streamline and simplify how work gets done across the enterprise. We are the fastest growing enterprise cloud software company in the world and was recently recognized on Fortune’s Future 50 list (https://fortune.com/future-50/2019/) For us, this is just the start.Who is Marketing at ServiceNow?Marketing is the engine room for growth at fuel the success of our customers, sales, and products. We have a customer-first mindset in all that we do. As a Marketing team, we are laser-focused on how we can connect with our customers by creating simple, sweet spot targeting, and by the positioning and packaging of our products and solutions. We help our customers gain the most value from our products by providing best practices, business cases and trainings.We also partner closely with Sales to build high-quality pipeline through targeted Marketing activities ranging from thought leadership, strategic and executive events, webinars, digital acquisition, SEO, and more!ServiceNow tells its customers’ unique stories in a variety of different ways, encompassing the power of our Brand, Comms and Events to amplify the voice of the customer.Given the value to customers of our strategic and trusted partnership, combined with the power of our solutions, understandably dynamic, strategic and resourceful customer evidence and cooperative storytelling projects are front and centre in driving and supporting ServiceNow’s success.The Customer Advocacy Co-op will play an integral part in identifying and developing customers/stories who will drive the pipe for Brand, Comms and Events activation and amplification. The successful Co-op will have an unrivalled opportunity to work with both customer and ServiceNow stakeholders, sharing the value of our programme, recruiting customers and connecting them to opportunities that will promote them, their companies and their innovative approaches, to a global audience.Successful Candidate will:· Collaborate with talented teams and stakeholders across Customer Advocacy, Brand, Comms and Events, and our creative agencies; helping to execute against set strategy to build referenceable customers in this area.· Work directly with customers at all levels – from project owners to C-level Execs to communicate the benefits associated with the opportunities presented to them.· Get involved in helping shape creative content creation – example: ‘Now You Know’ Brand customer campaign.· Drive reporting of success metrics.· Represent the Customer Advocacy Team internally and externally.Role Requirements:· Majoring in business, marketing, communications, and/or PR/journalism, or creative types with a passion for this work.· A passion for people and their stories.· An understanding of B2B and Human2Human approaches to storytelling.· Motivated, creative problem-solving in a fast-paced environment; excellent time management and organizational skills.· Strong writing and communication skills with a passion for storytelling.· Results-oriented.

Description: From Matt Handy, VP of MarketingI know what you're thinking. Perhaps the Orthodontics or even 3D Printing industry isn't what you were looking for. If I am being honest, that's what I initially thought. But the more I learned about the Orthodontic space, the more I started to see the exciting and massive opportunity. Imagine an industry that hasn't changed in 50 years. This space is old, slow, and ripe for a team of creative marketers to do something BIG.We have a very real and rare opportunity to truly build a brand from the ground up and disrupt a $2B industry. There aren't many startups in Boston that can honestly say that.From a marketing perspective, we're starting from scratch. We're revamping the brand, building our own creative marketing playbook (nothing is off limits), and we have the budget, runway and senior support to make it happen. We're now looking for a marketing Co-op team member to join our band of pirates and build something meaningful. This position will have exposure to all marketing efforts. Only apply if you have off-the-chart hustle, an entrepreneurial spirit and passion for juggling a lot of projects at once beautifully and gracefully.About LightForceLightForce Orthodontics is a technology company bringing together the latest in 3D printing, "Industry 4.0" principles and digital orthodontic treatment. Based in Cambridge, MA, their first product is the world's only fully-customized, 3D-printed bracket system, which combines proprietary treatment planning software, a digital manufacturing, and advanced 3D printing to enable the world's second example of customization at scale for a medical device; thereby matching a patient's exact tooth morphology and bracket prescription.General ResponsibilitiesRequirements$18-24/hour range dependent on experienceThis is a 40/week temporary employment

Responsibilities of the Process Engineering function include both tactical support of ongoing plant operations and strategic implementation of engineering projects to meet the changing needs of the business. The role reports into the Manufacturing Engineering department at the site.Our Lonza Portsmouth site is a clinical-to-commercial, multi-product manufacturing facility located in Portsmouth, New Hampshire, only 56 miles north of Boston, Massachusetts. The site, which employs over 1,000 employees, is a custom manufacturer of therapeutic monoclonal antibodies and recombinant proteins using mammalian cell culture. We offer an onsite cafeteria, unlimited coffee (hot, iced and lattes), as well as a delicious outdoor grill in the summer. The city of Portsmouth is a quintessential New England seaport town, home to many restaurants, breweries, museums, and theaters. The ocean and mountains are nearby and we have major cities close by (Boston, Portland, and Manchester). People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference. Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.Key Accountabilities and Duties:· Performs all work safely and meets the requisite training requirements· Develop a basic understanding of the cGMP fermentation and purification processes and equipment· Supports engineering in resolution of major equipment breakdowns and quality issues· Provide SME support to Manufacturing and other departments for the design and operation of process equipment.· Gain experience within biologics industry· Conduct troubleshooting and technical analyses on manufacturing equipment and processes· Assist with tech transfer of new processes into the facility· Assist with modifying/developing preventative maintenance plans and creating spare parts· Assist with the planning and execution of plant projects involving equipment changes and process improvements· Execute commissioning protocols (installation, operation, CIP/SIP, wet testing)· Complete change request tasks to support project completion· Assist the Quality department with deviation investigations· Participate in root cause analysis investigations for equipment issues· Assist with completion of CAPA actions· Review/revise Engineering and Manufacturing related SOP’s, work instructions, and maintenance assessments/procedures as a result of CAPA, equipment/process changes, and error prevention activities.· Initiate updates to Engineering documents including engineering drawings· Author commissioning protocols (installation, operation, CIP/SIP, wet testing).· Remain up to date on all assigned training activities· Perform other duties as assignedMinimum Required Qualifications/Skills:· High School Diploma or Equivalent; pursuing BS in Engineering Discipline· Preferred area of study: Chemical Engineering· Completion of sophomore year (typically 60 credits)· Education in the application of engineering principles to plant systems; Biopharmaceutical/process experience preferred, but not required at this level..· Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite with focus on Outlook, Word, PowerPoint and Excel.Communication SkillsAbility to effectively communicate via writing and oral communication at all levels. Express ideas effectively in individual and group situations (including non-verbal communication).Project Management SkillsAbility to learn and demonstrate project management skills in their work.Analysis/Problem AssessmentAbility to secure relevant information and identify key issues and relationships from a base of information. Relate and compare data from different sources and identify cause and effect relationships.Technical KnowledgeAbility to evaluate engineering problems and be able to devise cause and affect relationships and propose solutions. Develops knowledge of other departments and how engineering work impacts them.Follow-upAbility to keep customers/requesters and management apprised of status of work under your direction. Ability to maneuver around hurdles to accomplish goals/tasksPlanning/Work ManagementAbility to establish a project plan that outlines the course of action for self and/or others to accomplish a specific goal. Ability to learn Lonza’s systems to complete work tasks.Interpersonal and Leadership SkillsWorks effectively on cross-functional teams and in a fast paced environment.

Description: More than 30,000 Takeda employees working in more than 70 countries are committed to improving quality of life for patients, who remain at the center of everything we do. Takeda Pharmaceutical Company Limited is a global, research and development-driven organization working internally and with external partners to translate science into life-changing medicines. Takeda focuses on the core therapeutic areas of oncology, gastroenterology, neuroscience and providing vaccines that address the most important infectious diseases. Novel products, especially in oncology and gastroenterology, as well as our presence in emerging markets, fuel our growth.Takeda Pharmaceuticals U.S.A., Inc. ranks among the top 15 pharmaceutical companies in the United States. Our larger U.S. offices are in Cambridge, MA, Deerfield, IL, and San Diego, CA. Research & Development employees in our Cambridge location focus on oncology, gastroenterology, immunomodulation, biologics, translational research, and external innovation. In March 2016, we opened our newest space at 300 Massachusetts Avenue, featuring 230,000 square feet of state-of-the-art office and lab space.While Takeda is enjoying tremendous growth as an emerging global leader in the pharmaceutical industry, we remain ever mindful of our commitment to serve people worldwide by striving toward better health through leading innovation in medicine. In short, we are a passionate team doing important work that impacts patients’ lives. If you are driven to create better health and a brighter future, join us!Position Description:Takeda Pharmaceuticals is looking to hire a talented and entrepreneurial Co-op within Protein and Cell Line Generation, Global Biologics to serve an essential role in being part of a world-class biologics team. Responsibilities and milestones include, (1) performing transient mammalian protein expression and basic molecular biology techniques within a team of scientists focused on general novel therapeutics, (2) be able to effectively present one’s work to the group and appropriate project teams when required and (3) work closely with Lead Discovery, Biotherapeutics Engineering, and Protein Analytics in support of therapeutic discovery.The successful candidate preferably should have at least one co-op/internship of experience including but not limited to biochemistry, protein expression, and molecular biology. The candidate should be eager minded and familiar with general protein expression and other biochemistry methods.The Co-op will possess excellent interpersonal skills and a desire to work in a fast paced and collaborative environment.· Opportunity to take part in a global organization with state of art capabilities· Lunch and Learns (Leadership team and other dept members to present topics)· Great Location, 1.2 miles from Campus (few stops on Bus Route 1)· Mentoring to take a more direct, intentional role with each Coop· Quality Conversations (Goals/career track)· Potential to extend to 8 months and part time work· Cross-training (across four groups in Global Biologics)· Poster session/final presentationsPrior experience in the following areas is preferred:-Basic mammalian cell culture techniques in various cell lines (CHO, HEK293, etc.)-Transient transfection techniques using either electroporation or cationic lipids preferably at larger scales (>100ml)-Other basic techniques related to protein biochemistry (ELISA, Octet, SDS-PAGE, protein quantitation {A280, Bradford, BCA}, Western Blot and pH reading).The Coop will be confident, passionate, execution focused, team oriented and will have the ability to motivate others as well as themselves.

Description: Software Engineer Co-opCompany OverviewAt Vicarious Surgical, our mission is to give doctors the tools to provide the highest quality of care to patients around the globe. Our technology combines immersive virtual reality and proprietary human-like robotics, exponentially improving a surgeon's visibility and accuracy. We are a passionate and innovative team looking for motivated self-starters who want to make an impact.Team FocusThe Systems Engineering team sits in the middle of the action. The team is composed of talented engineers across a broad spectrum of disciplines. As new subsystems are designed and built, it is our job to incorporate them into the system as a whole. Playing with, breaking, and debugging robots are a daily occurrence for our team, and we work closely with engineers from every part of the company to design hardware and software solutions, develop tools and procedures, and make the system work more effectively and reliably.Project WorkYou will work as a Software Engineer Co-op within the Systems Engineering team to create a system for logging robot usage and performance data. Both low-level and high-level robot data is valuable to debug and tune current systems and inform future design choices. You will work to develop a system for collecting this data, storing it, analyzing and presenting it in a meaningful way. This will require considerable collaboration with the software, controls and integration teams and a strong knowledge of C and Python. Knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools (such as matplotlib) is a plus. Understand the robot system, usage, and data collection needs Work within the software architecture constraints to collect relevant robot data Create software tools for internal use to analyze and report data collected Link analysis to high-level metrics for evaluating and comparing robots Develop system of reporting findings and usage for specific robots Implement tools for system parameter calibration and performance evaluation Develop tools to visualize and analyze data generated from robots and system simulations

Description: Organization name: ArtSparks FoundationResponsibilities and Duties:Qualifications: Social sciences; Community work; Communications;Required skills/Personal skills:Skills gained by the end of internship:Team work, decision making skills, problem solving skills, adaptability skills and work cultureProgram fees and services offered by Bridge CulturesOnline workshops/webinars:Students learn about the culture and multiple facets and influences on various aspects of life through conversations with people they would meet while in Bangalore. With a remote co-op, Bridge Cultures will enable these conversations virtually. We will organize 3 virtual webinars and workshops on various topics in context to cultural integration which will align with students’ professional and personal growth. Bridge Cultures will bring professionals from various domains and facilitate these interactive sessions.Few topics (not confined to) are listed below:· Social entrepreneurship· Know the city - food, culture, people· Leadership and Teamwork· Unconscious biases· Critical thinking· Influence of culture on design, education, outdoor education, experiential education· Sustainability· Mental health, emotional well-being· Impact of traveling on our personalitySelf-reflection session:Bridge Cultures believes that self-reflection is highly important and necessary to learn and grow, especially after working with a social enterprise on an impactful project. Out of many reasons, reflection is important because it:· Enables the individuals to process and make meaning of the experience· Fosters a better understanding of context. i.e. understanding how their work impacts the community and encourages more participation in future· Creates a sense of accomplishment· Enables the individuals to examine the effects of their behavior, discover ways to improve· Reinforces the feeling of empathy gained during the experience· Acknowledges the skills gained during the experience and builds confidenceProgram fees and processInclusions:· Co-op placement· Necessary documentation· Self-Reflection session· 2-3 online webinars/workshops on various topics· Review meetings during co-op to track progress· Social networkProcess:1. Students apply for various positions through NU works2. Bridge Cultures will send an email to the student to schedule a call3.   After the student’s response to that email, a call will be scheduled between the student, Ms. Aspa Papanastasiou (Associate Director, Global engagements at NU), and Bridge Cultures to ensure accountability from the student’s side4. Another call will be scheduled with Bridge Cultures (if needed) to understand the student’s interest, motivation, and expectations from the co-op5. The student will pay the Program fees to Bridge Cultures ($455)6. Bridge Cultures will facilitate the call between student and the organization7. The organization will communicate their response to Bridge Cultures and the student8. If the student is selected, the organization will share the appointment/offer letter with Bridge Cultures9. Bridge Cultures will share the appointment letter with the student10. The student will start the co-op on the decided dates11. Bridge Cultures will facilitate virtual onboarding if necessary12. Bridge Cultures will facilitate 3 online sessions on various topics and organize 2 review meetings during the co-op13. Bridge Cultures will facilitate self-reflection session at the end of the co-opRefund policy:· If the student is not selected by the first organization interviewed for, Bridge Cultures will find another position with another organization. If the student is not selected there as well, 50% of the program fees will be refunded to the student· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op prior to confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 25% of the program fees (this is to factor the currency transaction charges that incurs to Bridge Cultures)· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op after receiving confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 75% of the program fees

Description: Xilio Therapeutics is a development-stage biotechnology company advancing next-generation cancer immunotherapies designed to improve patient outcomes by unleashing the power of the immune system selectively at the site of the tumor. The company’s tumor-selective immunotherapies are based on its proprietary technology, which maximizes the potency of proven immuno-oncology therapies and restricts their activity to the tumor to minimize peripheral side effects. The broad applicability of these therapies across cancer types means that all patients could benefit from these potentially curative medicines.Xilio was founded in 2016, and closed a $100.5M Series B financing from blue chip venture investors in February 2020. Xilio is headquartered in Waltham, MA.SUMMARY:We are seeking a motivated and curious student to work with a Research Associate Scientist in the Protease Biology Group.RESPONSIBILITIES:· Help prepare conditioned media and OCT blocks from fresh human tumor tissues: dissociation of tissue, culture, collection of culture supernatant and storage· Keep track of inventory of this bank of tissue blocks and conditioned media· Prepare culture media, media buffer solutions and test article aliquots· Keep a record of day to day tasks in a notebookDESIRED MAJORS/MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS + SKILLS· Majors: Biology, Biochemistry· All years welcome to apply· Should have basic understanding of biology· Familiarity with aseptic technique, a plus· Must be detail orientated and organized· Must be able to meet deadlines in a timely manor· Must be able to work well in a cross functional team environment, both independently as well as collaborativelyEEOC Statement: Xilio Therapeutics believes in a diverse environment, and is committed to equal employment opportunity for all its employees and qualified applicants. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. Description: Ceres Accelerator Intern/Co-opOrganizationCeres is a sustainability nonprofit organization leading the most influential investors and companies to build leadership and drive solutions throughout the economy. Through our powerful networks and advocacy, we tackle the world’s biggest sustainability challenges, including climate change, water scarcity and pollution, and human rights abuses. For more information about Ceres, please visit our website (www.ceres.org).For our nation to effectively address climate change, we need to engage federal financial regulators. This is especially important today, as climate-related wildfires rage in the Western States and as our country witnessed new hurricanes on our Southern borders. We appreciate your interest in the growing movement that is elevating climate change to the role of financial regulation -- and exploring the vital role of the Federal Reserve System and other regulators to protect our markets from the systemic risk of climate change.In June, the Ceres Accelerator for Sustainable Capital Markets issued our report, Addressing Climate as a Systemic Risk: A call to action for U.S. financial regulators.This report addresses over 50 recommendations for the Federal Reserve and other federal and state regulators. The recommendations are based on the progress made by central bankers and other prudential regulators around the globe, and each can be enacted right now without new legislation.The Accelerator is seeking an intern/co-op to help us advance this work by conducting independent research and analysis as described below:Desired Background:

Targeted Academic Majors: College of Arts, Media & Design/Music, College of Arts, Media & Design/Communication Studies, College of Professional Studies/Project Management, College of Professional Studies/Nonprofit Management, College of Professional Studies/Global Studies and International Relations, College of Professional Studies/Corporate & Org Communication, College of Social Science & Humanities/Sociology, College of Social Science & Humanities/Public Policy & Administration, College of Social Science & Humanities/Political Science, College of Social Science & Humanities/International Affairs, College of Social Science & Humanities/Human Services, College of Social Science & Humanities/Cultural Anthropology, College of Social Science & Humanities/Africana Studies, D'Amore-McKim School of Business/Marketing, D'Amore-McKim School of Business/Management, D'Amore-McKim School of Business/Business Administration
Workplace Type: Primarily on-site work
Desired Skills: Strong writing skills and fluency in English, An ability to work very independently, A flexible and resourceful approach, A strong desire to learn a great deal!, A passion for the work the Living Music Foundation is doing, Strong Communication skills
Description: ENJOY A TRULY UNIQUE WORK EXPERIENCE AS A CHARITY DEVELOPMENT INTERN IN UGANDA!You’ll be part of a nonprofit organization that teaches music lessons to kids who wouldn’t be able to afford musical instruments. The charity thoroughly believes that through music lessons, kids learn valuable life lessons, and gain a huge amount of motivation and inspiration.As an intern, you’ll help with the overall development of this nonprofit initiative. This will involve exploring a variety of fundraising opportunities, helping design and implement a communications strategy, and putting systems in place for monitoring and evaluation. It’s a hugely varied and rewarding work experience. You’ll be guided by a digital marketing and fundraising expert based in South Africa, who will check in with you regularly.Not unimportantly, you’ll get to live in Uganda; a stunning and welcoming country that offers a wealth of travel opportunities.To qualify for this internship in Uganda, you’ll need to have a self-starter and flexible attitude, a passion for nonprofit work, and an ability to take on a great variety of tasks.Your TasksAs an intern, you’ll help to raise the profile of the Living Music Foundation in a number of ways. Your tasks will include;Good to knowThe Living Music Foundation, founded in 2017, is an NGO based in Mbarara, Uganda. Their passion is music, and having seen the transformative impact that the performing arts can have on children in developing countries (and around the world), they have devoted their work to sharing this gift. The founders of the Living Music Foundation believe that exposure to music can provide children with many positive life skills, including commitment and discipline. It also builds character and helps develop self-esteem.Their main goal is to provide music lessons for children who are economically or socially challenged. By offering music lessons free of charge, they provide an outlet for kids who are lacking family or community support. The lessons take place either in their Mbarara centre as well as in the home communities of the children. Music is meant to be shared, and once the children develop their skills, they are able to share their talent with their communities, creating a happy and uplifting atmosphere for everyone.

Description: Company ProfileWe are an exciting, revolutionary chem-tech start-up that has altered the smart textile technology. Our initial product is conductive/heated garments. Traditional smart textile/garments uses metallic wires or carbon prints to achieve conductivity in fabric. As these components are externally attached or integrated into the fabric structure, it renders the resulting garment bulky, inflexible and prone to wear and tear. Invented at UMass, Amherst, our patented and scalable vapor deposition application converts widely available commodity fabric into active joules heater by depositing layers of conductive coating without altering the feel or form of the fabric. "Your clothes need to feel comfortable before they are smart" is our goal in transforming the smart garment industry.What You'll Do:- Help with grant writing as and when possible- Attend management meetings and provide suggestions for operational excellence and continuous improvement.This position can be done part time or full time depending on the candidate's needs.

Proven experience as a marketing specialist or similar role Thorough understanding of marketing elements (including traditional and digital marketing such as SEO/Social media etc.) and market research methods Demonstrable experience in marketing data analytics and tools  Proven graphic designing experience A strong portfolio of illustrations or other graphics Familiarity with design software and technologies (such as InDesign, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, Photoshop) A keen eye for aesthetics and detailsSkills gained by the end of the internship:· Teamwork· Problem Solving Skills· Work Ethics· Adaptability Skills· Communication Skills· Responsibility· Time ManagementAbout the company:Hasiru Dala Innovations Private Limited is a for-benefit, not-for-loss social enterprise that is focused on creating better livelihoods for wastepickers through inclusive businesses that have an environmental impact. Our current services include Total Waste Management for the responsible bulk waste generator, Event Waste Management for the eco-friendly event host and Home Composters for the progressive householder. We are currently a BBMP (Bangalore’s municipal corporation) empanelled service provider for Bulk Waste Generators in Bangalore.In partnership with our sister organization Hasiru Dala, the non-profit focused on social justice and policy advocacy for waste pickers and solid waste management, Hasiru Dala Innovations is in a unique position to bring in the best practices for solid waste managementPrograms and services offered by Bridge CulturesOnline workshops/webinars:Students learn about the culture and multiple facets and influences on various aspects of life through conversations with people they would meet while in Bangalore. With a remote co-op, Bridge Cultures will enable these conversations virtually. We will organize 3 virtual webinars and workshops on various topics in context to cultural integration which will align with students’ professional and personal growth. Bridge Cultures will bring professionals from various domains and facilitate these interactive sessions.Few topics (not confined to) are listed below:· Social entrepreneurship· Know the city - food, culture, people· Leadership and Teamwork· Unconscious biases· Critical thinking· Influence of culture on design, education, outdoor education, experiential education· Sustainability· Mental health, emotional well-being· Impact of traveling on our personalitySelf-reflection session:Bridge Cultures believes that self-reflection is highly important and necessary to learn and grow, especially after working with a social enterprise on an impactful project. Out of many reasons, reflection is important because it:· Enables the individuals to process and make meaning of the experience· Fosters a better understanding of context. i.e. understanding how their work impacts the community and encourages more participation in future· Creates a sense of accomplishment· Enables the individuals to examine the effects of their behavior, discover ways to improve· Reinforces the feeling of empathy gained during the experience· Acknowledges the skills gained during the experience and builds confidenceFees and process:Inclusions:· Co-op placement· Necessary documentation· Self-Reflection session· 2-3 online webinars/workshops on various topics· Review meetings during co-op to track progress· Social networkProcess:1. Students apply for various positions through NU works2. Bridge Cultures will send an email to the student to schedule a call3.   After the student’s response to that email, a call will be scheduled between the student, Ms. Aspa Papanastasiou (Associate Director, Global engagements at NU), and Bridge Cultures to ensure accountability from the student’s side4. Another call will be scheduled with Bridge Cultures (if needed) to understand the student’s interest, motivation, and expectations from the co-op5. The student will pay the Program fees to Bridge Cultures ($455)6. Bridge Cultures will facilitate the call between student and the organization7. The organization will communicate their response to Bridge Cultures and the student8. If the student is selected, the organization will share the appointment/offer letter with Bridge Cultures9. Bridge Cultures will share the appointment letter with the student10. The student will start the co-op on the decided dates11. Bridge Cultures will facilitate virtual onboarding if necessary12. Bridge Cultures will facilitate 3 online sessions on various topics and organize 2 review meetings during the co-op13. Bridge Cultures will facilitate self-reflection session at the end of the co-opRefund policy:· If the student is not selected by the first organization interviewed for, Bridge Cultures will find another position with another organization. If the student is not selected there as well, 50% of the program fees will be refunded to the student· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op prior to confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 25% of the program fees (this is to factor the currency transaction charges that incurs to Bridge Cultures)· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op after receiving confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 75% of the program fees

Description: (REMOTE)Who isServiceNow?Imagine your workday dominated less by emails and spreadsheets and more time given back to you to do your actual job. Description: Office OverviewCome work for Attorney General Maura Healey and make a difference! Are you looking for more than just a great learning experience? At the Attorney General’s Office, you will be part of “The People’s Law Firm”. Whether working directly with our residents, or supporting our talented and dedicated staff, your work here will contribute to a higher mission of serving the public and making a difference in the lives of others.The Attorney General’s Office is the largest public sector legal office in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. Attorney General Maura Healey is the chief lawyer and law enforcement officer of the Commonwealth. Her office serves as an advocate and resource for the Commonwealth, its residents, and businesses in many areas, including protecting consumers, combating fraud and corruption, protecting civil rights, and promoting meaningful economic stability. The Attorney General's Office is organized into six bureaus. The divisions and teams within each bureau have distinct missions and work closely together to ensure the Attorney General’s Office provides the highest level of public protection. We invite you to explore the work of our office at www.mass.gov/agoWork CultureThe Attorney General’s Office is a professional, collaborative work environment. Our dedicated employees work together with a shared commitment to serving the interests of the Commonwealth. Students have shared these comments about the Office:· “A kind and welcoming atmosphere.”· “The positive energy was very infectious, and it made me strive to work harder as well.”· “The most professional yet fun office I’ve yet to work in.”The Office supports and appreciates the diverse perspectives and backgrounds of our employees and strives to provide a welcoming and inclusive workplace environment for all. We offer a variety of co-op positions, and our co-op students are an integral part of the Office.Position DescriptionAttorney General Maura Healey is looking for a highly-motivated person to join the Press Division as a Digital Media Assistant. The Digital Media Assistant will work with the Digital Director, Communications Director, Press Secretary, and Deputy Press Secretaries to deliver information from the Attorney General’s Office to the public.The Digital Media Assistant is responsible for:· Assisting in video production, including concepting videos, filming, and editing;· Designing social media graphics, flyers, and other materials;· Drafting social media posts and web pages;· Taking photos at public events, editing photos, and managing a photo catalog;· Assisting in developing social media strategy;· Assisting with analyzing social media performance;· Compiling a weekly newsletter;· Assisting the press team in their duties, including researching journalists and tracking topics and trends in the news.Please review posts and media on the Attorney General’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram to gain an understanding of the kind of content the Digital Media Assistant will produce.www.facebook.com/massattorneygeneralwww.twitter.com/massagowww.instagram.com/mass_agoDesired QualificationsProficiency in Adobe Premiere and video production required. Proficiency in Adobe Indesign, After Effects, and/or Photoshop preferred, but on-the-job training will be available, particularly in InDesign. Interest in social justice, journalism, public service, or government preferred. Applicants who lack some of the aforementioned skills but with an interest in our office’s mission will have training opportunities and are still encouraged to apply.Strong interpersonal and organizational skills and attention to detail. Strong writing skills.Students with filming, video editing, and motion graphics experience are strongly encouraged to apply and students with previous co-op experience are preferred.Professional and presentable office attire is required.Learning and Professional Take-AwaysStudents will develop key technical and organizational skills, as well as gain an inside look at the communications strategy of a statewide elected official.You can expect to leave this co-op with:· Extensive training in the Adobe Creative Suite;· Experience with livestreaming major news announcements;· A portfolio of professional social media videos and graphics;· Experience creating media on short schedules;· An understanding of how a communications team that supports the Attorney General develops proactive strategy and responds to major news and events;· Exposure to the inner workings of a major government office operating at the forefront of state and national issues.Location and AmenitiesLocation and convenience! We are centrally located at One Ashburton Place on Beacon Hill; close to the State House, Boston Common, and Faneuil Hall. We are easily accessible by public transportation, and accessible to the many cultural and social activities offered in the city. Enjoy the convenience of Metro Café, a cafeteria offering a wide variety of affordable food options, located on-site at One Ashburton Place.DURING COVID: The Office has not yet determined work arrangements for the spring, but co-op positions will likely be remote for some or all of the upcoming six-month co-op period. Some in-office work may be required and will be discussed at time of interview.Pay and Work HoursThis position is full-time and pays $14/hour. This is a non-benefitted position with paid earned sick time. The expected work hours are 9:00 to 5:00 with a half hour lunch (37.5 hours per week).Former Co-ops have this to say about their experience:My co-op at the AGO was a dream! As Digital Assistant, I worked closely with the Digital Director and Press Team to create videos and other content for the AGO’s social media channels. It was a hands-on learning experience in an exciting environment with a passionate team and I’d highly recommend it to anyone interested in video, digital, or social media work! It definitely confirmed my plans to work in social video post-graduation.The Attorney General’s Office is an Equal Opportunity Employer. As the representative of the Commonwealth and its residents, the Attorney General’s Office strives to ensure that those working in our office reflect the diversity of the communities we serve. The Office encourages applicants from a broad spectrum of backgrounds to apply for positions.

Description: Join a dynamic team of researchers developing first-of-its kind prototypes with a focus on the aerospace and automotive industries. We seek to provide a significant role for each COOP as part of an accelerated design-build-test development program that leverages our expertise in nonlinear dynamics, multiferroics, and multi-functional materials for vibration isolation, sensing and communication. Experience in a university research lab, national lab, or similar organization is also desirable.We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. Description: Dr. Zimmerman’s research examines the link between early sucking/feeding behaviors and subsequent neurodevelopment through an array of objective, customized sensors and technologies. She studies the environmental, maternal, physiological, and genetic influences of these behaviors across patient populations and cultures. Further, Dr. Zimmerman is particularly interested in maternal exposures to chemical exposure during pregnancy and child development.Puerto Rican children are exposed to an array of environmental exposures that place them at a heightened risk for neurodevelopmental delays. Our centers use a variety of standardized and non-standardized tests to examine the relation between environmental exposures and child health and development. This research opportunity will allow for a deeper dive into some of these relationships through literature reviews and data analyses to help answer some of the important research questions stemming from a variety of our NIH-funded projects. Experience with Microsoft word and excel is required.To apply: Please submit a resume and a short cover letter addressing the following questions:1. ROUTES is an NIH-funded program designed to support students from underrepresented backgrounds in environmental health research. How does the diversity of your experiences and background inform your work or eligibility for ROUTES?2. How do you see yourself applying your undergraduate training and experiences as a ROUTES Scholar after graduation (i.e. careers in research, education, government, industry, non-profit)?ROUTES: https://web.northeastern.edu/routes/Speech & Neurodevelopment Lab: https://snl.sites.northeastern.edu/

Description: We are looking for a key contributor to our marketing communications strategy to create and facilitate programs that build thought leadership and buzz in the U.S. (and EMEA). As an emerging company, you will have an important role in executing and supporting our analyst relations, public relations and internal communications programs. You work well as a team member, but also independently and look for opportunities to own or grow projects that deliver results. You have an interest in the technology industry, are passionate about marketing, and have a willingness to learn.

Description: Fidelity Investments is looking for motivated students to spend their next co-op with us. This 6 month experience will offer the opportunity to work with business leaders, participate in new innovation projects, and learn about Fidelity Center of Applied Technology (“FCAT”). FCAT is a centralized function whose mandate is to catalyze innovation across the firm. FCAT teams prototype and pilot new businesses and capabilities that continue to distinguish our brand as the best customer experience in the financial services industry. We are looking for individuals who are passionate for creating products and services that make lives better and are action-oriented, collaborative, and disciplined self-starters. Candidates must thrive in a fast-paced, highly ambiguous environment working with emerging technologies, with high-risks and uncertainty.The Background We’re Looking ForWorking toward a Bachelor’s Degree or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Physics or other related fieldThe Skills You Bringo web-based technologies like HTML, JavaScript & CSS, Jasono JavaScript frameworks like Angular, Bootstrap, jQuery, etc.o Java, PHP or .NETo Object Oriented familiarityo software design patterns such as MVCo Native Applications / Mobile Web development for devices like phones & tablets (a plus)o relational database & server side development (a plus)The Purpose of Your RoleAs a key role on our incubator team, you will leverage multiple methodologies during your Co-Op such as Lean Start Up, Design Thinking and Agile, to rapidly move ideas through the scan/try to proof of concept phase. Some of the technologies that our teams focus on include Blockchain, Cryptocurrency, VR/AR, AI and data science technologies. We will explore how we can disrupt our current businesses, and provide new opportunities to create visionary products and services with these emerging technologies and human­centered design to create visionary products and services that improve people’s financial lives. As the innovation engine for Fidelity Investments, you will be part of an exciting group that provides expertise to the rest of the firm on new tools and techniques, while also incubating potential new applications of emerging technology.The Value You DeliverThe Fidelity Center of Applied Technology (FCAT) Co-op Program is designed to begin to build the technical and analytical skills needed for a successful career with Fidelity FCAT. Co-ops have the opportunity to add value to the organization and learn about Fidelity’s businesses in an environment supported by state-of-the-art technology.Company OverviewAt Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in creating and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to our associates.
