Description: Prof. Jones researches transport related stress impacts on bacteria growth and development over long time scales and examining how new technology, like antibiofouling coatings, can impact environmental justice outcomes. This is done using confocal microscopy, energy balances, and proteomics to understand multispecies biofilm growth under controlled stress conditions. Engineering work is informed by stakeholder engagement with doctors, water and wastewater engineers, and manufacturers. Impacts of technological artifacts are analyzed using the Institutional Analysis and Development framework to weigh costs and benefits.The student will perform simple modeling of transport in a porous electrode and flow cell in addition to Nernst equilibrium. The student will then perform electrolysis in a three-electrode cell with carbon cloth. The student will manufacture PDMS devices in Northeastern’s cleanroom. The student will integrate and test those devices and he/she will later produce the devices using laser cutting and finally, they will assemble the devices.To apply: Please submit a resume and a short cover letter addressing the following questions:1. ROUTES is an NIH-funded program designed to support students from underrepresented backgrounds in environmental health research. How does the diversity of your experiences and background inform your work or eligibility for ROUTES?2. How do you see yourself applying your undergraduate training and experiences as a ROUTES Scholar after graduation (i.e. careers in research, education, government, industry, non-profit)?ROUTES: https://web.northeastern.edu/routes/

A strong work ethic and desire to learn is also required.Primary Responsibilities:· Manage the trouble ticket queue for all network related incident tickets from end users, including break/fix tickets, 'how-to' questions/end user training and helping other IT teams who interface with ours. Tickets requiring more advanced knowledge should be escalated to the appropriate senior engineer.· Configure a network lab to learn and gain hands on experience with routing and switching technologies, including technical features such as spanning tree, VLANs, dynamic and static routing.· Assist or manage and execute special projects under guidance and direction of senior engineers.· Assist with installation and maintenance of routers and switches in various network configurations supporting VLANs, QOS, VoIP, and advanced access control.· Manage IP Addresses and DNS records through the Infoblox Grid system.· Write technical documentation for end users and team members and publish to internal web sites as needed. Manage the content and appearance of the team's internal website.· Assist in managing the day-to-day operations of network monitoring systems.· Assist other teams within the IT Infrastructure department if time allows, which could include server, email, security and PC technologies.· Attend IT and business related training courses provided by the company, including ITIL Certification, Mutual Fund Industry Overview Training.Job Requirements:Co-op/Internship Program Description:Along with providing a meaningful learning opportunity to students through their internships, Eaton Vance offers interns the opportunity to network and become immersed in our culture through our Lunch and Learn Series and Community Outreach.Our Lunch and Learn series provides interns the opportunity to listen to presentations led by seasoned professionals in different areas of the firm, who share their insights and expertise. Description: CompanyMesodyne is a startup company commercializing a breakthrough technology initially developed at MIT. Mesodyne’s Light-Cell is a new class of power generator that provides efficient, silent, reliable, long-endurance power from any fuel and enables a 10X improvement in run time for UAVs, robots, wearables, and more. Mesodyne is developing products for the industrial, scientific, and defense sectors. Dr. Veronika Stelmakh, CEO and Dr. Walker Chan, CTO have been leading the company since they founded it in 2018. Based in Somerville MA, the company currently has 5 employees and you will be joining a growing, dynamic, and motivated team.Our engineering team has a strong maker/hacker culture: from blowing glass and forging knives to creating model airplanes, launching rockets, and restoring vintage analog synthesizers - we love building things and are excited to bring a new technology to the market that has the potential to revolutionize small power generation. We would love to talk to you.The initial duration of this opportunity is 6 months, and subject to the further extension of additional months based on project needs and the candidate performance.

Description: Radix is a software start-up, building a system that would significantly change how biologists and scientists in Biotech and Pharma companies go about doing research and production. Radix brings to biology a framework and a set of tools much like the tools for CAD/CAM/CAE or VLSI Design. https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-019-02875-zCurrently, research process in the labs of pharma and bio-tech is very labor intensive. It doesn’t have to be this way. Our technology is a compiler and operating system for biology labs. We create a next generation visual programming language and optimizing compiler that takes biotech procedures and compiles them to instructions that can be executed in a physical biology lab. Biologists describe their protocol in our front end language and our compiler and run-time system realize this in their physical lab. We hope to accelerate biotech innovation like early compilers did for computing by enabling lab protocols to seamlessly operate and be optimized across physical labs. We have funding from some pretty cool people (YCombinator, Firstminute Capital, MIT's The Engine, and Nikesh Arora) and have multiple pilots in academic research labs and commercial biotech corporations, and this number is growing. Before COVID-19 we were based out of The Engine in Central Square in Cambridge, MA within sight of the Red Line MBTA stop, but are presently working from home.This paid position will report directly to our COO. He’s a tech start-up veteran with previous successful exit. You will perform market research to build up a list of potential customers in the various market segments. You will work closely with the COO & CEO to build out specific value proposition and supporting presentation for these potential customers. You will identify specific individuals in these segments to present the value proposition of Radix. You will also participate in sales and other customer meetings to help present the value of Radix’s software offering and help customers identify key cost savings and operations benefits of incorporating Radix’s software. You will develop powerful customer communication tools to help potential customers and investors see the power of the Radix software.This is a technical position. You will speak tech with our customers every day and advocate for their needs. You’ll also get to do a decently deep technical software dive so you really understand how our software works and can explain it to prospects.Key Skills:Nice to have:Radix is a exciting work environment. We care about each other. We’re also LGBTQ+, polyamoroy, kink, gender, minority, and most other things supporting. We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Description: About Massachusetts General HospitalFounded in 1811, Mass General is the third oldest general hospital in the United States and the original and largest teaching hospital of Harvard Medical School, where nearly all our staff physicians serve on the faculty. We remain committed to the simple vow of service that our founders made in a letter seeking community support for Mass General's creation: "When in distress, every man becomes our neighbor." More than two centuries later, that promise sustains our commitment to deliver the most advanced and compassionate care to patients and their families.One of the world's top academic medical centers and home to the largest hospital-based research program in the United States, we continue to push the boundaries of what is possible in medicine. As we strive to make a difference today in the health of communities locally and around the world, we also prepare for the future by educating the next generation of healthcare providers and researchers.The Development OfficeThe Development Office is a vibrant and collaborative team focused on advancing the hospital's mission of healthcare excellence. Thanks to our dedicated volunteers and the generosity of our donors and employees, Mass General Hospital consistently raises over $300M annually and its most recent fundraising capital campaign surpassed its $1.5B goal a year ahead of schedule. Beyond these numbers is the major impact in the life of our institution. At Mass General, everything we do is motivated by our mission of excellence in patient care, research, education and community service. Specific responsibilities for these events and other virtual events may include:General Admin Support as assigned by supervisor:In addition to the skills and experiences described above, the DevelopmentCo-opwill have the opportunity to meetvirtually with members of their Development Team and others in the Development Office to learn about different career paths and areas within Development. They will also be able to attend any virtual internal training sessions or special seminars offered by the Mass General and Mass General Brigham Development Offices.During my time at Mass General Hospital, I developed valuable professional skills in a fast-paced, intellectually stimulating, and constantly evolving environment. I was able to experience the dynamics of a corporate office while participating in fulfilling day-to-day tasks and interacting with colleagues of different specialties. The special events team works closely with various other teams and departments both in the Development office and throughout the hospital itself to help foster a strong donor community and show appreciation for the donors, physicians, patients, faculty, and community members that allow MGH to be a leader in national healthcare.My role consisted of a lot of organizational upkeep including managing spreadsheets, maintaining continuity between manual trackers and the automated bookkeeping system (Raiser’s Edge), vendor interaction for specific events, and planning and attending various events to ensure they run smoothly. Overall, I enjoyed my time at Mass General and would highly recommend this fun, challenging, and unique, position to anyone looking to further their professional skills in a creative and fast-paced environment.- Carly, Northeastern University class of 2018

Description: About the Organization:The MSPCA-Angell is a national and international leader in animal protection and veterinary medicine and provides direct hands-on care for thousands of animals each year. Founded in 1868, we are the second-oldest humane society in the United States. Our services include animal protection and adoption, advocacy, humane education, law enforcement, and world-class veterinary care.The MSPCA-Angell is a private, nonprofit organization. We do not receive any government funding nor are we funded or operated by any national humane organization. The MSPCA-Angell relies solely on the support and contributions of individuals who care about animals.The mission of the MSPCA-Angell is to protect animals, relieve their suffering, advance their health and welfare, prevent cruelty, and work for a just and compassionate society.About the MSPCA Advocacy Department:The Advocacy Department of the MSPCA educates the public about issues impacting animals, works for better animal-protection laws nationally and statewide and helps individuals and communities co-exist with animals. We are seeking an enthusiastic student to work with us on a wide variety of animal protection issues.About the MSPCA Community Outreach Team:At the core of our Community Outreach programs is the belief that families and pets belong together.While our adoption programs work tobringpeople and pets together, our Community Outreach programs work tokeepfamilies and pets together.We strive to achieve this goal by offering affordable and accessible animal care resources to families in underserved communities.About the Position:This is a part-time, dual co-op, where 50% of the time will be spent with the Advocacy Department and the other 50% of the time will be spent with the Community Outreach team. We are looking for someone who can work 20 hours a week, from January 2021 until June 2021. This position provides a $1,250 stipend.The community outreach portion of this co-op requires in-person work. Therefore the applicant must be based in Boston, or a commutable distance from MSPCA-Angell.We are close to Northeastern’s main campus and accessible by the Route 39 bus and the Green Line (Heath St).Responsibilities:The Advocacy portion of this role would involve research, writing testimony, organizing events and meetings to help pass animal protection legislation, responding to questions via email and phone, drafting email alerts and articles for publication, managing databases and organizing information in other formats, and helping provide support to the department with the goal of helping better protect animal in Massachusetts.The Community Outreach portion of this role involves meeting member of the community and connecting them with access to pet food, supplies, veterinary care,and other resources. This is done through door-to-door interactions, delivering supplies and donations to food pantries, participating in vaccine clinics, and much more.Job Requirements:Please include a writing sample with this application.

Description: The Sustainable investment initiative is part of our global investment platform and is led by the former head of our Global Multi-Asset Strategies team. The focus of Sustainable Investment is to research and incorporate into our investment decisions the impact of non-traditional financial issues, such as climate change, human rights and stakeholder management. As asset managers we invest in the world we live in. This means fully understanding and cultivating the long-term sustainability of a potential investment. In the long run, we believe that investments that foster a sustainable financial system will also be poised to benefit from it.This role will be focused on supporting this initiative and will involve working closely with the Sustainable Investment Policy Manager, the ESG Research team, and other equity, fixed income, and multi-asset investors focused on engagement and sustainability.· Research projects will include understanding the sustainable investment issues most pressing to our clients and third party assessors and, supporting the analysis of material environmental, social, and governance issues in portfolio companies, gathering relevant data in advance of specific engagements with companies, and analyzing results of our voting and engagement efforts on these issues· Additional projects may include conducting analysis to support the business strategy for sustainable investment, assistance with portfolio-specific analysis, and support of the development of internal trainings for investment teams on ESG issues relevant to portfolio management.· Ability to work independently and with a team· Analytical skill and capital markets knowledge· Curiosity, ingenuity, and research skills· Effective verbal and written communication skills· Course work/interest in the area of sustainable investment (impact, climate, diversity, long termism)

We are looking for people who can excel, add value to our mission, and thrive in a demanding start-up environment.

Description: Marketing Co-op at Innovation StudioCalling all Intrapreneurs!​ So, what does that mean, exactly? Do you love startups and innovation in general? Are you outgoing, love working with the public and have exceptional organizational skills? Are you looking to deepen your knowledge of entrepreneurship and become part of the larger entrepreneurial ecosystem here in Boston? ​Then this opportunity is for YOU! We are a dynamic, innovative and fun non-profit startup working at the intersection of entrepreneurship and innovation!Innovation Studio is looking for a passionate “intrapreneur” co-op to join our Programming and Marketing team. At Innovation Studio, we believe Innovation is for Everyone! Our mission is to democratize innovation by cultivating relationships and providing resources for anyone to successfully launch and grow a business. We envision a world in which anyone can be an innovator.The Co-op will help us in our marketing of live and virtual entrepreneur programs including Pitch Nights, Accelerators, Mentor Program and Business Workshops. The programming and marketing team is responsible for creating and launching new and innovative programs to help accelerate the business ideas of our innovative community. You will work in a way that is not “business as usual,” challenging yourself and each other, using entrepreneurial skills and an experimental mindset. This will be a test and learn environment, with rapid experimentation.We are seeking someone who is highly collaborative and passionate about role modeling an entrepreneurial mindset and approach.Expertise is preferred in one of the the following areas: Intrapreneur Mindset​ – An in-house entrepreneur with an “entrepreneurial spirit.” You are driven by the desire to create new services and products, develop original ideas, think beyond what’s already been done, and are always looking to provide valuable solutions to common problems. You’re personally invested in achieving a successful outcome. Flexibility + Adaptability, this is a fast-paced, constantly changing workplace!Key Accountabilities:This role will be a full-time hybrid (remote + in-person) role during the weekdays (M-F) between 9 am and 5 pm. Occasionally there will be some weeknights required to cover programming, with dates provided​ in advance​. We are committed to working with student schedules at all times. If work is done outside the hours, there is an opportunity to collect comp time to use at your discretion for time-off during your Co-op. In-person location will report to District Hall in the Seaport and/or Roxbury Innovation Center in Roxbury. Hybrid will require 2-3 days in person and 2-3 days at remote.For more information, visit: ​www.innovationstudio.org Watch us in action here: ​https://tinyurl.com/y4dumndv.

Description: Metro East Medical Reserve Corps (MRC) Co-op31 hours per week – Grant FundedSalary: $15/hourDefinition:Arlington Health Department, serving as the host agency for the Metro East Medical Reserve Corps (MRC) Unit, seeks a Co-op to assist in the development and maintenance a robust Medical Reserve Corps made up of volunteers representing the 28 communities included in Public Health Region 4B, in accordance with MDPH MRC deliverables and federal MRC best practices.The co-op’s work is focused:Supervision:Works under the general direction of the Metro East Medical Reserve Corps Coordinator.Work Environment:Work is performed both indoors under typical office conditions and in the field. The employee may be required to work outside of normal business hours at night and on weekends to run meetings, attend trainings, and host recruitment events. Frequent travel to communities in and around Region 4b is required.The employee operates standard office equipment and an automobile.The employee has regular contact with local, state and federal agencies as well as the general public and volunteers. Contacts are in person, by telephone, teleconference, in writing and by e-mail.The employee has access to confidential volunteer information.Errors could result in delay or loss of service, poor public relations, loss of funding and grant opportunities.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:The essential functions or duties listed below are separated into two main areas: Regional and Unit based activities. These functions/duties are intended only as an illustration of the various types of work that may be performed. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related, or a logical assignment to the position.Regional DutiesUnit DutiesRecommended Minimum Qualifications:Education and ExperienceCandidates should be working towards or already have a Bachelor’s Degree or Master’s Degree in one of the following fields, or related field: public health, health-related social services, emergency management, nursing, public safety. Experience with public health or emergency preparedness desired.Additional RequirementsAbility to obtain certification in ICS 100, 200 and NIMS 700 within 1 month of employmentAbility to pass CORI and VSOS background checksValid motor vehicle operator’s licenseKnowledge, Ability, and SkillsKnowledge about the Medical Reserve Corps programs at the local, state, regional and national levels. General knowledge of public health emergency preparedness cooperative agreement and public health preparedness and response capabilities preferred. General knowledge of local public health in Massachusetts desired.Ability to effectively communicate well with others during stressful and emergency situations.Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills. Public speaking skills. Planning and organizational skills. Computer skills including Word and Excel.Physical RequirementsMinimal physical effort is required to perform duties under typical office conditions. Moderate physical effort is required when conducting recruitment and training activities/events. The employee is frequently required to stand, walk, sit, speak and hear, and use hands to operate equipment, and run meetings, events and functions. The employee may be required to lift and/or move materials weighing up to 50 pounds. Vision requirements include the ability to read routine documents, fine print, computer screen and operate a motor vehicle.

You will need to be competent in your craft and malleable enough to deliver within the context of dynamic and fluid nature of start-up work culture.Skills gained by the end of co-op:Regenerative design, ecosystem design, project design, social forestry, regenerative technology knowledge, deep research, content creation, design thinking, systems thinking, data sensemaking.Start Date and Duration:Jan-June 2021(We are ready whenever you are! Preferable min period of 6 months. We can consider 3 months as well).We are pre-1st raise at this moment. Should we raise funds during the span of your internship we would love to take better care of you.We care about the quality of work and whether you have fun doing it. We never count the hours. Enjoy and complete your work in 20 hours or in 50 hours a week, it’s up to you.About the company:Online workshops/webinarsStudents learn about the culture and multiple facets and influences on various aspects of life through conversations with people they would meet while in Bangalore. After the student’s response to that email, a call will be scheduled between the student, Ms. Aspa Papanastasiou (Associate Director, Global engagements at NU), and Bridge Cultures to ensure accountability from the student’s side4. Description: We are looking for Data Scientist co-ops to #JoinTheBand and help drive a data-first culture across Spotify. Our Data Scientist mission is to turn terabytes of data into insights and get a deep understanding of music and listeners so we can impact the strategy and direction of Spotify. You will study user behavior, strategic initiatives, markets, content, and new features and bring data and insights into every decision we make. Above all, your work will impact the way the world experiences audio.What you'll doWho you areThe Co-Op experienceThis is your chance to help craft the way the world listens, learn more about what we do, how we do it - and why that matters. We’re looking for enthusiastic current students with a passion for audio experiences and an ambition to go far. This isn't just any co-op, you’ll make an impact and play a real part in the success of Spotify, All over one unforgettable spring semester!If that’s you, tell us who you are, what you care about, and where you want to go.Our paid co-op last for 6 months and starts at the beginning of January.You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be brilliant. So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It's in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.

Position: Co-op: Research Assistant, Islet Cell Therapy
Targeted Academic Majors: Bouve College of Health Sciences, College of Science
Workplace Type: On-site work is preferred when public health concerns allow
Description: Sigilon Therapeutics is searching for an energized and highly motivated candidate to be part of a team focused on developing a novel therapeutic product for diabetes utilizing Sigilon’s Afibromer™ technology combined with leading edge pancreatic islet cell technology.Sigilon Therapeutics is a biopharmaceutical company creating functional cures for chronic diseases using Shielded Living Therapeutics. The Shielded Living Therapeutics product platform consists of novel engineered human cells that are encased in a proprietary immune-shielding matrix and placed in the body. These Shielded Living Therapeutics then produce therapeutic proteins in a programmable and durable fashion, without generating fibrosis or immune rejection. Our pipeline of products in hemophilia, lysosomal storage diseases, and, in collaboration with Eli Lilly, type 1 diabetes, are rapidly advancing toward the clinic. Sigilon was founded and created by Flagship Pioneering in conjunction with Daniel Anderson, Ph.D., and Robert Langer, Sc.D., of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.This position provides an outstanding training opportunity to work closely with scientists. The Research Assistant will be given their own project or set of tasks and receive close guidance and mentorship from a Scientist-level supervisor and a Project Manager.Exemplary Duties and Activities:· Tissue culture of pluripotent stem cells and differentiated cellular aggregates· Comply with standard laboratory practices and company policiesWho are we looking for?· An enthusiastic and dedicated student that is interested in regenerative medicine and creating novel treatments· Laboratory skills in molecular biology, cell biology or related sciences are preferredWhat are we looking for?· Leading the way:A creative and dedicated scientist· Working together:A colleague to thrive on collaboration with our scientific teammates· Loving what you do:A team member with positive energy that is passionate about our missionWhat are we offering?· Exposure to pioneering science and the opportunity to help create therapeutics that will benefit Type I Diabetes patients· Unique opportunity to develop skills and deliver important experimental results at a small company· Manager & co-workers who are proven mentors and coaches· Membership within a growing, dynamic and collegial organizationIslet Cell Therapy Co-opA co-op student in the Islet Cell Therapy group would have the opportunity to learn cell and molecular biology techniques, including stem cell culture, qPCR, flow cytometry, ELISA, and others. Additionally, the co-op student would be involved in the encapsulation process for the differentiated cellular aggregates and benchtop and in vivo functional assessments. The candidate will be an integral member of a small research team and will receive close guidance and mentorship from a senior scientist level supervisor and a project manager. The individual will be given their own project and set of tasks within a project and be an integral contributor. Projects will be designed based on (1) the current progress and challenges to the research program, and (2) the capabilities of the individual.

Description: Office OverviewCome work for Attorney General Maura Healey and make a difference! Are you looking for more than just a great learning experience? At the Attorney General’s Office, you will be part of “The People’s Law Firm”. Whether working directly with our residents, or supporting our talented and dedicated staff, your work here will contribute to a higher mission of serving the public and making a difference in the lives of others.The Attorney General’s Office is the largest public sector legal office in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. Attorney General Maura Healey is the chief lawyer and law enforcement officer of the Commonwealth. Her office serves as an advocate and resource for the Commonwealth, its residents, and businesses in many areas, including protecting consumers, combating fraud and corruption, protecting civil rights, and promoting meaningful economic stability. The Attorney General's Office is organized into six bureaus. The divisions and teams within each bureau have distinct missions and work closely together to ensure the Attorney General’s Office provides the highest level of public protection. We invite you to explore the work of our office at www.mass.gov/agoWork CultureThe Attorney General’s Office is a professional, collaborative work environment. Our dedicated employees work together with a shared commitment to serving the interests of the Commonwealth. Students have shared these comments about the Office:· “A kind and welcoming atmosphere.”· “The positive energy was very infectious, and it made me strive to work harder as well.”· “The most professional yet fun office I’ve yet to work in.”The Office supports and appreciates the diverse perspectives and backgrounds of our employees and strives to provide a welcoming and inclusive workplace environment for all. We offer a variety of co-op positions, and our co-op students are an integral part of the Office.Position DescriptionThe Criminal Bureau co-op position offers students a broad experience working on teams with all of the bureau divisions: Appeals; Enterprise, Major & Cyber Crimes; Financial Investigations; Gaming Enforcement; Human Trafficking; Insurance & Unemployment Fraud Unit; and White Collar & Public Integrity as well as the Environmental Crimes Strike Force. The co-op student assists the attorneys, financial investigators, paralegals, support staff and state police assigned to the bureau. Responsibilities will include:· Analyzing video surveillance;· Transcribing police and witness interviews and jail calls;· Researching legal issues and summarizing research;· Analyzing evidence and creating spreadsheets from complicated investigative data such as bank and other financial records;· Creating charts and PowerPoint exhibits for grand jury and trial;· Scanning and copying evidence.Students will also assist the bureau with administrative tasks, covering the reception desk, screening and directing phone calls and visitors, and other tasks as needed. Co-op students are also encouraged to observe arguments, hearings and trials in the Appeals, District, Superior, Federal and Supreme Judicial Courts, and attend bureau and office-wide educational programs, moots and trainings.Desired Qualifications· Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, Powerpoint;· Ability to work as part of a team and independently;· Capable of handling sensitive and confidential matters responsibly;We seek students who are dependable, flexible, and proactive. This is a great position for a student with an interest in the criminal justice system who is looking to get a hands-on experience.Learning and Professional Take-AwaysStudents develop professional skills during their co-op experience while building self-confidence. You can expect to leave this co-op with:· Exposure to the inner workings of a busy government office;· Exposure to assignments with all Criminal Bureau divisions for a diverse and collaborative work experience;· Experience as part of investigative and trial preparation teams;· Exposure to proceedings in District, Superior, Appeals, and Supreme Judicial Courts;· Hands-on work with the different stages of a criminal case;· Experience working in a professional office setting;· Professional mentors;· An understanding of how the team that supports the chief lawyer and law enforcement officer of the Commonwealth operates.Location and AmenitiesLocation and convenience! We are centrally located at One Ashburton Place on Beacon Hill; close to the State House, Boston Common, and Faneuil Hall. We are easily accessible by public transportation, and accessible to the many cultural and social activities offered in the city. Enjoy the convenience of Metro Café, a cafeteria offering a wide variety of affordable food options, located on-site at One Ashburton Place.DURING COVID: The Office has not yet determined work arrangements for the spring, but co-op positions will likely be remote for some or all of the upcoming six-month co-op period. Some in-office work may be required and will be discussed at time of interview.Pay and Work HoursThis position is full-time and pays $14/hour. This is a non-benefitted position with paid earned sick time. The expected work hours are 9:00 to 5:00 with a half hour lunch (37.5 hours per week).Former Co-ops have this to say about their experience:"The AGO is a friendly, supportive, and professional work environment. My daily tasks included writing research memorandums, watching and editing video surveillance footage for court usage, and actually getting the chance to go over to court and watch ongoing trials. I got a wide range of exposure to the legal system and how, more specifically, prosecutors do their work from start to finish. I genuinely enjoyed going into the office every day. The importance of a good work environment and team is something I won't ever undervalue."The Attorney General’s Office is an Equal Opportunity Employer. As the representative of the Commonwealth and its residents, the Attorney General’s Office strives to ensure that those working in our office reflect the diversity of the communities we serve. The Office encourages applicants from a broad spectrum of backgrounds to apply for positions.

Description: Are you a highly motivated student or recent graduate with a passion for supply chain or engineering? Join our Data Center Group Global Supply Chain Rotational Program and be part of a world class Supply Chain. We work tirelessly to help our business partners across 160+ countries succeed. It's not just about being different. It's about being better.About our Team:In the past 2 years, our team has grown from three to twenty, and our impact has grown with it! We enjoy spending time together while at the office and outside of work. Our team consists of hikers, runners, travelers, sports fans and movie enthusiasts. We work tirelessly to help our business partners and clients change the world.About the Program:In this program you will rotate cross-functionally within Lenovo Data Center Group to leverage career advancement and business impact while developing a broad base of understanding across the business and supply chain. Description: This is in NORWOOD, MA. The commuter line does go to Norwood Depot or Westwood Station and has shuttles that run to and from these stops.The Role:This position will work in the drug product potency bioassay group within the Analytical Development department. The person will participate in the evaluation of drug product materials using cell-based potency bioassays. The individual will report to the Manager of Potency Assays and work closely with all members of the potency team to learn the principles of potency bioassays, understand design and execution of in vitro relative potency testing, learn principles around regulatory requirements of potency testing, become competent in key instrumentation, and learn the analytical principles and software for potency bioassay data analysis. The individual will participate in sample testing activities that support late stage clinical development vaccine programs as well as being exposed to earlier stage programs across the Moderna portfolio. The position will initially be based in Cambridge until the group moves to the Norwood site sometime in the first quarter of 2021.Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table:Here’s What We’ll Bring to the Table:About Moderna:Moderna is advancing messenger RNA (mRNA) science to create a new class of transformative medicines for patients. mRNA medicines are designed to direct the body’s cells to produce intracellular, membrane or secreted proteins that can have a therapeutic or preventive benefit and have the potential to address a broad spectrum of diseases. The Company’s platform builds on continuous advances in basic and applied mRNA science, delivery technology and manufacturing, providing Moderna the capability to pursue in parallel a robust pipeline of new development candidates. Moderna is developing therapeutics and vaccines for infectious diseases, immuno-oncology, rare diseases, cardiovascular diseases, and autoimmune and inflammatory diseases, independently and with strategic collaborators.Headquartered in Cambridge, Mass., Moderna currently has strategic alliances for development programs with AstraZeneca, Plc. and Merck, Inc., as well as the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA), an agency of the U.S. Department of Defense, the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority (BARDA), a division of the Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response (ASPR) within the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) and the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI). Moderna has been ranked in the top ten of Science’s list of top biopharma industry employers for the past five years. To learn more, visit www.modernatx.com.Our Mission:Deliver on the promise of mRNA science to create a new generation of transformative medicines for patients.Moderna is a smoke-free, alcohol-free and drug-free work environment.Moderna is committed to equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to a person’s race, color, gender, age, religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation or any characteristic protected under applicable law. Moderna will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.

Description: SummaryDo you love building elegant solutions to highly complex challenges? Do you intrinsically see the importance and take pride in the details of your work? At Apple, we work every day to create products that enrich people’s lives. We are looking for someone who's interested in joining our Silicon Engineering team within Hardware Technologies. You’ll help design, verify, and drive to manufacture our next-generation, high-performance, power-efficient system-on-chip (SoCs). Your work will impact Apple products and ensure they efficiently handle the rich features and evolving workloads on devices that are beloved by millions. You’ll be responsible for crafting and building the key technologies that fuel all of Apple devices.DescriptionIn some positions you will be working on design, architecture, and validation of new designs across the complex SoC ecosystem often spanning multiple sub systems. Some positions are in digital domain, analog or RF, and others are a mixture. In other various roles you will develop and support chip level physical design and flow used by multiple VLSI design projects across Apple. In this role you must have excellent CAD flow programming and algorithm development background. Knowledge of physical design CAD flow is a huge plus. Strong analytical skill, effective social communication of complex concepts, and assertive leadership skills are important to every position. As a member of our dynamic group, you will have the unrivaled and rewarding opportunity to craft upcoming products that will delight and encourage millions of Apple customers every single day.QualificationsApple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. Description: About Neo4j:Neo4j is the leader in graph database technology. As the world’s most widely deployed graph database, we help global brands – including Comcast, NASA, UBS and Volvo – to reveal and predict how people, processes and systems are interrelated. Using this relationships-first approach, applications built using Neo4j tackle connected data challenges such as analytics and artificial intelligence, fraud detection, real-time recommendations and knowledge graphs. Find out more at neo4j.com.Our Vision:At Neo4j we have always strived to help the world make sense of data.As business, society and knowledge become increasingly connected, our technology promotes innovation by helping organizations to find and understand data relationships between people, processes, locations and systems. We created, drive and are at the forefront of innovation in the Graph Database category; and we’re disrupting how organizations leverage their data to innovate and stay competitive.Neo4j is looking for a Solutions Engineerco-opwith a track record of success to join our solutions team. We’re looking for someone passionate about building enterprise class business solutions, working with sales to demonstrate these solutions to key customers and prospects, conduct proofs-of-concept and evangelize solutions internally and externally.Why Join Neo4j?We are one of the fastest growing startups in enterprise software in Silicon Valley, and this is an opportunity to lead and develop high-value strategic technology partnering relationships.For full-time employees we offer competitive salary, employer-paid benefits, generous paid family leave plans, catered lunches, a fully stocked kitchen, weekly activities, company off-sites, happy hours and the list goes on!Neo4j is a proud equal opportunity employer that fully supports a global mindset and workforce diversity. You will love your co-workers!Our Roots and Culture:Neo4j is a Silicon Valley company with a Swedish soul. We aim to hire smart, funny, creative and humble people who possess a lot of heart and drive. We value relationships (just like a graph!) and place trust in our colleagues to meet each day with focus and integrity.We foster collaboration and intellectually honest discussions for consensus decision making. Every Neo4j employee is empowered to contribute and put one's own innovative stamp on projects.Most of all, we are fanatical about graphs and creating an experience our users love.Intrigued by this role? We encourage you to apply even if you don't 100% fit the qualifications above.Neo4j is committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. Please read the Privacy Notice Regarding Neo4j's Recruitment Process to understand how the personal data that you provide will be handled.

Description: Please apply on the company website in addition to this posting:https://www.argo.ai/join-us/#j2417116Who we are:Argo AI is in the business of building self-driving technology you can trust. With experienced leaders in the field and collaborative partnerships with some of the world’s largest automakers, we’re building self-driving technology that is engineered to scale globally and transform mobility for millions.Talented individuals join our team because they share our purpose to make it safe, easy, and enjoyable for everyone to get around cities. We aspire to impact key industries that move people and goods, from ride hailing to deliveries.At Argo AI, we view internships as an incredibly valuable part of our culture and of our recruiting pipeline. It’s our opportunity to see you in action in a way that is far more informative than an interview. For you, it is an opportunity to demonstrate your skills and character in a real world setting. Moreover, it is an opportunity for personal and professional development while learning something new and contributing to Argo AI’s effort to change the world.Every intern will be paired with a senior member of our staff who will provide guidance and mentorship for the duration of the internship. Interns are considered contributing members of our project teams and participate in project meetings. So join us* for a unique 12-14 week paid internship that offers personal and professional development, a fun work environment, and community-building!*At this time, we expect to host our interns onsite at one of Argo AI's locations. However, if COVID-19 prevents us from doing so, internships will be conducted remotely. In the event our internship program is remote, interns will not be required to relocate and must reside in certain states for the duration of their internship. Additionally, remote interns will not receive housing or relocation assistance. Any changes will be communicated to successful candidates in advance of the start of the internship program. Note: At this time, Argo AI is only able to support remote internships in the following states: CA, CT, DC, FL, GA, MA, MI, MN, NC, NJ, NY, PA, TX, VA, WA.Meet the team:Mechanical Hardware Engineering Interns at Argo AI will be responsible for research, design, development, test qualification, and deployment of automotive robotics hardware for Argo AI products. The Vehicle Interfaces team is responsible for leading the packaging of autonomous vehicle hardware on the vehicle platform. Current opportunities on the team include work on component positioning, structural integration, cooling systems, cleaning systems, and more. The team places a strong emphasis on validation and verification in all areas.What you’ll do:Argo AI was founded in late 2016 by industry experts with extensive experience building robotic systems for commercial applications. Our once-small team has since grown into an over 1,000-person strong company with strategic partnerships with two of the world’s leading automakers: Ford and Volkswagen. Our self-driving system is the first with commercial deployment plans for Europe and the U.S., and thanks to an ability to tap into both automakers’ global reach, our technology platform has the largest geographic deployment potential of any self-driving technology to date.At Argo AI, we believe that embracing differences delivers superior results. We are an equal opportunity employer that is committed to an inclusive environment for all employees.

Description: AcquiaMarketing Programs / Demand Generation Co-opLocation: Boston, MAYou will be a key contributor of our Marketing Programs team here in Boston; helping build a world class marketing machine across our global markets. In this role, you will have an immediate impact supporting and executing global marketing and demand generation programs. You will be able to use your creativity to generate new ideas, and will work closely with the broader marketing team to gain an understanding of processes and functions of marketing at Acquia.Who is Acquia? We are the open source digital experience company. We help the world's most ambitious brands create customer moments that matter. You’ve already seen us and might not have known it when you went to the City of Boston, Wilsons, Olympics, World Cup, Super Bowl or Oscars websites. At Acquia we believe in the power of community. We live by our “core DNA”, which injects creativity, commitment, integrity, and enjoyment into everything we do. Our core DNA celebrates how every Acquia, including you, can be a unique contributor.What will you do? Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:• Assist in the coordination, promotion and optimization of global marketing campaigns through our demand generation channels• Support our paid search and social media activities• Contribute to our account based marketing program for targeted accounts• Provide weekly reports on campaign metrics and insights; assist in analyzing and optimizing performance of activities• Create & edit copy for various marketing campaigns• Support project management efforts of marketing programs team• Use your creativity to help generate new marketing ideasThis hands-on role would be a great first job for a recent marketing/communications graduate and could even be entertained as a role for someone still in school who is interested in building practical marketing skills and gaining an understanding of how a global marketing team operates. This co-op role will be for a duration of six months, from July to December 2019.Are you qualified?You are pursuing a degree in Marketing or Communications with a solid academic record. You are self-motivated, detail-oriented, organized, and comfortable with multi-tasking. You have excellent communication skills and thrive in a fast paced, high energy environment. You’re able to work well as part of a team, but also independently and look for opportunities to own projects that deliver results. You have a passion for marketing, an interest in the technology industry, and a willingness to learn.Acquia is an equal opportunity (EEO) employer. We hire without regard to age, color, disability, gender (including gender identity), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law.

Description: Come Join Analog Devices – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For the past 50 years, Analog Devices has been inventing innovative technologies that transform lives. Get hands-on experience working with the brightest minds to solve complex problems that matter: from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality to remote healthcare. Enjoy a culture that values aligned goals, balanced work-life priorities, continuous learning throughout your career and shared rewards. At ADI, we invest in you and succeed together because we believe that happy, healthy, intellectually-challenged people drive our growth and market leadership.ADI at a GlanceADI helps customers bridge the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that solve real-life problems and make the world smarter, healthier, greener and safer. With over $5 billion in revenue, ADI specializes in high-performance analog, mixed-signal, power, and digital signal processing (DSP) integrated circuits that sense, measure, interpret, connect, power, secure and transform how the world experiences the world around them.Analog Devices’ Aerospace and Defense group is seeking a highly motivated Software Engineering Intern/Coop to participate in the development of embedded software to control digital and analog electronic circuits used in a wide range of commercial, military, and aerospace applications. Work closely with internal team members and participate in various phases of the development effort. Create and release engineering documents and test procedures. ADI’s Aerospace and Defense (ADEF) Module and Subsystem group designs RF/Microwave products ranging from 1GHz up to 70GHz for commercial, military, and space applications. Products include receivers, transmitters, low spur/phase noise synthesizers, high-power GaN amplifiers, and multifunction modules.Principal Job responsibilities may include:• Participate in the design, coding and/or evaluation of embedded software controlling analog & digital circuits utilizing FPGA, embedded processors, data converters, and DC powerregulation technologies.• Work closely with other Software engineers to develop embedded software.• Use Git, Bitbucket and Jira applications in embedded software design.• Software test, debug, and validation.Qualifications:• Working towards a BS and/or MS degree with student status.• Good presentation and writing/communication skills.• Some C/C++ programming experience desired• U. S. Citizenship Required.For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. We are a global biopharmaceutical company focused on human health. We prevent illness with vaccines, provide innovative treatments to fight pain and ease suffering. Students work side-by-side with biopharmaceutical professionals, providing an opportunity to make an impact in the lives of patients around the globe. Capture Operations group consists of Weigh, Kit and Dispense operations, Equipment Prep, MF and TSK processing, and Buffer Prep. The Business Operations group oversees the indirect support of operations via Quality Systems execution production schedule and ensures manufacturing work is aligned with our delivery commitments.Responsibilities:Support continuous improvements projects as a manufacturing team member. Description: Burn Design Lab, headquartered on Vashon Island, WA is offering an unpaid internship to a clear thinking, creative, undergraduate material science or materials engineering undergraduate, who is ready to make lasting contributions to the development of leading edge biomass burning cookstoves. We are looking for someone who enjoys working with others to develop creative solutions to challenging problems. Burn Design Lab will a provide a small living expense stipend, plus provide housing or a housing stipend for the selected candidate.Burn Design Lab is a U.S. based internationally focused non-profit organization dedicated to the improvement of lives and the environment in the developing world through research, design, and development of outstanding cookstoves and fuels.The successful candidate will be engaged in some or all of the following:· Researching alternative materials for cookstove applications· Testing materials and developing material test methods· Working with others to developing conceptual designs· Using CAD (SolidWorks) to develop detailed designs· Building prototypes from sheet metal (forming, spot welding, and general metal fabrication), ceramics, refractory, & other materials.· Evolving stove design based on test results and on feedback from potential users.· Cookstove material evaluation and selection· Pursuing a degree in material science or materials engineering· Competency in SolidWorks &/or other CAD tools.· Hands-on maintenance, fabrication, &/or construction experience.· Eagerness to learn both hands-on and academically.· Ability to thrive both independently and in a team environment.· A willingness to do what is needed for the success of the organization and it’s mission.· A strong work ethic & attention to detail.The internship is 6 - 12 months duration, beginning in early January 2021.

Description: Interested in transforming health care for Parkinson's disease? Join Clemens Scherzer and his team at the Neurogenomics Lab and Parkinson Personalized Medicine Initiative at Brigham & Women's Hospital and Harvard Medical School. We use massive data to reinvent health care for Parkinson's disease. The interdisciplinary lab includes computer scientists, biologists, and clinicians. Our goal is to shift medicine for Parkinson's from a reactive, one-size-fits-all approach to a predictive, proactive, tailored, and data-driven approach using large-scale genome and biomarkers data. We conduct the Harvard Biomarkers Study, one of the largest longitudinal biobanks for Parkinson's in the world, today with more than 3,000 participants.From there, it is less than a 5-minute walk to the Building for Transformative Medicine, 60 Fenwood Rd.

Description: Lyra Therapeutics (Nasdaq: LYRA) is a clinical-stage company pioneering a new therapeutic approach to treat debilitating ear, nose and throat (ENT) diseases that impact the lives of millions of people. Our goal is to transform the ENT treatment paradigm by providing effective front-line solutions for physicians and new treatment options for their patients. In a Phase 1 study, the company observed a rapid, clinically meaningful and durable improvement in symptom score, with 90% of Chronic Rhinosinusitis (CRS) patients having improved symptoms at 24 weeks. A Phase 2 readout of LYR-210 is anticipated in Q4 2020, with LYR-220 expected in the clinic the following year. Headquartered in the Boston area, Lyra Therapeutics was founded by George Whitesides and Robert Langer, academic luminaries in the fields of chemistry, materials science and biotechnology.We currently have an opening for a co-op responsible for analytical characterization to support research and product development efforts. The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast-paced environment, be adaptable and be motivated by the opportunity to learn new technologies.Key areas of responsibilityQualificationsAt Lyra, we value creativity, leadership, and collaboration. The company sees significant expansion opportunities for our platform, and look for people who are driven to succeed, innovative, and adaptable. For consideration, please submit cover letter and CV.Please visit www.lyratx.com for more information.

Description: Software Engineer, Front End - Boston (Remote)About the RoleTeikametrics is looking for a software engineer with experience and interest in helping customers visualize and manipulate large amounts of analytical data.Current client-side technologies at Teikametrics emphasize React, Redux, and TypeScript, backed by services powered by a functional-first Scala stack. We also use Python, Javascript, and PostgreSQL.At Teikametrics, you will: Write code primarily in React and contribute to our web application’s front end. Become an essential member of a team of ~3-6 engineers, frequently pair programming. Learn, grow, and receive mentorship from individual members of your diverse and talented engineering team. Actively contribute to our development roadmap and to the evolution of our software platform. Collaborate and communicate with our other development teams. Read and review pull requests. Participate in planning meetings, retros, and other scrum meetings.Qualified candidates should have: Strong computer science fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, distributed systems Proficiency in modern frameworks, libraries (e.g. React, Redux, etc.) Experience writing clean, semantic HTML and CSS Ability to set up reusable, testable, and performant UI components, allowing for rapid development and well-organized code Startup-level passion about wanting to take on large, challenging problems with a small team of world-class developers A desire to work in a collaborative environment focusing on continuous learning; participating in tech talks, code review, and some pair programmingABOUT TEIKAMETRICSAt Teikametrics, we’re building an operating system to optimize every aspect of a retailer's business -- from advertising to inventory to pricing. We optimize billions of transactions for thousands of entrepreneurs and brands around the world selling on Amazon and other marketplaces. The Teikametrics Retail Optimization Platform uses proprietary econometrics and machine-learning data models packaged in a simple SaaS interface. We combine our best in class technology with coaching and support from our world-class teams based remotely and in Boston, MA, Seattle, WA, Tel Aviv, Israel and Bengaluru, India. We are looking for people who can excel, add value to our mission, and thrive in a demanding start-up environment.

These opportunities in our Research Division can provide you with great development and a chance to see if we are the right company for your long-term goals.We are seeking a bench-based 6-month co-op, with passion and interest in single cell sequencing and/or spatial transcriptomics platforms, to join the Genome Sciences team within the Department of Genetics & Pharmacogenomics (GpGx) at our Research & Development Division in Boston. Our mission is to develop high-throughput cutting-edge technologies to better understand disease mechanism and to identify and validate new targets and biomarkers. Our group utilizes innovative genetic screening (i.e., Clustered Regularly Interspaced Short Palindromic Repeats - CRISPR) and multi-omics single cell approaches such as simultaneous Ribose Nucleic Acid (RNA) and protein profiling (i.e., REAP-seq), immune repertoire profiling, CRISPR droplet sequencing - CROP-seq/Perturb-Seq, and Spatial Transcriptomics to impact all stages of the drug development pipeline from pre-clinical to clinical development. Genome Sciences collaborates closely with the discovery therapeutic areas (i.e., oncology, immunology, neuroscience, and cardiometabolic disease), pharmacology, and ChemBio groups within the Discovery, Preclinical and Early Development (DPED) organization to utilize these technologies to pursue key biological questions.The responsibilities of the candidate include but are not limited to:Required Education and Skills:Preferred Experience and Skills:We are a research-driven biopharmaceutical company. Our mission is built on the simple premise that if we “follow the science” that great medicines can make a significant impact to our world. We believe that a research-driven enterprise dedicated to world-class science can succeed by inventing medicine and vaccine innovations that make a difference for patients across the globe.Who we are …We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.What we look for …In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.INVENT.IMPACT.INSPIRE.

Description: In the pharmaceutical industry, drugdissolution testingis routinely used to provide criticalin vitrodrug release information for bothquality controlpurposes and drug development. Dissolution is one of the most important biopharmaceutical methods to characterize the expected in vivo bioavailability under in vitro conditions. Thus, an efficient dissolution method is needed during formulation development process to facilitate the selection of lead formulations with an expected higher bioavailability.Working closely with his/her supervisor on an analytical chemistry project, the coop student will be instructed in method development for dissolution and other analytical chromatography technologies. The coop student will learn analytical chemistry concepts and apply them to analyze complex molecules developed at Takeda. This is an exciting opportunity to work with new analytical chemistry techniques that are not typically taught in school but are widely utilized in the pharmaceutical industry.The position may also involve:· Working with and interacting with other departments outside of analytical development· Learning about different methodologies and strategic approaches to analyze a drug and make sure it is of an appropriate quality· Opportunities to expand the work to multiple Takeda projectsPrimary responsibilities include:· Maintenance of an accurate laboratory notebook· Training on several analytical techniques· Develop robust and bio-relevant dissolution method· Collaboration with scientists on a project team· Preparation and delivery of oral presentations to the project teamThis opportunity will allow the coop student to experience a real-life job situation.Throughout the coop’s tenure with Takeda, he/she will interact with experienced scientist to aid in all aspects of his/her employment. He/she will also attend many department-wide presentations and poster sessions to learn more about the on-going research projects and will have the opportunity to present his/her work to the department.In addition, there are many opportunities to tour other labs on Takeda’s Cambridge campus to learn about all aspects of the pharmaceutical industry. There will be opportunities to interact with other co-op students within Takeda as well. The proximity of so many experienced scientists with a broad range of backgrounds provides a unique opportunity to learn about the pharmaceutical industry.

Description: OBJECTIVES:Interested in robotics, laboratory automation, and software in the pharmaceutical industry setting? Want a hands-on experience in applying modern software, robotics, and manufacturing technology to advance the drug discovery process? This position in the Lead Discovery group within Global Biologics at Takeda Boston will involve software development, testing, and documentation in the context of maintaining and deploying laboratory automation systems.ACCOUNTABILITIES and FOCUS:· Contribute to the software development process for robotics systems in the laboratory· Document software systems and robotic system use procedures· Collect robotic system performance data and analyze for optimization· Combine software, 3D CAD and rapid-prototyping tools to develop tools, systems, and solutions for improving laboratory operations· Maintain good written records of design procedures, results and conclusions· Participate in group meetings and contribute to scientific discussionsEDUCATION, BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES AND SKILLS:· Minimum GPA of 3· Open to current sophomores, juniors or seniors (undergrad or graduate programs)· Experience with or enthusiasm for computer science, programming, robotics, or engineering disciplines· Strong familiarity with computer systems and engineering principles· Hands-on approach to problem solving· Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail· Self-motivated, curious, independent and eager to learnADDITIONAL INCENTIVES THAT TAKEDA PHARMACEUTICALS OFFER:· Opportunity to take part in a global organization with state-of-the-art capabilities· Lunch and Learns (Leadership team and other dept members to present topics)· Great Location, about 1.5 miles from Campus (few stops on Bus Route 1)· Mentoring to take a more direct, intentional role with each Coop· Quality Conversations (goals/career track)· Potential to extend to 8 months and part time work· Cross-training (across four groups in Global Biologics)· Opportunity for poster session/final presentationsCOMPANY OVERVIEWTakeda fosters a collaborative and stimulating work environment filled with opportunity and the chance to make a difference in people's lives. It is a workplace driven by integrity, one of Takeda’s long-held values that extends to both the patients we serve and our employees who develop and deliver medicines. Across our company, Takeda employees bring together diverse strengths that together create a stronger whole.As one of the world’s leading biopharmaceutical companies, Takeda is committed to bringing Better Health and a Brighter future to people worldwide. We aspire to bring our leadership in translating science into life-changing medicines to the next level, in our core focus areas; oncology, gastroenterology, neuroscience, rare diseases, plasma-derived therapies, and vaccines. The Greater Boston Area is headquarters to many of our Global and US business units.We are a passionate team doing important work that impacts patients’ lives. If you are driven to create better health and a brighter future, join us!TRANSPORTATION:By Bus: Take the bus CT1 or bus 1, going towards Central square in Cambridge and get off at the "University Park" stop. Landsdowne street is across the streetBy T: Take the red line towards Alewife, get off at the "Central" stop. Walk on Mass Ave. towards Boston until youget toLandsdowne Street on the right.

Description: The Sleep and Inflammatory Systems Laboratory at the Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (https://projects.iq.harvard.edu/humansleepandinflammation) is investigating how short or disturbed sleep increases disease risk, including cardiovascular diseases, chronic pain, and infectious diseases, by studying inflammatory, endocrine, and autonomic responses to various manipulations of sleep in humans.Co-op students will· Assist in the recruitment of healthy participants and individuals suffering from hypertension and prehypertension· Preparation and completion of study runs carried out in the Clinical Research Center, including blood tube preparation, computer and equipment setups, data download.· Assist in the administration of autonomic testing, computerized emotional/cognitive functioning, and pain testing performed in the Clinical Research Center.· Data management and assistance in the analysis of physiological parameters.· Assist in laboratory work with primary human cell cultures, immunological, and molecular biological methods· Participate in lab meetings, attend sleep grand rounds· Prepare a data project to be presented at the internal lab meeting and/or Harvard Research Day/Division of Sleep Medicine· Work with flexible schedules (start times include mornings and some later afternoons)

Description: Please apply online and on NUWorks.At Hewlett Packard Enterprise, we bring together the brightest minds to create breakthrough technology solutions that advance the way people live and work. What sets us apart? Our people and our relentless dedication to helping our customers make their mark on the world.We are a team of doers, dreamers and visionaries; inspired by our purpose and driven by our strategy. We live by our three values: partner, innovate and act.Our legacy inspires us as we forge ahead, always pushing to discover what’s next. Every day is a new opportunity to advance and grow ourselves, our company and the industry. Some people call it an obsession, we call it a way of life.Learning does not only happen through training. Relationships are among the most powerful ways for people to learn and grow, and this is part of our HPE culture. In addition to working alongside talented colleagues, you will have many opportunities to learn through coaching and stretch assignment opportunities. You’ll be guided by feedback and support to accelerate your learning and maximize your knowledge. We also have a “reverse mentoring” program which allows us to share our knowledge and strengths across our multi-generation workforce.Are you excited about leveraging cutting edge data analytics technologies and methodologies? Are you interested in driving business decisions through data analysis, reporting, and KPIs? Do you want to work with a team of Business Analysts & Data Scientists to solve some of HPE GreenLake Cloud Service’s most complex business problems through data?The GreenLake Cloud Services Business Intelligence/Analytics Practice Team is looking for a passionate, driven Data Science Intern who will apply a logical, systematic approach to problem-solving using mathematical and statistical techniques and/or innovative/quantitative analytical approaches to identify insights and make actionable recommendations to help drive growth. In this role, you will be exposed to and partner with members from the Strategy & Planning, Go-to-Market, Operations, and Data Management teams to ensure we are capturing and surfacing the most meaningful data and insights to make optimal business decisions. You will also collaborate with our tools partners to build self-service reports and BI dashboards.The ideal candidate will have experience working with large data sets, deep-dive data analysis including experience extracting and manipulating data using queries (SQL) and Regression analysis to develop predictive models. She/he should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to work cross-organizationally. A keen sense of learning, ownership and drive is required to succeed.Responsibilities:Education and Experience :Requirements:What we can offer you:Extensive benefits, a competitive salary and participation in the shared values and purpose that make Hewlett Packard Enterprise one of the world´s most attractive employers! At HPE, our goal is to provide equal opportunities, flexible work-life balance, and constantly evolving career growth. If you are looking for challenges in an exciting, supportive and international work environment, then we definitely want to hear from you. Continue the conversation by clicking apply now below, or directly via our Careers Portal atwww.hpe.com/careers.Join us and make your mark!HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Veterans/Disabled/LGBTand Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to diversity and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We do not discriminate and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global diverse team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together.

Description: EXCITING INTERNSHIP IN KENYA FOR THOSE WITH A PASSION FOR CHILDREN, AND CREATING A STIMULATING, LEARNER-CENTERED EDUCATIONAL ENVIRONMENTBe part of an organization that supports an Educational Center on the shores of Lake Victoria in Kenya. This center provides education, food security, (health)care for over 300 vulnerable and orphaned children from the community.Children are also taught the ideals of respect and love, environmental awareness, social and economic empowerment. The focus is only toward the best education with the means available.During this Education and Pedagogy Internship in Kenya, you will use your knowledge and expertise to introduce and train staff to new pedagogical methods and approaches. And you assist the organization in implementing and designing their educational program to create a stimulating learning environment. An exciting opportunity if you have a passion for children, education and creating an environment allowing people to thrive and fulfill their potential.Your tasksThe Educational Center is a non-formal school and responsible for the care and education of more than 300 children who otherwise couldn’t afford basics in life. Besides a nursery and primary school, thecenter houses a children’s home and acts as a sponsor for high-school and university. Children not only receive an education but are also taught the ideals of respect and love, environmental awareness, social and economic empowerment. The focus is only toward the best education with the means available (uniforms and learning materials, for example, are provided whenever possible).You will work closely with the international team and especially the teaching staff (13 teachers). Your role will be designed according to your skills, desired learning outcomes, and needs of the Educational Center. The tasks include:During the weekends or weeks off, you have free time to relax or take the opportunity to explore Kisumu, wider Kenya, and Eastern Africa. You can also initialize workshops or excursions with the kids, the staff or the wider community, or just spend time with the team and the children, play football, volleyball and so on.Good to knowThis organization was founded in 2015 and they aim to empower and inspire people to initiate the individual and societal transformation we want to see. They work towards an environment allowing people to thrive and fulfill their potential. It is their role to build the capacity of people and organizations they work with, build bridges between agents of change to co-create this environment.In January 2015 he made his promise come true. Together with his good friend Mathilde he started a long 5200km journey from South Africa to Kenya, crossing Zimbabwe, Zambia, Malawi, Tanzania and Uganda on their way, to raise awareness but also funds for the Educational Center. What started as a simple idea to help the Center and her children, turned into a big vision that evolved into the founding of this organization. They providefinancial support as well as helps the Centerto strengthen their capacity by consult in organizational development, designing and managing educational and development projects. Additionally, they also facilitate vocational training, alternative educational programs, and training of teachers.The Center now houses a children’s home, non-formal nursery and primary school and acts as a sponsor for high-school and university.Aside from education, the children are taught the ideals of respect and love, environmental awareness, social and economic empowerment.They also have 14 acres of farm, as well as livestock like cows, pigs, chickens, goats, sheep, fish and rabbits to provide an income.

These startups have collectively created more than 6500 jobs and have raised more than $850 million in funding. The incubator’s mission is to provide entrepreneurs with the community, resources, and space they need to thrive. Staying true to these guiding principles is the reason we are recognized so often and by so many for the quality of life we enjoy here. We believe it directly translates to a better experience for everyone: employees, advisors, clients, and our communities.Creating a supportive culture where everyone can thrive is a mission we take seriously. From professional development to comprehensive benefits, grassroots leadership opportunities, generous bonus and stock option incentive plans, opportunities to unwind and connect, and so much more, Commonwealth is not just a great place to work—it’s a place that, for many, feels like home.Commonwealth Financial Network® is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to a diverse workforce.We care about your online safety as a prospective employee and encourage you to exercise caution when responding to job postings online.
