Targeted Academic Majors: College of Science
Workplace Type: Primarily on-site work
Desired Skills: CRISPR, Mammalian Cell Culture, Molecular Biology, Western Blotting
Description: Position:             Co-op, Discovery BiologyReports to:           Scientist IILocation:            Kendall Square, Cambridge, MATimeframe:           January 2021 – June 2021Hours:              Monday through Friday, 40 hours per weekCasma OverviewCasma Therapeutics is harnessing the natural cellular process of autophagy to open vast new target areas for drug discovery and development that will profoundly impact the lives of patients. Autophagy is a conserved cellular process that contributes to overall organismal health. Inefficient autophagy flux or defects in lysosomal homeostasis are observed in numerous pathologies, e.g., neurodegeneration, metabolic disorders, inflammation, and muscle degeneration. Casma uses several approaches to intervene at strategic points throughout the autophagy-lysosome system to improve the cellular process of clearing out unwanted proteins, organelles and invading pathogens. By boosting autophagy, Casma expects to be able to arrest or reverse the progression of lysosomal storage disorders, muscle disorders, inflammatory disorders and neurodegeneration, among other indications. Casma was launched in 2018 by Third Rock Ventures and is based in Cambridge, Mass.Casma is seeking a talented and highly motivated co-op to support the Discovery Biology team. You will get experience working on drug discovery programs that are leading to the identification of novel therapeutic targets and drug candidates for clinical development. As a newly founded and fast-growing startup, you will get to be a part of a dynamic environment as we are building the science and programs and have the opportunity to interact with the entire organization. We are looking for someone who will share our excitement about the science, contribute to our culture, and honor our commitment to patients.QUALIFICATIONS YOU SHOULD POSSESSCasma Company Values + CultureCourage to listen learn, lead, Awesome science, Strength through collaboration,Medical breakthroughs for patients, Always do the right thingWe have created and are sustaining a creative scientific culture where we recognize and reward our “Casmaniacs” for exemplifying our Core Values, and we accelerate our professional growth through coaching, development, and frequent feedback. Our plan of nurturing the fiercest, most talented and diverse Casmaniacs is coming to fruition before our very eyes. . Casma is proud to be named one of Boston’s 2019 Best Places to Work by the Boston Business Journal and one of FierceBiotech’s Fierce 15 Biotech Companies.Equal Employment OpportunityCasma provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, veteran status, disability, pregnancy or conditions related to pregnancy, or genetics.

Position: AmeriCorps Writers' Room Fellowship, Volunteer Engagement S
Targeted Academic Majors: College of Social Science & Humanities
Workplace Type: On-site work is preferred when public health concerns allow, Remote work is permitted when public health concerns dictate, Primarily on-site work
Desired Skills: Non-profits organizations, Writing, Volunteer Coordination, Community Engagement
Description: AmeriCorps Writers’ Room Fellowship, Volunteer Engagement Specialist 826 Bostonseeks mission-driven change-makers to join the Writers’ Room Fellowship as AmeriCorps Members for the spring 2021 semester.826 Boston is expanding to serve more students in the Boston Public Schools through its innovative Writers’ Room Program. This is an exciting opportunity to join 15 AmeriCorps members and play a key role in driving impact. Serving as an AmeriCorps Volunteer Engagement Specialist in the Writers’ Room Fellowship is a challenging yet rewarding experience. You will be part of a five-member team, including the Volunteer Manager, Community Engagement Coordinator, and three AmeriCorps Volunteer Engagement Specialists. Your role is designed to affect individual students and school-wide systems. Through your service, you will work with students to empower them to find their voices, tell their stories, and gain critical communication skills while also recruiting, training, and supporting the corps of 500 community volunteer tutors in Writers’ Rooms across Boston.AmeriCorps Volunteer Engagement Specialists will serve out of 826 Boston's writing and tutoring center, located at 3035 Washington Street, Roxbury. Additionally, AmeriCorps Volunteer Engagement Specialists will travel to two of the six 826 Boston Writers’ Rooms located in a Boston Public School on a weekly basis to serve directly with students.The Writers’ Room Fellowship is a full-time (40 hours per week), six-month service program beginning on Monday, January 11, 2021. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Reasonable accommodations will be considered for interviews and throughout the term of service upon request.The AmeriCorps Writers' Room Fellowship program is dependent on a yearly funding award from the Corporation for National and Community Service. Key Responsibilities and Functions Writers’ Room Volunteer Coordination: Support volunteer management, including attending recruitment events, creating volunteer email campaigns, and co-facilitating new volunteer trainings Support Writers’ Room program teams by planning tutor debriefs  Develop and co-lead supplemental training for volunteer tutors Oversee on-boarding of service-learning partners within universities and collaborate with faculty and students to enrich 826 Boston Writers’ Rooms Coordinate a series of volunteer appreciation initiatives, including social media campaigns, monthly newsletters, and in-person celebrations Support Volunteer Manager with cultivation and stewardship of potential corporate partners, with a specific focus on engaging more STEM professionals in Writers’ Rooms Communicate project progress to staff supervisor and seek counsel when help is needed to execute goals Tutoring Students: Serve as writing tutor to students seeking support with writing assignments in 826 Boston Writers’ Rooms through class visits, individual drop-ins, writing workshops, and publication projects Support students’ writing development through one-on-one conferences, small-group collaboration, and whole-class instruction of creative and professional writing and reading workshops Qualifications High school diploma Proficiency in Spanish to support our bilingual Writers’ Room required Interest in teaching/tutoring writing to students grades K-12 in an urban setting  Desire to work with and support volunteers from diverse backgrounds and wide ranges of experience  Ability to coach and mentor volunteers and interns Ability to adapt to various working and management styles Ability to participate in open communication to build community and foster team goals including the advancement of diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives Strong written and verbal communication skills  Proficiency in organizational, time management, project management, and resource management skills Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Google Apps Familiarity with the Boston Public Schools system, particularly the schools in Roxbury, Dorchester, and Jamaica Plain preferred, but not required Compensation and Benefits Professional Development: As an AmeriCorps Volunteer Engagement Specialist, you will build upon your personal strengths and develop transferable skills, such as teamwork, leadership, decision-making, project management and relationship development. You will develop your knowledge of school and community partnerships, cross-sector collaboration, and the day-to-day operations of a nonprofit organization. 826 Boston provides AmeriCorps Members with formal on-boarding at the beginning of their period of service, ongoing training throughout the year, and individualized coaching from a direct supervisor. Living Stipend: AmeriCorps Volunteer Engagement Specialists will receive a gross bi-weekly stipend of $625. Education Award: As an AmeriCorps Member, Volunteer Engagement Specialists qualify for an Eli Segal Education Award for every successful year of service, which includes completing 900 hours of service and completing the full duration of the six-month program. The education award can be used to repay student loans or cover tuition costs for graduate studies at an accredited college or university and will amount to at least $3,097.50. Travel Stipend: $70/month travel stipend for months of active service Medical Coverage: AmeriCorps members have the opportunity to request reimbursement of up to $50/month to cover individual health coverage premiums. All AmeriCorps members are eligible for this reimbursement but may decline it in favor of alternative coverage obtained through a parent, guardian, or spouse. Time Off: 40 hours time off + 3 Holidays off Public Benefits: AmeriCorps Members may be eligible for food and public utility benefits.About 826 Boston 826 Boston is a nonprofit youth writing and publishing organization located in Roxbury, Massachusetts, that empowers traditionally underserved students ages 6-18 to find their voices, tell their stories, and gain communication skills to succeed in school and in life. Our high-impact programs are based on the understanding that great leaps in learning can occur with individualized attention, and that writing skills are fundamental to future success. 826 Boston is part of a national network of youth writing centers, founded by the award-winning author Dave Eggers and the educator Nínive Calegari, which was voted one of the top 30 companies to work for by Good Magazine.Since opening in 2007, 826 Boston has delivered its free youth writing and tutoring programs to more than 25,000 students and has been recognized by The Boston Globe as one of the best places in the city to volunteer. 826 Boston’s youth writers have published their work in The New York Times, The Boston Globe, and in numerous award-winning 826 Boston books, including A Place for Me in the World, which was hailed as a “triumph of middle school education” by The Boston Globe. In 2014, the 826 network garnered the American Literacy Prize from the Library of Congress for its pioneering work to eradicate illiteracy in the United States. Link to apply:Additional Information:submit resume on NUworks AND through:https://826boston.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=25

Description: All applications for co-ops and internships must be received via MassCareers in order to be considered. If a student has submitted their application via any other system, we are unlikely to see it.About MassDOT:An agency on the move, the Massachusetts Department of Transportation (MassDOT) takes great pride in connecting the Commonwealth’s residents and communities. Powered by a growing data-analytics discipline – and working in conjunction with municipalities, public agencies and the private sector – we’re finding new ways to improve the Bay State’s transportation infrastructure.Position Summary:The Co‐op will support the Environmental Services Section by reviewing MassDOT projects statewide to ensure compliance with state and federal environmental regulations. Duties may include reviewing project construction plans, analyzing project areas using ArcGIS, evaluating projects against environmental regulations, reviewing and developing permit applications, and performing occasional field work.Duties and Responsibilities:The Co‐op will work closely with MassDOT staff to complete all tasks and will gain a broad range of knowledge in environmental regulations including the Clean Water Act, the National Environmental Policy Act, the Massachusetts Environmental Policy Act, the Endangered Species Act, the Wetlands Protection Act, and various regulations associated with hazardous materials, historic and archeological resources, and conservation land/open space.The Co‐op will work closely with the Wetlands and Water Resources Unit to review projects and ensure federal and state wetland permits are received before advertising for bids. Duties may include reviewing plans and permit applications, assisting with wetland delineations, and coordinating rare species permitting. Occasional field work may be required for site visits, wetland delineations, and rare species monitoring.The Co‐op will also support the Stormwater Unit in implementing the statewide Stormwater Program. This will include assisting with collecting drainage infrastructure asset data in accordance with the MassDOT Asset Management Program; reviewing stormwater retrofit design plans; developing an inspection and maintenance protocol for stormwater treatment facilities; developing permit applications and reports for Stormwater Retrofit Projects in accordance with state and federal regulations, and daily administrative tasks associated with the Stormwater Program.In addition to meeting the minimum entrance requirements for this position, it is desirable that the selected applicant should possess the following:• Coursework or familiarity in hydrology and hydraulics, environmental policy, wetland science, hazardous materials, or conservation biology• An interest in environmental and transportation topics• Proficiency in Microsoft Office and ArcGIS• Excellent organizational abilities• Ability to operate effectively and professionally under pressure• Self‐motivated with strong aptitude and desire to learn and perform duties with limited supervision• Demonstrated ability to take direction and communicate clearly both verbally and in writing• Demonstrated positive "can do" attitudeIf you have questions regarding this position, please contact Alaina Seitz, Human Resources Specialist, at alaina.seitz@dot.state.ma.us .This requisition will remain open until filled; however, first consideration will be given to those applicants that apply within the first 14 days.Candidates must be enrolled in a full-time degree program in Spring 2021. The selected candidates will be expected to work from January through May 2021on a full-time (37.5 hours/week) basis.All job applications must be submitted online through MassCareers to be considered.For a disability‐related reasonable accommodation or alternative application method, call ADA Coordinator, Rita Dinunzio – (857) 368‐8738.An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Females, minorities, veterans, and persons with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply.

Description: The Medical Assistant/Co-op Student performs medical office support and clinical support in both the administrative and clinical areas.These duties are essential to the overall functioning of the clinic.Under the direction and supervision of both the registered nurses and medical assistants, and in accordance with the policies of Boston Health Care for the Homeless Program, procedures, protocols and standards of practice, this person participates in the delivery of patient care in collaboration with the multidisciplinary clinic team.The person will work with medical assistants and registered nurses throughout the shift to determine appropriate assignments, priorities, gather patient information important in the registration process, schedule follow-up appointments, prepare medical records for the clinic and assist with patient appointment confirmation calls and filing.The Practice Assistant will also be responsible for communicating the status of delegated task completion and outcome of patient data findings.Collaborates with the supervising RN throughout the shift to determine appropriate work assignments and priorities, as well as communicating the status of delegated task completion and outcome of patient data findings.Essential DutiesUnder the direction of the Nurse Manager, performs a variety of appropriately delegated patient care interventions·Obtain and document vital signs and weights, report findings to nurse·Perform treatments and procedures, i.e., dressing changes, blood glucose testing. If the student is already trained in phlebotomy then may perform those skills, as well.·Collaborate with RN in conducting admission interviews and assessments·Escort and assist with transport of patients to and from appointments and procedures·Provide general health information to homeless patients. Assist with patient teaching; Assist with treatments and exams·Assist with unit routines; Collaborate as a member of a multidisciplinary team·Answer telephones appropriately as needed·Attends daily team huddles when in clinic·Attends BMC clinic staff meetings and team break-out sessions·Support and attend in-service education as required·Maintains timely ongoing verbal communication in order to assure good patient care and the effective running of the Clinic·Responsible for collecting, collating, and entering data and information into the applicable database or format in an accurate and timely manner·Maintains appropriate equipment logs and records per standards·Accurately collects requested patient date (e.g. vital signs, weights and reason for visits), notifying the supervising RN of abnormalities·Treats patient in a manner that preserves and supports patient confidentiality, patient rights, and patients dignity·Performs basic patient testing, including, but not limited to, tests for guiac, urine dip, and glucose fingerstick·Collects, labels, and sends specimens to the lab, with appropriate laboratory slips and/or requisitions·Assists nurse/provider during complex treatments/procedures, including but not limited to, doing preps and set-ups for examinations/treatments, assisting during procedures when requested or required·Check inventories on a weekly basis, order clinic supplies and stock them in their appropriate location upon arrival in order to avoid a shortage or misplacement of necessary supplies·Act as a member of the team of care givers·Assist patients with personal hygiene, including bathing and showering·Escort patients off site appointments·Performs other duties as required· Medical terminology· Vital signs

Description: (REMOTE)Who isServiceNow?Imagine your workday dominated less by emails and spreadsheets and more time given back to you to do your actual job. At ServiceNow, we are making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud-based platform and products streamline and simplify how work gets done across the enterprise. Description: SUMMARY:The Global Medical and Scientific Affairs (GMSA) department serves as a bridge between several departments within Karyopharm. GMSA works directly with Commercial, Marketing, Market Access, Regulatory, ClinDev, and ClinOps departments to develop, present and execute on internal and external material that is used to deliver on Karyopharm’s business objectives. Over the course of one to two 6-week rotations, the APPE student will learn important operational and strategic tactics of the Medical Affairs function at Karyopharm. These principles can be applied to other industry rotations and future career goals. APPE student will be mentored by Senior Director, MSL to optimize experiences for Karyopharm and studentROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:• Rotate through each function of GMSA including Scientific Communications, Medical Information, Medical Science Liaisons, and Investigator Sponsored Trial Operations.• Perform literature searches and journal clubs using Karyopharm internal databases and publicly available external databases on disease states of interest to address gaps in knowledge for both internal and external use.• Participate in field visits with Karyopharm (local) MSL to understand about the opportunities and challenges of field-based customer-facing roles.• Learn the disease landscape and competitive landscape of disease states of interest in hematology/oncology.• Provide input into the operational efficiencies and strategic tactics that are employed in Karyopharm’s active IST program.• Contribute to the creation of GMSA material including externally facing MSL tools/resources/ programming and measure the impact of the utilization of such material.• Abide by all pertinent compliance regulations, standard operating procedures, and other policies.QUALIFICATIONS:• Successful completion of P3 year and IPPE Co-Op periods 1-3.• Ability to efficiently manage time and priorities.• Excellent written and verbal communicator, skilled at diplomacy and capable of effectively combining science and relationship building.Karyopharm is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Karyopharm complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as employment eligibility verification requirements of the immigration and Nationality Act.8-2020

Assignments will entail real-world applications, valuable work assignments and opportunities to experience HPE’s industry leading portfolio.Being an Intern within Systems & Software Engineering at Aruba Networks entails working as a member of a R&D team to define and implement next generation networking solutions which integrate LAN, WAN, SDN, and Cloud products into powerful synergistic solutions for our customers.Job Description:Internships typically run through the summer, though part-time roles may be available for up to 12 months for local students that are interested in this option.Currently, we’re hiring top-tier students enrolled full-time in a university program for internships working on leading-edge technology. We seek students majoring in degree programs such as computer engineering, computer science, and electrical or software engineering.Responsibilities:Education and Experience Required:The candidate must be currently enrolled in a 4 year technical degree program (CS, CE, EE, etc.). At time of start, intern should have completed at least their 2nd year of a Bachelor's degree program in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent and be on track to graduate in good standing (3.0 or higher GPA).Required Knowledge and Skills:Possessing some of the following skills would be a plus:Hewlett Packard Enterprise Values:HPE is an EOE / Female / Minority / Individual with Disabilities / Protected Veteran StatusWhat do we offer?Extensive social benefits, flexible working hours, a competitive salary and shared values, make Hewlett Packard Enterprise one of the world´s most attractive employers. At HPE our goal is to provide equal opportunities, work/life balance, and constantly evolving career opportunities.If you are looking for challenges in a pleasant and international work environment, then we definitely want to hear from you. Description: Rheos Medicines is a biopharmaceutical company harnessing insights in immunometabolism to develop a novel class of medicines with potential to transform the lives of patients with immune mediated diseases. We are rapidly applying a first-in-field approach in immunometabolism with a comprehensive, systems-biology understanding of the metabolic pathways that drive immune cell function and fate coupled to a biomarker discovery effort with potential to bring precision to the treatment of immune-mediated diseases. Launched in 2018 by Third Rock Ventures with a $60 million Series A financing, Rheos is built on groundbreaking science from pioneers in the field, our passionate team of more than 35 employees is advancing a novel pipeline of immunometabolism drugs, and in December 2019, we entered into a worldwide collaboration with Roche to identify and develop new therapeutics for autoimmune and inflammatory disease. We have brought together leading scientists whose discoveries opened the field of immunometabolism, clinicians with a deep understanding of immune-mediated diseases, and an experienced leadership team that integrates immunology, metabolism, computational biology, and drug discovery to unlock a new frontier in precision medicine for immune mediated diseaseThe RoleRheos Medicines is seeking a creative and motivated individual to join the Computational Biology team. The intern/co-op will help to design, develop, and deploy bioinformatic pipelines and applications for visualization and analysis of multi-omics datasets. They will get to work closely with bioinformaticians, biologists and other scientists to understand how high-throughput omics data are generated, processed and analyzed to provide insights into the exciting field of immunometabolism.Requirements & QualificationsBelow are some potential projects and can be adapted based on applicant’s expertise. The most important criteria we are looking for is passion in using omics data to understand biology towards drug discovery and development.Potential projects:Multi-omics analytics and visualization:· Design, development and optimization of Shiny apps for multi-omics data integration and visualization· Opportunity to work with different omics data to design applications that would help scientists find, retrieve, visualize and analyze data· Get to work with big omics datasets and learn how they are used to drive drug discoveryo Required skills:· Basic R· Basic Shiny app development· Basic Postgres databaseo Preferred skills:· Basic JavaScript· Basic UX design· Basic biology· Basic understanding of basic bioinformatics pipelinesNetwork-based omics method evaluation:· Implement and evaluate state-of-the-art methods for network-based omics analyses to identify molecular signatures in omics datasets· Review set of network-based methods for transcriptomics and/or metabolomics data for characterization of molecular signatureso Required skills:· R or Python· Working in Linux environmento Preferred:· Basic database scripting and querying· Basic network theory· Basic graph algorithms· Basic biology or biochemistryReview and implementation single-cell RNAseq workflows:· Single-cell RNAseq (scRNA-seq) analyses can enable us to identify novel disease driving cell relative to traditional profiling methods that assess bulk populations· scRNA-seq is a relatively new technology and hence there are many new pipelines being developed to process and analyze such datasets· A comparison of the leading methods and their performance would help select the pipeline to deploy within Rheoso Required skills:· R or Python· Working in Linux environmento Preferred:· Basic biology or biochemistry· Understand how to implement cloud-based high-performance computing pipelines

Description: Who we areYou'll work with us full-time for about six months, January–June 2021.You’ll work with the organic marketing team, which is part of the Consumer Growth team. The organic marketing team’s goal is to acquire new users for BookBub and Chirp (our audiobook brand) via unpaid channels, including social media marketing, content marketing, search engine optimization (SEO), viral and referral marketing, earned media, and more. You’ll contribute across the team, and responsibilities could include: working on SEO strategy through backlink outreach and editing SEO-focused content; social media work across Pinterest, Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter; aiding in copy editing and publishing original content; optimizing on-site signup experiences; growing our referral marketing program across both channels; contributing to PR outreach efforts; and analyzing data to help inform strategic decisions.Our interviewing philosophy Our goal is to get to know you in a low-pressure, friendly environment — and to give you ample opportunity to learn more about us, too.Our typical process includes these types of experiences:We personally review every application, and if we think there might be a fit, we’ll typically reach out via email within a couple weeks to start the conversation.We will always do what we can to be flexible around your personal time commitments, deadlines, and general availability. Description: EMD Serono Research and Development institute is seeking a Research Assistant – (Co-op) for the Antibody Technologies B-Mine/IMAb Group.Co-op will join an Antibody Technologies sub team that is responsible for High Throughput (HT) discovery of immunoglobulin genes from single B-cells majorly using microfluidic “Beacon” platform. They may also work partially for a sub-group that is responsible for utilizing next generation sequencing (NGS) data for antibody discovery and hit optimization using variety of computational tools in a High Throughput (HT) manner.The Co-op will join a team which supports a wide variety of cutting-edge molecular biology techniques (High Throughput Cloning, PCRs, Sequencing, RNA and DNA preparation) for early drug antibody discovery, with high focus on Berkeley Lights - Beacon enhanced single B cell platform. The co-op will have the opportunity to assist in preliminary experiments involving NGS platforms as well. Additionally, the co-op will also learn to operate automation systems such as QIAGEN BioRobot Universal Systems, iQue Screener, QPix420, epMotion 5073 and 5075 Liquid Handlers, BioXp3200 Gene Synthesis etc. for high throughput screening processes.The candidate will perform all above experiments and may have the opportunity to perform NGS data analysis using R/python programming to discover novel biology of B cells. They will document work in electronic lab notebooks and may present data in weekly group meetings. The co-op will actively interact and work closely with team members within the department and other departments as well. The Co-op will follow and promote safety instructions and regulations according to Quality Management Standards.The candidate should preferably be a graduate (MS degree) in Biotechnology, Molecular biology, Biochemistry, Pharmaceutical Sciences, Immunology, Bioengineering or Biological sciences. Under-graduates with previous coop experience are also encouraged.

Description: Office OverviewCome work for Attorney General Maura Healey and make a difference! Are you looking for more than just a great learning experience? At the Attorney General’s Office, you will be part of “The People’s Law Firm”. Whether working directly with our residents, or supporting our talented and dedicated staff, your work here will contribute to a higher mission of serving the public and making a difference in the lives of others.The Attorney General’s Office is the largest public sector legal office in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. Attorney General Maura Healey is the chief lawyer and law enforcement officer of the Commonwealth. Her office serves as an advocate and resource for the Commonwealth, its residents, and businesses in many areas, including protecting consumers, combating fraud and corruption, protecting civil rights, and promoting meaningful economic stability. The Attorney General's Office is organized into six bureaus. The divisions and teams within each bureau have distinct missions and work closely together to ensure the Attorney General’s Office provides the highest level of public protection. We invite you to explore the work of our office at www.mass.gov/agoWork CultureThe Attorney General’s Office is a professional, collaborative work environment. Our dedicated employees work together with a shared commitment to serving the interests of the Commonwealth. Students have shared these comments about the Office:· “A kind and welcoming atmosphere.”· “The positive energy was very infectious, and it made me strive to work harder as well.”· “The most professional yet fun office I’ve yet to work in.”The Office supports and appreciates the diverse perspectives and backgrounds of our employees and strives to provide a welcoming and inclusive workplace environment for all. We offer a variety of co-op positions, and our co-op students are an integral part of the Office.Position DescriptionThe Assistant Investigator will assist the Medicaid Fraud Division with complex criminal and civil cases involving provider fraud, drug diversion, patient abuse and neglect, and other types of white-collar crimes within the Medicaid program. Duties may include, but are not limited to, the following:· Independent casework under the supervision of investigators and attorneys;· Weekly case meetings;· Data and financial record analysis;· Report and memoranda writing;· Assist with conducting telephonic interviews;· Research program rules, regulations, and laws;· Trial exhibit preparation;· Review of medical records;· Organizational projects; and· General investigative assistance as needed.Depending on the student’s background, review of financial records may include financial statements, cost reports, bank accounts, billing records, and payroll records.Desired QualificationsThe Assistant Investigator should be able to work independently and also on a multidisciplinary team; be proficient with all Microsoft programs, particularly Excel and/or Access; possess strong organizational, analytical, and interpersonal skills; and have strong written and oral communication skills. An understanding of accounting fundamentals including US GAAP is a plus. Prior investigative, paralegal, or auditing experience is preferred, but not required.The Medicaid Fraud Division is looking for a self-motivated candidate who is detail orientated and takes initiative. This is a great position for a student who has an interest in both civil cases and criminal prosecutions and is looking for hands-on experience investigating fraud.Learning and Professional Take-AwaysStudents develop professional skills during their co-op experience while building self-confidence. You can expect to leave this co-op with:· Exposure to the inner workings of a busy government office;· An understanding of how the team that supports the chief lawyer and law enforcement officer of the Commonwealth operates;· Experience working with healthcare claims data, utilizing Excel or Access to identify patterns and trends;· Experience writing about case findings in a clear and concise manner;· Time management skills and experience working on multiple projects; and· Experience being part of an investigative team, including attending case related meetings and communicating with supervisors and co-workers alike.Location and AmenitiesLocation and convenience! We are centrally located at 100 Cambridge Street on Beacon Hill; close to the State House, Boston Common, and Faneuil Hall. We are easily accessible by public transportation, and accessible to the many cultural and social activities offered in the city. Enjoy the convenience of Metro Café, a cafeteria offering a wide variety of affordable food options, located on-site at One Ashburton Place.DURING COVID: The Office has not yet determined work arrangements for the spring, but co-op positions will likely be remote for some or all of the upcoming six-month co-op period. Some in-office work may be required and will be discussed at time of interview.Pay and Work HoursThis position is full-time and pays $14/hour. This is a non-benefitted position with paid earned sick time. The expected work hours are 9:00 to 5:00 with a half hour lunch (37.5 hours per week).The Attorney General’s Office is an Equal Opportunity Employer. As the representative of the Commonwealth and its residents, the Attorney General’s Office strives to ensure that those working in our office reflect the diversity of the communities we serve. The Office encourages applicants from a broad spectrum of backgrounds to apply for positions.

Description: OverviewThe Structural & Thermal-Fluids Engineering Group at MIT Lincoln Laboratory designs and builds structures for the protection and support of advanced airborne sensor and communication systems. These systems operate in a variety of challenging environments, ranging from extreme and variable temperatures to high shock and vibration loads during launch. In support of this mission, we are developing metal matrix composites that can be processed by 3D printing so that materials with high strength and stiffness can be used in components requiring complex shapes and short lead times.Job DescriptionYou will join a research program working to invent stiff, strong, and lightweight aerospace metals for 3D printing by selective laser melting (SLM). The project entails fabrication of metal-ceramic powders, laser consolidation ofthese powders with SLM, and characterization of both powders and printed materials with microscopy, mechanical testing, and other methods. Although the focus of the project is experimental, you will use modeling and theory to plan and interpret experiments. Programming of build files and the 3D printer itself may also be involved.Requirements:

Description: Office OverviewCome work for Attorney General Maura Healey and make a difference! Are you looking for more than just a great learning experience? At the Attorney General’s Office, you will be part of “The People’s Law Firm”. Whether working directly with our residents, or supporting our talented and dedicated staff, your work here will contribute to a higher mission of serving the public and making a difference in the lives of others.The Attorney General’s Office is the largest public sector legal office in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. Attorney General Maura Healey is the chief lawyer and law enforcement officer of the Commonwealth. Her office serves as an advocate and resource for the Commonwealth, its residents, and businesses in many areas, including protecting consumers, combating fraud and corruption, protecting civil rights, and promoting meaningful economic stability. The Attorney General's Office is organized into six bureaus. The divisions and teams within each bureau have distinct missions and work closely together to ensure the Attorney General’s Office provides the highest level of public protection. We invite you to explore the work of our office at www.mass.gov/agoWork CultureThe Attorney General’s Office is a professional, collaborative work environment. Our dedicated employees work together with a shared commitment to serving the interests of the Commonwealth. Students have shared these comments about the Office:· “A kind and welcoming atmosphere.”· “The positive energy was very infectious, and it made me strive to work harder as well.”· “The most professional yet fun office I’ve yet to work in.”The Office supports and appreciates the diverse perspectives and backgrounds of our employees and strives to provide a welcoming and inclusive workplace environment for all. We offer a variety of co-op positions, and our co-op students are an integral part of the Office.Position DescriptionThe Consumer Advocacy & Response Division (CARD) provides information, referrals and assistance to consumers in response to written consumer complaints received by mail or from our website. CARD seeks to achieve resolution for consumers by offering free consumer assistance services. CARD also supports the Office’s Information Services Center (ISC) which operates a hotline Monday through Friday. from 10:00 am until 4:00 pm.CARD and ISC offer a full-time, paid co-op opportunity to a student interested in consumer issues, public service, law, or business. The co-op student will receive training to perform three primary job-related functions: staff the Information Services Center hotline; read and respond to written inquiries; and conduct advocacy work between consumers and businesses. The co-op student will learn state and federal consumer laws and will assist with CARD administrative projects such as records management. The student will have a caseload and spend approximately twelve hours per week on the consumer hotline. A significant portion of the duties involve working with and providing support to a person with a visual impairment. The selected co-op may also assist with large projects and perform other duties as required.Desired QualificationsApplicants with an interest in consumer issues, public service, law, or business are encouraged to apply. We seek students with the following:· Strong computer and keyboard skills;· Dependability, flexibility, and the ability to work effectively with the public;· Strong writing and verbal communication skills;· Proficiency with Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, and database applications (preferred);· A serious commitment to this job as a full-time position.. Familiarity with a professional office environment and previous customer service experience are a plus.. Professional and presentable office attire is required.Learning and Professional Take-AwaysStudents develop professional skills during their co-op experience while building self-confidence. You can expect to leave this co-op with:· Experience working in a professional office setting;· Exposure to the inner workings of a busy government office;. Experience using a case management database and electronic records system;. Experience in managing work projects and communicating with supervisors and co-workers;·  A solid foundation in consumer protections issues facing the Commonwealth and the relevant laws of the state;·  Significant training on consumer topics and customer service;.  An understanding of confidentiality and issues around sensitive personal information;.  Improved writing skills.Location and AmenitiesLocation and convenience! We are centrally located at One Ashburton Place on Beacon Hill; close to the State House, Boston Common, and Faneuil Hall. We are easily accessible by public transportation, and accessible to the many cultural and social activities offered in the city. Enjoy the convenience of Metro Café, a cafeteria offering a wide variety of affordable food options, located on-site at One Ashburton Place.DURING COVID: The Office has not yet determined work arrangements for the spring, but co-op positions will likely be remote for some or all of the upcoming six-month co-op period. Some in-office work may be required and will be discussed at time of interview.Pay and Work HoursThis position is full-time and pays $14/hour. This is a non-benefitted position with paid earned sick time. The expected work hours are 9:00 to 5:00 with a half hour lunch (37.5 hours per week).Former Co-ops have this to say about their experience:· "CARD provides a rewarding atmosphere for those who want to learn and have some insight to state government!"· "Thank you all for such an eye-opening and memorable experience. I have really enjoyed my last six months working for this office. I still can’t believe how much I’ve learned in such a short amount of time. I owe my positive experience working here to all of you. I really appreciate how welcoming and helpful you all have been during my time here. This was truly an unforgettable experience."· "Today is my last day in the office, and I wanted to thank everyone for making my time at the AGO a memorable, exciting, and truly enriching experience. I want to thank everyone for their contributions in making this Co-op meaningful for me, and I will never forget the knowledge and friendships that have developed over time from working in this office. These past 6 months have been amazing, and I am happy I got to spend it with amazing people. I will miss everyone!"· "Thank you all so much for making my co-op experience so worthwhile. Working with CARD has been challenging for me and has made me step outside of my comfort zone in a big way, but I’ve learned an incredible amount, not only about conducting myself professionally, but how to be a smart, responsible consumer myself. Thank you all for a busy, rewarding six months."The Attorney General’s Office is an Equal Opportunity Employer. As the representative of the Commonwealth and its residents, the Attorney General’s Office strives to ensure that those working in our office reflect the diversity of the communities we serve. The Office encourages applicants from a broad spectrum of backgrounds to apply for positions.

Description: Greetings, students! We’re geared up here to offer another round of epic internship experiences in summer 2021. The internship program offers the opportunity to pause your studies for one summer and work side-by-side with Blizzard Entertainment employees in your area of interest, doing real work that oftentimes ends up in production. As such, we hold you to the same high standards as anybody else in the company.Just like our gameplay experiences, Blizzard internships are a fully immersive experience. We want interns who are enthusiastic about what they want to do for a living and excited to come in every day to learn and contribute in this hyper-creative atmosphere. Being fully engaged with our team also means communicating effectively and maintaining an open mind - one that is receptive to feedback and able to adapt and grow. Your hobbies and interests can also play in your favor. Passion for technology, gaming, game development, and an in-depth knowledge of Blizzard games, products, and services will always be a plus with us, regardless of the position you’re applying for. Be passionate about who you are, be into our industry, and be willing to go all-in and embrace this opportunity to the fullest!QUEST OBJECTIVESWe’re seeking post-graduate students to help us analyze and build data-powered products and services for Blizzard. Interns will follow the full end-to-end project model used by data scientists at Blizzard and have the opportunity to share their results with game and product teams. Intern projects are tailored to candidate strengths and fit to ongoing opportunities across game teams and Blizzard-wide services.What’s life like as a data scientist and what can you expect? Whether working with game teams (e.g., Hearthstone, Overwatch, or WoW) or support teams (e.g., Battle.net or marketing) we regularly meet stakeholders to define and refine our project goals. From these goals we build and iterate on analytical models: pulling data, analyzing and testing assumptions, building models, and vetting the model conclusions. As we refine these models, services, or products we present the results to stakeholders, ultimately augmenting stakeholder decision-making (e.g., segmenting our player base) or delivering automated models (e.g., a matchmaking algorithm).This position is a unique opportunity to work closely with game and product teams (designers, engineers, and analysts) to take your data science knowledge and turn it into analyses, products, or services impacting the games you love!QUEST REQUIREMENTS· Currently enrolled in a college or university· Returning for at least one more semester or quarter following the Summer 2021 internship· Able to work fulltime hours for 11 – 12 weeks at the Blizzard office indicated in this job posting between May 2021 – August 2021 or June 2021 – September 2021 (group dates depend on when you get out of school)· Authorized to work in the USLEVEL REQUIREMENTS· Pursuing a Masters or PhD in computer science, statistics, math, or related quantitative fields (e.g., economics, physics, psychology)· Experience building and evaluating machine learning or statistical models· Passion for gaming!· Proficient in R, Python, or related programming languages· Strong written and spoken communication skillsRECOMMENDED TALENTS· Database querying (e.g., SQL, HiveQL)· Data visualization (e.g., R plotting, matplotlib, Tableau)· Accomplished in Blizzard games (e.g., 12 wins in Hearthstone arena, Diamond rank in Overwatch, or max-level in WoW)QUEST ITEMS· Resume· Cover LetterWARNING! Applications that do not include all of the required materials will not be considered. We’re serious about this – due to the volume of applications we receive, we only have time to consider complete submittals.Blizzard Entertainment is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.Blizzard Entertainment is a global company committed to growing our employees along with the business. We offer generous benefits and perks with an eye on providing true work / life balance. We’ve worked hard to foster a deeply collaborative and creative environment, a diverse and inclusive employee culture, and training and opportunity for professional growth. Our people are everything. Our core values are real, and our mission has never changed. We are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences…ever. Join us!

With NIBR Informatics (NX) department, scientists are able to do their work with the digital tools, systems and services that are critical to the future of drug discovery.We are looking for a bright and eager student to join the User Experience Research and Design group in NX. Description: In this Co-op experience, the student would have the opportunity to be exposed to psychiatry-related clinical and research activities, with specific emphasis on 1) supportingresearch studies with patients with schizophrenia and psychotic disorders and 2) supporting the development and administration of our department’s WRAP program (Wellness & Recovery After Psychosis) and First Episode Psychosis (FEP) program within our outpatient behavioral health service. Students will gain exposure to a wide range of research responsibilities throughout the project lifespan including protocol development, operationalization, participant recruitment and screening, Internal Review Board (IRB) submissions, data collection, administration of clinical assessments, data entry and quality assurance (QA), literature reviews, study visit scheduling and maintenance of regulatory documentation. Exceptional and highly motivated students may also be afforded presentation and publication opportunities. The student may also have the opportunity to get involved in with other research projects throughout the department of psychiatry, which may be further tailored to their specific interests, e.g. biostatistical data analysis, exposure to qualitative research.On the clinical administration side, the student would work closely with the Director of the WRAP program to support the administration of this program including coordinating intake appointments with patients, developing program materials including website development and maintenance, supporting program staff in the administration of the clinical intake battery with opportunity to observe and potentially administer to patients, helping with patient and family engagement and follow-up, and collection of quality improvement (QI) and process data. The student may also gain clinical experience through: - Shadowing physicians and clinicians throughout the department (MDs, PhDs, LICSWs, NPs, RNs, etc)- Conducting clinical assessments with human subjects as part of research protocols The student will also be tasked with important administrative responsibilities, which may include: - Preparation and facilitation of research meetings including A/V set-up and meeting minutes - Preparing study materials for research visits - Facilitating protocol logistics such as picking up pharmacy prescriptions - Organization and maintenance of study regulatory materials - Searches for additional funding opportunities and potentially contributing to grant writing - Upkeep of the Department of Psychiatry's newsletter and WRAP website Other career development opportunities include: - Attending weekly Department of Psychiatry Grand Rounds - Contributing to activities within our department's Global and Local Center for Mental Health Disparities - Attending our Global Dinner Series (speakers involved in diverse global mental health initiatives) - Attending a wide range of educational seminars and workshops for BU and BMC employeesThe student would report directly to the Director of the WRAP program and the Research Coordinator, who would supervise them and assist in balancing responsibilities and managing priorities. Co-ops may have opportunities to become involved in analysis of both qualitative and quantitative data. Outstanding co-ops may also have the opportunity to contribute to research manuscripts and to present research at poster sessions and conferences. Personal Qualities: - Adherence to the highest standards of professional conduct, including both verbal, non-verbal and written (including email) forms of communication - Team-oriented attitude with ability to also work independently - Strong interpersonal aptitude for working with vulnerable and challenging mental health populations including those with serious mental illness (e.g. schizophrenia, major depression, bipolar disorder) - Extremely well-organized and detail-oriented - Ability to handle concurrent, competing and shifting priorities - Excellent writing and communication skills

Description: (REMOTE)Who isServiceNow?Imagine your workday dominated less by emails and spreadsheets and more time given back to you to do your actual job. At ServiceNow, we are making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud-based platform and products streamline and simplify how work gets done across the enterprise. We are the fastest growing enterprise cloud software company in the world and was recently recognized on Fortune’s Future 50 list (https://fortune.com/future-50/2019/) For us, this is just the start.Who is Marketing at ServiceNow?Marketing is the engine room for growth at ServiceNow. We fuel the success of our customers, sales, and products. We have a customer-first mindset in all that we do. As a Marketing team, we are laser-focused on how we can connect with our customers by creating simple, sweet spot targeting, and by the positioning and packaging of our products and solutions. We help our customers gain the most value from our products by providing best practices, business cases and trainings. We also partner closely with Sales to build high-quality pipeline through targeted Marketing activities ranging from thought leadership, strategic and executive events, webinars, digital acquisition, SEO, and more!About the team:A best in class Product and Solutions Marketing team that creates authentic and connective storytelling to build trust and inspire customers to transform enterprises and employee experiences across the world. We are responsible for marketing strategy and connectedness through messaging and positioning, product and solution launches, sales and field enablement and execution of go-to-market.Successful Candidate will:o Market Analysis & Competitive Intelligence: Conduct primary and secondary competitive research, and maintain a current view of the competitive landscape by documenting customer uses cases, win stories and creating content and assetso Messaging: Participate in crafting narratives that communicate product positioning and value proposition to connect, inspire and help enterprise customers wino Launch: Support creation of compelling end-to-end GTM (Go-to-Market) content for launch including analyst and press communications, demand generation, digital/social engagement, and field readiness while ensuring consistency across different channels and regions to engage with and deliver to customers and partnerso Sales Enablement and Readiness: Assist with content, activities and manage tools/systems that drive sales productivity and results through training and coaching, and preparation to have value and solutions oriented conversationsRole Requirements:· Currently enrolled at an accredited University pursuing a bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing,Psychology, EnglishMajor, or a similar field· Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal· Strong quantitative skills, and ability to use metrics to drive decision making· Self-starter with initiative and attention to detail· Positive attitude, and growth mindset to be curious about what works, what doesn’t and why· Good relationship building skills· Agility and speed, able to work in a fast-paced environment

Description: Organization name: SukhibhavaAt Sukhibhava, we are passionate about making menstruation a non-issue through our engagement with men, women, adolescent boys and girls in marginalised and rural communities across India. Scaling this movement through The Period Fellowship is critical to achieving our vision of reaching 1.5 million people over the next five years. We’re seeking a passionate volunteer to help us redesign and launch the 2021 fellowship for a COVID-19 context.The Period Fellowship:The Period Fellowship is a paid 15 month full-time leadership journey designed to nurture future male and female leaders in the MHH ecosystem, and to scale Sukhibhava’s community model. Starting off with a rigorous boot-camp where the fellows are trained on delivering the MHH intervention, find and work on their unique strengths, and use that to shape their future journeys in the space. Period Fellows gain an understanding of menstruation in a rural or marginalised context and experience a combination of grassroots field work, stakeholder management and leadership, where they are encouraged to step out of their comfort zones and up to the plate of shaping the narrative around MHH in India.Pre-COVID19 Model:Current Context:COVID-19 disproportionately impacts women and girls, especially in urban slum or rural communities where managing menstruation and sexual reproductive health can become increasingly challenging as lockdowns, economic uncertainty and taboos persist. In response to the unfolding crisis, Sukhibhava has initiated a free menstrual health helpline and tele-medicine services to continue sharing credible and contextual knowledge and discreetly address women’s concerns around menstrual health and hygiene and sexual reproductive health.The prevalence of COVID-19 also means we need to rethink how we approach The Period Fellowship activities in 2021 as a community based intervention may not be feasible.What you’ll do: Support the leadership team in reviewing The Period Fellowship (TPF) program design, recruitment and impact in response to COVID-19 Manage The Period Fellowship recruitment processes for the 2021 cohort Manage marketing and communication efforts around The Period Fellowship 2021 launch Support the Operations team in nurturing strategic partnerships across India to support The Period Fellowship planned operationsWho you are: Passionate about gender equity, women empowerment and menstrual health Ability to thrive in ambiguity, remain cool-headed when there are curve balls and withstand the tests of a rapidly changing environment with resilience and resolve An exceptional communicator with an ability to drive accountability An instinctive self-starter and problem solver who can quickly identify opportunities and make the most of them Low ego, collaborative team member; motivated to work with other verticals to improve the quality of interventions Highly organized and resourceful, with an ability to drive focus, clarity and prioritization Data driven with excellent documentation skills; ability to analyse and share key insights with HQ team Empathetic, respectful and grounded with a strong understanding of the role organisation’s culture Fluent in spoken and written EnglishWhat we offer: A flexible remote working culture rooted in our organisational values of respect, empathy and trust Growth and development opportunities to engage with our comprehensive Content design Frameworks, Organisation principles and design philosophy, Monitoring & Evaluation tools, Theory of Change and Impact Assessment and Training methodologies Access to a flourishing network within the social development sector Mentoring and support on top-notch training and facilitation philosophies and skills Internal and External learning opportunities to further skills and interest areas Support and collaboration with a highly-committed team, and a strong organisational culturePrograms and services offered by Bridge CulturesOnline workshops/webinars:Students learn about the culture and multiple facets and influences on various aspects of life through conversations with people they would meet while in Bangalore. With a remote co-op, Bridge Cultures will enable these conversations virtually. We will organize 3 virtual webinars and workshops on various topics in context to cultural integration which will align with students’ professional and personal growth. Bridge Cultures will bring professionals from various domains and facilitate these interactive sessions.Few topics (not confined to) are listed below:· Social entrepreneurship· Know the city - food, culture, people· Leadership and Teamwork· Unconscious biases· Critical thinking· Influence of culture on design, education, outdoor education, experiential education· Sustainability· Mental health, emotional well-being· Impact of traveling on our personalitySelf-reflection session:Bridge Cultures believes that self-reflection is highly important and necessary to learn and grow, especially after working with a social enterprise on an impactful project. Out of many reasons, reflection is important because it:· Enables the individuals to process and make meaning of the experience· Fosters a better understanding of context. i.e. understanding how their work impacts the community and encourages more participation in future· Creates a sense of accomplishment· Enables the individuals to examine the effects of their behavior, discover ways to improve· Reinforces the feeling of empathy gained during the experience· Acknowledges the skills gained during the experience and builds confidenceProgram fees - USD $455Inclusions:· Co-op placement· Necessary documentation· Self-Reflection session· 2-3 online webinars/workshops on various topics· Review meetings during co-op to track progress· Social networkProcess:1. Students apply for various positions through NU works2. Bridge Cultures will send an email to the student to schedule a call3.   After the student’s response to that email, a call will be scheduled between the student, Ms. Aspa Papanastasiou (Associate Director, Global engagements at NU), and Bridge Cultures to ensure accountability from the student’s side4. Another call will be scheduled with Bridge Cultures (if needed) to understand the student’s interest, motivation, and expectations from the co-op5. The student will pay the Program fees to Bridge Cultures ($455)6. Bridge Cultures will facilitate the call between student and the organization7. The organization will communicate their response to Bridge Cultures and the student8. If the student is selected, the organization will share the appointment/offer letter with Bridge Cultures9. Bridge Cultures will share the appointment letter with the student10. The student will start the co-op on the decided dates11. Bridge Cultures will facilitate virtual onboarding if necessary12. Bridge Cultures will facilitate 3 online sessions on various topics and organize 2 review meetings during the co-op13. Bridge Cultures will facilitate self-reflection session at the end of the co-opRefund policy:· If the student is not selected by the first organization interviewed for, Bridge Cultures will find another position with another organization. If the student is not selected there as well, 50% of the program fees will be refunded to the student· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op prior to confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 25% of the program fees (this is to factor the currency transaction charges that incurs to Bridge Cultures)· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op after receiving confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 75% of the program fees

Description: NOTE: Students must apply on NUworks and company website:https://careers.analog.com/job/ANLGUS7835/Data-Scientist-InternCome Join Analog Devices – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For the past 50 years, Analog Devices has been inventing innovative technologies that transform lives. Get hands-on experience working with the brightest minds to solve complex problems that matter: from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality to remote healthcare. Description: Come Join Analog Devices – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For the past 50 years, Analog Devices has been inventing innovative technologies that transform lives. Get hands-on experience working with the brightest minds to solve complex problems that matter: from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality to remote healthcare. Enjoy a culture that values aligned goals, balanced work-life priorities, continuous learning throughout your career and shared rewards. At ADI, we invest in you and succeed together because we believe that happy, healthy, intellectually-challenged people drive our growth and market leadership.ADI at a GlanceADI helps customers bridge the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that solve real-life problems and make the world smarter, healthier, greener and safer. With over $5 billion in revenue, ADI specializes in high-performance analog, mixed-signal, power, and digital signal processing (DSP) integrated circuits that sense, measure, interpret, connect, power, secure and transform how the world experiences the world around them.Analog Devices’ Aerospace and Defense group is seeking a highly motivated Intern/Co-op/Part-Time Employee for the role of Product Engineer. ADI’s Aerospace and Defense (ADEF) Module and Subsystem group designs RF/Microwave products ranging from 1GHz up to 70GHz for commercial, military, and space applications. Products include receivers, transmitters, low spur/phase noise synthesizers, high-power GaN amplifiers, and multifunction modules.Primary Responsibilities:• Interact with multi-functional teams to move RF Amplifier products from design to production• Support product engineering development of hardware and software for automated and manual tests• Perform and document lab bench test for device characterization• Use statistical analysis to process large amounts of data• Support creation of data analysis reports for use by Product/Test Engineering staff during device evaluations and qualification• Support customer sample screening when necessaryMinimum Qualifications:• Enrolled in an Electrical or Computer Engineering undergraduate or graduate program• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills• Ability to work independently and as a team memberAdditional Qualifications:• Knowledgeable in RF measurements and signal processing• Knowledge of LabVIEW, Python, Visual BASIC, and/or C/C++ preferredFor positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process.Analog Devices, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Females/Vet/DisabilityEEO is the Law:Notice of Applicant Rights Under the Law

Description: OverviewMLJ Contracting is a premier general contractor performing public works projects for major agencies in the New York heavy construction market. We provide quality workmanship to our customers, fair and high-integrity relationships to our suppliers and subcontractors, challenging and rewarding careers to our employees, and a safe and professional work site for all.MLJ Contracting began operations approximately one and half years ago, but our Principals have been executives in the New York area Public Works Construction sector for more than 30 years. Throughout our careers we have performed high profile projects for agencies like the MTA, Port Authority, and New York City DOT, DDC, and DEP. To date MLJ has been awarded 5 projects totaling $500 million in work. Our projects include ADA and other improvements to the MTA’s Times Square / Grand Central Shuttle ($132 million), restoration of the Arches and Towers of the Brooklyn Bridge ($238.3 million), and the Design/Build Construction of the Police Command Center at the World Trade Center ($79 million). We are well financed and positioned for continued growth.The Project Engineer Intern/ Co-op applies basic concepts and techniques to plan projects, develop basic installation drawings and contribute to intermediate project milestones. He or she has knowledge in civil engineering concepts and can quickly adapt to a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate will be eager to learn and work well in a team setting.In addition to daily assignments the intern/ co-op is assigned one complete project work item that he or she is solely responsible for. He or she will work closely with the Project Manager to implement policies and procedures required for item’s success. The intern/ co-op will maintain a good knowledge of the contract specifications, documents and the scope of work, including subcontracts and purchase orders and assist in development of project status reports and profit projections. In addition, the intern/ co-op is responsible for monitoring activities at construction sites and assisting the Superintendent and Project Manager with site management.ResponsibilitesQualificationsEduction / Certifications

Description: The student will use computational methods we have developed to predict the function of protein structures of unknown function, based on computed chemical properties of the individual amino acids. The student will adapt these tools to assign function and map the wood degradation pathway of the host and symbiont proteins of a wood-eating mollusk. Through collaborations, the student’s predictions will be tested experimentally by direct biochemical assay. The ultimate goal is to design an enzymatic system for the production of biofuels, for a healthier, sustainable method of energy production that does not consume human food resources.To apply: Please submit a resume and a short cover letter addressing the following questions:1. ROUTES is an NIH-funded program designed to support students from underrepresented backgrounds in environmental health research. How does the diversity of your experiences and background inform your work or eligibility for ROUTES?2. This includes all things program preparation and management, marketing/PR, and company support.Operations & Program Management (50% of time)Participate in strategic planningResearch and present on investment opportunities (during diligence period)Create Program curriculum & agendaSchedule and communicate Classes, workshops, sessions, and events to all stakeholdersSupport staff with research and execution of events as neededWork with Ops Director to determine Marketing Strategy and execute on marketing campaigns (promo of applications, selected companies, and general marketing throughout cycle)Run Social Media (light promotion) & Monthly Newsletter (monthly Mailchimp newsletter)Manage Website Updates (Wordpress updates for Blogs, Portfolio, etc.)Work with Portfolio Companies (10% of time)The selected Associate will be assigned at least one company oftheirchoice during each program to work with on a weekly basis for project-based assignments.Assist in scheduling and communicating cadence of weekly Accelerator Partner meetingsWork with Founders to determine meeting agenda and communicate weekly objectivesConduct micro-projects with companies, based on co-op's interestsThe selected Associate will also support Senior Staff members in their daily activities. Ensure clarity and strong coordination of the partner's daily activities.Proactively maintain partner's calendar; arrange upcoming meetings and conferences and prepare partner by providing supporting information.Manage or assist with special projects and events as needed including conducting research, event planning, preparation for speaking and other engagements, etc.Who we're looking for:Successful candidates will be those ready to roll up their sleeves and jump right into the deep end. We're a small, scrappy team on a mission to both drive innovation to transform learning and support founders in achieving their dreams.You'll thrive here if you...love a mix of managing projects autonomously and working really closely on a team. Both extremes happen at LearnLaunch!have acquired at least a basic understanding of business/startup terminology and principles.want to learn and grow. There is a lot to learn at the Accelerator, both in terms of content about education, how to run businesses, how to work with people and in teams. Candidates who really want to learn and grow professionally will have the space, time, and opportunity to do it here.LearnLaunch Acceleratoris looking for an Associate to join their dynamic, fast-paced, innovative work environment! This critical team member will join the leading edtech startup accelerator on a mission to improve teaching and learning by growing great education technology startups.LearnLaunch Accelerator (www.learnlaunch.com/accelerator) has two investment-focused programs as well as personalized bootcamps for edtech companies across Early Childhood Education, K-12, Higher Ed, and Workforce Edtech. Programs are 1-3 month immersive experiences for early-stage founders who need support building their businesses. Using a mix of mentors, curriculum, partners, and strategic support, LearnLaunch Accelerator improves the chance that a company succeeds.LearnLaunch Accelerator provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Description: Please apply on NUWorks and Online.Joining HPE in an early career role is an excellent opportunity for a self-motivated, proactive individual to grow with us and help us drive our continued success globally. We are one of the largest technology companies in the world, operating in over 150 countries and market leading in several industries. We believe in partnership, innovation and taking action – our culture is what defines us as a company: how we act, how we treat others, and how we conduct business. In addition to working alongside great colleagues, you will have many opportunities to learn through coaching and stretch assignment opportunities.You’ll be guided by feedback and support to accelerate your learning and maximize your knowledge. We even have a “reverse mentoring” program which allows us to share our knowledge and strengths across our multi-generation workforce.An Information Developer possesses a general passion for technology, strong technical-communication skills, and deep understanding of coding and data administration in the big data /data analytics space,In this role, you will identify what content will enable Data Fabric customers (data administrators or application developers) to be successful. You will design and create that content primarily using text and illustrations. You will work on fast-moving projects that typically have high complexity, impact, and visibility. You will regularly exercise significant judgment within your project area and you will be expected to work independently with the guidance of experienced team members. You will leverage productivity tools like Jira to manage your work load and source management tools Git and Github to manage your changes in the shared work environment. You will work on multiple work items simultaneously, so you must be able to track and manage your work using the supplied tools.You will work under the guidance of experienced Information Developers and your manager.You will work with developers, product managers, and sales engineers to identify new features and content that needs to be improved. You must test the procedures you create, so you must become comfortable testing products that are in development.The HPE Ezmeral Data Fabric team has a highly collaborative culture, so you will be expected to work well in a team environment.Requires BS in CS or a BS in engineering or technical communication with a CS minor. Optimally, applicants will also have technical-communication experience via internships or school projects. Writing samples will be requested and you will be required to do a basic writing skills test. What we can offer you:Extensive benefits, a competitive salary and participation in the shared values and purpose that make Hewlett Packard Enterprise one of the world´s most attractive employers! At HPE, our goal is to provide equal opportunities, flexible work-life balance, and constantly evolving career growth.If you are looking for challenges in an exciting, supportive and international work environment, then we definitely want to hear from you. Continue the conversation by clicking apply now below, or directly via our Careers Portal atwww.hpe.com/careers.Join us and make your mark!HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to diversity and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We do not discriminate and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global diverse team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together.
