Description: You must apply both on NUworks and using this link:https://grnh.se/afea55302usIT Engineering Co-opTo be eligible for this role, you must be available for the full 6 months (January 11-June 25)Employee Tech is Wayfair’s IT Department. The team is on a mission to constantly challenge the status quo to provide an exceptional end-user experience. We strive to enable employee productivity with a suite of tools and technologies that grow as the business grows, and we maintain a focus at all times on understanding the needs of our business partners so that we can build around those needs. The team partners with stakeholders across the organization to create and deliver flexible solutions that empower our desktop & development computing environments, in-office tech, back-end applications, and cloud services. We are looking for both IT Engineering Hardware Co-ops and IT Onboarding co-ops. Please see the specific job descriptions below.Our IT Engineering department is looking for dynamic, hardworking and talented students to join us on our fun, dynamic, and collaborative team. As a Wayfair Employee Technology Co-op, you will dive right into a number of complex technical projects while also gaining a better understanding of our business. Coming in you will have the opportunity to join the IT Onboarding Operations team. Below are the specific job descriptions.IT Onboarding Co-opAt Wayfair, we are looking to grow and develop a team that handles new employee onboarding by bringing on meticulous, hard-working individuals, who are looking for entry-level experience in corporate IT. Individuals will gain experience in technologies and operations that support our infrastructure and our remarkable employees. We offer an opportunity for driven individuals to get on board with a growing organization that has become a noteworthy innovator in the e-commerce world.What You'll Do | ResponsibilitiesWhat You'll Need | QualificationsIT Hardware Operations Co-opThe Hardware Operations Co-op plays a critical role in enabling the Wayfair Community by managing stock, imaging computers, deploying licenses and supporting the overall lifecycle of an asset.The role will work closely with Wayfair's IT Service Desk, the team responsible for fielding all IT requests, issues, questions, etc. from the Wayfair global user base. They will also work with teams across IT, such as the IT Onboarding who physically deploy equipment to new employees.What You'll Do | ResponsibilitiesWhat You'll Need | QualificationsTechnology Experience Co-opThe Technology Experience team plays a critical role within IT by acting as the champions of technology adoption across Wayfair. The team has three core functions: (1) employee feedback collection used to inform priorities, (2) technical solutions to tackle complex user problems and create solutions, and (3) change management to facilitate end user behavior changes for IT rollouts. This role will partner with teams throughout IT and be involved in processes that impact the entire department. Through proactive partnership and constant data collection, the team creates a better Wayfair-experience for all end users.What You'll Do | ResponsibilitiesWhat You'll Need | QualificationsAbout Us:Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences and diversity, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.

Knowledge of R programming and analytic and visualization skills are a plus.Depending on the individual’s skills, they will have the opportunity to:·    Plan and run their experiments and develop novel assays using human patient samples implementing state-of-the art technologies·    Run R scripts to improve our process of data reporting, hi-content analysis, etc.·    Design analysis pipelines to analyze large datasets of de-identified patient biological dataThis is a great opportunity to learn about biomedical research in an industry setting, to perform work that will impact drug development timelines, and to learn about the drug development process in a dynamic and highly productive organization.Location: Summit, NJ

Description: Development Sciences Informatics SpecialistThe Safety Assessment department plays a critical role in the development of safe and effective medicines at Roche. The Safety Assessment toxicologists and pathologists run in vivo studies, among others, to determine safety risks associated with the drug candidates. The dataset collected during these studies serves it’s primary purpose to answer the questions posed by the study; however, this same dataset becomes an asset for the computational toxicologists and data scientists who are answering drug safety questions using deep learning predictive safety methods. To meet the everyday needs of the toxicologists and to enable the predictive safety methods, we have created a Safety Assessment data repository that contains all of the in vivo toxicology study data. The majority of the data within the Safety Assessment Data Repository solution is presented to the scientists within Safety Assessment through a data visualization tool called SEND Explorer. The data that is not in scope for visualization in SEND Explorer can be accessed by those who are able to query our SADR mart tables through AWS Athena via Presto.This project will center on creating a dashboard-like user interface to the SADR mart that would enable all of the scientists to easily browse, view, and download all in vivo study datasets within the SADR solution. In order to enable viewing of a few non-standardized data domains, the project would require data modeling and data engineering to enable consistent cross-study data visualizations.Competencies and Qualifications:

Description: About the organization:Labhya Foundation is an India-based educational nonprofit. Labhya enables children from low socio-economic backgrounds with necessary skills to cope with the ill-effects of poverty & become lifelong learners through SEL interventions, at scale.(Create an effective and attractive social media strategy to create awareness about mental health/Social and Emotional Learning (SEL) in India as well as Labhya’s requirements).Required skills/Personal skills:We, at Labhya give more importance to skill rather than an individual's qualifications, thus following are the basic skill requirements for the above-mentioned role –Skills gained by the end of the internship:  Experience in development and impact communication  Creating informational content for positive social change  Autonomy to plan and execute strategies  Effective time-management  CollaborationOnline workshops/webinars:Students learn about the culture and multiple facets and influences on various aspects of life through conversations with people they would meet while in Bangalore. With a remote co-op, Bridge Cultures will enable these conversations virtually. We will organize 3 virtual webinars and workshops on various topics in context to cultural integration which will align with students’ professional and personal growth. Bridge Cultures will bring professionals from various domains and facilitate these interactive sessions.Few topics (not confined to) are listed below:· Social entrepreneurship· Know the city - food, culture, people· Leadership and Teamwork· Unconscious biases· Critical thinking· Influence of culture on design, education, outdoor education, experiential education· Sustainability· Mental health, emotional well-being· Impact of traveling on our personalitySelf-reflection session:Bridge Cultures believes that self-reflection is highly important and necessary to learn and grow, especially after working with a social enterprise on an impactful project. Out of many reasons, reflection is important because it:· Enables the individuals to process and make meaning of the experience· Fosters a better understanding of context. i.e. understanding how their work impacts the community and encourages more participation in future· Creates a sense of accomplishment· Enables the individuals to examine the effects of their behavior, discover ways to improve· Reinforces the feeling of empathy gained during the experience· Acknowledges the skills gained during the experience and builds confidenceInclusions:· Co-op placement· Necessary documentation· Self-Reflection session· 2-3 online webinars/workshops on various topics· Review meetings during co-op to track progress· Social networkProcess:1. Students apply for various positions through NU works2. Bridge Cultures will send an email to the student to schedule a call3.   After the student’s response to that email, a call will be scheduled between the student, Ms. Aspa Papanastasiou (Associate Director, Global engagements at NU), and Bridge Cultures to ensure accountability from the student’s side4. Another call will be scheduled with Bridge Cultures (if needed) to understand the student’s interest, motivation, and expectations from the co-op5. The student will pay the Program fees to Bridge Cultures ($455)6. Bridge Cultures will facilitate the call between student and the organization7. The organization will communicate their response to Bridge Cultures and the student8. If the student is selected, the organization will share the appointment/offer letter with Bridge Cultures9. Bridge Cultures will share the appointment letter with the student10. The student will start the co-op on the decided dates11. Bridge Cultures will facilitate virtual onboarding if necessary12. Bridge Cultures will facilitate 3 online sessions on various topics and organize 2 review meetings during the co-op13. Bridge Cultures will facilitate self-reflection session at the end of the co-opRefund policy:· If the student is not selected by the first organization interviewed for, Bridge Cultures will find another position with another organization. If the student is not selected there as well, 50% of the program fees will be refunded to the student· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op prior to confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 25% of the program fees (this is to factor the currency transaction charges that incurs to Bridge Cultures)· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op after receiving confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 75% of the program fees

Description: Specific skills / Personal skills:Online workshops/webinars:Students learn about the culture and multiple facets and influences on various aspects of life through conversations with people they would meet while in Bangalore. With a remote co-op, Bridge Cultures will enable these conversations virtually. We will organize 3 virtual webinars and workshops on various topics in context to cultural integration which will align with students’ professional and personal growth. Bridge Cultures will bring professionals from various domains and facilitate these interactive sessions.Few topics (not confined to) are listed below:· Social entrepreneurship· Know the city - food, culture, people· Leadership and Teamwork· Unconscious biases· Critical thinking· Influence of culture on design, education, outdoor education, experiential education· Sustainability· Mental health, emotional well-being· Impact of traveling on our personalitySelf-reflection session:Bridge Cultures believes that self-reflection is highly important and necessary to learn and grow, especially after working with a social enterprise on an impactful project. Out of many reasons, reflection is important because it:· Enables the individuals to process and make meaning of the experience· Fosters a better understanding of context. i.e. understanding how their work impacts the community and encourages more participation in future· Creates a sense of accomplishment· Enables the individuals to examine the effects of their behavior, discover ways to improve· Reinforces the feeling of empathy gained during the experience· Acknowledges the skills gained during the experience and builds confidenceFees and process:Program fees - USD $455Inclusions:· Co-op placement· Necessary documentation· Self-Reflection session· 2-3 online webinars/workshops on various topics· Review meetings during co-op to track progress· Social networkProcess:1. Students apply for various positions through NU works2. Bridge Cultures will send an email to the student to schedule a call3.   After the student’s response to that email, a call will be scheduled between the student, Ms. Aspa Papanastasiou (Associate Director, Global engagements at NU), and Bridge Cultures to ensure accountability from the student’s side4. Another call will be scheduled with Bridge Cultures (if needed) to understand the student’s interest, motivation, and expectations from the co-op5. The student will pay the Program fees to Bridge Cultures ($455)6. Bridge Cultures will facilitate the call between student and the organization7. The organization will communicate their response to Bridge Cultures and the student8. If the student is selected, the organization will share the appointment/offer letter with Bridge Cultures9. Bridge Cultures will share the appointment letter with the student10. The student will start the co-op on the decided dates11. Bridge Cultures will facilitate virtual onboarding if necessary12. Bridge Cultures will facilitate 3 online sessions on various topics and organize 2 review meetings during the co-op13. Bridge Cultures will facilitate self-reflection session at the end of the co-opRefund policy:· If the student is not selected by the first organization interviewed for, Bridge Cultures will find another position with another organization. If the student is not selected there as well, 50% of the program fees will be refunded to the student· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op prior to confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 25% of the program fees (this is to factor the currency transaction charges that incurs to Bridge Cultures)· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op after receiving confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 75% of the program fees

Description: Production Tracking and Buildings FellowshipPosition OverviewThe Production Tracking and Buildings Fellow will primarily support MassCEC’s Production Management Department, and, as time allows, provide support to MassCEC’s Buildings programs.MassCEC's Production Management Department supports leading state incentive programs that promote solar, renewable thermal energy, and clean peak resources. The Fellow will work with staff and various market participants: the Department of Energy Resources, homeowners, production reporters, installers, aggregators, etc., to understand and facilitate these production based renewable energy incentive programs, assist in day to day operations, and ensure data quality in the Production Tracking System (PTS).MassCEC’s Buildings programs work to decarbonize the Commonwealth’s buildings through grants, rebates, and technical assistance to help Massachusetts businesses, municipal entities, affordable housing organizations, and low and moderate income individuals transition to clean energy and electrify buildings.Pending reopening plans, the fellowship program at MassCEC includes various educational and networking opportunities, including:Job DutiesPosition QualificationsEducation:Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:The candidate will demonstrate strong multi-disciplinary skills and interests, including:SupervisionThe fellow will work under the supervision of the Director of the Production Management Department and the Managers of the Buildings team.SalaryThe fellow will earn $16 per hour and be eligible to work for 35 hours per week.About the Massachusetts Clean Energy CenterThe Massachusetts Clean Energy Center (MassCEC), as a quasi-public entity, plays a critical role in fostering the success of our state’s clean energy sector. MassCEC actively supports the Baker-Polito Administration’s commitment to addressing Massachusetts’ energy challenges, maintaining national leadership in clean energy, and meeting the requirements of the Global Warming Solutions Act.MassCEC undertakes targeted programmatic initiatives to accelerate cost reductions in clean energy, help consumers diversify their energy choices and address evolving energy needs, leverage public and private funds to drive investment into this rapidly-growing sector, and scale-up renewable energy deployment across the state.

Description: The Infection Control Assistant works with the Director, two associate hospital epidemiologists, five infection control practitioners and infection control fellows in the implementation and organization of the Infection Control program.Primary responsibilities focus on our hand hygiene initiative:· Assist with observation and monitoring activities related to hand hygiene (approximately 20 hours/month).· Assist with education of staff on hand hygiene including activities such as hand culturing of hospital staff, following up on culture results, observation, and education sessions.Other projects include:· Participate in surveillance of resistant organisms, including interfacing with hospital staff regarding precautions.· Assist with reporting of communicable diseases to the Department of Public Health.· Participate in catheter-associated bloodstream infection surveillance in ICUs and medical-surgical units, including interfacing with staff and calculating infection rates.· Participate in catheter-associated urinary tract infection surveillance.· Assist with collection, analysis, and distribution of infection control data for both reporting and special projects.· Participate in multidisciplinary work groups requiring infection control input, including literature review and data collection, analysis and presentation.· Assist with new and ongoing infection control projects as needed.· Participate in research projects within the division, as desiredDesirable Qualifications:Overall, this position requires someone who is organized and highly motivated. He/she needs to be able to work independently and take over a task after being given some introduction. Prior clinical experience is preferred; maturity and ability to be a self-starter is essential. Effective written and verbal communication skills are essential. Time management and attention to detail are important skills. Good computer and data management skills are useful.Time Commitment: 40 hours/week, 5 days per weekSalary: $1styear $14.25,2ndyear $15.00,3rdyear $15.75Overtime: NonePhysical Exam: Not requiredStudent Level Considered for Position: Sophomore -SeniorIn addition, the Longwood Medical area runs a shuttle service as listed below: LMA Harvard Medical School Shutte (M2) MASCO manages the Harvard Medical School shuttle, which runs between the LMA and Harvard University in Cambridge. Tickets for the Harvard M2 shuttle can be bought at certain institutional parking offices or at the cashier's office at Holyoke Center in Cambridge. Purchase location for M2 tickets are listed on the M2 schedule, which is available at your parking/commuting office, the Information Office at Holyoke Center Arcade, and the security desk at Vanderbilt Hall. Ruggles Express (Service to and from the Ruggles MBTA Station) The Ruggles Express provides service between the Ruggles MBTA Station and the LMA at no charge to all employees and students of MASCO member institutions. Schedules and other information about the Ruggles Express can be obtaine drom the institution's parking offices, or by asking the bus driver. JFK/UMASS Shuttle (service to and from JFK/UMASS MBTA The JFK/UMASS Shuttle provides service between JFK/UMASS MBTA station and the LMA at no charge to employees and students of MASCO's member institutions. The shuttle runs approximately every 15 minutes in the morning between 5:55 am to 9:30 am, and approximately every 15-20 minutes in the afternoon from 3:20 pm until the last trip at 8:05 pm. Please click the above line to view the current schedule.

Description: Software Engineer, Cloud Services Co-opSomerville, MA, USAAvigilon, a Motorola Solutions company (NYSE: MSI), is defining the future of the security industry through innovative end-to-end-solutions. We’re changing the landscape of the surveillance industry through advanced award-winning AI based surveillance systems. Artificial Intelligence is transforming the world and our team is advancing the field as it applies to the intersection of computer vision and real-time video analysis. We are proud to be industry leaders in video analytics with features such as Appearance Search and Unusual Motion Detection along with our innovative Avigilon Blue cloud service platform. Unlike a startup, we’re part of a company that has the resources to do great things now.Our team is a talented set of AI researchers, computer scientists, hardware engineers, and security experts who work every day on challenging problems involving artificial intelligence and computer vision. Avigilon’s solutions have been installed in more than 120 countries at thousands of customer sites, including school campuses, transportation systems, healthcare centers, public venues, critical infrastructure, prisons, factories, casinos, airports, financial institutions, government facilities, and retailers. If you want to be part of a team that has been doing important work for nearly 20 years while changing the world – we need you!Avigilon’s Boston Office is located in Somerville’s Assembly Row at 450 Artisan Way and is accessible via the Orange line. We are seeking students to join us from January 2020 – June 2020 for a full-time (40 hours per week) opportunity to gain practical experience in application software development.Position Overview:If you are a Software Engineer Co-op who is passionate about building large scale distributed data processing platforms, then we would like to have you join our Avigilon Blue Cloud Services team.You will work with a team of mobile application developers building applications on both Android & iOS, along with full-stack engineers responsible for evaluating tools & technologies along with prototyping & building our application platforms using an Agile Scrum development philosophy.You will be part of an engineering organization that will entrust you to design, develop, and maintain various portions of our applications with lots of autonomy while receiving guidance and feedback to help you grow. You will be expected to collaboratively experiment, prototype, take risks, and document your work while helping to build new applications, web services, and tools used by our existing Avigilon Blue cloud offering.Responsibilities include:Qualifications:

Description: PDTO: CMC-Cell line development groupJounce Therapeutics is a clinical stage biotech company taking a broad approach to one of the most exciting fields in cancer therapy today - immunotherapy. Based in Cambridge, MA, we are developing protein-based therapeutics aimed at achieving durable anti-tumor immune responses for multiple cancer indications.Our work at the cutting edge of science combined with our culture of teamwork, empowerment, and fun enable our mission to dare to create a world immune to cancer.Our Cell Line Development group at Jounce Therapeutics is looking for an individual to learn and contribute towards cell culture and molecular biology method development for biologics’ manufacturing. The role will primarily focus on optimizations to our current Process Development process. This will include implementing new technologies for selection of production CHO cell lines, media evaluation and process development. Regular CHO cell culture maintenance, fed-batch production runs, and metabolite analyses will be an ongoing part of the project. He/she will be expected to participate in experimental design, conduct experiments, optimize throughput, maintain detailed records, and generate standard operating procedures.Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:· Learning cell and molecular biology techniques· Cell culture process optimization· Maintaining electronic laboratory notebook· Various aspects of CHO cell culturePreferred skills:· Aseptic techniques used for cell culture· Prior hands-on experience with at least one of the following methods: bioreactor setup and operation, transfection, automated cell counting· Theoretical understanding of cell culture techniques· Basic understanding of design-of-experiment (e.g. JMP), a plus· Excellent attention to detail, strong documentation skills, and ability to communicate effectively (both written and verbal)

Description: Cedilla Therapeutics is a young company focused on harnessing intrinsic protein stability mechanisms to expand the reach of small molecule therapeutics. Targeting diseases caused by protein dysregulation, in ways that are distinct from other approaches, provides an opportunity to create unique and valuable new medicines for patients in need. This is an exciting opportunity to join a fast-paced start-up environment, and candidates who are keen experimentalists, enthusiastic, creative, and have a passion for drug discovery should apply.We are looking for a collaborative and enthusiastic co-op to join our Chemical Biology and Proteomics team. You will expand your skills in bioanalytical characterization of proteins and protein-small molecule interactions in disease-relevant cells. We view the methods and workflows of chemical biology, biochemistry and chemo-proteomics as central part of our research platform and are looking for a co-op with intellectual and scientific curiosity, flexibility, personal motivation and determination to help drive our target validation and drug discovery programs.We view you as a valuable member of our team. Contributions made during your co-op will be critical to the success of our endeavor. Those contributions may include:· Sample preparation for chemical biology/proteomics experiments· Working with cell lysates to perform analysis and quantification of proteins· HPLC purification/fractionation of complex peptide mixtures· nLC/MS/MS proteome-wide analysis of biological samples treated with bioactive small molecules or other perturbagens.Some of the highlights of your background are:· Currently enrolled in a B.S. or M.S. program in organic or analytical chemistry, biochemistry or related discipline.· Coursework with labs in biochemistry, physics and/or chemistry is required.· Previous experience in bioanalytical techniques (i.e. ELISAs, pull-downs, enzymatic, Bradford assays, FRET or protein interaction assays) would be favorably considered.· Excellent attention to detail and strong documentation skills are essential.· Prior experience at a biotech or pharmaceutical company would be desired but is not a must.To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter to Careers@Cedillatx.com

Description: We are looking for students who are very serious about becoming scientists. Specifically, this means that you are planning (or at least seriously considering) entering a PhD program after graduation and want to use my lab as an opportunity to get experience as an independent scientist. We have had11undergrads over 5 years that have gone on to top PhD (Harvard, Yale, Hopkins, Michigan, UCSB) or MD/PhD (UCSF) programs, with many more on the way.There is no routine busy work for co-ops in my lab; after the first few weeks everyone designs their own experiments (under the supervision of a permanent lab member) and analyzes their own data. Several undergrads have been authors on high-profile papers.Our lab uses male mating behavior in Drosophila to study motivation. What determines the drive to mate as opposed to doing something else? The co-op would use an automated, machine-vision system we have established to genetically interrogate this system and gain an understanding of the molecular and circuit mechanisms that control the changes motivation. This mostly involves simple Drosophila behavioral neurogenetics techniques that can be learned fairly quickly.Lots of information on my website (crickmorelab.org).Please contact me directly with your story, interests, career plans, etc.: michael_crickmore@hms.harvard.edu

Description: JOB SUMMARYWe are looking to bring on an Embedded Software Co-opstarting in January 2021. This will be a full-time position (40 hours per week) reporting in to our brand new corporate headquarters in Marlborough, MA. Description: The Bose Acoustic Test Group (ATG) is responsible for developing, or overseeing the development of acoustic test methods, software (for test automation), and hardware used to test Bose products at the end of the manufacturing line. We have a small, energetic, and innovative team that is agile to new product complexities and schedules and is continuously improving current and innovating new acoustic test solutions.We currently use primarily Audio Precision (AP) as a data acquisition (DAQ) platform and Bruel and Kjaer microphones and preamps. We would like to explore new functionality of the AP DAQ and associated software, more cost effective DAQ solutions for tests that may allow the use of lower performance hardware, and find other replacement options for other test equipment where applicable.Project Responsibilities:The specific goals of this project are threefold:1. Investigate the new dual channel (multi-mode) Audio Precision function to reduce the cycle time of test measurements. Report to the team on the cycle time savings and functionality.2. Explore lower cost equipment (data acquisitions, microphones, power supplies, etc.) and baseline the performance.3. Investigate a B&K NEXUS microphone power supply replacement. This work will require some intelligent programing to capture microphone TEDS information and interface with current ATG test sequences.Opportunities for you in this role· Learn and understand the function of audio/acoustic test hardware and software used for Bose products and gain knowledge of Bose products and the acoustics measurements performed on those products in manufacturing· Develop your knowledge in acoustics and acoustic/audio testing.· Use AP Software and Matlab to control instruments an automate tests.Required/Recommended Qualifications:· Matlab familiarity· Experience with use of software for instrument control and test automation.· Other programming language experience a plus: C/C++, Python.· Comfortable working with PCs, Windows OS, networks.· Knowledge of various computer interfaces and buss formats including PCI,PXI, GPIB, USB, Ethernet, RS232 for data acquisition and instrument control· Good written and verbal communication skills and ability to work in cross-functional teams.· Energetic and motivated.

We welcome individuals who are currently pursuing an undergraduate (BS) and/or graduate (MS) degree to participate in a 6-month, paid opportunity at our Cambridge office. Through this role, you will gain meaningful, hands-on experience working for a Health-Tech company.In this role, you have the opportunity toJoin a dynamic, fast-moving software test and automation engineering team testing best-in-class Healthcare Informatics and Patient Monitoring solutions. You will be part of an established team committed to innovation and contribution, trust and respect, teamwork and uncompromising integrity.You are responsible forCultivating effective working relationships with other test team members, software architects and developers. Position: Social Work and Psychology Internship with NGO in Kenya
Targeted Academic Majors: College of Science/Psychology, College of Social Science & Humanities/Sociology
Workplace Type: Primarily on-site work
Desired Skills: Some experience with digital marketing is beneficial, Nice to have: some project management experience, Just-do-mentality and keen to take on different kind of tasks, Nice to have: Basic knowledge of Photoshop, An ability to work independently, Good English speaking and writing skills
Description: SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF PROGRAMS EMPOWERING THE CHILDRENSpend your internship in Kenya and support this grass-roots organization in the development and implementation of programs empowering the children.During this Social Work and Psychology Internship in Kenya, you will be based on the premises of an Educational Center on the shores of Lake Victoria. Depending on your skills, desired learning outcomes, and needs of the children you will assist withday-to-day operations and organize educational and stimulating activities. You might also be involved with group counseling and be a mentor to individual students. A great opportunity if you are keen to support this grass-roots organization to work towards an environment allowing people to thrive and fulfill their potential.Your tasksYou will work closely together with the international team (we always provide a supervisor), local social workers and other caregivers such a the matron as well as the teachers and administrative staff of the Educational Center. Depending on your skills, you will support the caregiving staff and/or take charge of counseling sessions and other activities supporting the child development. Your role will be designed according to your background and expertise, desired learning outcomes, and needs of the children.During the weekends or weeks off, you have free time to relax or take the opportunity to explore Kisumu, wider Kenya, and Eastern Africa. You can also initialize workshops or excursions with the kids, the staff or the wider community, or just spend time with the team and the children, play football, volleyball and so on.Good to knowThis organization was founded in 2015 and they aim to empower and inspire people to initiate the individual and societal transformation we want to see. They work towards an environment allowing people to thrive and fulfill their potential. It is their role to build the capacity of people and organizations they work with, build bridges between agents of change to co-create this environment.In January 2015 he made his promise come true. Together with his good friend Mathilde he started a long 5200km journey from South Africa to Kenya, crossing Zimbabwe, Zambia, Malawi, Tanzania and Uganda on their way, to raise awareness but also funds for the Educational Center. What started as a simple idea to help the Center and her children, turned into a big vision that evolved into the founding of this organization. They providefinancial support as well as helps the Centerto strengthen their capacity by consult in organizational development, designing and managing educational and development projects. Additionally, they also facilitate vocational training, alternative educational programs, and training of teachers.The Center now houses a children’s home, non-formal nursery and primary school and acts as a sponsor for high-school and university.Aside from education, the children are taught the ideals of respect and love, environmental awareness, social and economic empowerment.They also have 14 acres of farm, as well as livestock like cows, pigs, chickens, goats, sheep, fish and rabbits to provide an income.

Description: Seres Therapeutics is a dynamic biotechnology company in Cambridge MA pioneering innovative Ecobiotic® microbiome therapeutics. Seres recently had a successful Phase 3 clinical trial for treatment of recurrentClostridium difficileinfection, and has promising late clinical stage programs in Ulcerative Colitis. As such, we are well-positioned to become the first company to commercialize a new therapeutic modality comprising ecologies of commensal bacteria.Additionally, Seres has entered the clinic with multiple new product candidates in a range of therapeutic areas including immuno-oncology and inflammation to build upon its field-leading portfolio of intellectual property and know-how.Knowledge Graph, Bioinformatics Co-op Position:Knowledge graphs are abstract representations of entities that can be used to describe anything from social networks to characters in a novel. Description: Alzheimer’s disease (AD) is a debilitating neurodegenerative disorder with no effective treatments. Traditionally, disease pathology was believed to be caused by dense plaque formations of the protein amyloid beta, resulting in neuronal loss and dementia. Recent genome-wide association studies have discovered numerous risk genes that implicate microglia, which are brain-resident immune cells, in disease progression, a novel finding that has opened new avenues for AD research.This project will focus on validation of novel microglial drug targets identified from internal computational approaches.Responsibilities will includeCandidates with previous experience (at least 6 months) in cell culture, western blot, flow cytometry, fluorescent microscopy or other in vitro assays preferred, but not required.

If this is not possible then please include other faculty and/or work managers.MGH has received the Magnet Hospital Recognition, which is the highest level of recognition the American Nursing Credentialing Center can grant for excellence in nursing. The Magnet Recognition Program affords important national recognition to health care organizations that demonstrate sustained excellence in nursing care. The program also provides a vehicle for the dissemination of best practices and strategies among nursing systems. Hospitals seeking Magnet Recognition submit written evidence demonstrating that they meet or exceed the 14 standards. After a thorough review, they undergo an intensive site visit. A report is submitted by the ANCC appraisers to the Commission on Magnet Recognition. The Commission reviews the findings to determine if the standards of care and professional performance are met. MGH was the first hospital in Massachusetts to be awarded this designation by the ANCC. (10-16)

Description: The Dunn Lab (http://www.thedunnlab.com/) is looking to hire a highly motivated and enthusiastic Communications Co-op to assist with the marketing, development, and growth of the lab’s social media, website, and online presence.The Dunn Lab is based in the Psychiatric and Neurodevelopmental Genetics Unit (PNGU) within the Center for Genomic Medicine and Department of Psychiatry. In the lab, we use interdisciplinary approaches to better understand the social and genetic factors that influence the etiology of mood disorders, with an emphasis on depression among women, children, and adolescents. The goal of our work is to identify the causal mechanisms underlying risk for mood disorders, develop population-based strategies for prevention, and target these strategies to “sensitive periods,” or developmental stages in the course of the lifespan when the brain is highly “plastic” and therefore, when experience, including exposure to childhood adversity, can have lasting impacts. To do this, we analyze genetic and other types of data collected from individuals across the globe, including longitudinal studies that follow children from the time of their birth. We are a multidisciplinary team of researchers from a range of fields, including epidemiology, public health, genetics, education, neurology, psychiatry, and psychology.Under the direction of Dr. Erin Dunn, the Principal Investigator of the lab, the Communications Co-Op will be responsible for creating and implementing a digital marketing strategy for the lab and supporting external communications for a range of research projects. They will maintain and develop social networking accounts, create original social media content, increase awareness about new and ongoing lab initiatives, assist in communicating research findings to lay audiences, and grow the lab’s online presence on all social media and web platforms. The Co-op will collaborate with Dunn Lab Research Coordinators and lab members to develop relevant, original, high-quality social media and website content for various projects.Candidates must have a demonstrated knowledge of social media coordination, platforms, services, and tools (Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Squarespace, blogs, etc.). Knowledge of Microsoft Word, Office, Keynote, and creative tools such as Illustrator or Canva preferred.Additionally, candidates must have the ability to work well in a collaborative environment and demonstrate strong communication and writing skills in English. Successful candidates will be self-starters, able to run with ideas, and capable of incorporating multiple perspectives on a given project. Interest in psychiatric disorders, adversity/traumatic stress, and brain health is preferred but not required.

Description: Montai Health, Inc. (FL65)Montai is a privately held, early-stage biotechnology company developing a platform for understanding and leveraging complex molecular interactions within organisms to solve global challenges in human health and sustainability. The company leverages a multidisciplinary approach that integrates tools ranging from machine learning and big data to multi-omics and high-throughput screening.Montai was founded in Flagship’s venture creation engine, where companies such as Moderna Therapeutics (NASDAQ: MRNA), Rubius Therapeutics (NASDAQ: RUBY), and Editas Medicines (NASDAQ: EDIT) were conceived and created. Since Flagship’s founding in 2000, the firm has originated and fostered the development of more than 100 scientific ventures, resulting in over $34 billion in aggregate value, 500+ issued patents, and more than 50 clinical trials for novel therapeutic agents.Montai is headquartered in Cambridge, MA, USA.Role OverviewWe are seeking a creative and motivated machine learning Scientist to assist in marshalling the large, complex chemical and omics datasets to help our team unlock the potential of our planet’s interdependent natural systems to solve pressing agriculture, nutrition & environmental challenges. In this role, you will work closely with both computational and experimental sides of the team.The role will also involve testing and optimizing machine learning models of biological and chemical systems, and contributing to a growing codebase. You will work closely with other members of the computational and experimental teams to develop machine learning tools that will guide our experimental and product development teams.Responsibilities· Design and implement ETL and cleaning processes for relevant data sets· Capture data from computational and wet lab experiments, implement bidirectional connections between machine learning experiments and wet lab experiments·    Deploy novel machine learning algorithms for classification or regression models of biological and chemical data·    Collaborate with computational team to develop and maintain a robust and scalable machine learning platform·    Maintain scientific and technical expertise through familiarity with scientific and technical literature·    Work closely with an entrepreneurial, highly-collaborative, interdisciplinary team and actively contribute to creating, shaping and executing the scientific vision of the companyQualifications· Current curriculum includes any combination of the following: computer science, statistics, computational biology, bioinformatics, or closely related field· Experience with data handling, ETL, and schema design· Experience with Python, SQL, and Unix shell scripting· Familiarity with machine learning and statistics· Familiarity with biology at the level of proteins, DNA, RNA, metabolites preferred· Experience with modern bioinformatic and cheminformatic databases, schemas, ontologies, etc. preferred· Experience with AWS infrastructure (EC2, S3, RDS, EMR, etc.) preferredCompetencies· Self-motivated and curious with strong desire to both learn from and teach others· Execution-focused· Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills

Description: Co-op - Internship DevOps and Test Automation – Cambridge, MA – Jan 2021Are you interested in a Co-op with Philips? We welcome individuals currently pursuing an undergraduate (BS) or graduate (MS) degree to participate in 3-6 month paid Co-op at our Cambridge, MA location. Through this role, you will gain meaningful, hands-on experience working for a HealthTech company.In this role, you have the opportunity toJoin a DevOps and Test Automation Software Engineering team. We deliver tools and pipelines for testing and deploying best-in-class Healthcare Informatics and Patient Monitoring solutions. As an intern, you will work on a SW Components based on Microsoft Technology (.Net, .Net Core, C#) Angular, SQL Server/PostgreSQL and more.Our development environment is based on Azure DevOps and GitHub Enterprise and leverages the Azure cloud as well as our hyper converged infrastructure. We’re developing test automation using Behavior Driven Development (BDD) methodology, based on Cucumber, Gherkin and Specflow.You are responsible for· Creating high quality working software· Featuring driven development in an agile approach· Actively participating in sprint planning, daily stand-up meetings, sprint reviews, sprint retrospectives and backlog refinement.· Contributing to continuous improvement of the team, software and processes· Designing, coding, documenting testing (automated); maintaining and deploying software· Supports DevOps in deploying softwareYou are a part ofAn established team committed to innovation and contribution, trust and respect, teamwork and uncompromising integrity.To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience· Currently pursuing a Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science; Master’s is preferred· Experience with Microsoft© Windows operating systems· Demonstrated software development skills, using C#, Java and/or C++, Linux or equivalent· Demonstrated software test engineering skills· Strong written and verbal communication skills· Excellent teamwork and collaborative skills· Self-starter, willing and able to quickly learn new applications and technologies· Good problem solving skillsDesired qualifications:· Experience using automated test tools· SQL/DB knowledge· Experience with reliability test methods and tools· Knowledge of Healthcare tech a plusIn return, we offer youThe ability to collaborate with, learn and grow from colleagues in a highly complex, global organization where you can use your strengths to help drive strategic business initiatives for Philips.  Additionally, we provide you a dynamic working environment in an innovative business, paired with a competitive salary, excellent benefits, and a supportive atmosphere where you can sharpen your talents with new challenges and career opportunities.US work authorization is a precondition of employment. The company will not consider candidates who require sponsorship for a work-authorized visa.Company relocation benefits will not be provided for this position. Candidates need to live within the territoryorwithin commuting distance to Cambridge, MA.  Why should you join Philips?Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across thehealth continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways.To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit theWorking at Philips pageon our career website, where you can read stories from ouremployee blog. Once there, you can also learn about ourrecruitment process, or find answers to some of thefrequently asked questions.It is the policy of Philips to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, pregnancy/childbirth, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability or perceived disability, genetic information, citizenship, veteran or military status or a person’s relationship or association with a protected veteran, including spouses and other family members, marital or domestic partner status, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws.As an equal opportunity employer, Philips is committed to a diverse workforce. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Veterans' Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, applicants that require accommodation in the job application process may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.

Description: Machine Learning CoopWaters Corporation, headquartered in Milford, Massachusetts, develops, manufactures and services instruments and software for analytical Liquid Chromatography (LC) and Mass Spectrometry (MS) Systems. Our customers work from the early stages of drug discovery through final quality control and assurance. Since these instruments go through a rapid rate of technological change, Waters makes significant investments in research and development to meet/exceed customers’ needs/expectations.The Waters Informatics Research group researches and develops prototypes of data analysis tools that process and extract information and insights from raw signals data coming from our instruments. We are in the initial stages of a project to use reinforcement learning algorithms (including Deep Learning and Bayesian inference) to improve the customer experience of using our instruments.The role of this coop is to aid the team in helping collect and simulate specialty instrument data, develop optimization and reinforcement learning models, and experiment with new data features as well as new algorithmic features to maximize the efficiency and efficacy of the results. We are looking for someone with a growth mindset who is self-motivated, and ready to overcome obstacles to develop a working research prototype.Responsibilities:· Build out new techniques from the literature to improve the model· Create baseline models to compare against the main model, and build/improve the test harness to properly compare alternatives· Maintain (exercise, write tests, debug python/Tensorflow/Keras/pyStan/Scikit-learn/Pandas etc) codebase.· Create API to interface ML algorithms with instrument control.Required Qualifications:· Strong skillset in Python programming language, including OOP, Numpy, Pandas and Scipy libraries.· Knowledge / experience with Optimization algorithms.· Knowledge / experience with AutoML algorithms.· Knowledge / experience with Reinforcement Learning algorithms.· Comfortable with Git version control, BASH shell, and Anaconda environments.Desired (considered a plus) Qualifications:· Knowledge and class experience with Bayesian inference.· Experience with robotics applications and embedded programming.· Familiarity with C++ and/or Lua programming languages.· Experience designing high performance algorithms.

Description: Clinical Business Operations Co-Op/Full-Time InternABOUT THE NESTAt bluebird, only two things matter - patients and our people. Our innovation and sustainability are rooted in the diversity of our flock and results are achieved through cooperation and the incorporation of multiple points of view. The time is now to rise up and recode the science, the systems, and the status quo.ABOUT THE FLOCKThe Clinical Development Operations/Clinical Contracts Team flock is all about getting stuff done, working collaboratively, and advancing our technology. As a part of our evolving and dynamic college program, you’ll have a chance to work with some of the brightest birds in the business, striving to make real impact for our patients and our people. Come gain experiential hands-on knowledge with a group of birds that loves rising to the challenge much as we do!HOW YOU’LL FLYAs a Clinical Business Operations Co-Op/Full-Time Intern bird reporting to Emily Matthews, you'll help to bring more patients their bluebird days by:· Supporting development and roll out of improved contract tracking tools relative to implementation of updated CBO SharePoint site.· Combining existing ICH/GCP amendment list with Master contract Index· Create tracking tool to provide notification of upcoming contract expiration dates for Consulting agreements, which may expand the project to account for other agreements as applicable· Excel-based tracking projects (ad-hoc)· Other related tasks as neededWHAT YOU’LL BRINGYou’re the bird we’re looking for if you:· Have (Currently enrolled in a degree program at an accredited college or university)· Display natural enthusiasm for learning· Exemplary collaboration/cross-functional skillset· Strong Microsoft Excel skills required· Positive disposition· Excellent organizational skills, sufficient to multi-task in an extremely fast-paced environment with changing priorities.· Excellent communication skills and ability to influence across multiple functions.· Possess the (Ability to work a six-month assignment, full-time – January 11 – June 25)· This position is 100% REMOTE.All our birds embrace the principles of the bluebird bio culture: b colorful, b cooperative, b yourself.bluebird bio is deeply committed to fostering an environment where diversity and inclusion are not only valued, but prioritized. We believe a diverse and inclusive community empowers us to act courageously, care deeply, and dream boldly to impact people in big ways. Diverse viewpoints bring diverse capabilities which strengthen our focus and fuel our growth.bluebird is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or any other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Description: Greetings, students! We’re geared up here to offer another round of epic internship experiences in 2021. The internship program offers the opportunity to pause your studies for one summer and work side-by-side with Blizzard Entertainment employees in your area of interest, doing real work that oftentimes ends up in production. As such, we hold you to the same high standards as anybody else in the company.Just like our gameplay experiences, Blizzard internships are a fully immersive experience. We want interns who are enthusiastic about what they want to do for a living and excited to come in every day to learn and contribute in this hyper-creative atmosphere. Being fully engaged with our team also means communicating effectively and maintaining an open mind - one that is receptive to feedback and able to adapt and grow. Your hobbies and interests can also play in your favor. Passion for technology, gaming, game development, and an in-depth knowledge of Blizzard games, products, and services will always be a plus with us, regardless of the position you’re applying for. Be passionate about who you are, be into our industry, and be willing to go all-in and embrace this opportunity to the fullest!QUEST OBJECTIVES· Our team values creativity, collaboration and a commitment to quality and we are searching for like-minded artists to add to our team of talented game makers and cinematic creators. · Together we will learn, grow, and ultimately enjoy success as a team, overcoming new challenges together.· If you have a passion for games and/or cinematics and want to participate in the future of Blizzard, we would love to hear from you! QUEST REQUIREMENTS· Currently enrolled in a college or university· Returning for at least one more semester or quarter following the Summer 2021 internship· Able to work full time hours for 11 – 12 weeks at the Blizzard office indicated in this job posting between May 2021 – August 2021 or June 2021 – September 2021 (group dates depend on when you get out of school)· Authorized to work in the USQUEST ITEMS· Resume· Cover Letter· Portfolio and/or reel demonstrating relevant artistic skills required· Must be willing to complete an art test if requested to do soINTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITIESCharacter Modeler Intern, OverwatchTracer, Winston, Pharah, Hanzo… these are just a few of the memorable heroes that inhabit our world. Our talented artists put their heart and soul into bringing these unique and visually stunning characters to life, and their ranks are growing. We want to meet a Character Artist ready to step up and break new ground in the Overwatch universe.· Create both high resolution 3D sculpts and final low polygon game assets· Couple hand painted textures and next-gen materials for use in game engine· Iterate on game assets with production artists via prototyping and group critiquesEnvironment Concept Art Intern, OverwatchAs an environment concept art intern on Blizzard’s Overwatch, you will learn about and contribute to the expanding Overwatch universe. You will work closely with our concept, environment and level design team to help create levels that are both gameplay-oriented, beautiful and consistent with the handcrafted art styles that our games are known for. In short, you’ll be learning from and working with a close-knit, collaborative community of artists, engineers and designers whose sole goal is to make a truly epic and immersive game experience.Technical Artist Intern, OverwatchHelp make our next heroes come to life! You'll leverage your skills by providing support throughout the character skin production process, working closely with character artists and animators; physics set-up and skinning character bodies and faces, and preparing them technically for export.  You will learn the needs of a production pipeline and teams we support. You will work collaboratively with other departments including modeling, game design, animation, concept, and VFX. The ideal candidate is a highly motivated artist who has built rigs and can maintain a good level of visual and technical quality and must have a strong understanding of skinning. Pluses include ragdolls, anatomy, cloth / hair, and Python scripting. · Familiarity rigging/skinning characters in Maya, or similar software· Strong knowledge of character kinematics, deformations, and topology· Proficiency in character Skinning, Physics, and Technical Workflows· Strong communications skills3D Artist Intern, Unannounced ProjectOur ideal candidates have strong skills in authoring hand painted textures and is comfortable making a wide variety of 3D assets. We are looking for a 3D Art intern to help create hand painted props and environment art assets for an exciting new mobile title.· Author 3D props and environment art pieces· Create high quality hand painted textures· Learn the technical requirements of the game (poly counts, naming conventions, texture resolution etc) and adhere to the enforced standards· Integrate your own work and work received from outsource partners into the engine· Champion Blizzard’s core values, especially “Commit to Quality” and “Learn and Grow”Modeling Artist Intern, CinematicsCandidates should have some experience working with digital modeling software to create dynamic and appealing assets. From the stylized world of Overwatch or Hearthstone to photorealistic Cinematicmodels from the Warcraft Universe, the applicant must be excited to tackle any design tasked to them. Our ideal candidate is highly motivated and enthusiastic to share the workload of our hard-working, talented team. You will be right amongst the other artists and be held responsible to help assist the team in creating assets for our upcoming Cinematics.· Basic understanding of Maya and the production pipeline· Basic understanding of Zbrush and/or Mudbox· Basic understanding of UVing, Topology and Displacement map extraction· Ability to collaborate with the Modeling Team and bring your own passion, ideas and creativity to Blizzard Animation as a wholeDungeon Artist, Diablo IVBuild and assemble in-game dungeon environments.Essential skills include a solid grasp of form,composition, layout and creating a readablegameplay space. You are also up on the latest tools and technology.Modeling, texturing, and asset creation are always a plus.The ideal candidate works well in an environment of peers who are passionate about working on the dark gothic world of Diablo, making great games, killing millions ofmonsters,and getting loot!What will it take to be successful in this role? Well, we’re always looking for people who can help us become even better than we are today, and these are probably some of your previous achievements:·Work directly with level design to build atmospheric dungeons with a focus on composition,detail,and mood, while ensuring that the gameplay space is readable.·Work with LeadDungeonArtist and the Art Director to ensure all environments are meeting the high-quality bar Blizzard is known for.VFX Artist Intern, Diablo IVWorking with 3D packages, in-game FX systems to create a wide range of VFX (fire, smoke, magic, electricity, explosions, etc.), as well as a general understanding of good game play communication. A solid grasp of the principles of motion, anticipation, dynamics, follow-through, lighting, and other facets of animation is essential for the position. The VFX ArtistInternmust have skill in creating textures and geometry needed for stylized VFX. What will it take to be successful in this role? Well, we’re always looking for people who are game developers first and who can help us become even better than we are today, so these are probably some of your previous achievements:Blizzard Entertainment is a global company committed to growing our employees along with the business. We offer generous benefits and perks with an eye on providing true work / life balance. We’ve worked hard to foster an intensely collaborative and creative environment, a diverse and inclusive employee culture, and training and opportunity for professional growth. Our people are everything. Our core values are real, and our mission has never changed. We are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences…ever. Join us!  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Team Name:Overwatch

Description: University Summary:VMware recognizes that today’s students are tomorrow’s trailblazers and we value the opportunity to benefit from your fresh perspective. If you thrive in an open, innovative, technology-driven culture, VMware could be the place for you! You will be exposed to a wide range of software platform technologies that are utilized by customers all over the world.Business Summary:98% of Fortune 500 Companies use VMware Technology!The most advanced companies in the world turn to VMware to manage, grow and transform their business. When you work here, you’re connected to a global community of innovative, empowered employees working together to solve the most critical technology challenges.We believe that creativity sparks innovation and inspires our employees to think differently and challenge the status quo. Whether it’s the kind of products we develop, our approach to sustainability, or how we give back to our communities, VMware finds unique ways to bring people together to fuel creative thinking. Want to know more, check out our website https://careers.vmware.com.About the Team:As a member of the Americas Commercial Marketing team, you will help develop and execute scalable marketing programs and sales play campaigns that align to the segment’s go-to-market strategy.  Implementing both internal and external high priority initiatives, you will collaborate cross-functionally with sales, agencies, business units and the field for scalable and repeatable programs.  The Commercial Marketing Team seeks a detail oriented and flexible Marketing Program Manager to play an important role in the continued growth of VMware’s transactional business through the creation of marketing programs that help build pipeline.    Job Role and Responsibilities· Work cross-functionally with divisions, operations, digital and sales teams to help execute campaign tactics and deliverables.· Manage marketing programs end-to-end by collaborating with teammates, external agencies and business units to create impactful content, materials, and targets.· Work with internal and external teams on project timelines, development of the program, bill of materials and securing the resources needed for effective execution.· Partner with operations resource to establish program tracking, lead follow up, and reporting requirements.· Monitor, analyze, and optimize marketing programs to ensure efficiency and effectiveness in achieving program goals. This includes real-time monitoring and adjustments, as needed, as well as longer-term reviews.· Help to source, negotiate and manage relationships and contracts with third-party vendors and internal teams.  Document and communicate marketing plans to all stakeholders.· Work with the field and inside sales teams to identify appropriate tactics and execute against the resulting field marketing plans.· Manage all the logistics to run a successful event from start to finish.· Help to develop an integrated marketing plan, working with multiple stakeholders that creates awareness, consideration and preference for VMware solutions.· Budget management to maintain projects within budget and report back on costs and ROI.· Assisting in the ordering of new materials, updating materials and disbursement as needed.Required Skills · Currently pursuing a BS degree in Marketing, Communications or related field· Team oriented, creative, adaptable, driven and attention to detail· Data-driven decision maker· Excellent communication and partnering skills· Stellar project management skills· Confident in leading and managing multiple projects· Attention to detail, organizational skills, creative problem-solving, and innovative thinkingskills· Remote position required*Please note that while anyone with a legal right to work in the U.S. may apply for this role, VMware is not presently sponsoring work visas for the entry-level roles for which these Internships may prepare you.

Description: Office OverviewCome work for Attorney General Maura Healey and make a difference! Are you looking for more than just a great learning experience? At the Attorney General’s Office, you will be part of “The People’s Law Firm”. Whether working directly with our residents, or supporting our talented and dedicated staff, your work here will contribute to a higher mission of serving the public and making a difference in the lives of others.The Attorney General’s Office is the largest public sector legal office in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. Attorney General Maura Healey is the chief lawyer and law enforcement officer of the Commonwealth. Her office serves as an advocate and resource for the Commonwealth, its residents, and businesses in many areas, including protecting consumers, combating fraud and corruption, protecting civil rights, and promoting meaningful economic stability. The Attorney General's Office is organized into six bureaus. The divisions and teams within each bureau have distinct missions and work closely together to ensure the Attorney General’s Office provides the highest level of public protection. We invite you to explore the work of our office at www.mass.gov/agoThe Attorney General’s Office is a professional, collaborative work environment. Our dedicated employees work together with a shared commitment to serving the interests of the Commonwealth. Students have shared these comments about the Office:· “A kind and welcoming atmosphere.”· “The positive energy was very infectious, and it made me strive to work harder as well.”· “The most professional yet fun office I’ve yet to work in.”The Office supports and appreciates the diverse perspectives and backgrounds of our employees and strives to provide a welcoming and inclusive workplace environment for all. We offer a variety of co-op positions, and our co-op students are an integral part of the Office.The Community Engagement Division (CED) works collaboratively with the bureaus and divisions of the Attorney General’s Office (AGO) and with constituencies statewide to provide programs, host special events, and create initiatives across the Commonwealth in the areas of public health and safety, youth employment, consumer protection, workers’ rights, financial literacy, civic engagement and community service. This position offers the opportunity to serve in a key division responsible for community health and safety statewide. It is anticipated that CED campaigns will include, but are not limited to, addressing: civil rights and discrimination, environmental justice, wage theft and consumer protection.The Program Assistant will perform the following duties, and other duties as needed:Help execute CED’s initiatives:· Assist with community engagement campaigns and prevention initiatives· Help plan events pertinent to department’s initiatives· Engage decision-makers in community-building efforts· Civic and community leadership and service. Draft written material:· Educational material for distribution: print, website, and social media content· Talking points, briefings and conference/trainings with the Attorney General and stakeholders· Translate into other languages (if applicable)· Health· Workers’ rights· Consumer protection· Public safety· Economic wellnessThe Program Assistant will have the opportunity to:· Attend Executive Bureau and CED Department meetings weekly· Attend special events and trainings with the Attorney General’s staffDesired QualificationsDependability, flexibility, strong organization, strong verbal communication skills, knowledge of computers and the ability to work effectively with the public are required. Professional and presentable office attire is required. Ability to work independently and take initiative is required. Previous Co-Op experience is preferred. Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Excel, Access, Word, Outlook) is recommended. Additional language proficiency, familiarity with a professional office environment and previous telephone experience are a plus.Learning and Professional Take-AwaysStudents develop professional skills during their co-op experience while building self-confidence. You can expect to leave this co-op with:· Exposure to the inner workings of a busy government office;· An understanding of how the team that supports the chief lawyer and law enforcement officer of the Commonwealth operates;· Knowledge in consumer rights laws, in addition to workers’ and civil rights, health and the environment;· Public speaking skills;· Experience in general office and administrative skills;· Experience in managing work projects and communicating with supervisors and co-workers;· Experience in working with diverse communities.Location and AmenitiesLocation and convenience! We are centrally located at One Ashburton Place on Beacon Hill; close to the State House, Boston Common, and Faneuil Hall. We are easily accessible by public transportation, and accessible to the many cultural and social activities offered in the city. Enjoy the convenience of Metro Café, a cafeteria offering a wide variety of affordable food options, located on-site at One Ashburton Place.DURING COVID: The Office has not yet determined work arrangements for the spring, but co-op positions will likely be remote for some or all of the upcoming six-month co-op period. Some in-office work may be required and will be discussed at time of interview.Pay and Work HoursThis position is full-time and pays $14/hour. This is a non-benefitted position with paid earned sick time. The expected work hours are 9:00 to 5:00 with a half hour lunch (37.5 hours per week)."The environment at the AGO is the quintessential team environment. Everyone is working together to fulfill the obligations of the Office of the Attorney General, and to help protect the people of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. Much of my work was helping protect vulnerable populations like seniors, teens, immigrants, and the impoverished via free trainings so they knew their rights and had access to services offered by the Commonwealth. I learned a lot of excellent teamwork skills, constituent service skills, and time management skills. I loved working with the Community Engagement Division because they made me feel like a valued and important member of the team from day 1."The Attorney General’s Office is an Equal Opportunity Employer. As the representative of the Commonwealth and its residents, the Attorney General’s Office strives to ensure that those working in our office reflect the diversity of the communities we serve. The Office encourages applicants from a broad spectrum of backgrounds to apply for positions.

Description: We are RGG Technology, the team responsible for all the technology behind Ruelala.com and Gilt.com Powering an online retail operation of this magnitude takes substantial systems and some serious engineering.When we’re not busy rolling out award-winning mobile apps or our completely rebuilt web store, we can be found hosting video-game nights or honing our technique as nerf gun assassins. We got foodies well covered too with cookouts and sprint-end celebrations.Well, now, we are more focused on hosting virtual cookouts and game nights.If a high-pace, rapid-growth technology organization that is well supported by a proven, expanding and innovative business sounds interesting to you then read on and see if you’d like to join our team and play an active role in taking our platform to the next level.We are looking for technologists who:The OpportunityCome and join our small, incredibly talented and highly productive Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing team. Work with seasoned data professionals to learn all aspects of how to build data warehousing and business intelligence solutions that power a half-billion-dollar online retail business.Here’s what we can promise:About Rue La LaRue La La partners with world-class brands to create a shopping frenzy that’s the envy of other online retailers. Our unique private flash sale model disrupted ecommerce in 2008 and earned the love of our members for delivering the most sought after lifestyle brands at incredible prices through a great shopping experience and top-notch customer service.Our success is the result of our unmatched skill in brand relationships, customer experience, merchandising, technology and logistics. Today, we have over 15 million members, 2,000+ premier brands and over $450M in revenue, and we’ve only just begun.
