Description: (REMOTE)Who isServiceNow?Imagine your workday dominated less by emails and spreadsheets and more time given back to you to do your actual job. At ServiceNow, we are making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud-based platform and products streamline and simplify how work gets done across the enterprise. We are the fastest growing enterprise cloud software company in the world and was recently recognized on Fortune’s Future 50 list (https://fortune.com/future-50/2019/) For us, this is just the start.Who is Marketing at ServiceNow?Marketing is the engine room for growth at ServiceNow. We fuel the success of our customers, sales, and products. We have a customer-first mindset in all that we do. As a Marketing team, we are laser-focused on how we can connect with our customers by creating simple, sweet spot targeting, and by the positioning and packaging of our products and solutions. We help our customers gain the most value from our products by providing best practices, business cases and trainings.We also partner closely with Sales to build high-quality pipeline through targeted Marketing activities ranging from thought leadership, strategic and executive events, webinars, digital acquisition, SEO, and more!About the team:ServiceNow makes work, work better for people. Our cloud-based Now platform and products streamline and simplify how work gets done.Today, every enterprise is becoming a technology company, creating unprecedented challenges, opportunities, and complexity. ServiceNow lets them run smarter, faster and better. We help people spend their time on work that’s meaningful, not menial.We are the fastest-growing enterprise cloud software company in the world, the fastest-growing enterprise company over $1 billion, and an increasingly relevant leader in digital transformation. For us, this is just the start.We’re disruptive and fast paced. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our products, and we live for our customers. We have high expectations, and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better.As part of the Digital Acquisition Strategy and Operations team (DASO), our Digital Acquisition Co-Op will get a chance to work on several projects related to the operational success of our team. These complex and data-driven projects will help aide in the success of ServiceNow’s digital ad campaigns. Our goal is to centralize and scale the digital marketing efforts within ServiceNow and ultimately drive success for our stakeholders. We work with many teams across ServiceNow like the Global Campaigns, Talent and Event Marketing teams to execute and drive their paid media programs. The role requires an acute attention to detail, an eye for operational efficiencies and a passion for deep diving into data to find actionable insights.Successful Candidate will:o Gain an understanding of how paid search, paid social, programmatic display, and video work to help us promote ServiceNow digitally.o Learn how to utilize a variety of tools that help us acquire new customers via our digital channels.o Create and update operational manuals and checklists across the entire team that will help with the launch of digital campaigns.o Utilize our tools and platforms to learn how to pull reporting while also gaining an understanding of how to properly analyze them.Role Requirements:· Currently enrolled at an accredited University pursuing a bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing,Computer Science, Engineering, Psychology, EnglishMajor, Communications, Design or a similar field· Familiarity with Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Fiddler, Httpfox a plus· Familiarity with Agile, Scrum, Waterfall techniques a plus· Self-starter with initiative and attention to detail· Ability to assimilate quickly and work productively in a team environment· Curious about what works, what doesn’t and why·   Agility and speed, able to work in a fast-paced environment

Description: Fidelity’s Center for Applied Technology (FCAT) is looking for Designers and Design Thinkers to spend their next co-op with us. This 6 month experience will offer the opportunity to work with business leaders, and the FCAT Design Studio, and to participate in new innovation projects, resulting in a portfolio piece based on your own design research. FCAT is a think tank whose mandate is to catalyze innovation across the firm. Our teams prototype and pilot new businesses and capabilities that incorporate future technology and techniques, often well before public adoption. We are looking for individuals who are passionate about grounding technology in human needs and at human scale, based on empathy and direct research. Candidates must enjoy being in a fast-paced, highly ambiguous environment working with emerging technologies, combined with a designer’s deep curiosity and empathy for people.The Background We’re Looking ForWorking toward a Bachelor’s Degree or Master’s degree in the College of Arts, Media and Design, Business, the Social Sciences or other related field with experience or a demonstrated interest in Design Thinking, prototyping, or User Research.The Skills You Bring· Can design and execute basic qualitative research using a number of methods based on project goals and timelines· Synthesize research—ability to get to the “so what” and create actionable insights, develop key frameworks, and explore opportunity areas from research so the whole team can move forward- Make simple prototypes, take learnings as a springboard for iteration- Demonstrate creative and inventive problem solving- Ability to roll up the sleeves, visualize ideas and concepts and make concepts tangible- Possess the ability to thrive in moments of chaos and ambiguity- Has the confidence to talk to customers and show them things are not ready for primetime- Enjoy working as part of a highly collaborative team- A strong IQ is nice, but even nicer is strong EQ and CQ (Curiosity Quotient)!The Purpose of Your RoleAs a key role on our incubator team, you will experience multiple methodologies during your Co-Op such as Lean Start Up, Design Thinking and Agile, to rapidly move ideas through the scan/try to proof of concept phase. Some of the technologies that our teams focus on include Blockchain, Cryptocurrency, VR/AR, AI and data science technologies. We will explore how we can disrupt our current businesses, and provide new opportunities to create visionary products and services with these emerging technologies and human­centered design to create visionary products and services that improve people’s financial lives. As the innovation engine for Fidelity Investments, you will be part of an exciting group that provides expertise to the rest of the firm on new tools and techniques, while also incubating potential new applications of emerging technology.The Value You DeliverThe Fidelity Center of Applied Technology (FCAT) Co-op Program is designed to begin to build the design, technical and analytical skills needed for a successful career with Fidelity FCAT. Co-ops have the opportunity to add value to the organization and learn about Fidelity’s businesses in an environment supported by state-of-the-art technology.Company OverviewAt Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in creating and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to our associates.

As an Innovation Center, the BIC focuses in areas where requirements are less defined, and step in to assist customers create product and technology definition.We are positioned to look at technologies at the intersection of cutting edge and reality, creating the technology and product building blocks to support the broader Flex ecosystem. Our talented designers, and engineers work in a highly collaborative environment on innovative products designed to improve people’s lives. In addition to pursuing cutting edge technologies, the Boston Innovation Center houses the Flex Center of Competence for Soft Systems. The Soft Systems team is focused on integrating novel materials and electronics with soft materials such as textiles to create new applications for connected devices.Mechanical Design Engineering Co-opAs a Mechanical Design Engineering Co-op student, you will work under the supervision of senior engineers to design and develop parts of complete products. You will understand the requirements of the new design, develop a mechanical solution, and use the latest CAD software to design the parts. You will provide design expertise, technical competency, while contributing to a team designing and developing innovative mechanical and electro-mechanical products or subsystems in a contract design and manufacturing environment. You will work on cutting edge products to design and implement innovative, cost-effective, and manufacturable product solutions of complex scope in order to support the organization from early prototype development.PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES/DUTIES:· Support hands-on design and development of products/platforms from initial concept to production.· Assist innovation team by performing research and development on cross industry disruptive technologies· Work closely with clients on initial concept development, including brainstorming, sketching, and complex CAD modeling.· Organizational, management, and communication skills to effectively work with a team of engineers and designers to develop superior systems including system design, integration, and final testing.· Support rapid prototyping and sample fabrication for both internal and external customer projects· Adapt existing methods to support the development of new products and technology.· Collaborate with cross functional team developing the products.· Manage design parameters and design tradeoff priorities while keeping on schedule.· Learn more about soft systems integration, techniques, and materialsQualifications:· BS/BE (Senior year) or ME/MS students in Mechanical Engineering· Previous relevant design focused Co-op or industry experience,· Understanding electrical and electromechanical systems, testing, and prototyping· Adept in SolidWorks· Experience with prototyping and/or manufacturing methods including but not limited to 3Dprinting, Injection Molding, Machining, and Sheetmetal· Experience with MS Office, specifically Word, Excel, PowerPoint· Self-starter with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think analytically· Highly collaborative team attitude· Ability to work within a cross-functional team while maintaining self sufficiency· Solid oral and written communication skills· Experience or interest in textiles and/or soft goods integration preferredFor more information on what Flex engineers are working on watch these videos:· Flex Live Smarter:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tjsYun64gOM· Flex Employees:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DxHsytV9KN0· Flex Innovation:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CXJuzzoGIW4For more information please visit our careers page at www.flextronics.com

Description: The Co-op student will be involved in working closely with members of the lab to study how and why bacterial pathogens use specialized nanomachines to directly inject proteins into human cells during the course of an infection. In particular, they will work on a project related to how these machines can be reengineered to serve as novel delivery systems for therapeutic payloads. The Co-op student will have an independent project as well as work collaborative with members of the group. Typical workload may include recombinant DNA cloning, PCR, DNA sequencing, protein secretion assays, genetic screens, yeast transformation, high throughout growth and microscopy based assays using robotics. In addition, the co-op will help out in the daily running of the lab including preparation of media and buffers as well as work on assisting the lab with other related projects as time allows. Candidates should have some previous laboratory experience and an interest in microbiology.

Description: Who We AreEnel is a globally recognized leader in sustainable energy and is consistently named one of Fortune Magazine’s “Companies that are Changing the World.” It is also one of the largest and most trusted energy companies in the world, serving around 70 million customers in more than 30 countries across 5 continents. The Enel Group vision is about Open Power. Open Power means opening energy access to more people; opening the world of energy to new technologies; opening new ways for people to manage energy; opening new uses of energy; and opening more partnerships. These are ambitious goals and we are pursuing them with the passion of more than 65,000 people whose brilliant work is based on our values of Responsibility, Innovation, Trust and Proactivity. In the US and Canada Enel operates through three business lines: Enel Green Power, Enel X and Enel Trading. Together our businesses are leading the energy transition, creating the sustainable energy solutions of the future to help individuals, businesses and communities change energy into lasting value.Meet Enel X:Enel X, part of Enel Group, is a global business leading the transformation of the energy sector. We enable consumers, businesses and communities to make smarter decisions about the way energy is created, stored and managed. We are passionate, motivated thinkers who are unified by our mission to change the way the world uses energy. We thrive on solving big problems for our customers and are fueled by our innovation and determination. In the US & Canada, Enel X combines the spirit of a startup with the expertise and infrastructure of a global innovator. We’re opening up the full spectrum of energy innovation to help our customers grow through sustainable energy solutions in the following core areas: Demand Response, Demand Management, Energy Supply Management, Energy Storage and Microgrids, Energy Efficiency, Electric Vehicle Charging, Utility Bill Management, and Sustainability. Together, with our passionate people, we are accelerating the pace of change in the energy industry, towards a more efficient and sustainable world.The Opportunity: Enel X has a need for a Customer Support Intern to join our talented and energetic Global Support team this summer. In this role, you are a key player in achieving the team’s mission to deliver easy, enjoyable, and effective customer experiences to our growing commercial and industrial customers. You are the internal voice of the customer, and will solve challenging customer issues in a dynamic, collaborative team environment.The ideal candidate has demonstrated interpersonal and communication skills, and is eager to learn about the energy and software industries. Successful candidates are technically savvy and apply creative problem-solving to a variety of challenges. This role offers the opportunity to learn about Enel X’s demand response programs and core operational processes, and develop business acumen.Responsibilities: Qualifications:

Position: Patient Care Associate - BWH Medical Intensive Care Unit
Targeted Academic Majors: Bouve College of Health Sciences/Physical Therapy, Bouve College of Health Sciences/Nursing, Bouve College of Health Sciences/Health Science, College of Science/Cell and Molecular Biology, College of Science/Biology, College of Science/Biochemistry, College of Science/Behavioral Neuroscience
Workplace Type: Primarily on-site work
Description: About this unit:The unit cares for a broad range of critically ill patients that require a high degree of medical and nursing care with diverse and complex diagnoses and conditions. Our patients are adults and typically range in ages from 18 to 100. Our population varies from single organ dysfunction to complex multisystem failure patients. Our general population of patients ranges in admission diagnosis from patients with gastrointestinal bleeds, pneumonia, SIRS, sepsis, drug and alcohol overdoses and withdrawals, diabetic ketoacidosis, acute respiratory distress syndrome, acute lung injury, pancreatitis and occasionally patients awaiting lung transplants. To meet the needs critical care needs within the facility we also accept overload of surgical, neurological or cardiac patients who require critical interventions and monitoring. We also provide a unique service for those patients requiring desensitization to chemotherapy, or other medications necessary for treatment. In addition, approximately few years ago our institution implemented an extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) program as a treatment option for adult patients. Also, MICU was designated early during the pandemic as the unit whose staff t teams possessed the expertise to manage COVIS-19 special patient population. Utilizing a hospital wide approach which included multidepartment’s-Infection diseases, department of environmental affairs, emergency department and clinical laboratories, a control plan was developed. Job responsibilities:NRSG 2000, NRSG 2220/1 - Nursing Interventions and Assessment LabCurrentlyenrolled in BSN programOccasionally, a student outside of nursing major will be considered but the student must be a Certified Nursing Assistant and be licensed through Mass. Dept. of Health. As the state of MA is not offering CNA exams at this time, documentation of successful completion of full CNA course work will suffice.Hiring requirements:Public transportation from NU:GREAT CO-OP EXPERIENCE WITH STAFF THAT ENJOY TEACHING!

Description: Do you ever find yourself wondering what it is like to work behind scenes in Washington, DC? Do you have what it takes to make it as a Coop in the fast-paced environment of Capitol Hill?Thank you for your interest in learning more about our nation?s government and the legislative process through an internship in Missouri Republican Congressman Billy Long?s office.??We are currently looking for a conservative, dependable and professional college junior or senior with a positive attitude and strong work ethic. Description: Important Job InformationPlease see full job description below.[YES ] Background check/CORI[ YES] Special InformationWelcome to the John D. Runkle School of Brookline! Dating back to 1897 the Runkle School has a long and distinguished history in the town of Brookline. The school was named for John Daniel Runkle, a Chairman of the Brookline School Committee and an early advocate of Mathematics and technical education. John Daniel Runkle was a founder of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and served as its second president.The John D. Runkle School serves the Fisher Hill neighborhood and is located between Route 9 and Beacon Street with a K-8 population of approximately 500 students. The Runkle School is proud of its diverse and vibrant community and strives for academic excellence while supporting the arts and the belief in teaching the ?whole? child. The school embraces its diverse population and is committed to the work of Brookline?s Equity Project as well as the system wide programs such as Spanish English Language Learners. With an active relationship with the Parent Teach Organization (PTO), the Runkle School works to build community through events such as the Family Picnic and the annual Halloween Fair, Ice-Skating Night, BINGO night, the gala International Night and the annual Music and Arts Festival. The PTO helps by supplementing teacher supplies, underwriting class field trips, providing scholarships and helping to raise school spirit. The Runkle School is constantly working on school-improvement through various groups including PTO, the School Council and the Student Council. Each organization is active in helping build community and support. The Runkle School Council is committed to working on the school?s annual School Improvement Plan. The Student Council works to uphold the code of conduct and values of the school including: Respect, Unity, Nurture Ideas, Kindness, Learn from Mistake and Effort Counts. The Runkle school just completed renovations to increase classroom and meeting spaces, to create a new media center, cafeteria, gymnasium and multi-purpose room. The new facilities are beautiful!In 2011 the Runkle School students in grades 3, 5 and 7 partook in a bullying survey, which combined with the bullying prevention and interventions programs, provided both education and awareness to the concept of bullying.The responsibilities may be as follows:üAssist head teachers and school staff with K-8th grade childrenüTutor individual studentsüAssist with small and large group instruction as well as activities.üPerform general tasks for the principal's office and libraryüSupervise recess and lunch periodsInstructional Assistant Qualifications:üMust have an interest in children, education, and recreationüCPR and First Aid are preferredüTheoretical knowledge of childhood development is a plus.üFlexibility- being able to shift quickly from one assignment to anotherTransit directions to the school from Northeastern U campus:Northeastern University360 Huntington AveBoston, MA 021151. Walk to Hynes Convention Center StationAbout 14 mins (0.7 mi)2. Hynes Convention Center Station Stop ID: 70153Green Line Light rail towards D - Riverside(15 mins, 6 stops)3. Beaconsfield Station Stop ID: 70177Walk to John D. Runkle SchoolAbout 6 mins (0.2 mi)John D. Runkle School50 Druce StreetBrookline, MA 02445

Description: 2nd or 3rd co-op only! Must have already completed one co-op!Students must have a graduation date of 2021 or 2022As Smartleaf's Business Development Co-op, you will have a unique opportunity to support the business development and enterprise sales functions of a progressive financial technology firm. You'll be responsible for deploying business development campaigns, conducting industry research, improving company sales practices, and more.Because we are a small team, you will have the opportunity to work closely with the company President and senior management in other areas of the business. You will be empowered to propose improvements and new initiatives, be given real operational responsibilities, and actively participate in project execution. Located in downtown Boston, Smartleaf is a collaborative investment tech company.Working at Smartleaf during the Pandemic:In response to the pandemic, Smartleaf has offered additional flexibility and support to all of our employees. Everyone working for the company is provided with technology to work comfortably from home, wherever that may mean for your individual situation. Staff local to the Boston area also have the option of working in the office (distant and in limited numbers), should their living situation be less conducive to feeling productive.We’ve also done our best to maintain the unique, inclusive culture that makes Smartleaf a great place to work. Impromptu meetups in the kitchen, conversations in the hallways, and after-work excursions have been replaced by online activities. You can still look forward to a low-key daily scrum (complete with a fun question to ponder), weekly team and company meetings to stay in sync, the occasional after-work game hour (codenames, anyone?), and many more opportunities for meaningful interaction with your colleagues.Provide support for business development, enterprise sales and overall company growth including but not limited to:Our automated rebalancing software enables wealth managers to spend less time on the nitty-gritty details of trading, and instead focus on fostering stronger client-advisor relationships. Currently, we help manage over $50 billion in assets across more than 40,000 accounts. Smartleaf is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Description: Note: This is a remote co-op opportunity.Programs and services offered by Bridge CulturesOnline workshops/webinars:Students learn about the culture and multiple facets and influences on various aspects of life through conversations with people they would meet while in Bangalore. With a remote co-op, Bridge Cultures will enable these conversations virtually. We will organize 3 virtual webinars and workshops on various topics in context to cultural integration which will align with students’ professional and personal growth. Bridge Cultures will bring professionals from various domains and facilitate these interactive sessions.Few topics (not confined to) are listed below:· Social entrepreneurship· Know the city - food, culture, people· Leadership and Teamwork· Unconscious biases· Critical thinking· Influence of culture on design, education, outdoor education, experiential education· Sustainability· Mental health, emotional well-being· Impact of traveling on our personalitySelf-reflection session:Bridge Cultures believes that self-reflection is highly important and necessary to learn and grow, especially after working with a social enterprise on an impactful project. Out of many reasons, reflection is important because it:· Enables the individuals to process and make meaning of the experience· Fosters a better understanding of context. i.e. understanding how their work impacts the community and encourages more participation in future· Creates a sense of accomplishment· Enables the individuals to examine the effects of their behavior, discover ways to improve· Reinforces the feeling of empathy gained during the experience· Acknowledges the skills gained during the experience and builds confidenceFees and processProgram fees - USD $455Inclusions:· Co-op placement· Necessary documentation· Self-Reflection session· 2-3 online webinars/workshops on various topics· Review meetings during co-op to track progress· Social networkProcess:1. Students apply for various positions through NU works2. Bridge Cultures will send an email to the student to schedule a call3.   After the student’s response to that email, a call will be scheduled between the student, Ms. Aspa Papanastasiou (Associate Director, Global engagements at NU), and Bridge Cultures to ensure accountability from the student’s side4. Another call will be scheduled with Bridge Cultures (if needed) to understand the student’s interest, motivation, and expectations from the co-op5. The student will pay the Program fees to Bridge Cultures ($455)6. Bridge Cultures will facilitate the call between student and the organization7. The organization will communicate their response to Bridge Cultures and the student8. If the student is selected, the organization will share the appointment/offer letter with Bridge Cultures9. Bridge Cultures will share the appointment letter with the student10. The student will start the co-op on the decided dates11. Bridge Cultures will facilitate virtual onboarding if necessary12. Bridge Cultures will facilitate 3 online sessions on various topics and organize 2 review meetings during the co-op13. Bridge Cultures will facilitate self-reflection session at the end of the co-opRefund policy:· If the student is not selected by the first organization interviewed for, Bridge Cultures will find another position with another organization. If the student is not selected there as well, 50% of the program fees will be refunded to the student· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op prior to confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 25% of the program fees (this is to factor the currency transaction charges that incurs to Bridge Cultures)· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op after receiving confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 75% of the program fees

Description: Optikos Corporation offers our customers quick-turn full life-cycle engineering design services for challenging optical systems. The mechanical engineering department is looking for thoughtful, creative, and driven students to join our small (<10 person) team. We work in a collaborative and fast paced multi-disciplinary environment to solve some of the world’s most complicated optically based design challenges. You will be interfacing with a diverse technical staff including optical, software, electrical, and manufacturing engineers, highly experienced optical technicians, and a technically savvy sales staff.In a 6 month co-op term, you will see and work on dozens of projects at all stages of the product development cycle from initial brainstorming all the way to prototyping and low volume contract manufacture.Specific job tasks and responsibilities include:Prospective students should have good written and verbal communication skills, understand the fundamentals of mechanical engineering design, and be familiar with 3D modeling (SolidWorks preferred) and manufacturing techniques. Participation in projects such as Baja or Formula SAE, AIAA, FIRST robotics, etc. and examples of past work are a plus. You don’t need experience with optics, but you will need to love learning, designing and engineering.Optikos Corporation is a product development firm specializing in optical systems. Optikos has over 37 years of experience solving some of the toughest optical, electro-optical, and opto-mechanical problems for the consumer products, aerospace, medical, life sciences and automotive industries. Our creativity and innovation have led to the awarding of over 70 US patents. We are located conveniently within the I-95 belt loop in Wakefield, MA.

Description: About Morphic TherapeuticMorphic Therapeutic is a biopharmaceutical company developing a new generation of oral integrin therapies for the treatment of serious chronic diseases, including autoimmune, cardiovascular and metabolic diseases, fibrosis and cancer. In collaboration with AbbVie, Janssen and Schrödinger, Morphic is advancing its pipeline and discovery activities using its proprietary MInT technology platform which leverages the Company’s unique understanding of integrin structure and biology. For more information, visitwww.morphictx.com.Morphic is advancing both partnered and fully-owned oral integrin therapeutic candidates with the initial clinical trials beginning in the 2020. Our immediate focus is on the areas where the clinical activity of antibody inhibitors of integrins is precedented, thus enabling a rapid path to clinical proof-of-concept. Morphic Therapeutic is located in the AstraZeneca BioHub in Waltham, MA. We are seeking a highly talented and motivated individual to join our culture of teamwork, craftsmanship, tenacity, compassion, and integrity.Job descriptionThe Morphic computational chemistry team designs small molecules to inhibit biological targets involved in human disease. The successful applicant will utilize modern computational algorithms to discover, design and optimize small molecules for synthesis and biological testing. In addition, modern cheminformatics and data analysis techniques are used to mine the large amounts of varying types of data being generated. The position will be part of an integrated team of scientists, all working together to advance novel therapeutics forward to clinical studies. A familiarity with chemistry is desired, in addition to experience and aptitude for computational work. Direct computer science skills are a plus but not required.Morphic Therapeutic is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an environment that maximizes our employees’ development and achievement goals. We strive to treat each employee as an individual, as we seek to foster a spirit of teamwork to help change patients’ lives.

Description: Position:  Co-op, Discovery BiologyReports to: Senior Associate ScientistLocation: Kendall Square, Cambridge, MATimeframe: January 2021 – June 2021Hours:              Monday through Friday, 40 hours per weekCasma OverviewCasma Therapeutics is harnessing the natural cellular process of autophagy to open vast new target areas for drug discovery and development that will profoundly impact the lives of patients. Autophagy is a conserved cellular process that contributes to overall organismal health. Inefficient autophagy flux or defects in lysosomal homeostasis are observed in numerous pathologies, e.g., neurodegeneration, metabolic disorders, inflammation, and muscle degeneration. Casma uses several approaches to intervene at strategic points throughout the autophagy-lysosome system to improve the cellular process of clearing out unwanted proteins, organelles and invading pathogens. By boosting autophagy, Casma expects to be able to arrest or reverse the progression of lysosomal storage disorders, muscle disorders, inflammatory disorders and neurodegeneration, among other indications. Casma was launched in 2018 by Third Rock Ventures and is based in Cambridge, Mass.Casma is seeking a talented and highly motivated co-op to support the Cellular Assays and Pharmacology team. Your work will support drug discovery programs that are leading to the identification of novel therapeutic targets and drug candidates for clinical development. As a newly founded and fast-growing startup, you will get to be a part of a dynamic environment as we are building the science and programs and have the opportunity to interact with the entire organization. We are looking for someone who will share our excitement about the science, contribute to our culture, and honor our commitment to patients.WHAT YOU WILL DOQUALIFICATIONS YOU SHOULD POSSESSCasma Company Values + CultureCourage to listen learn, lead, Awesome science, Strength through collaboration,Medical breakthroughs for patients, Always do the right thingWe have created and are sustaining a creative scientific culture where we recognize and reward our “Casmaniacs” for exemplifying our Core Values, and we accelerate our professional growth through coaching, development, and frequent feedback. Our plan of nurturing the fiercest, most talented and diverse Casmaniacs is coming to fruition before our very eyes.Equal Employment OpportunityCasma provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, veteran status, disability, pregnancy or conditions related to pregnancy, or genetics.

Description: Alpha Platform Strategy Analyst Co-opState Street Alpha, the industry’s first and only Front-to-Back Platform, gives clients access to the complete investment lifecycle with the power of choice. By streamlining and improving their day-to-day operations through a single open platform, clients are free to focus on innovation and growth.Alpha Platform Management team is recruiting for an exciting new role to develop and deliver product and business strategy that is aligned to the vision of our State Street Alpha Platform.This role will require working across multiple different groups within the bank to collect required information and create content that is digestible at a senior level. The successful candidate must be proactive by nature, skilled in analyzing complex business concepts, eager to tackle and drive new efforts and resourceful at gathering and organizing information. Additional required qualities include creativity, excellent verbal, written and presentation skills. An understanding of State Streets internal business units and service/product offering is a plus.The Alpha Platform Strategy Analyst will play a key role in supporting the platform roadmap, multi-year strategy planning, governance, and transformation efforts. The successful candidate will be a key partner to the Alpha management team. The position will be located in Boston, Massachusetts.Responsibilities:· Support development and management of Alpha Roadmap· Create Alpha Platform documentation, e.g., Alpha roadmap, operating model, software catalogue· Develop materials for strategic internal and external discussions· Review and refine client facing materials and documentation that is prepared outside of the Alpha Platform Management Organization· Analyze and evaluate plans and initiatives to enable strategic recommendations and issue resolution· Work across groups to capture and consolidate input to produce consumable updates for executive management· Monitor executive meeting follow ups and status of strategic prioritiesQualifications:· Experience in financial services or the high-tech/software (SaaS preferred) industries· Undergraduate degree from top-tier institution or similar academic / professional experience· Ability to think both strategically and tactically with a persistent attention to detail and problem-solving mentality· Excellent presentation skills, including strong oral and written capabilities; ability to clearly communicate compelling messages· Team-oriented and collaborative approach to work, with strong interpersonal skills· A self-starter who can work independently and has worked in a fast-paced, quickly evolving, and sometimes ambiguous environment with multiple partnersAbout the State Street AlphaSM PlatformState Street’s AlphaSM platform is the first front-to-back investment servicing platform for Institutional and Wealth Managers globally. State Street and Charles River Development share a common focus on helping clients achieve better investment outcomes. By combining our back- and middle-office expertise with Charles River Development’s complementary front-office tools and solutions, we aim to provide clients with a comprehensive servicing platform across the investment process, supported by deep enterprise data management and transaction management capabilities. Our interoperable platform will also enable clients to integrate and align their preferred systems utilizing State Street provided data, as well as access to liquidity, insights and infrastructure.

Description: Museum Education Assistant (Commonwealth Museum) - 2 PositionsSummary of OrganizationThe Commonwealth Museum at the Massachusetts Archives displays rare historical materials of national significance. Among many “treasures” are the copperplate used by Paul Revere to engrave the famous Boston Massacre image and one of fourteen original copies of the Bill of Rights. High tech interactive exhibits trace the development of rights using touch tables, videos, and primary source materials. Currently we are emphasizing virtual access to museum resources.Job Description and ExpectationsThe major responsibility is working with the Education Department to conduct museum programs for teachers and students. Under present circumstances we are developing and offering online materials. Current co-op student are involved in research, design, and presentation of materials including live zoom programs (an example was the development of a virtual tour of the museum and virtual field trip for teachers). Programs are offered for elementary, middle and high school groups.In-person field trips have been suspended. If they were to resume next spring (because a vaccine and other measures have brought the virus under control) they could resume. In that case museum assistants would guide students through the exhibit and make presentations in the museum classroom. Classroom programs feature costumes and props to help bring history alive.In addition to teaching there is an administrative role, sending out educational material to teachers in advance of their visit and scheduling preferred programs. Currently there is a heightened emphasis on social media including developing brief historical vignettes for the museum facebook page and twitter account.Desirable QualificationsThe student will gain experience in teaching and public speaking; social media, publicity and outreach; general administrative experience in an office setting; customer service skills; and research.We value the energy and enthusiasm that Northeastern students bring to the museum and work to provide a welcoming atmosphere and professional development for our co-op students

Description: OverviewAt Friday, we believe the future of work is a more flexible work environment and that remote work is only the tip of the iceberg. We’re building software to give people awareness and visibility into what’s going on at work, regardless of where the team is based. Remote teams love the software and 87% of our users say it improves the remote work experience.We are looking for a productivity writer to help us redefine the future of remote work and help individuals and teams become more productive.The product is like a digital work planner or a sidekick to workplace chat tools like Slack or Microsoft Teams. The software bundles the best practices of remote teams and makes it easy for any team to roll these work habits out in less time and with less stress. This is especially important as millions of people were forced to work remotely due to Covid-19. The software is used by leading teams at Twitter, Red Hat, EA, and more.About the RoleWe seek an independent, self-motivated writer who can take initiative and work autonomously. You will report directly to the CEO and our content marketing group as we build out our go-to-market group.Responsibilities: Research, investigate, and write about personal productivity concepts like the Ivy Lee method, SMART goals, GTD, daily/weekly planning, and more. Review productivity software tools and share how they compare/contrast to Friday Reach out to successful business leaders and interview them (via email) about their daily routines, personal productivity methods, and more Read/review popular or bestselling books on productivity and summarize key conceptsWe’d like you to create content that looks/feels like Keep Productive, Farnam Street, or a similar website. We value quality over quantity, but we appreciate speed and focusing on the most important things. You must love writing about productivity concepts and love sharing what you learn in a simple and easy to understand way You should have writing samples that you’d be willing to share You should have experience working autonomously in a self-directed wayOther things you should know about the roleThe role is flexible, but some of these projects can be accelerated if we meet up in-person, especially for the first-part of the program.

Description: Company DescriptionAddgene is a non-profit company that facilitates biomedical research and discovery. Our biorepository stores, archives and distributes plasmids for academic scientists around the world. Addgene’s plasmid collection represents a broad range of disciplines and can be used for a variety of functions such as genome engineering, gene expression, optogenetics, viral gene delivery, and applications in a wide range of cells and organisms.Job LocationAddgene is located in Watertown, MA. It is a short shuttle ride from the MBTA red line and has ample onsite parking.Addgene is committed to creating and fostering a diverse, supportive, and inclusive working environment. All of our initiatives benefit from the diverse and open worldwide scientific community that we work with, and we believe that the best innovations and discoveries come from diverse teams. Addgene will continue to build these diverse teams, as well as continue to do the hard work of examining how Diversity, Equity and Inclusion can be meaningfully woven into our work life, foremost and always to combat bias of all kinds. We are looking forward to continuing to get to know and celebrate a variety of perspectives and backgrounds as we grow our teams; and in doing so, we will bring more scientists together to share their resources in order to change the world.Spring 2020 (January – June Co-op cycle)Compensation commensurate with experience. The cost of public transportation is fully paid by the company.Please send a cover letter and resume to jobs@addgene.org. Only applications including both a cover letter and resume will be considered.

Description: Software Engineer, Full Stack - Boston (Remote)About the RoleWe are looking for a co-op with strong computer science fundamentals and a background in application development to join one of our feature development teams.Feature teams at Teikametrics currently focus on Python powered Flask APIs servicing data out of Postgres, which is in turn filled from Snowflake tables, in turn filled by DBT. We also have a 'functional-first' Scala stack with cats, fs2, akka-http, and slick, powering our data ingest and our older APIs. These back ends power a front-end that uses TypeScript with React and Redux.At Teikametrics, you will: Become an essential member of a team of ~3-6 engineers, frequently pair programming. Learn, grow and receive mentorship from individual members of your diverse and talented engineering team. Write code to develop features for and fix bugs in our backend, primarily in Python. Collaborate with designers to improve our front end, coding in React. Collaborate and communicate with our other development teams. Actively contribute to our development roadmap and to the evolution of our software platform. Read and review pull requests. Participate in planning meetings, retros, and other scrum meetings.Qualified candidates should have: Strong computer science fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, distributed systems Proficiency in modern frameworks, libraries (e.g. React, Redux, etc.) Experience writing clean, semantic HTML and CSS Ability to set up reusable, testable and performant UI components, allowing for rapid development and well-organized code Experience with Python Knowledge of and experience with databases (especially SQL/RDBMS experience) Experience with writing code that interfaces with the database layer Experience writing well designed and testable code and writing effective unit and integration tests Startup-level passion about wanting to take on large, challenging problems with a small team of world-class developers A desire to work in a collaborative environment focusing on continuous learning; participating in tech talks, code review, and some pair programming.ABOUT TEIKAMETRICSAt Teikametrics, we’re building an operating system to optimize every aspect of a retailer's business -- from advertising to inventory to pricing. We optimize billions of transactions for thousands of entrepreneurs and brands around the world selling on Amazon and other marketplaces. The Teikametrics Retail Optimization Platform uses proprietary econometrics and machine-learning data models packaged in a simple SaaS interface. We combine our best in class technology with coaching and support from our world-class teams based remotely and in Boston, MA, Seattle, WA, Tel Aviv, Israel and Bengaluru, India. We are looking for people who can excel, add value to our mission, and thrive in a demanding start-up environment.

Description: Entrada Therapeutics is a biotechnology company dedicated to transforming the treatment of devastating diseases through the intracellular delivery of biologics. Entrada’s technology enables the efficient intracellular delivery of proteins, peptides and nucleic acids, thus allowing for the development of programs across several intracellular target classes. The Company’s novel approach addresses current challenges associated with both large and small molecule therapeutics and represents a fundamental advancement in the delivery of molecules into the cytosol.Entrada is comprised of experts and leaders in both biologics development and the rare disease space. In December 2018, Entrada closed a $59 million Series A from 5AM Ventures, MPM Capital, Roche Venture Fund, MRL Ventures Fund and Agent Capital.Entrada is hiring for a protein engineering Co-Op position to join the Company’s intracellular biologics discovery programs. This individual will work closely with antibody discovery scientists in the biologics group to progress programs from target identification to preclinical proof-of-concept. The successful candidate will conduct design of expression constructs, recombinant protein expression and optimization. By the end of the co-op training, the candidate will have practical knowledge and experience from gene cloning to recombinant protein production.Job ResponsibilitiesQualificationsEntrada Therapeutics is an equal opportunity employer. From heavy mechanical and fire protection, to plumbing, HVAC, and specialty contracting, we engage with the best clients on the most challenging and unique projects.Welkin enjoys a strong foundation to build upon. The company is poised to grow as we take advantage of the current emphasis on rebuilding America’s infrastructure as part of renewing our nation’s economy. Welkin’s work is concentrated in the heart of New York City.The Project Engineer Intern/ Co-op applies basic concepts and techniques to plan projects, develop basic installation drawings and contribute to intermediate project milestones. He or she has knowledge in civil engineering concepts and can quickly adapt to a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate will be eager to learn and work well in a team setting.In addition to daily assignments the intern/ co-op is assigned one complete project work item that he or she is solely responsible for. He or she will work closely with the Project Manager to implement policies and procedures required for item’s success. The intern/ co-op will maintain a good knowledge of the contract specifications, documents and the scope of work, including subcontracts and purchase orders and assist in development of project status reports and profit projections. In addition, the intern/ co-op is responsible for monitoring activities at construction sites and assisting the Superintendent and Project Manager with site management.ResponsibilitesQualificationsEduction / Certifications

Description: Brief Description of Campaign’s Department internship, Oxfam AmericaOxfam America is seeking an energetic and enthusiastic Intern to work closely with its Campaigns Department. This position will support campaigning, research, and advocacy efforts for Oxfam’s work related to COVID-19, climate change, food security, women’s empowerment, economic justice, voter’s rights and worker’s rights.DescriptionOxfam America is seeking an energetic and enthusiastic Intern to work closely with its Campaigns Department. This position will support campaigning, research, and advocacy efforts for Oxfam’s work related to COVID-19, climate change, food security, women’s empowerment, economic justice, voter’s rights, and worker’s rights.The intern will provide organizing, research, and administrative support for several key projects, including aiding in the management of Oxfam’s Sisters on the Planet Ambassadors program. Other projects include Oxfam America’s Dignity for All campaign as well as the Access to Meds campaign. Oxfam America is an international anti-poverty and development organization, whose mission is to create long-lasting solutions to poverty, hunger and social injustice. The internship is 40 hours per week and is unpaid.Typical tasks and responsibilities include:- Research and writing related to targeted Congressional campaigns, as well as prospective campaigns for Oxfam America-Supporting organizers in their outreach with key individuals and groups, including Oxfam’s Sisters on the Planet Ambassadors; research and writing on potential new recruits for the Sisters on the Planet Ambassadors program-Tracking information and measuring impact of program work; coordinating virtual events and program logistics;- Monitoring the work of Oxfam America’s partners and allies within the disciplines of health care, environmental activism, worker’s equality, gender justice and more.-Aiding Oxfam America’s virtual operations for webinars, online conferences and training sessions by providing technical supportThe Campaigns Department Intern will have the opportunity to gain practical organizing skills, learn about food security, climate change, gender and sustainable development issues, and get an inside understanding of campaigning, grassroots organizing and outreach within an international development agency. The internship offers a friendly and open work environment of supportive staff with whom to share knowledge, career advice, and workplace mentoring.Qualifications:The intern should have or be pursuing an undergraduate degree or higher, or have comparable work experience.The intern must have exacting attention to detail, strong writing and communication skills, ability to work well with others;The intern should possess strong organizational skills, professionalism and ability to meet deadlines;Also, it is important that the intern have an interest in furthering knowledge about Oxfam and global social justice issues; and high level of personal energy and commitment. Familiarity with Outlook, Zoom, and Excel is preferred.The ideal candidate will be self-motivated, an excellent listener, and a good organizer with a strong commitment to social justice and alignment with Oxfam’s core values.*This is an unpaid internship*

Description: About theRole:For spring 2010, the Manufacturing team at Abcam is offering an internship to students seeking a college degree in Computer/Data Science or related fields. The selected student will be working on a small team of engineers with backgrounds from Mechanical to Chemical and Software Engineer. For six months the selected student will be tasked with implementing new solutions as well as updating existing code when necessary. This opportunity is open to all levels of experience of software engineers as you will be working with experienced developers. You will not only gain experience working as full a stack developer, you will also be working in a laboratory setting controlling hardware such as liquid handling robots. As a life science company, the Manufacturing team at Abcam offers students a wide range of opportunities to learn and work on technologies that are used across many industries.Abcam’s Boston facility plans a move from its’ current location in Kendall Square, Cambridge to Waltham in Spring 2021 so this co-op position will start in Kendall Square for approximately 3 months and then will move to Waltham for the final approximately 3 months.Roles & Responsibilities:About YouIf you are passionate about leveraging the power of software engineering to find solutions to new problems. Our goal is to find solution to problems and sometimes that includes thinking outside of the constraints of your CS background. If this sounds like you and you’d like to be a part of a fast-paced, growing business with thevision to become the most influential company and best-loved brand in life sciences, please apply now!Pay and BenefitsIn addition to competitive salaries, we offer an attractive and flexible benefits package (including our award-winning share scheme, 18 weeks full paid maternity leave and 6 weeks full paid paternityleave), a culture focused on well-being and opportunities for growth and development, and a highly flexible working environment.What’s more, as a WORK180 Endorsed Employer, we are recognized globally as an organization that’s diverse, inclusive and supports women in the workplace.About UsAn idea conceived in a University of Cambridge laboratory in 1998, Abcam plc (www.abcamplc.com) began life as an innovative and entrepreneurial start-up, spearheaded by like-minded individuals who shared a common purpose of providing the scientific community with quality antibody reagents, as well as trustworthy and up-to-date information about their uses and limitations. Abcam has now grown to become a leading supplier of protein research tools to life scientists, whilst always maintaining the core collaborative values assumed at its inception.  Abcam now supports life science researchers in their quest to understand the cause of disease and ultimately offer improvements to diagnoses and treatments. To achieve this outcome, the company both develops andmanufactures its own products in specialist facilities across the globe, and sources from over 400 partners, offering scientists the newest, most innovative and highest quality research tools available globally, regardless of source. With a customer base of research scientists who require high performance products with detailed technical specifications, 64% of global researchers use Abcam products.  Inclusion & DiversityAbcam is an Equal Opportunity Employer and makes all employment decisions without regard to age, national origin, race, ethnicity, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Description: What You’ll Get to Do:TeraDiode (TDI) is a Massachusetts based Panasonic subsidiary and a world leader in developing high-power, high-brightness diode laser systems. Our kW-class direct diode laser technology is a disruptive force in the materials processing industry, which is currently dominated by Fiber and CO2 lasers. Our patented wavelength beam combining technology was developed by our co-founders from MIT Lincoln Laboratory for defense, industrial, and commercial materials processing applications.Work with TDI's team of engineers to design new and make improvements to existing products. The design includes opto-mechanical and mechanical concept development, design detailing, thermal and stress analysis, and tolerance analysis. Assist with the mechanical design and analysis of TDI's product line of high power, high brightness direct-diode lasers from design through verification. Interface with vendors, quality, manufacturing, and assembly technicians to better understand design requirements and project goals.We are seeking a highly motivated mechanical engineer co-op to work alongside our team of mechanical, optical, and laser engineers to help design, test, implement, and improve our unique high-power lasers. The ideal candidate will have experience creating high tolerance designs and technical drawings, ready for the challenges of a fast-paced work environment and looking to gain experience as a design engineer.What You’ll Bring:Education & Experience:Competencies:Communications:Other Requirements:

Description: Arrowstreet Capital during COVID-19At Arrowstreet Capital, we continue hiring for full time, intern and co-op positions. Like many firms, due to the pandemic, all employees are currently working remotely. We are pleased to interview candidates for Spring of 2021 via video interview (starting October 22nd). Please note that if we are still working remotely in 2021, due to legal and tax considerations, Spring 2021 co-ops must have authorization to work in the United States and be physically situated in the United States during the duration of the program (January – June 2021). If we return to our offices during the Spring 2021 co-op program, our expectation is that co-ops will be able to be present in our offices with a reasonable amount of advance notice.Company OverviewArrowstreet Capital is a Boston-based systematic investment firm that manages global equity portfolios for institutional investors around the world. Our firm manages approximately $100 billion for over 200 client relationships.Co-op Program OverviewThe Arrowstreet Co-op Program provides an exciting opportunity to learn about the institutional asset management industry and Arrowstreet as a company while gaining deep experience within a specific function. The co-ops are highly valued members of the team and participate in team meetings, perform business-critical work and receive real-time, balanced feedback. They enjoy all the perks of being an employee at Arrowstreet, including a warm and friendly work environment and a relaxed, business-casual dress code. The co-ops across the organization come together on a regular basis to meet members of the firm’s leadership and to learn about all aspects of the investment management process.Job OverviewThe Investment Analytics team is responsible for overseeing and producing analytics to support the investment process. This includes producing attribution, analyzing the results to ensure quality, and disseminating the results to stakeholders, including the portfolio management, research, business development, and the client relationship management team. This team is also responsible for calculating, analyzing, and generating additional analytics to explain the results of Arrowstreet's portfolio construction and investment processes. These additional analytics include portfolio positioning, active weights and shifts, model attribution, and tactical portfolio tilts.The team also oversees investment content. Members of this team will coordinate, draft, and respond to inquiries, questionnaires, and RFP's, and will contribute to the drafting of portfolio commentary. This team acts as the repository of investment responses, client notes, and white papers as it relates to all elements of Arrowstreet's investment process.The Investment Analytics team reports to the CIO. Individuals on this team play an important role working with the broader investment team, including the CIO, as well as members of the research and portfolio management teams, on strategic initiatives to implement and enhance the attribution and investment analytics process. Members of this team must have a sound understanding of portfolio construction, usage of derivatives, impact of leverage, and how to select the appropriate benchmark(s) to compute and report out attribution.ResponsibilitiesQualificationsWe maintain a friendly, team-oriented environment and place a high value on professionalism, attitude and initiative

Description: Pathology, Translational Sciences Co-opJounce Therapeutics is a clinical-stage biotech company focused on cancer immunotherapy, a paradigm-shifting approach in the treatment of cancer that has transformed the lives of many cancer patients in the last 5 years. Top-notch science and a strong culture of teamwork, empowerment and fun define our team, as we embark on our mission to create a world immune to cancer. We invite applications from talented and enthusiastic co-op students who are interested in expanding their knowledge in biology, protein science and drug discovery in a fast-paced, productive biotech environment. We are based in Cambridge, MA.Job Description:The Translational Pathology Team is seeking a talented and motivated undergraduate for a 6 month co-op at Jounce Therapeutics in Cambridge, Massachusetts. This role is best suited for someone with strong initiative and drive who will actively seek out opportunities to make an impact across a range of projects.You will have the opportunity to participate in investigating novel cancer immunotherapies and will gain hands-on experience in these areas:· Validation of immunohistochemistry (IHC) antibodies and in situ hybridization (ISH) probes for essential immuno-oncology biomarkers.· IHC and ISH evaluation of therapeutic mechanism and effect of candidate molecules in tumors from human and preclinical model(s).Experience:· Students need to have completed their third year of school and be authorized to work in the United States.· Major in Biology, Biochemistry, Biotechnology or biology-related fields required.A background/coursework in immunology and/or tumor biology preferred.

Description: Company SummaryTaking care of our customers, our communities and each other. That’s the Travelers Promise. By honoring this commitment, we have maintained our reputation as one of the best property casualty insurers in the industry for over 160 years. Join us to discover a culture that is rooted in innovation and thrives on collaboration. Imagine loving what you do and where you do it.Target Openings5Job Description SummaryThe goal of the Technology Leadership Development Program (TLDP) Co-Op is to attract and develop self-motivated individuals who are highly skilled and passionate about a career in technology while providing a foundation for future success within the organization.As a TLDP Co-Op intern, you will be exposed to a challenging professional work experience in technology with planned activities giving you insight into business, technology, and the many career options at Travelers. You will not only be able to gain a deeper understanding of what you can do in technology but also who we are as a company and how you fit within our Technology community. Description: Who We AreEllevation is a growth-stage education software company that is changing how educators work with English Language Learners, the fastest-growing student demographic in the country. We build web-based tools for educators to help enhance instruction, improve collaboration, and increase productivity. We partner with public school districts all across the country. In the past 12 months, we have more than doubled the size of our team and quadrupled the number of districts that we serve. We are well-capitalized, have an awesome and growing team, and are looking to add passionate, smart, fun and entrepreneurial folks to who are interested in building a high-impact company. This is where you come in?We are looking for a Software Engineer to join Ellevation's core technology team for theSpring as a Co-op. They will play a key role in helping to build dynamic web applications and services, implement complex data and API integrations, and be part of the conception-to-design-to-implementation product development process.As a member of our small engineering team, you will contribute to our software development ecosystem. Just as importantly, we are looking for someone who wants to be in a startup, has tremendous communication skills, and is a motivated self-starter.We value best-practice software engineering principles such as automated testing, continuous integration and very frequent, incremental delivery. As a small technology group, we seek individuals who are willing to be cross-functional and hands-on in multiple areas. You will be testing, releasing and supporting the code that you design and develop. This is a tremendous opportunity to help build the engineering foundation of the company.The ideal candidate has an understanding of core software development principles and the right attitude and interest to learn more. Description: JOB DESCRIPTION:Are you looking for a patient-focused, innovative-driven company that will inspire you and support your career development? If so, be empowered to take charge of your future at Takeda. Join us as a Co-op Research associate at our Cambridge office.Here, everyone matters and you will be a vital contributor to our inspiring, bold mission in Cell Therapies. Certified as a Global Top Employer, we offer stimulating careers, encourage innovation, and strive for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our global teams are united by a wavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world.Takeda’s Co-op Program is a six to eight-month, full-time experience where you will have the opportunity to apply your knowledge beyond the classroom, partner with industry-leading professionals in engineering, automation, statistics, and modeling while networking with fellow students as you engage in cutting-edge therapeutic programs.POSITION OBJECTIVES:The Cell Therapy Pharmaceutical Sciences team is investigating ways to improve the safety, efficacy and accessibility of first- and next-generation CAR T cells therapies. This position’s primary role is to provide support to cross-functional teams (process, analytical and automation).POSITION ACCOUNTABILITIES:· Work cross-functionally among workstreams, and programs to provide hand-on and technical support across the Cell Therapy functional groups.· Actively communicate with teams to inform program strategies and coordinate the team activities.· Establish the management databases of data file, sample banking and devices.· Assist in identifying operations improvement areas in compliance with good laboratory practices (GLP).· Assist in risk assessment, mitigations, scenarios, and proactive planning to ensure synergy and innovation among functions.QUALIFICATIONS:To participate in the Takeda Co-op Program, students must meet the following eligibility criteria:· Legal authorization to work in the U.S.· Grade point average of 3.4 or higher· At least 18 years of age prior to the scheduled start date· Be currently enrolled in an accredited college or universityEDUCATION, BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES AND SKILLS:· Minimum GPA of 3.4 and candidate has completed at least 1 year of Master studies preferred.· Enrolled in a Master program in one of the following: Biology, Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field· Graduate students in a Master program (related fields above) are eligible to apply for an Internship position.· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills· Working knowledge/experience of lab cell culture work is a plus.· Self-motivation and excellent time management skills· Excellent written and verbal communication, organizational skills, and be a strong team player.· Ability to drive initiatives, and excited to pursue professional development opportunitiesEMPLOYMENT CATEGORY· Full-time RegularEXPERIENCE LEVEL· Co-op or InternshipRelocation is not offered for this position.

Description: Videos will be on:1. Celebrating our women facilitator and their journey with ArtSparks2. Volunteers3. Creative Learning Lab (ArtSpark’s main program)4. EdSparks CollectiveResponsibilities and Duties:· Create high quality videos using the archive of videos and pictures at ArtSparks Foundation.· Create video content to support ArtSparks Foundation’s mission and tell compelling stories that brings visibility to the organizations work.· Develop compelling, bite-sized videos, GIFs, and social advertisements for distribution across various marketing channels.· Collaborate with Marketing & Communications Head to ensure that organizational branding and messaging strategies are being followed.· Collaborate with social media manager to provide content for social media periodically.· Other tasks as assigned.They can come up with creative ideas on how to raise funds, ideate or merch items for ArtSparks which we can potentially sell them later on and even gift to some of our volunteers.Qualifications: Photography and videography DesignRequired skills/Personal skills:Skills gained by the end of internship:Team work, decision making skills, problem solving skills, adaptability skills and work cultureProgram fees and services by Bridge CulturesOnline workshops/webinars:Students learn about the culture and multiple facets and influences on various aspects of life through conversations with people they would meet while in Bangalore. With a remote co-op, Bridge Cultures will enable these conversations virtually. We will organize 3 virtual webinars and workshops on various topics in context to cultural integration which will align with students’ professional and personal growth. Bridge Cultures will bring professionals from various domains and facilitate these interactive sessions.Few topics (not confined to) are listed below:· Social entrepreneurship· Know the city - food, culture, people· Leadership and Teamwork· Unconscious biases· Critical thinking· Influence of culture on design, education, outdoor education, experiential education· Sustainability· Mental health, emotional well-being· Impact of traveling on our personalitySelf-reflection session:Bridge Cultures believes that self-reflection is highly important and necessary to learn and grow, especially after working with a social enterprise on an impactful project. Out of many reasons, reflection is important because it:· Enables the individuals to process and make meaning of the experience· Fosters a better understanding of context. i.e. understanding how their work impacts the community and encourages more participation in future· Creates a sense of accomplishment· Enables the individuals to examine the effects of their behavior, discover ways to improve· Reinforces the feeling of empathy gained during the experience· Acknowledges the skills gained during the experience and builds confidenceFees and process:Inclusions:· Co-op placement· Necessary documentation· Self-Reflection session· 2-3 online webinars/workshops on various topics· Review meetings during co-op to track progress· Social networkApplication Process:1. Students apply for various positions through NU works2. Bridge Cultures will send an email to the student to schedule a call3.   After the student’s response to that email, a call will be scheduled between the student, Ms. Aspa Papanastasiou (Associate Director, Global engagements at NU), and Bridge Cultures to ensure accountability from the student’s side4. Another call will be scheduled with Bridge Cultures (if needed) to understand the student’s interest, motivation, and expectations from the co-op5. The student will pay the Program fees to Bridge Cultures ($455)6. Bridge Cultures will facilitate the call between student and the organization7. The organization will communicate their response to Bridge Cultures and the student8. If the student is selected, the organization will share the appointment/offer letter with Bridge Cultures9. Bridge Cultures will share the appointment letter with the student10. The student will start the co-op on the decided dates11. Bridge Cultures will facilitate virtual onboarding if necessary12. Bridge Cultures will facilitate 3 online sessions on various topics and organize 2 review meetings during the co-op13. Bridge Cultures will facilitate self-reflection session at the end of the co-opRefund policy:· If the student is not selected by the first organization interviewed for, Bridge Cultures will find another position with another organization. If the student is not selected there as well, 50% of the program fees will be refunded to the student· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op prior to confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 25% of the program fees (this is to factor the currency transaction charges that incurs to Bridge Cultures)· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op after receiving confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 75% of the program fees

Description: The Clinic Assistant I is responsible for working collaboratively within the Department of Clinical Services and with the other services throughout the organization. The Clinic Assistant I will work primarily alongside internal medicine, general medicine and emergency departments.The Department of Clinical Services requires staff to exhibit proficiency in the following two elements:§ Excellence: Models outstanding client service and clinical expertise.§ Service: Eagerly approaches each interaction with a client or colleague with an active desire to exceed their expectations.§ Integrity: Makes decisions based on a desire to achieve what is best for our clients, their pets and this organization.§ Collaboration: Works within the clinical team to provide excellent patient care. Partners with other areas of the hospital and the MSPCA to ensure everyone’s success.§ Compassion: Enjoys working in a fast-paced environment and making quick decisions that support the best interests of our clients and patients.§ Positivity: Maintains an optimistic outlook. Approaches each challenge with a sense that the end goal is attainable.b) Assisting with euthanasia and preparing bodies for cremation with kindness and compassion, understanding the dignity of the patient. Demonstrate the understanding of proper labeling of pet remains.c) Is able to perform suture and staple removals and is able to recognize problems or complications with incisions.d) Demonstrating proficiency in animal restraint including fear-free techniques for both canine and feline patients. Common nonchemical restraints include muzzle, towels, voice, and cat bags. Safe pet restraint may include chemical restraint (including pre-visit sedation when prescribed by a veterinarian).e) Demonstrating the ability to hold canine patients in the following methods: lateral, hugging, and/or standing. Any of these may be asked to be performed on the floor or table.f) Demonstrating the ability to hold feline patients in the following methods: lateral, hugging, standing, and/or scruffing. Most commonly, these will be asked to be performed on the table.g) Is able to perform basic animal grooming procedures such as nail trimming and ear cleaning.b) Demonstrating the ability to handle laboratory samples correctly including understanding the importance of correct sample labeling procedures. Laboratory samples may include blood, urine, aspirate samples, cultures, among others.c) Demonstrating the ability to use a centrifuge for sample processing.b) Demonstrating ability to communicate effectively and efficiently with clients and co-workers to continue providing excellent medical care.c) Developing knowledge of commonly prescribed medication including uses and side-effects.b) Documenting patient medications and belongings, vitals in medical record, completing treatments, adding charges, documenting events performed during a technician appointment. The expectation that record keeping will be done electronically through Angell software (Signature).b) Accurately documenting cleaning & stocking tasks.This is by no means a complete list of duties. Other duties may be assigned by Clinic management.Ability to lift 25 pounds or more with assistance and up to 25 pounds independently.
