Please consideravailabilitybeforesubmitting an application.Our CompanyTesla is accelerating the world’s transition to sustainable energy. We design, manufacture, sell and service the world’s best solar technology, energy storage systems, and electric vehicles, providing customers the opportunity to generate, store and consume energy entirely sustainably.Tesla is committed to hiring and developing top talent from around the world for any given discipline. Based in California, Tesla’s workforce spans across four continents. We work to build an inclusive environment in which all people, regardless of gender, race, religion, or background, can come to do their best work.Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional philosophy of inter-disciplinary collaboration. Each member of the team is expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. We’re tackling the world’s most difficult and important problems—and we wouldn’t succeed without our shared passion for making the world a better place.Internship Program at TeslaThe University Recruiting Team is driven by the passion to recognize emerging talent. Our year around program places the best students in positions that they will grow both technically and personally through their experience working closely with their Manager, Mentor, and team. We are dedicated to providing an experience that allows for the intern to experience life at Tesla by given them projects that are critical to their team’s success.Instead of going on coffee runs and making copies, you’ll be seated at the table making critical decisions that will influence not only your team, but the overall achievement of Tesla’s mission.LocationsThe Purchasing team supports the development, implementation and management of strategies to provide Tesla with optimal supply assurance, pricing, flexibility, quality and delivery performance. Interns build and leverages strong working relationships with our engineering teams and key suppliers to assure cost, quality, and delivery targets are met. They work toward good supplier relationships and total costs of ownership to achieve maximum advantage for Tesla and our customers.DepartmentsWe are looking for a highly motivated Global Supply Management interns to support our cross functional development teams in sourcing and project management of direct supply chain components and assemblies. These include but are not limited to Mechanisms, Electro-Mechanisms, Closures, and Lighting within any or all TESLA programs, including (Model S, X, 3, and Y). This role will report directly to a Global Supply Manager within the supply chain direct purchasing organization.This individual will implement and manage strategies to provide Tesla with optimal supply assurance, pricing, flexibility, quality and delivery performance. The ideal candidate has a fundamental understanding of key manufacturing processes, excellent project management skills, and an ability to multi-task, prioritize and work in an extremely fast-paced environment. The Global Supply Management Intern builds and leverages strong working relationships with our engineering teams and key suppliers to assure cost, quality, and delivery targets are met. They work toward good supplier relationships and total costs of ownership to achieve maximum advantage for Tesla and our customers.Tesla is a fast moving, dynamic environment where flexibility and adaptability are key attributes needed for success. The successful candidate will be a self-starter and continuously motivated to keep learning.The RoleRequirements

Description: Organization: Ashoka Innovators for PublicProject Title: Nourishing Schools ProgrammeJob position title: Social Media and Communications InternLocation: Virtual/Remote workJob Overview: Ashoka’s Nourishing Schools programme is on a mission to enable young changemakers to take charge of their own nutrition and profess the same knowledge within their communities. The intern will support in the development of communications and multimedia materials that are consistently engaging and propel interest and action. The ideal candidate is a digital media enthusiast with exceptional writing and design skills and demonstrated curiosity and background in impact communications.Responsibilities and Duties: Develop high-impact social media content including graphics, videos and other multimedia formats that effectively informs and engages external audiences Devise collection and analysis of social media metrics to gauge reach, engagement and other performance measures for social media posts, accounts, and campaigns, helping to inform results-based decision making and drive the effective use of resources. Design and prepare content/copy for reports, presentations, blog articles and other internal and external communications materials Support the development and implementation of larger communication strategies and efforts Support the development of web sites, including layout, content, look and feelReports To: Archana Sinha, Senior Change managerQualifications:Students from following majors may find it relevant: Communications and media studies, Journalism, Business, Design (strategy design, information design) Data VisualizationRequired skills/Personal skills: Experience in producing, editing, and disseminating multimedia content for online audiences. Experience using advanced tools for online publishing, including content management systems and social media authoring tools like Hootsuite. Experience in producing and interpreting web or social media analytics (ex: Google Analytics) to inform strategies and work plans. Sophisticated understanding of multimedia content, including how it can best be produced, packaged, published, and shared on websites, on social media and for partner organizations. Excellent command of English and highly developed writing and editing skills. Excellent computer skills (MS Office essential; Adobe Photoshop and/or Adobe Premiere Pro an asset). Familiarity with Slack and Trello is an asset.Skills gained by the end of internship: Experience in development and impact communication Creating informational content for positive social change Creative visualization of data Autonomy to plan and execute strategies Effective time-management CollaborationInternship start date and Duration: January to June 2021Compensation (per month): UnpaidWorking hours (per week): Minimum 20 hours per week and up to 40 hours a week.Add-ons:Fluid workspace, Relaxed environment, Friendly and inspiring co-workers, chance to engage with ever-inspiring Ashoka fellows.About AshokaAshoka is the largest network of social entrepreneurs worldwide, with nearly 3,000 Ashoka Fellows in 70 countries putting their system changing ideas into practice on a global scale. Founded by Bill Drayton in 1980, Ashoka has provided start-up financing, professional support services, and connections to a global network across the business and social sectors, and a platform for people dedicated to changing the world.About Nourishing SchoolsNourishing Schools has been designed by Ashoka India’s Health and Nutrition Initiative in partnership with various stakeholders. It aims to develop young changemakers aged between 9-14 years, who can take charge of their own nutrition and that of their communities. The broad objective is to develop a toolkit that enables schools to improve the nutrition of school children and communities.Ashoka has partnered with Ashoka Fellows and various organisations to roll out the Nourishing Schools programme across India in over 200 schools.Optional services provided by Bridge CulturesStudents learn about culture and multiple facets and influences on various aspects of life through conversations with people they would meet while in Bangalore. With remote co-op, Bridge Cultures will enable these conversations virtually. We will organize 3 virtual webinars and workshops on various topics in context to cultural integration which will align with students’ professional and personal growth. Bridge Cultures will bring professionals from various domains and facilitate these interactive sessions.Few topics (not confined to) are listed below:· Social entrepreneurship· Know the city - food, culture, people· Leadership and Teamwork· Unconscious biases· Critical thinking· Influence of culture on design, education, outdoor education, experiential education· Sustainability· Mental health, emotional well-being· Impact of traveling on our personalitySelf-reflection session:Bridge Cultures believes that self-reflection is highly important and necessary to learn and grow, especially after working with a social enterprise on an impactful project. Out of many reasons, reflection is important because it:· Enables the individuals to process and make meaning of the experience· Fosters a better understanding of context. i.e. understanding how their work impacts the community and encourages more participation in future· Creates a sense of accomplishment· Enables the individuals to examine the effects of their behavior, discover ways to improve· Reinforces the feeling of empathy gained during the experience· Acknowledges the skills gained during the experience and builds confidenceInclusions - Program Fees (virtual):· Co-op placement· Necessary documentation· Self-Reflection session· 2-3 online webinars/workshops on various topics· Review meetings during co-op to track progress· Social networkBridge Cultures Refund Policy:· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op prior to confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Mr. Richard Conley. Refund will be processed after deducting 25% of the program fees (this is to factor the currency transaction charges that incurs to Bridge Cultures)· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op after receiving confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Mr. Richard Conley. Refund will be processed after deducting 75% of the program fees

Desired Skills: Medical Records, Solid computer skills, Analytical Skills, Professionalism, Telephone Skills, Investigation, Interpersonal and intercultural communication
Description: HEDIS Reviewer Job Description DraftNortheastern Co-op ProgramResponsibilities:Our department is looking for eager and hardworking students with an interest in healthcare to review medical records for our annual HEDIS process. HEDIS (Healthcare Effectiveness Data and Information Set) is a performance measurement guide to track important aspects of care provided to customers of health insurance plans. The HEDIS Medical Record Review Team works to assure quality of care for our members at Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts, collecting data on physician practices and patient outcomes to report to the NCQA healthcare accreditation organization, ultimately helping BCBS maintain its excellent reputation as a premier health insurance company. The candidate will be contacting BCBSMA provider offices to request medical records, reviewing charts to abstract the necessary data, and entering said data into our database application. Students may be reviewing 50-60 charts a day, in both paper and electronic format.There is a possible travel component of this position, as students may be required to go to various healthcare facilities within Massachusetts (ie: UMass, Lahey, Southcoast Hospital) to review records onsite, while maintaining BCBS professionalism. This travel will be concentrated in a 4-6 week period in February and March. Travel expenses will be compensated in addition to the hourly wage offered. BCBS makes a conscious effort to plan this travel strategically based on where each student resides, to avoid unnecessary travel time.Top Criteria/Requirements:1. Computer Skills – Students must be computer savvy: able to navigate different databases, comfortable updating and maintaining Excel spreadsheets, etc.2. Familiarity with Provider Offices – The candidate should have a basic understanding of the environment in a doctor’s office or hospital setting; as a HEDIS reviewer, you will be a guest in various professional healthcare settings and should feel confident working in these environments.3. Professionalism – Students are representing BCBS; professional dress, conduct, etc. are crucial.4. Culture Fit – This department prides itself on a cohesive team mentality and values a student who is a contributing team member. For instance, if a student has more experience with a specific computer program, they should be willing to impart that knowledge to others. Students should also be open to asking questions; it is better to ask questions than make mistakes that can take time and effort to correct.5. Telephone Skills – Students will be making phone calls to providers’ offices to ask for medical records not received or to request missing clinical information. Professionalism and telephone etiquette are required.Opportunity:This position provides an eye-opening look into the complex and ever-changing industry of health care in the United States. Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts is a major healthcare provider, insuring about 2.8 million individuals in MA, as well as across state lines. In a time where health insurance is on the forefront of many political conversations, and on the minds of most Americans, this is a unique opportunity to gain a comprehensive understanding of the health insurance industry and its efforts to improve care for millions of Americans.1. HEDIS Knowledge – Students will gain an in-depth understanding of the HEDIS review process, a nationally recognized and standardized measurement of quality health care. They will become familiar with the various measurements of care, collected through random sampling of members, both healthy and those with chronic medical conditions.2. Electronic Medical Records – This position will expose students to multiple EMR systems. They will learn to navigate different systems, locate essential clinical information, and work with office staff for assistance if/when difficulties are reached (ie: unable to access certain records or results, computer freezes, etc.) A problem-solving mentality, paired with a sense of flexibility, is essential to working through these systems and their complexities.3. Provider’s Offices – This position will expose students to various healthcare settings, where they will be working with employees, and sometimes directly with medical professionals, to abstract the necessary information.We are excited to welcome several Northeastern Co-op students to our 2021 HEDIS Review Team! We look forward to reviewing each application and interviewing candidates who we think would be a great addition to our team.

Description: Accounting Co-opJanuary 11-June 25, 2021To be considered for this role, you MUST apply through NUworks AND this link:https://grnh.se/c8e30a6a2usIMPORTANT APPLICATION INFORMATION: WAYFAIR CO-OP PRIORITY DEADLINE OCTOBER 2All candidates who apply on or before October 2, and who advance in our interview process, will receive an offer decision from the team by October 30. After October 30, we will continue the interview process to fill any remaining roles not filled during the Priority Period.The Finance team consists of detail-oriented, highly organized individuals who oversee the company's financial well-being while supporting operational and general business planning. We solve challenging accounting problems and provide financial analyses to determine key operational decisions within a growing and diversifying organization. We are dedicated to meeting new challenges head on at each milestone in Wayfair's development and can adapt to changes within a dynamic, fast-paced environment.The mission of the Wayfair Accounting team is “To close the books efficiently with no material errors or audit findings while providing support to our business partners as the subject matter experts on all accounting and auditing matters.” As a part of our team, you will be integral to the monthly financial close process and quarterly SEC filings.What You’ll Do:What You’ll Need:About Us:Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employers, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Description: Location: Various US LocationsAbout Us:GE rises to the challenge of building a world that works. For more than 125 years, GE has invented the future of industry, and today the company’s dedicated team, leading technology, and global reach and capabilities help the world work more efficiently, reliably, and safely. GE’s people are diverse and dedicated, operating with the highest level of integrity and focus to fulfill GE’s mission and deliver for its customers. www.ge.comRole Summary/Purpose:The Financial Management Program (FMP) equips early professionals with exceptional experiences, as it both begins and continues the acceleration of corporate finance careers.The FMP Intern will be aligned to one of our core finance teams and have an assignment in corporate finance, including Commercial Finance, Supply Chain Finance, and Financial Planning and Analysis.Qualifications/Requirements:· Overall GPA greater than or equal to 3.0/4.0· GPA in major greater than 3.0/4.0· Must be willing to relocate· AN OFFICIAL TRANSCRIPT SHOULD BE PROVIDED TO THE INTERVIEWEREligibility Requirements:GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Since our founding in 1973, we have measured our success by the success of our clients. We proudly maintain the highest level of client advocacy in the industry, and our clients have outperformed the stock market 4-to-1. Description: At Bristol-Myers Squibb, we are a team dedicated to discovering, developing and delivering innovative medicines that help patients prevail over serious diseases. Our commitment is to foster a globally diverse and inclusive workforcewith a high-performing culture that is agile, entrepreneurial and accountable. This enables our business strategy while encouraging excellence, growth, achievement, innovation and a balance between our personal and professional lives.Current Six-Month Co-op OpportunityMedicinal Chemistry (Cambridge, MA)This co-op position in the Medicinal Chemistry department will involve the preparation of key intermediates to drive a discovery program directed against a particular molecular target of interest and the synthesis of new molecules designed to modulate that target and optimize for properties that predict for in vivo target modulation.Requirements/Education:Enrolled in Bachelor’s degree program in Chemistry. The successful candidate should have completed course and lab work in Organic Chemistry. Candidates with research experience are preferred.Key responsibilities:- Searching literature databases to inform on synthetic route execution- Preparation of molecules of interest through multi-step organic synthesis- Purification using HPLC and other automated methods- Compound characterization using NMR and MS dataKey Deliverables at Project Completion:The student will present their results and conclusions to a broad audienceBristol-Myers Squibb Discovery Coop job descriptionWe are seeking talented undergraduates who desire learning about the drug discovery process and the role chemists play in developing innovative cancer therapies at our Cambridge, MA location. Upon completion of a 6month program, you will have gained experience in searching literature databases to inform on synthetic route execution, preparation of molecules of interest through multi-step organic synthesis, purification using HPLC and other automated methods, and compound characterization using NMR and MS data. In addition, the candidate will be exposed to the breadth of disciples that are brought to bear on the drug discovery process. Good communication skills and a naturally collaborative style are necessary for effective drug discovery team participation.

Description: Amazon Robotics Supply Chain Co-opJanuary 2021 to June 2021Are you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to any of these and you’ll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even imagine yet. We invent new improvements every day. We are Amazon Robotics and we will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling and fun.Amazon Robotics, a wholly owned subsidiary of Amazon.com, empowers a smarter, faster, more consistent customer experience through automation. Amazon Robotics automates fulfilment center operations using various methods of robotic technology including autonomous mobile robots, sophisticated control software, language perception, power management, computer vision, depth sensing, machine learning, object recognition, and semantic understanding of commands. Description: PT 5101-Foundations of Physical Therapy (or permission from employer)The Deafblind Program at the Perkins School for the Blind is a unique environment full of exciting learning opportunities for a co-op student.Deafblindness is the condition of little or no useful sight and little or no useful hearing.Educationally, individuals are considered to be deafblind when the combination of their hearing and sight loss causes such severe communication and other developmental and educational needs that they require significant and unique adaptations in their educational programs.Deafblind people have an experience quite distinct from people who are only deaf or only blind. As a co-op student at the Deafblind Program you will be given the unique opportunity to learn to communicate and work with these students, from ages 3 to 22. Our student population utilizes Total Communication, which means that we use any modes of communication that our students are able to access - this includes verbal language, sign-supported English (using the same vocabulary but not the grammar of American Sign Language to sign to the student as you speak), visual and tactile symbols, and communication devices. While it is helpful for applicants to have a prior knowledge of ASL vocabulary, it is not required. You will take sign language class, learn how to use tactile sign language and tactile symbols, and use schedule systems during the co-op rotation.You will become an integral part of an already friendly and motivated team of therapists who all come from a variety of work backgrounds, in addition to collaborating with our educational staff. You will help carry out therapy treatment programs, shape therapy programs, work with PT equipment and help carry over these programs in the classroom. Some opportunities you will be given that are specific to Perkins include attending low vision clinic, observing audiology evaluation and treatments, orthotic clinic, physiatrist clinic, and wheelchair clinic. You will work in our assistive device center one afternoon a week and learn to make adaptive equipment from scratch that will be specific to the students with whom you are working. Responsibilities will include assisting with set up and clean up before and after treatment sessions, cleaning the treatment and office space, and clerical work in addition to carrying out your own schedule of treatments and co-treatments with the students. If you are interested in providing rehabilitation to a complex pediatric population, this position would be a good fit. Love for children and an appreciation for the amazing challenges they learn to overcome are a must!Hours 8:00am to 4:00pmPublic Transportation available via the bus and there is parking available on-site.

Description: Location: CanadaApplicants must currently have appropriate visa and work authorization to work in Canada. Analog Devices, Inc.(ADI) is a maker of analog and digital integrated circuits, specializing in high-performance circuits suited for real-world signal processing. ADI's signature products include high-speed amplifiers, high-speed/high-resolution analog-to-digital and digital-to-analog converters, high-performance Digital Signal Processors and micro-Electro-Mechanical systems. In the high-speed converter market, ADI's 40% market share is more than double that of its nearest competitor. ADI was founded in 1965 and posted revenues of $6.2 billion in 2018. ADI employees more than 15,000 people worldwide. Approximately 25% of ADI's employees are engineers.This position offers the motivated student the opportunity to learn from some of the best engineers in the industry, while also pushing the technology envelope in the form of a new and aggressive product. This is the ideal opportunity for a smart, hard-working student who is driven to know more about integrated circuits than is taught in class.Any experience with software tools such as MATLAB, SPICE, Cadence Virtuoso, Calibre LVS and DRC, or with printed circuit board design/debugging, or with lab evaluation, will be regarded favourably.

Description: SummaryImagine what you could do here. At Apple, extraordinary ideas have a way of becoming phenomenal products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Apple’s University Recruiting team is looking for a highly motivated, engineering students with a strong background in Back-End Engineering, Core OS, and Web Development to join its team of highly skilled software engineers.Our software engineers are the brains behind some of the industry’s biggest breakthroughs. OS X, Siri, Apple Maps, and iCloud — not to mention the system-level software for iPhone and Apple TV — all started here. These teams are on the front line of our constant charge toward innovation. We are actively seeking enthusiastic interns who can work full-time for a minimum of 12-weeks either for our Fall 2020, Winter 2021, Spring 2021, or Summer 2021 sessions.DescriptionBackend Development - You will be making the features that our users love (like Siri) work by communicating data to the user-facing applications. Backend development opportunities are available for students in the following areas:Siri, iCloud, Apple Maps, Core OS, OS X, Frameworks and Applications, Interactive Media Group, Audio/Video Software Integration and Localization, Advanced Computation, iLife, iWorks, Aperture, Pro Apps, iTunes, Security, Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) and Platform Infrastructure Engineering (PIE)Specifically, the opportunity in CoreOS is in the sensor technology area. By integrating motion, optical, and other sophisticated sensing hardware to Apple's products, we are now able to build innovative features that are truly adaptive to the user and environment.Engineers here work on both UI level and lower-level implementation details. The successful intern candidate will be amenable to working in a dynamic, collaborative environment. The person filling this position must be a hands-on, enthusiastic, self-motivated developer with strong initiative and desire to succeed in a challenging environment. You will have a real passion for extraordinary user experiences and an eye for details. Those applying for the Web Development intern position should include a link to a web portfolio.Qualifications

Description: JOB DESCRIPTIONThe co-op will be responsible for operational execution of contracts against the purchasing and supply management strategies created by the Category Managers within the North America Global Professional Services/ITspace. Work intimately with customers, divisions, Procurement Operations, and Category Managers driving the Abbott Global Procurement model. Provide high levels of customer service and satisfaction while adhering to a strict standard of business ethics and integrity. The Specialist Procurement has delegated authority to commit company funds. This position will primarily work to support contracting needs of Abbott internal stakeholders, with external suppliers. This position also has the opportunity to work on the definition and resolution of known or anticipated problems in value, quality, feasibility and specifications in the procurement of goods and services while contributing cost savings, partnerships with suppliers and other value-added activities to support customer needs and expectations. Proactively seek and lead innovative ways to improve the procurement processes, cycle times, and customer service levels. This position is considered a "SME in training" across the vertical while maintaining a strong understanding of Procurement category strategies. Ideal for candidate that is interested in both Professional Services/IT and supply chain disciplines.CORE JOB RESPONSIBILITIES•First line responder; pivots between strategy and operations.•Execute against larger category strategies and work with the guidance of operations and strategic category leaders.•Manages Agreements, SOWs, RFx, and ordering documents while assisting with supplier selections.•Performs value analysis on costs and supplier quotes.•Recommends process improvements to streamline for efficiencies.•Manages day-to-day supply issues. Analyzes possible solutions using standard procedures. Communicates pertinent information to both internal customers and suppliers to keep apprised and to prevent problems.•Supports PO conversion, non-transactional and some negotiations, with PO approval authority up to $199,999.•Communicate issues to leadership while driving for resolution.•Access technology and tools to effectively perform.•Supports Ops issues and drives invoice error resolution and lead resolution on issues and invoice error.•Adhere to operational support service level agreementsEnable supplier integration and KPIs.•PO change management and communicate trends of changes•Drive value and lead savings outcomes while collaborating with various functions.•Create and implement RFPs; lead RFPs as well as small projects.•Ability to work with various legal and business functions to execute Master Service Agreements and Statements of Work between Abbott and suppliers.Relationship ManagementImplement agreed purchasing strategies for category. Seek and support business relationships with diverse suppliers. Meet regularly with divisional customers and support functions to ensure good customer satisfaction and continuous improvement.Leading PeopleExhibit cultural awareness with foreign business entities. Seek, develop, and maintain business relationships with suppliers, clients and customers.Strategic ThinkingPerforms routine professional-based activities and contribute to and manage some projects. Communicate with appropriate departments to clarify request and obtain appropriate supporting documentation for the purchase.Accountability•Highly self-motivated and self-directed.•Takes ownership and fulfills goals established by the Regional Procurement Operations Managers and Category Management•Drives innovative ways to maintain and improve procurement processes, cycle times, total acquisition costs, and customer service levels.•Executes against the goals set by the Regional Managers•Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional policies and proceduresRequired/Desired Skills /Qualifications:•Proficient in Microsoft Office•Career focused in Supply Chain, Procurement, Contracting, strategic sourcing, Engineering and/or Pre-Law•Data driven•Inquisitive Thinker•Project Management•Problem Solving•Strong Communication, written and verbal•Strong interdisciplinary, influence, and networking skill•GPA: 3.0 +

Today, our 30 planned gift professionals work with over 200 charities with $3 billion in planned gift assets for more than 34,000 donor/beneficiaries. Our charitable clients include colleges; universities; foundations; private schools; hospitals; and cultural, environmental and religious organizations.Transportation: MBTA Red Line: take MBTA Red Line to Broadway head up West Broadway To A Street turn left and head down to Iron Street and turn left onto Channel Center Street. MBTA Silver Line: Accessible via the Seaport District Station. This includes processing checks that come in for new gifts and checking the status of any outgoing checks.- Support client service by answering and logging any questions that are related to the back office support group (Fidelity Investor Services FIS).- Communicating by telephone or e-mail with internal and external parties.- Assist with projects.As a CAM Operations Co-op, in addition to processing and administration of charitable gifts, you will have the opportunity to interact with and learn alongside other teams that comprise Charitable Asset Management. These include Business Development, Client Service, Investment, and Tax.Desirable Qualifications:Applicants should be enthusiastic about working with nonprofit organizations to assist in meeting client needs and goals. Description: Office OverviewCome work for Attorney General Maura Healey and make a difference! Are you looking for more than just a great learning experience? At the Attorney General’s Office, you will be part of “The People’s Law Firm.” Whether working directly with our residents, or supporting our talented and dedicated staff, your work here will contribute to a higher mission of serving the public and making a difference in the lives of others.The Attorney General’s Office is the largest public sector legal office in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. Attorney General Maura Healey is the chief lawyer and law enforcement officer of the Commonwealth. Her office serves as an advocate and resource for the Commonwealth, its residents, and businesses in many areas, including protecting consumers, combating fraud and corruption, protecting civil rights, and promoting meaningful economic stability. The Attorney General's Office is organized into six bureaus. The divisions and teams within each bureau have distinct missions and work closely together to ensure the Attorney General’s Office provides the highest level of public protection. We invite you to explore the work of our office at www.mass.gov/agoWork CultureThe Attorney General’s Office is a professional, collaborative work environment. Our dedicated employees work together with a shared commitment to serving the interests of the Commonwealth. Students have shared these comments about the Office:· “A kind and welcoming atmosphere.”· “The positive energy was very infectious, and it made me strive to work harder as well.”· “The most professional yet fun office I’ve yet to work in.”The Office supports and appreciates the diverse perspectives and backgrounds of our employees and strives to provide a welcoming and inclusive workplace environment for all. We offer a variety of co-op positions, and our co-op students are an integral part of the Office.Position DescriptionResponsibilities include assisting the Non-Profit Organizations/Public Charities Division (“NPCD”) in ensuring transparency and accountability in the charitable sector, including review of charities’ compliance with registration and annual filing obligations and assisting the public in response to questions regarding public charities registrations, solicitations, filings and/or concerns about the use of charitable funds. Specific duties will include:· Processing new registrations and annual filings, ensuring compliance with associated requirements and entering filing data into AGO database.· Answering the division main phone line and responding to inquiries from the public.· General office assistance such as copying, filing, organizing, distributing mail.· Special projects and other duties as needed, including assistance with investigations regarding possible misapplication of charitable assets and breach of fiduciary obligations.Desired QualificationsStrong interpersonal and organizational skills, attention to detail, and a sincere interest in public service. Ability to work with sensitive information and maintain confidentiality. This is a great entry level position for a student who has not yet had the opportunity to develop office experience. We are looking for a team player with a can-do attitude and an interest in learning. Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook) is recommended.Learning and Professional Take-AwaysStudents develop professional skills during their co-op experience while building self-confidence. You can expect to leave this co-op with:· Exposure to the inner workings of a busy government office.· Experience working in a professional office setting.· Ability to multi-task and prioritize tasks to meet deadlines.· Experience communicating with supervisors and co-workers.· An understanding of how the team that supports the chief lawyer and law enforcement officer of the Commonwealth operates.Location and AmenitiesLocation and convenience! We are centrally located at 100 Cambridge Street on Beacon Hill; close to the State House, Boston Common, and Faneuil Hall. We are easily accessible by public transportation, and accessible to the many cultural and social activities offered in the city. Enjoy the convenience of Metro Café, a cafeteria offering a wide variety of affordable food options, located on-site at One Ashburton Place.DURING COVID: The Office has not yet determined work arrangements for the spring, but co-op positions will likely be primarily remote for some or all of the upcoming six-month co-op period. Some in-office work is required and will be discussed at time of interview.Pay and Work HoursThis position is full-time and pays $14/hour. This is a non-benefitted position with paid earned sick time. The expected work hours are 9:00 to 5:00 with a half hour lunch (37.5 hours per week).The Attorney General’s Office is an Equal Opportunity Employer. As the representative of the Commonwealth and its residents, the Attorney General’s Office strives to ensure that those working in our office reflect the diversity of the communities we serve. The Office encourages applicants from a broad spectrum of backgrounds to apply for positions.

Description: Company Information:At KSQ Therapeutics, we seek to understand the role of every human gene in each disease, each tissue, and each cell that we study. This comprehensive approach has resulted in a massive, experimentally derived dataset that we have found to be remarkably predictive of past successes and failures in oncology and immuno-oncology product development. Utilizing this approach, we also identified a number of opportunities for the development of new medicines. As a result, we have aggressively invested in these distinct, highly validated pathways for new drug development with the expectation that the medicines we create may become the next breakthrough products for patients.Responsibilities & Qualifications· The successful candidate will work as part of an interdisciplinary team contributing to the design and execution of experiments that support our research activities and project goals.· Learn about cutting-edge genome engineering technologies to study the biology of therapeutic targets to develop new treatments for cancer and other human diseases.· Conduct genetic engineering experiments in mammalian cells to find or verify new cancer biology targets.· Participate in various aspects of this new company from building out the capabilities to contributing to generating data in a fast and efficient manner· Aid in the development and characterization of genetically engineered primary immune cells· General knowledge of molecular biology techniques (PCR, cloning, DNA/RNA extraction) a plus.· Mammalian tissue culture experience desired.· Familiarity with general biology research techniques (pipetting, preparing solutions, etc.) desired.· Maintain detailed experimental records of progress and data analysis/interpretation using electronic lab notebook.

Description: *Please note, this interview process will be entirely remote. We are unsure if the co-op itself will be fully remote or have the possibility to be in the office*Public, Social and Healthcare Practice (PuSH)Intern ideally with an economics background and international exposure through work experience or education, with a keen interest for public, social and health sectorsWorking at McKinseyYou will work (either remotely or in person, depending on circumstances) in Waltham, US as part of our global Public, Social and Healthcare Practice (PuSH) Capabilities & Insights team.McKinsey's Public, Social and Healthcare Practice (PuSH) aspires to bring the best of our global firm to help governments to improve the lives of citizens worldwide; we also help leading global institutions to better deliver on their mission to solve the world’s most pressing economic, social and health issues. We work in close collaboration with other private sector practices at McKinsey on specific themes (e.g. agriculture and financial services).You will also be part of our global Client Capabilities Network, which includes more than 2,000 colleagues, who bring a wide spectrum of capabilities, including Knowledge Consulting, Analytics Consulting and Data Engineering, Research, Client Development and Practice Management.What You’ll DoYour main role will be to manage the workflow database of incoming requests, called Research Insights, including scoping incoming questions and transferring to relevant teams. In addition, you will work with consultants and other team members to understand, disaggregate, and prioritize their research and information needs. You will identify the key issues for the team and determine the most appropriate solution, effectively balancing quality, availability, timeliness, and cost factors. By working with broad information source knowledge and your understanding of McKinsey’s global network of knowledge professionals, you will efficiently collect, summarize, and synthesize the relevant facts. Research end products delivered to consulting teams include charts, tables, frameworks, and written summaries. Where appropriate, you will guide consultants in the use of on-line knowledge resources and systems.You will be expected to to start to develop a broad knowledge of public, social and health sector sources. You will contribute to the continuous task of building and managing a state-of-the art knowledge infrastructure by reviewing and selecting information sources, establishing links to external experts, and developing and maintaining relevant library materials and databases.Background■ Education in an area that is relevant to the public sector or health, particularly economics■ Exposure to, and ideally experience through internships or studies, to international issues and organisations■ Broad understanding in, and passion for, the public, social and health sector, globally and locally■ Ability to interact with consultants and knowledge colleagues with a problem-solving mindset and with excellent communication skills■ Desire to work as a highly collaborative team player, whilst also having a strong ability to work independently, to develop and utilize global networks across practices and client teams, and to work as part of a geographically dispersed team■ Have a very strong service-orientation, including a high-energy ‘can do’ attitude, desire to work on different types and lengths of projects, combined with an inquisitive, investigative nature and flexibility to operate in an evolving environment■ Ability to creatively retrieve, summarize, and present complex information, including excellent search skills on web sources and electronic databases combined with strong analytical, quantitative and IT skills

Targeted Academic Majors: Bouve College of Health Sciences/Physical Therapy, Bouve College of Health Sciences/Nursing, Bouve College of Health Sciences/Health Science, College of Science/Cell and Molecular Biology, College of Science/Biology, College of Science/Biochemistry, College of Science/Behavioral Neuroscience

Description: About this unit:14 AB is a 30 beds intermediate general medical unit that cares for a diverse patient population. Most patients come in through the Emergency Department and are discharged to rehabilitative, skilled nursing, or assisted living facilities prior to returning to their home. Co-op students can expect to gain a tremendous amount of experience and learn the foundations of nursing from a team of life-long nurses as well as recent new graduates. On D/E each pod is staffed with 5 nurses and 2 patient care assistants (PCA), and at night with 4 nurses and 1 PCA. Being a general medical unit, we care for a variety of patients including patients with Cystic Fibrosis, Sickle Cell disease, Substance Use Disorder, dementia, alcohol withdrawal. We also care for patients with hypertension, diabetes, suicide ideation, different types of cancer, and patients who might need a social admission for placement.Job responsibilities:Functioning under the direction of the Registered Nurse (RN) and as a member of the unit-based patient care team, the Patient Care Assistant (PCA) performs duties of direct and indirect patient care. The PCA is responsible for supporting the RN with clinical tasks, including, but not limited to glucometry, EKGs, and vital signs. In addition, the PCA is responsible for responding to the needs of patients and family members and takes a proactive role in the efficient operation of the unit.General requirements:NRSG 2000, NRSG 2220/1 - Nursing Interventions and Assessment Lab Currently enrolled in BSN programOccasionally, a student outside of nursing major will be considered by the nurse director but the student must be a Certified Nursing Assistant and be licensed through Mass. Dept. of Health. As the state of MA is not offering CNA exams at this time, documentation of successful completion of full CNA course work will suffice.Hiring requirements:Public transportation from NU:Shift/hours requirements:Students can expect to work between 36-40 hours per week both 8 hour and 12 hour shifts. Co-op students are required to work day, evening, night and weekend shifts.Students must be very open the first 3 weeks of the co-op for orientation.Compensation:Minimum $15.00/hourGREAT CO-OP EXPERIENCE WITH STAFF THAT ENJOY TEACHING!

The Entegris Co-op Program consists of real work experience, cross-functional learning and development opportunities, and a variety of social and volunteering events.Entegris, Inc. is a global leader in contamination control, specialty material handling, and advanced process materials for the semiconductor industry. We are developing a method to count and identify unknown nanoparticles in DIW and very clean aqueous samples, which is a big challenge in the semiconductor industry. In this position, we are looking for a motivated and talented chemistry or chemical engineering intern to work in the Metrology Lab. The co-op selected for this position will spend most of the time in a lab setting to perform analytical tests using the cutting-edge metrology tools such as Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM), Confocal 3D Laser Microscope, and Atomic Force Microscope and communicate their findings to the Metrology Team. The co-op will also help develop and improve upon various test methodologies. If you want to have valuable hands-on experience in advanced microscopies and spectra instruments, this co-op is absolutely a fantastic opportunity for you!In this role you will:Traits we believe make a strong candidate:What we offer:At Entegris we are committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees and applicants. Description: Data Science Engineer - Boston (Remote)Teikametrics is looking for a Data Science Engineer to join a team under the Data Science directorate tasked with building a platform that supports the rapid construction and deployment of prediction and control services in the domain of E-commerce.At Teikametrics, you will:About the Team:The Data Science team at Teikametrics is responsible for building, deploying, and maintaining production-grade automated decision-making and forecasting services for our sellers. We do the data engineering necessary to power our machine-learning models as well as the data science to select, train, and analyze those models.About the Role:The Data Science team is looking for an engineer with an interest in data engineering and model development or deployment. The current data science stack uses Snowflake and dbt to produce training data for our SageMaker-based model lifecycle management system written in Python. Our predictive services are consumed by our decision-making system written in Scala. The focus of the role would be on improving the model development and deployment ecosystem. It is thus helpful but not necessary to have a background in machine learning or statistics; enthusiasm for the engineering issues around the production deployment of machine learning is required.Qualified candidates should have:ABOUT TEIKAMETRICSAt Teikametrics, we’re building an operating system to optimize every aspect of a retailer's business -- from advertising to inventory to pricing. We optimize billions of transactions for thousands of entrepreneurs and brands around the world selling on Amazon and other marketplaces. The Teikametrics Retail Optimization Platform uses proprietary econometrics and machine-learning data models packaged in a simple SaaS interface. We combine our best in class technology with coaching and support from our world-class teams based remotely and in Boston, MA, Seattle, WA, Tel Aviv, Israel, and Bengaluru, India. We are looking for people who can excel, add value to our mission, and thrive in a demanding start-up environment.

Description: Burn Design Lab, headquartered on Vashon Island, WA is offering an unpaid internship to a clear thinking, well-organized, undergraduate, who is ready to learn the details and challenges associated with determining the performance characteristics of improved biomass burning cookstoves. We are looking for someone with good communication skills, with a background in science or engineering who has an interest in laboratory testing, research, and data analysis. Burn Design Lab will provide housing or a housing stipend, plus a small stipend for living expenses for the selected candidate.Burn Design Lab is a U.S. based an internationally focused non-profit organization dedicated to the improvement of lives and the environment in the developing world through research, design, and development of outstanding cookstoves and fuels.The successful candidate will be engaged in some or all of the following:· Performance, combustion, safety, durability, and emissions testing of cookstoves· Biomass fuel analysis, and analysis of above testing results· Providing input to stove designs based on testing results· Documentation and improvement of testing methods and protocols · Calibration of laboratory equipment· Making improvements to laboratory systems & equipment· Building cookstove prototypes out of sheet metal (forming, spot welding, and general metal fabrication), ceramics, refractory, & other materials.· Pursuing a degree in science or engineering· Collecting, organizing, & analyzing data.· Proficiency with MS Excel, PPT, and Word.· Significant laboratory & report writing experience· Strong organization skills and attention to detail· Eagerness to learn.· Ability to work both independently and in a team environment.· Strong work ethic.The internship is 6 – 12 months in duration, beginning in January 2021.

Description: The Future Talent Program features Cooperative (Co-op) education that lasts up to 6 months and will include one or more projects. These opportunities in our Research Division can provide you with great development and a chance to see if we are the right company for your long-term goals.Our Company Exploratory Science Center (ESC) in Cambridge provides a unique experience to contribute to our Company's drug discovery efforts at one of the earliest stages of the process. To this end, we strive to create a fast-paced, nimble and flexible environment of mutual respect, creativity, invention and teamwork. Co-op students will be part of a highly collaborative and innovative scientific culture with the ultimate goal of learning new biology that drives therapeutic development. Students will be exposed to Immunology, Microbiology, Chemical Biology, Target Discovery, Synthetic Chemistry and Bioactive Discovery both within the our Company Exploratory Science Center and other our Company Sites across the country. With access to our Company's proven global Research & Development Division (R&D) organization, students will have the opportunity to collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues while developing and expanding their career.We are looking for a co-op who will help ultra-sensitive mass spectrometry profiling efforts at the ESC by developing bioinformatic and mass spectrometer (MS)instrument control methods for targeted peptide acquisition, focusing on hallmarks of cellular pathways or cell states, enabling the instrument to dwell on these critical information-bearing peptides and minimize stochastic sampling variation and abundance biases. The co-op will further apply these targeting techniques to a biological system, such as characterizing heterogenous cellular responses to external stimuli, working closely with their mentor to execute the research project during the co-op experience. This co-op will be enabled to work off site, both remotely and in-lab so as to pursue both computational and experimentational aspects of this project.Preferred Experience and Skills:We are a research-driven biopharmaceutical company. Our mission is built on the simple premise that if we “follow the science” that great medicines can make a significant impact to our world. We believe that a research-driven enterprise dedicated to world-class science can succeed by inventing medicine and vaccine innovations that make a difference for patients across the globe.Who we are …We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.What we look for …In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.INVENT.IMPACT.INSPIRE.

Description: ST Equipment & Technology (STET) is the developer of a proprietary separation technology used to process dry powders such as fly ash, mineral ores, food/ feed powders, by triboelectrically charging and separating dry particles in a strong electric field. STET is a part of Titan America group.When applied to the processing of fly ash generated at coal-fired electric power stations, the STET technology reduces landfill disposal, reduces air emissions, increases energy efficiency, and produces a high-quality ash product that improves the durability of concrete. When applied to the processing of industrial minerals, the technology offers mineral processors a lower cost, more environmentally benign process, compared to conventional wet separation methods used in the minerals industries. STET designs and builds our separators in Needham MA, and licenses the technology world-wide for the processing of fly ash and other industrial minerals.STET has an opportunity for a Co-op student, based in our technical center in Needham, Massachusetts.Location: Needham, Massachusetts

Description: Software Development Co-opAbout UsSmartleaf was founded to improve the way money is managed for the majority of people.Everyone wants their money to be managed well, but the quality of financial advice available today can be inconsistent and attention from a financial advisor is directly proportional to the amount of money an investor already has.Smartleaf is about bringing consistency and scale to the investment process so that good advice can be delivered to everyone.Our software enables financial advisors to serve smaller investment accounts with the same level of sophisticated analytics, tax management and customization that was previously available only to investors with millions of dollars.We work with wealth management firms of all types, from multi-billion-dollar national banks to startup “robo advisors” whose apps can be downloaded by anyone with a smartphone.As a software development co-op at Smartleaf, you will have a chance to work on an investment management system that provides customized automated rebalancing and workflow automation to help financial advisors scale up without sacrificing quality.Technologies You’ll Work with Every DayWhat You’ll GainYou’ll do hands-on development work on a complex financial application.You’ll gain experience working in a cross-functional team. Description: Network Security Engineer, Co-OpLocation: Massachusetts ( Boston Area)In a world of increasingly malicious threats to data security, robust systems protection is a top priority for every company. Here at Dell Technologies, we work at the cutting edge of internet security, responding quickly to the changing online landscape. Our IT Security team supports our customers with security infrastructure design, operation and support. As well as planning and installing network security systems, we investigate vulnerabilities and incidents relating to firewalls and systems to provide a timely response to security alerts.Join us as a Network Security Engineer on our IT Security team in Massachusetts to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.What you’ll achieveYou Will· Integrate trends, data and information into plans, deliverables and recommendations· Escalate matters of business risk· Contribute to the development of new techniques and plans within area of expertise· Identify process gaps across the team that impact efficiencyTake the first step towards your dream careerEvery Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life — while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. Description: Company OverviewEntrada Therapeutics is a biotechnology company dedicated to transforming the treatment of devastating diseases through the intracellular delivery of biologics. Entrada’s technology enables the efficient intracellular delivery of proteins, peptides and nucleic acids, thus allowing for the development of programs across several intracellular target classes. The Company’s novel approach addresses current challenges associated with both large and small molecule therapeutics and represents a fundamental advancement in the delivery of molecules into the cytosol.Entrada is comprised of experts and leaders in both biologics development and the rare disease space. In December 2018, Entrada closed a $59 million Series A from 5AM Ventures, MPM Capital, Roche Venture Fund, MRL Ventures Fund and Agent Capital.Position SummaryEntrada is hiring for a Bioanalytical Co-Op position to join the Company’s intracellular biologics discovery programs. This individual will be mentored by and work closely with senior and principal scientists in the discovery group, providing bioanalytical support from target identification to preclinical proof-of-concept projects. The successful candidate will conduct bioanalysis of preclinical development compounds, including compound characterization, impurity, PK/biodistribution, in vitro/in vivo metabolism and biomarker studies.Job ResponsibilitiesQualificationsEntrada Therapeutics is an equal opportunity employer. Description: Bioinformatics Research Engineer: Research Lab Support and Software EngineeringWe are looking for a highly motivated and talented individual to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing software and infrastructure support that is critical to our research effort and involves close collaboration with our renowned team of engineers and scientists. Responsibilities will include building, installing, and troubleshooting software; scripting and developing biological analysis workflows; and maintaining and improving documentation. The successful candidate will be a key player in supporting teams at Dragonfly by building internal tools and solutions using biology, chemistry, and programming skills.Perks include company catered lunches on Mondays, unlimited snacks, Biohub-sponsored happy hours, and company subsidized noise-cancelling headphones. Compensation will be commensurate with experience.Responsibilities:· Interface with various teams at Dragonfly to understand scientific and project management workflows· Design, build, and implement software solutions that address current needs of teams. Internal tools built could be microservices, standalone tools, user-facing web applications, etc.· Collaborate with tech lead and product manager to define key milestones and deliverables· Communicate across disciplines and teams to provide technical solutions to a variety of complex problems· Automate workflows and process management solutions for project leads· Work as a member of an agile team, attending scrum meetings and reviewing code produced by peers· Write automated tests for your solution and oversee its deployment· Provide assistance, maintain tools, documentation, and tutorials to help scientists and leads use internal products successfully· Offer advice and expertise as engineering consultant to help teams improve performance in terms of operations, efficiency, or scientific process· Function as a technical specialist to equipment or systems regarding troubleshooting operations, suggest problem resolution and provide troubleshooting mentorship· Routinely monitor processes for performance indicators and operations· Collaborate with project managers to complete design, engineering, and construction projects within schedule and specified constraintsIn addition to their core responsibilities, students are strongly encouraged to shadow and spend time working with members of other teams to learn additional skills and gain a broader understanding of different roles and functions in the biotech industry.Qualifications:·Applicants must be in at least the sophomore year of their undergraduate studies, with coursework in biology, biological engineering, chemical engineering, computer science, biotechnology, biochemistry, or related field.· Experience in industry, campus research, or internships. Experience of projects in the biotech space desirable.· Background or deep interest in scientific research and experience using Python to script and automate scientific workflows· A commitment to providing excellent user support, and a demonstrated track record of improving past work environments· Proficiency in Python required. Hands-on experience with SQL, Javascript, git, and testing is a big plus· Excellent organizational skills, with ability to take on several projects at once, and an ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities· Strong leadership and decision-making abilities, as well as interpersonal and communication skills, ability to work well on a collaborative team, and communicate across disciplines and groups· Extreme attention to detail and quality, with commitment to building tools and solutions to support teams· Proven track record of ability to maintain high-performing, cross-functional partnerships, and work in matrix teams to advance complex projects· Adaptability to changing business needs and operational requirementsDragonfly Therapeutics is a discovery-stage company developing drugs to stimulate immune responses against cancer. We are developing novel first-in-class therapeutics targeted at natural killer cells and other cells of the innate immune system. These therapies are designed to counterbalance immune suppressive factors present in the tumor microenvironment and mobilize anti-cancer immune responses. Our molecules are expected to be potent as single agents as well as in treatment combinations with existing cancer immunotherapies. Our scientific founders are major figures in cancer biology and immunology and have launched Dragonfly to harness the power of the immune system to provide breakthrough cancer treatments for patients.

We are Amazon Robotics and we will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling and fun.Amazon Robotics, a wholly owned subsidiary of Amazon.com, empowers a smarter, faster, more consistent customer experience through automation. Description: Entrada Therapeutics is a biotechnology company dedicated to transforming the treatment of devastating diseases through the intracellular delivery of biologics. Entrada’s technology enables the efficient intracellular delivery of proteins, peptides and nucleic acids, thus allowing for the development of programs across several intracellular target classes. The Company’s novel approach addresses current challenges associated with both large and small molecule therapeutics and represents a fundamental advancement in the delivery of molecules into the cytosol.Entrada is comprised of experts and leaders in both biologics development and the rare disease space. In December 2018, Entrada closed a $59 million Series A from 5AM Ventures, MPM Capital, Roche Venture Fund, MRL Ventures Fund and Agent Capital.Entrada is hiring for an In vitro Cellular Pharmacology Co-Op position to join the Company’s intracellular biologics/Oligonucleotide discovery programs. This individual will be working closely with scientist and principal scientists in the cellular pharmacology team. Mentorship and guidance will be provided by lab scientist and will have opportunity to shadow along with hands on experience on certain techniques. Candidate will have exposure to process involved in target identification to preclinical proof-of-concept. The successful candidate will conduct in vitro/in vivo studies using a wide range of biological tools. The efforts will support the cell-based assays for candidate optimization as well as rodent PK/PD in vivo studies. By the end of the co-op training, the candidate will be able to design and implement rigorous in vitro and in vivo experiments to support drug discovery research, as well as communicate and present their findings effectively.To learn more please visit entradatx.comEntrada Therapeutics is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

Description: JOB DESCRIPTIONTitle: Medical Affairs Co-op         Department: Medical AffairsPosition Location: Needham, MACompany Overview:Chiasma is focused on developing and commercializing oral therapies to improve the lives of patients who face challenges associated with their existing treatments for rare and serious chronic diseases. Employing its Transient Permeability Enhancer (TPE®) technology platform, Chiasma seeks to develop oral medications that are currently available only as injections. On June 26, 2020, Chiasma received FDA approval of MYCAPSSA for long-term maintenance therapy in acromegaly patients who have responded to and tolerated treatment with octreotide or lanreotide. MYCAPSSA is the first and only oral somatostatin analog approved by the FDA. Chiasma is headquartered in Needham, MA with a wholly owned subsidiary in Israel.SUMMARYThe Medical Affairs department works independently and in collaboration with Marketing, Sales, Market Access, Regulatory, Clinical Development, and other functions to engage with the scientific community through the execution of research and analysis and exchange of scientific information and insights. Over the course of one to two 6-week rotations, the APPE student will learn important operational and strategic tactics of the Medical Affairs function at Chiasma. These principles can be applied to other industry rotations and future career goals. APPE students will be mentored by a VP or Senior Director in Medical Affairs to optimize experiences for Chiasma and student.RESPONSIBILITIES:• Support each function of Medical Affairs including Scientific Communications, Medical Information, Medical Science Liaisons, and Operations.· Learn the disease landscape and competitive landscape of disease states of interest.· Perform literature searches and journal clubs using Chiasma internal databases and publicly available external databases on disease states of interest to address gaps in knowledge for both internal and external use.· Provide input into the operational efficiencies and strategic tactics that are employed in Chiasma.· Contribute to the creation of material including externally facing Publications, Medical Information, and Field Medical tools/resources/programming and collect insights on the impact and/or utilization of such material.· Abide by all pertinent compliance regulations, standard operating procedures, and other policies.QUALIFICATIONS:• Successful completion of IPPE/Co-Op periods 1-2.• Ability to efficiently manage time and priorities.• Excellent written and verbal communicator, skilled at diplomacy and capable of effectively combining science and relationship building.Chiasma Inc. (the "Company") is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, color, sex, religion/creed, national origin, marital status, ancestry, citizenship, military, reservist or veteran status, pregnancy, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, gender expression, physical or mental disability, genetic predisposition or carrier status, or any other category protected under applicable federal, state or local law. Consistent with its obligations under applicable law, the Company will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you require an accommodation in the application process, please contact a member of the Company’s Human Resources department.

Description: A DCU FIC Coop’s principal role is to make the DCU FinTech Innovation Center (the “Center”) the best possible experience for its members. You must be able to embody the spirit of our mission - to support and foster FinTech startups. The role requires both a scrappy startup and a professional client services mentality. Financial services or FinTech experience is not required.You will have the opportunity to wear a few different hats that must work together in order to have a successful outcome. Your will primarily work within one of our core functions: Programming (assisting in the organization and execution of curriculum programming); Events (supporting the organization and execution of Center and community events); Operations (managing the physical space and the systems and processes that support it); Onboarding (touring and signing up new members), or: Marketing (highlighting startup and Center activity through social media).We are looking for a natural social leader and a disciplined self-starter who can help further develop one of Boston’s premier startup accelerators. The position will provide you with exposure to an extensive network of innovators, institutions, FinTech ecosystem members and a chance to build relationships with some of Boston’s best new startups.Primary responsibilities will include:Depending on the candidates performance there are opportunities for new responsibilities to arise to continue to push the future team members forward.This is a chance to get plugged into the Boston innovation ecosystem and get exposure to some of the nation's leading financial technology entrepreneurs.About the DCU FinTech Innovation CenterThe DCU FinTech Innovation Center is the leading sponsor of FinTech startups in Boston and is dedicated to fostering FinTech startups and the Boston FinTech community. The Center focuses on helping startups gain initial customer traction and provides seed-stage FinTech startups with one year of free mentorship, workspace, community and a professional network. The Center is fully funded by DCU, is supported by DCU executives and is operated by Workbar.

Description: BE PART OF A SOLAR-POWERED CINEMA PROJECT IN AFRICAYour tasksAs an intern,you will support Sunshine Cinema with marketing, social media, fundraising. You could be involved in the following tasks:Good to knowFounded in 2013, Sunshine Cinema is a South African solar powered cinema network that converts solar power to social impact. They train youth in South Africa, Malawi, Zambia, and Zimbabwe to be impact producers hosting solar powered screenings with a mobile cinema unit (the Sunbox). They use documentary and feature films that address social and environmental challenges and practical ways to overcome them. And also use these screenings to spark dialogue and inspire social change in their communities.They work in four countries with 17 Sunbox Ambassadors, who have screened to over 20,000 audience members during more than 200 screenings. They also developed a free podcast series, The SunCloud, to amplify their reach outside public gatherings. In addition, relevant topics and record interviews with community leaders, civil society groups, journalists, and filmmakers are shared on community Whatsapp groups, and social media platforms and through Webinars with low data usage. This work feeds into their existing community engagement strategies as it connects their Ambassadors to stakeholders, and further builds their audience network.

Description: IMPORTANT INFORMATIONLOCATED IN WASHINGTON DCDirections to the International Law Institute:The International Law Institute is located in the Foundry Building in Georgetown, 1055 Thomas Jefferson Street, NW, between 30th and 31st, and K and M Streets, NW.Walking: Follow M Street or Pennsylvania Avenue West. Pennsylvania Avenue merges with M Street. Follow M Street two more blocks and turn left onto Thomas Jefferson (at the Barnes & Noble bookstore) and proceed in the direction of the C&O canal. The Foundry Building will be on your left immediately after crossing the canal. Our offices are on the mezzanine level to the right of the main building entrance and are accessible from the street. Look for the ILI sign on the wall and above our entrance.By Metro: The nearest Metro stop is Foggy Bottom. Proceed up 23rd Street and turn left at Washington Circle. After the K Street overpass, turn left onto Pennsylvania Avenue and follow it until you get to M Street. Follow the directions above.By car: Coming from within the District, follow M Street or Pennsylvania Avenue into Georgetown. Turn left on 30th Street (one-way) to access the Foundry Building garage, located on your right. Alternately, from K Street, turn right on Thomas Jefferson Street (one-way) to access another parking garage. Also, parking meters are available throughout the area, in addition to several other garages and parking lots along K Street.

Description: Tango, a 2017 “Fierce 15” company, is an exciting new oncology company launched by Third Rock Ventures, one of Boston’s premier biotech funding groups. Our focus is on exploiting synthetic lethal interactions to discover and develop new breakthrough cancer therapies.Our discovery efforts begin and end with patients. We invert the traditional discovery paradigm by putting patient selection before target identification. We use deep DNA sequencing and CRISPR-based screening to identify novel targets for specific subgroups of cancer patients. Our goal is to leverage the principles of synthetic lethality to find novel weaknesses in cancer cells and use them to provide a roadmap to cures. As we advance our molecules into the clinic, our trials will enroll the patients most likely to benefit from our new treatments; thereby enabling greater speed, success, and impact for those patients.Job Responsibilities:Qualifications:
