Description: Your Impact at ArrakisCharacterizing and quantifying RNA biology in relevant cell lines and tissues is crucial for identifying potential targets for rSM development and for understanding their mechanisms of action. RNA sequencing (RNA-seq) data is a powerful and sensitive technology for quantifying RNA expression and splicing. In this role, you will help expand our analysis capabilities around RNA-seq data by comparing differential expression and splicing tools, developing and applying interactive visualization approaches including pathway analysis, and processing public and internal RNA-seq datasets. The goal will be to compare our current RNA-seq pipeline with other available tools to ensure we are using the appropriate analysis approaches and to expand our analysis capabilities around this data type. This project will provide the co-op student with exposure to a range of commonly used computational biology tools while collaborating with a multidisciplinary group of researchers at ArrakisJob Responsibilities:Learn, implement, and compare algorithms for identifying genes affected by rSM treatment to validate putative mechanisms of actionDevelop interactive visualization approaches with tools such as Rshiny or plotlyProcess and analyze public and internal RNA-seq datasetsLearn and apply pathway analysis tools including Ingenuity IPA to interpret large-scale transcriptomic signalsWork with genomicists and molecular biologists to interpret your results and link them to biological and business valueMaintain a well-documented, modular, and extensible codebaseRequirements:Arrakis is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Description: SolarKal is seeking a self-driven and motivated individual to enhance the company’s marketing strategy as it sustains a crucial growth phase. This is a rare opportunity to get hands-on experience in the cleantech sector and the burgeoning solar energy industry by working in a fast-growing start-up with several accolades and awards under its belt (2017 New York State 76West Renewable Energy Award Winner; Cleantech Open 2016 Finalist and 1776 Incubator Fellow). This role will involve working on a variety of activities such as copywriting, market research, content creation, and press relations.About SolarKalFounded by Yaniv Kalish, and co-founded by Neil Sharma, SolarKal is the leading marketplace for commercial solar in the U.S., connecting solar energy installers with businesses via solar energy advisors and proprietary efficiency tools. Businesses and commercial real estate owners that want to switch to solar—cutting their energy costs and reducing their carbon footprint—are represented by SolarKal to procure their clean energy. SolarKal pioneered the concept of a marketplace and brokerage for commercial solar and is still the industry leader. The access to a vast network of vetted solar contractors that have completed thousands of projects with Fortune 500 companies is a key driver as to why clients trust and choose SolarKal for their solar energy procurement needs.Our team is fervent about what we do and the people we work with. We have extensive experience working with MBA and undergraduate interns who benefit greatly from their internships and create a lasting impact during their time at SolarKal.Job Description:This is a full-time (5 days per week) Spring 2021 Internship. strategy or project management- Go-getter mentality with ability to work independently with limited information and generate value- Strong verbal, written and interpersonal skills- Strong problem-solving, analytical (research and data analysis), and organizational skills, including comfort with Excel- Proclivity for creativity- Comfortable traveling regionally- Experience with presenting to senior executives and decision-makers, a plus- Copywriting, graphic design and/or video/photo editing experience, a plus- Passion for sustainability, renewable energy and/or cleantech, a plusJob Benefits- Casual, entrepreneurial, comfortable, fun and proactive work environment that values high performance, results and accountability- Free training and mentoring on digital and exciting, rapidly changing, and socially responsible industry

Description: We are looking for Research Associate Co-op's for January 2021-June 2021Who you areYou are an ambitious, hard-working and curious individual majoring in biology, cell biology, biochemistry, molecular biology or related field.You have a passion for research, preferably with Independent research experience in a biological laboratory.You like working in a highly collaborative team environment on scientific problems that can have an impact on patients' lives.What you will doResults of the work you do will help us decide which diseases to treat and which drugs to pursue.Help discover new ways to use drugs to regulate the expression of disease-associated genes using techniques including:· Primary human cell culture· Gene expression analysis, QPCRs· Protein and enzyme activity assays· Data analysesWhy you should join us· Highly collaborative and welcoming environment where you will be integrated with the team· Work alongside globally diverse, high profile, talent that is excited about science· You will be hands-on, gaining experience with innovative lab and research techniques· Bright and energetic workspace right in the heart of Kendall Square· Fully stocked kitchen with an assortment of free snacks and beverages· Bi-weekly lunches provided, and company hosted events monthlyFounded in 2016 and focused on a core mission of realizing a world with ‘an effective treatment option for every patient,’ CAMP4 Therapeutics evolved from seminal discoveries made by company founders Dr. Richard Young and Dr. Leonard Zon, characterizing the ways in which cellular machinery controls the expression of genes. Operating at the intersection of genomics, computational biology and data sciences, CAMP4 has extended this foundational work, creating a unique platform to amplify the value of cellular and genetic insights to better understand how gene expression is controlled within the nucleus in specific disease states. Using next-gen sequencing and proprietary methods, CAMP4 can identify de-risked druggable targets, produce actionable insights and improve therapeutic predictability, potentially addressing hundreds of diseases and benefiting millions of patients globally.We sit at the intersection of technological innovation, emerging insight into basic gene control, and scientific ingenuity — uniquely positioned to build a self-sustaining, always innovating biotech company.

Description: Are you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to any of these and you’ll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even imagine yet. We are Amazon Robotics and we will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling and fun.Amazon Robotics, a wholly owned subsidiary of Amazon.com, empowers a smarter, faster, more consistent customer experience through automation. Amazon Robotics has a dedicated focus on research and development to continuously explore new opportunities to extend its product lines into new areas.The Operations Robotics Simulation Team at Amazon is seeking passionate and talented software development engineers and data scientists to help build out our suit of tools used to simulate and explore new robotic solutions. Description: Every year Italian Home assists over 300 children. Italian Home provides services to children from throughout Massachusetts. Childcare Worker is directly responsible for the day to day implementation of the Home's treatment philosophy and program. Through his/her limit setting, nurturing and related parenting activities, the professional Childcare Worker develops a stable consistent structured living environment which affords residents (clients) the opportunity to learn to replace their maladaptive behavior with more appropriate, socially acceptable behavior.A Childcare worker may be employed on a full time or part time basis.Responsibilities include:*Implements the level system and other facets of the therapeutic program.*Supervises day to day functioning of dorm life i.e. meal times, chores, bed times, and wake-up routines etc. *Participates in and/or supervises recreational activities.*Creation, implementation, monitoring, and evaluation of behavior management programs for clients in conjuction with dorm teams.*Ensure the safety and support of clients at all times, and process day to day incidents with residents in an appropriate manner.*Act as the monitor for assigned residents (clients). Attends ITP, Progress Reviews, Clinical and Discharge Meetings for assigned residents (clients). Attend Supervision with assigned supervisor or senior childcare worker, in-service, training's and all meetings deemed necessary by the Assistant Director and Director of Residential Services.*Prepare Life Space Reports regarding the resident's progress for Clinical Review Meetings.*Shopping and/or coordinating the arrangements for clothing, birthday gifts, Christmas gifts and other necessities for the resident.*Participate in regular restraint training and perform or assist in providing physical restraint in the TCI format when needed.*Transport residents to medical appointments, recreational activities, community schools and agencies home visits etc.*Efficient, professional and legible record keeping such as daily and medical logs, restraint reports serious incident reports etc.*Accept additional responsibilities as assigned by Supervisor, Residential Director and or Assistnat Residential Director. Maintain appropriate adult-child boundaries.*High School Graduate or equivalent (GED).*Ability to develop strong verbal and written communication skills are essential in conjunction with word processing, organizing and motivational abilities.*Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills.*Physical ability to provide therapeutic physical restraint.*Ability to bend, reach, move and lift 75 pounds.*Visual and hearing acuity to perform job related functions.Via MBTA Take the Orange Line to Forest Hills and switch to the &8 Bus. Get off at the Faulkner Hospital stop (at the bottom of Whitcomb Ave).Via Route 128 · Take Route 128 to Route 1 towards Dedham, Exit 15A. · Follow Route 1 to the end. (The road changes to the V.F.W. Parkway), the Jewish Rehabilitation Center. · Go left onto Centre St. · After second street light (flashing yellow crosswalk ), take a left onto Whitcomb Ave. (This is directly after the Faulkner Hospital.) · Italian Home will be the 3rd driveway on the right. Via Routes 93/95 · Take Routes 93 or 95 to Storrow Drive. · Exit left to Fenway are. Take a right at the first set of lights onto Bolyston Street and follow to an intersection. (Star Market on left, D?Angelo?s on right). · Vear right at lights and then left onto the River Way . (The River Way eventually turns into the Jamaica Way). · Stay on the Jamaica Way until rotary by Jamaica Pond. Description: Over the past four years, Zipline has made nearly 70,000 life-saving deliveries of medical supplies to doctors in Rwanda and Ghana. Using centralized distribution centers to dispatch autonomous, fixed-wing delivery drones to hospitals up to 50 miles away, Zipline is making a material difference in the lives of millions of people. In May of 2020 we launched in the US delivering PPE to a hospital network in North Carolina, and in September we announced a partnership with Walmart, which could scale our operational capacity in the US dramatically over the coming years.Underpinning our exponential delivery counts and ever-improving customer experience is a commitment by Zipline's engineering team to build incredibly reliable, high-performing systems that work day in and day out.With countless lives relying on our service, downtime and uncertaintyaresimply unacceptable.From prototyping to detailed design to testing to production, customer experience and reliability shape every step of our work.If you're interested in taking on challenging, multidisciplinary technical problems and driving them to completion, then Zipline might just be the place for you. Interns and Co-op students are given large swaths of responsibility on high-impact projects, not busy work that may never see the light of day.Experience working with your hands, working with CAD, working aroundambiguity, and working with multidisciplinary teams to achieve aggressive timelines are all traits of successful engineers at Zipline.

Description: The primary focus of the R&D Associate role will be to support research activities in the laboratory that will advance our core aluminum-water chemistry and drive new research project opportunities. While the underlying chemistry has been proven and de-risked, we continue to optimize our anode, cathode, and electrolyte materials to push our battery capabilities further. In parallel, we are exploring innovative ways in which to utilize our aluminum-water system to bring additional value to the underwater power industry.The day-to-day responsibilities will include setting up and running electrochemical experiments to test new electrode and electrolyte materials and working with the R&D team to support other ongoing research efforts. The individual will work with senior members of the R&D team to learn how to process, interpret, and analyze data from these experiments, and collaboratively decide on follow-up experiments. In addition to aiding in the execution of experiments, there will be opportunities for you to take ownership of various projects. This individual would work closely with the rest of the R&D team and interface with the other engineering groups (electrical and mechanical) to drive the implementation of new developments.Responsibilities:· Work closely with the R&D team to execute experimental plans· Analyze and communicate results to the R&D team· Help run and maintain experimental equipment· Troubleshoot and solve issues before, during, and after experimentsQualifications:· 3.0 GPA· Pursuing a degree in Chemical Engineering, Materials Science and Engineering, Chemistry, or related field· Due to ITAR regulations, the candidate must be a US citizen or Green Card holderPreferred Qualifications· Experience working in a laboratory environment· Experience with electrochemistryAbout Open Water PowerOpen Water Power (OWP) has developed an aluminum-water (Al-H2O) battery technology with a 2-10x improvement in energy density vs. alternative chemistries, currently focused on undersea energy delivery. OWP operates a 20,000 square foot high-bay facility in Somerville, MA. The facility supports a team of ~30 staff who have on-site access to a full wet chemistry research lab, research-grade equipment for characterization of electrochemical processes, a materials characterization lab, environmentally-controlled test chambers, and temperature-controlled test tanks for vehicles and sensors. OWP’s facility also supports full in-house production of Al-H2O systems from proof-of-principle through low-rate initial production (LRIP). Open Water Power is a wholly owned subsidiary of L3Harris Technologies, located in Somerville, MAAbout L3Harris TechnologiesL3Harris is dedicated to recruiting and developing diverse, high-performing talent who are passionate about what they do. The company provides advanced defense and commercial technologies across air, land, sea, space and cyber domains. Description: Medicinal/Organic ChemistNovartis Institutes for Biomedical Research is looking for chemistry Co-op students to provide synthetic organic chemistry support for drug discovery laboratories at our state of the art facilities in Cambridge, MA. Students will become active members of project teams and be immersed in the pursuit of drug candidates to treat unmet medical needs. Students will perform organic synthesis experiments and purification procedures, using modern organic chemistry laboratory techniques or new methods fromthe literature to obtain pure, characterized compounds for biological evaluation. Through the interaction with a mentor and other Novartis scientists you will gain valuable experience and learn more about research within a pharmaceutical company.To be eligible for this position you must be a Chemistry major having experience with commonly used organic synthesis and compound purification techniques, and spectroscopic methods such as NMR and mass spectroscopy. You will be responsible for your own housing during the internship.We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.Directions to NIBRI -Public Transportation:The Novartis campusis situated just a five minute walk from the Kendall Square or Central Square MBTA stops.Number 1 bus will take you from Mass Ave near campus directly to NIBRI at181 Mass Ave Cambridge.

Description: This is for a 6-month full-time co-op from January to June 2021DNA-Encoded libraries consist of billions of molecules that are screened against targets of interest to generate novel hits to start small molecule drug discovery programs. This screening method generates thousands of potential hits with different enrichment scores. The level of enrichment may not correlate with binding affinity. Also, there is a possibility for high false positive rate as the data is inherently noisy. Selecting true hits can be challenging. Co-op student will work on one or more DEL screening datasets to developmethods to find true hits and derive structure activity relationship information from the data.Additional Qualifications:The preferred candidate would have demonstrated expertise in the following skills:Education:

Description: Organization name: Labhya FoundationAbout the orgnization:Labhya Foundation is an India-based educational nonprofit. Labhya enables children from low socio-economic backgrounds with necessary skills to cope with ill-effects of poverty & become lifelong learners through SEL interventions, at scale.Responsibilities and Duties:Vedant Jain (Co-founder) and Trisha Aggarwal (Consultant, Organisation Development)Post-graduate (preferred)Required skills/Personal skills:We, at Labhya give more importance to skills rather than an individual's qualifications, thus following are the basic skill requirements for the above-mentioned role –7% of the total amount received upto $ 25,000.10% of any total amount higher than $25,000.Cases of recurring funding can be separately discussedPrograms and services by Bridge CulturesOnline workshops/webinars:Students learn about the culture and multiple facets and influences on various aspects of life through conversations with people they would meet while in Bangalore. With a remote co-op, Bridge Cultures will enable these conversations virtually. We will organize 3 virtual webinars and workshops on various topics in context to cultural integration which will align with students’ professional and personal growth. Bridge Cultures will bring professionals from various domains and facilitate these interactive sessions.Few topics (not confined to) are listed below:· Social entrepreneurship· Know the city - food, culture, people· Leadership and Teamwork· Unconscious biases· Critical thinking· Influence of culture on design, education, outdoor education, experiential education· Sustainability· Mental health, emotional well-being· Impact of traveling on our personalitySelf-reflection session:Bridge Cultures believes that self-reflection is highly important and necessary to learn and grow, especially after working with a social enterprise on an impactful project. Out of many reasons, reflection is important because it:· Enables the individuals to process and make meaning of the experience· Fosters a better understanding of context. i.e. understanding how their work impacts the community and encourages more participation in future· Creates a sense of accomplishment· Enables the individuals to examine the effects of their behavior, discover ways to improve· Reinforces the feeling of empathy gained during the experience· Acknowledges the skills gained during the experience and builds confidenceInclusions:· Co-op placement· Necessary documentation· Self-Reflection session· 2-3 online webinars/workshops on various topics· Review meetings during co-op to track progress· Social networkProcess:1. Students apply for various positions through NU works2. Bridge Cultures will send an email to the student to schedule a call3.   After the student’s response to that email, a call will be scheduled between the student, Ms. Aspa Papanastasiou (Associate Director, Global engagements at NU), and Bridge Cultures to ensure accountability from the student’s side4. Another call will be scheduled with Bridge Cultures (if needed) to understand the student’s interest, motivation, and expectations from the co-op5. The student will pay the Program fees to Bridge Cultures ($455)6. Bridge Cultures will facilitate the call between student and the organization7. The organization will communicate their response to Bridge Cultures and the student8. If the student is selected, the organization will share the appointment/offer letter with Bridge Cultures9. Bridge Cultures will share the appointment letter with the student10. The student will start the co-op on the decided dates11. Bridge Cultures will facilitate virtual onboarding if necessary12. Bridge Cultures will facilitate 3 online sessions on various topics and organize 2 review meetings during the co-op13. Bridge Cultures will facilitate self-reflection session at the end of the co-opRefund policy:· If the student is not selected by the first organization interviewed for, Bridge Cultures will find another position with another organization. If the student is not selected there as well, 50% of the program fees will be refunded to the student· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op prior to confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 25% of the program fees (this is to factor the currency transaction charges that incurs to Bridge Cultures)· In case the student wishes to cancel the co-op after receiving confirmation from the organization, cancellation must be provided in writing via email marking a copy to Ms. Aspa and Ms. Elisha. Refund will be processed after deducting 75% of the program fees

Description: E Ink offers candidates unique opportunities to shape the future. E Ink technology has enabled the creation of a new $10+ billion ebook market in less than 10 years. Our technology is being adopted in many new applications that would surprise even a loyal follower. Today you can find E Ink enabled products in applications such as electronic shelf labels in stores, smartphones, wearable devices and digital signage, to name a few. E Ink’s unique technology is currently being adopted in such novel applications as luggage tags for travel, smartcards for financial institutions, architectural design and even smart packaging for pharmaceuticals. In many instances E Ink is enabling products that would not be possible otherwise. Our customers are leading innovators themselves, often developing new products for completely new applications. Customers include Amazon, Sony, Rimowa, Displaydata, Abbott Diabetes Care, Global Display Systems and the Palladio Group.E Ink has a rich history. Starting as a spinoff from the MIT Media Lab, it has become the leading innovator and manufacturer of electronic paper displays (EPD) and technologies in the world. It has business and R&D offices in Massachusetts, California and Hsinchu, Taiwan. E Ink team members around the world take pride not only in what has been accomplished but in the potential of what is possible in the future. Description: Company OverviewRoux Associates provides a broad range of consulting and project management services to solve complex environmental problems. We solve our clients' most challenging environmental problems, and we provide our consulting and project management services to an impressive list of Fortune 500 and public sector clients nationwide.The Roux organization applies sophisticated engineering, scientific, technical, and managerial resources to develop and implement effective, efficient, sustainable solutions. Our work involves large complex environmental remediation projects, including Superfund sites, chemical and manufacturing plants, and petroleum refineries and distribution terminals. The range of services Roux provides to our clients includes environmental site assessment and remediation, compliance, litigation, economic analysis, insurance technical support, and a renowned wetlands practice. Our strong history with major Superfund, RCRA, and other regulatory-driven projects is now being applied to some of the most complex Brownfield redevelopment projects in the United States. Moreover, our innovative Engineered Natural Systems (ENS) technologies are being employed in remediation, stormwater runoff, and restoration projects in a cost-effective and sustainable fashion.Position OverviewWork Areas/Position: Civil/Environmental, RemediationCo-ops are given opportunities to contribute in multiple practice areas. Typically, Co-op work on projects in the petroleum/energy sector, remediation of legacy industrial sites, conceptual modelling of contaminant fate and transport, and redevelopment of contaminated properties. By balancing field and office work, Co-ops gain experience in all facets of the engineering process, including investigation, design, construction, and management.Position requirementsEssential DutiesCo-op responsibilities include:Roux is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital status, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or protected veteran status; and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Description: E-Commerce Co-opJanuary 11-June 25, 2021To be considered for this role, you MUST apply through NUworks AND this link:https://grnh.se/2f4eeb402us**15 Co-op Candidates Spots Open**All candidates who apply on or before October 2, and who advance in our interview process, will receive an offer decision from the team by October 30. After October 30, we will continue the interview process to fill any remaining roles not filled during the Priority Period.Wayfair continues to take the online customer experience to the next level, optimizing every part of the online shopping experience to help customers find what they’re looking for and create a home they love. The North America Retail team is at the center of the online customer experience. The department is responsible for defining and creating a “best in class” online experience, working with Wayfair’s suppliers to ensure we provide customers with an endless assortment of products and great value. The department encompasses teams such as Buying, Category Management, Specialty Retail Brands, Promotions, 3D Operations and many more.A successful co-op will be able to develop a strong understanding of what drives e-commerce sales, and leverage cross-functional relationships to drive business strategies to grow Wayfair’s retail business. They will be passionate, organized, and comfortable working in a cross-functional environment. This is a unique role for a highly motivated individual that is interested in joining a high growth company and making an immediate impact.What You’ll Do:Who We Are:Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Description: The CompanyRheos Medicines is a biopharmaceutical company harnessing insights in immunometabolism to develop a novel class of medicines with potential to transform the lives of patients with immune mediated diseases. We are rapidly applying a first-in-field approach in immunometabolism with a comprehensive, systems-biology understanding of the metabolic pathways that drive immune cell function and fate coupled to a biomarker discovery effort with potential to bring precision to the treatment of immune-mediated diseases. Launched in 2018 by Third Rock Ventures with a $60 million Series A financing, Rheos is built on groundbreaking science from pioneers in the field, our passionate team of more than 35 employees is advancing a novel pipeline of immunometabolism drugs, and in December 2019, we entered into a worldwide collaboration with Roche to identify and develop new therapeutics for autoimmune and inflammatory disease. We have brought together leading scientists whose discoveries opened the field of immunometabolism, clinicians with a deep understanding of immune-mediated diseases, and an experienced leadership team that integrates immunology, metabolism, computational biology, and drug discovery to unlock a new frontier in precision medicine for immune mediated diseaseThe RoleRheos Medicines is seeking a creative and motivated individual to join the Biology team. During the internship, this person will learn concepts and laboratory techniques in the fields of immunology and immunometabolism. The co-op will design, execute, and analyze experiments that support scientific projects relevant to immune-related diseases. They will also have the opportunity to present data and conclusions to cross-functional teams. This is an exciting opportunity to gain exposure to several sophisticated laboratory techniques and work in the cutting-edge field of immunometabolism.Responsibilities· Isolating and culturing primary immune cells· Performing genetic manipulations (e.g. CRISPR, shRNA) and setting up functional assays to support target validation· Execute experiments using molecular and cellular biology techniques such as flow cytometry, immunoblotting, lentiviral/retroviral transductions, ELISA, and/or Seahorse· Effectively communicate results and conclusions, and record data in an electronic lab notebookRequirements & Qualifications· Currently enrolled in a Graduate Program: Biomedical Sciences, Biotechnology or Pharmacology· Basic understanding of molecular biology, cell biology and immunology. Familiarity with standard laboratory techniques in these areas· Demonstrated scientific engagement and motivation; eager to learn new skills and actively participate in a dynamic, fast-paced research environment· Excellent organizational skills. Detail-oriented, able to maintain accurate documentation of experiments in an electronic lab notebook· Strong communications skills· Ability to work in a collaborative environment· Positive attitude

Description: CompanyProject scopeThe Laboratoire d'Imagerie sur Silicium (LIS) of CEA-Leti in Grenoble develops state of the art CMOS image sensors. Those sensors, to address an expanding market (cameras, smartphones, computers, automotive, industry, health, space), are developed continuously to enchancetheir overall performance. The laboratory is looking for an intern to study innovative structures such as metasurfaces and nanostructured lenses. The internship will be, on one hand, to characterize existing products on an optical bench, and on the other hand to analyse the performances of the product and compare it to corresponding optical simulations. The intern will be guided by senior researchers. Depending on the internship, continuing with a PhD on simulations and fabrication of metasurfaces microlenses for imager application is a possibility.International programIt includes relocation and administrative assistance, and free scientific and cultural activities.

Description: THE COMPANYPAX Labs is an award-winning consumer technology brand with a mission to establish cannabis as a force for good. Our products set a high bar for quality and, together with the PAX App, offer unique features such as safety locking, adjustable temperature and draw control. As millions of consumers try cannabis for the first time or return to it after a long hiatus, PAX believes that quality, transparency and predictability are the keys to safe, responsible use by adults.Headquartered in San Francisco, PAX is backed by leading technology investors including Tiger Global and Tao Invest (Pritzker family fund). We are an exceptional team with hardware and software backgrounds in consumer technology, healthcare, and biotech, and are growing rapidly to deliver on our mission. Our internal culture values diversity, integrity, having an impact, and passion for the larger movement that PAX is a part of.PAX HARDWARE TEAMThe Hardware division is responsible for the physical product, i.e. the industrial design+electrical+mechanicals+validation+firmware. We're responsible for delivering, so you should have that mind-set, too. We are a small but efficient team, diverse in experience from consumer products to medical devices to solar. Taking personal responsibility for your work and taking initiative to solve problems are both key traits we look for in our team members. Everyone here really cares about delivering on his or her slice of the product, and is willing to jump-in wherever a gap needs to be filled.THE ROLEQUALIFICATIONSYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Description: OVERVIEWThe Electronics & Embedded Systems division of Draper is looking to fill multiple co-op positions across various groups within the Hardware Design & Development Directorate. Successful candidates are self-starters and team-players with a desire to learn new things and advance technology while working with our results oriented teams. This position will directly impact the national security of the United States of America and push the boundaries of what is technically possible.Responsibilities:Successful candidates will be matched with an appropriate team based on their skills and experience. Co-op students have the opportunity to work with senior technical staff on various programs and will be expected to effectively communicate their work both orally and in written memos and presentations. As a student you will participate in all aspects of the product development process including design and prototyping, analysis and simulation, and modeling and test. You may work on various system types including the following:· RF and communication systems including transceivers, antennas, microwave circuits, magnetometers, and other electromagnetic sensors· Instrumentation electronics including low-noise operational amplifiers, analog to digital & digital to analog converters, and analog filtering· State-of-the-art accelerometers, gyroscopes, bio-electronics and novel sensors in various form factors including MEMS.· Layout, routing, and integration of Printed Circuit Boards· Digital systems that utilize FPGAs, Microcontrollers and ASICs to implement algorithms for signal, image, and data processingApplicant Qualifications:Co-op students must be US citizens who are enrolled in an accredited engineering curriculum and able to work full-time for a 4-6 month period.Candidates will be matched to a group based on their relevant experience and interests. Below is a list of broad qualifications sought across the division. Candidates are not expected to have every skill listed but should have experience with two or more of the following:· Scripting and modeling in MATLAB, Simulink, Labview, etc.· Simulation tools such as SPICE, CST, COMSOL, and ANSYS HFSS/SIwave· Digital/FPGA design tools, such as Xilinx Vivado and Microsemi Libero· Board & chip design tool sets, such as Cadence and Mentor Graphics· Signal integrity, layout, and grounding design principles· Digital signal processing, classical controls, and/or modern controls· Hands on experience in digital and/or analog electronics design, test, and debug

Description: AnalyticalChemistNovartis Institutes for Biomedical Research is looking for an analytical chemistry Co-op student to provide mass spectrometry support in our drug discovery laboratories in Cambridge, MA. The student will work in multi-disciplinary and collaborative team while actively supporting the Synthetic Biology group and other drug discovery projects. The student will utilize state-of-the-art analytical and robotic systems to develop and run assays, isolate and identify novel compounds, and develop data processing programing. The student will have the opportunity to learn laboratory automation, instrumental analysis (LC-MS, CE), structural elucidation techniques, and OpenSource MS data processing. Through the interaction with a mentor and other Novartis scientists, you will gain valuable experience and learn more about research within a pharmaceutical company. Prospective students should have a background in chemistry, biochemistry, or related sciences and should have completed course work in analytical chemistry and biochemistry and preferably computer science.You will be responsible for your own housing during the internship.What you’ll bring to the role:We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.Directions to NIBRI -Public Transportation:The Novartis campusis situated just a five minute walk from the Kendall Square or Central Square MBTA stops.Number 1 bus will take you from Mass Ave near campus directly to NIBRI at181 Mass Ave Cambridge.

Description: (REMOTE)Who isServiceNow?Imagine your workday dominated less by emails and spreadsheets and more time given back to you to do your actual job. At ServiceNow, we are making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud-based platform and products streamline and simplify how work gets done across the enterprise. As a Marketing team, we are laser-focused on how we can connect with our customers by creating simple, sweet spot targeting, and by the positioning and packaging of our products and solutions. We also have capabilities in change management that is vital in providing lasting results that stem from out initiatives.Successful Candidate will:o Work with critical workstreams in support of a strategic initiative.o Work with multiple teams to facilitate collaboration across teams.o Create schedules and resolve conflicting priorities to ensure quality on-time delivery of assets and efficient utilization of resources.o Identify level of day-to-day involvement based on ranking and support level needed.o Manage projects.o Track project plan and review daily/weekly work schedule with key stakeholders; ensure project milestones and objectives are met for projects.Role Requirements:· Currently enrolled at an accredited University pursuing a bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing,Psychology, EnglishMajor, or a similar field· Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal· Self-starter with initiative and attention to detail· Ability to assimilate quickly and work productively in a team environment· Curious about what works, what doesn’t and why· Usesmetrics to drive decision making· Good relationship building skills· Agility and speed, able to work in a fast-paced environment

Description: Greetings, students! We’re geared up here to offer another round of epic internship experiences in summer 2021. The internship program offers the opportunity to pause your studies for one summer and work side-by-side with Blizzard Entertainment employees in your area of interest, doing real work that oftentimes ends up in production. As such, we hold you to the same high standards as anybody else in the company.Just like our gameplay experiences, Blizzard internships are a fully immersive experience. We want interns who are enthusiastic about what they want to do for a living and excited to come in every day to learn and contribute in this hyper-creative atmosphere. Being fully engaged with our team also means communicating effectively and maintaining an open mind - one that is receptive to feedback and able to adapt and grow. Your hobbies and interests can also play in your favor. Passion for technology, gaming, game development, and an in-depth knowledge of Blizzard games, products, and services will always be a plus with us, regardless of the position you’re applying for. Be passionate about who you are, be into our industry, and be willing to go all-in and embrace this opportunity to the fullest!QUEST OBJECTIVES· Work with engineers on one of Blizzard Entertainment’s esteemed game development teams· Partner closely with a mentor to design, implement, and debug code in C++, C#, Lua and other languages that will ultimately drive the next generation of Blizzard games· Expand your skills and learn new technologyQUEST REQUIREMENTS· Currently enrolled in a college or university· Returning for at least one more semester or quarter following the Summer 2021 internship· Able to work fulltime hours for 11 – 12 weeks at the Blizzard office indicated in this job posting between May 2021 – August 2021 or June 2021 – September 2021 (group dates depend on when you get out of school)INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITIESWorld of Warcraft:Blizzard Entertainment is seeking skilled and creative software engineers to join our team for an internship working on the future of World of Warcraft. The ideal applicant will understand the technical challenges of engineering on a title as massive as WoW. We are looking for interns who can work closely with engineers and designers to develop a shared vision and then see it through from concept to completion.Unannounced Projects:Blizzard Entertainment is on the forefront of many new games and projects. Our engineering teams are looking for creative software engineers to help us craft the future of Blizzard games in both mobile and PC-oriented products. Join us as we embark on the projects that will define the next generation of games and get your hands on some of the newest game development technologies the industry has to offer.Available Game Development Roles:Gameplay Engineering: Partner with cross discipline teams developing gameplay, graphics, audio, and systems for our games. You will be working on either a live or future title, with a mentor, on a team making deliverables against deadlines. It may be the biggest challenge you have faced, but your strong technical skills, initiative, and commitment will get you through.   · Proficient in at least one programming language, preferably C++ or C# and Unreal· Experience programming in at least one scripting language (Lua, Python, Perl, etc.)· A strong desire to collaborate and innovate on game side code· Hiring Team: World of Warcraft & Unannounced ProjectsTools Engineering:  Help us to build the tools we use to create our games. Create user experiences for sophisticated, proprietary tools; and provide unique value to a small team of talented engineers. We help content creators be really creative, really fast.· Proficient in at least one programming language, preferably C++ or C#· A strong desire to meaningfully impact the way games are made· Demonstrated game programming experience (personal or professional)· Hiring Team: World of Warcraft & Unannounced ProjectsAutomation Engineering:Automation speeds things up. Join the team that works to make our development cycles and tools more efficient for our developers.· Working knowledge of C++ and/or C#· Demonstrated game programming experience (personal or professional)· Experience programming in at least one scripting language (Lua, Python, Perl, etc.)· Hiring Team: World of WarcraftGraphics Engineering:  Help us build upon advancements in graphics technology to push the boundaries of what’s possible for future Blizzard games! This is an amazing opportunity to get exposure to the most advanced graphics tools Blizzard has to offer and for you to bring your innovative ideas into the fold.· Proficient in at least one programming language, preferably C++ · Passion for computer graphics technology and game engine development· Interest in programming for modern graphics backends (e.g DirectX 12, Vulkan, Metal)· Hiring Team: Unannounced ProjectsMobile Engineering:  Help us develop new features and systems for our upcoming mobile applications/games, coordinating across disciplines with designers, artists, and other engineers. Everyone on the team is empowered to influence the direction of the product, and the ideal candidate will have a passion for quality and player experience.· Strong, proven programming skills (C#, .NET Core and Standard)· Working knowledge of the Unity platform, performance analysis, and code optimization· Experience with implementing game feature logic in a client/server environment· Hiring Team: World of Warcraft & Unannounced ProjectsServer Engineering:  Are you an engineer who has an absolute passion for gaming, programming, and finding simple elegant solutions to complex problems? Take this opportunity to help our server teams optimize our game services and servers for current and future Blizzard titles.· Proficient in at least one programming language, preferably C++ or C# · Knowledge of Python and SQL· Player-oriented mindset and drive to build operationally excellent services·Hiring Team: Unannounced ProjectsBlizzard Entertainment is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.Blizzard Entertainment is a global company committed to growing our employees along with the business. We offer generous benefits and perks with an eye on providing true work / life balance. We’ve worked hard to foster a deeply collaborative and creative environment, a diverse and inclusive employee culture, and training and opportunity for professional growth. Our people are everything. Our core values are real, and our mission has never changed. We are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences…ever. Join us!Team Name:

Description: In this co-op experience, the student would be exposed to a variety of psychiatry and addiction-related research activities, but with specific emphasis on intervention development and delivery for benzodiazepine discontinuation in patients on opioid maintenance therapy. The co-op student will additionally be asked to assist in program evaluation and treatment outcome data collection for the new SAMHSA funded ABOVE (Addiction & Behavioral Health Outpatient Recovery) Program, an integrated clinic aimed to provide medications for opioid use disorder for patients with co-occurring opioid use disorder and mental disorders. The co-op will also be involved in the collection of patient clinical assessments, focus group delivery, and data analysis. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, most of this work will be done remotely through virtual means until we can safely conduct operations in-person. Some limited work may be asked to be done in-person, though this can be modified based on the student’s comfort level.The student’s support for these projects would cover a wide array of research-based responsibilities which may include: participant recruitment; pre-screening and scheduling; conducting clinical scales; conducting semi-structured interviews with families; helping study coordinators in data collection; completing data entry and conducting data quality assurance checks; conducting literature reviews; supporting research protocol and regulatory logistics; assisting in IRB submissions; collaboration and cross coverage with fellow research assistants. Outstanding co-ops may have the opportunity to be involved in the analysis of quantitative and qualitative data, contribute to research manuscripts, and to present research at poster sessions and conferences.The student may also gain clinical experience through multiple activities, which could include shadowing psychiatrists and conducting clinical assessments with human subjects as part of research protocols.The student will also be tasked with important administrative responsibilities, which may include:· Preparation and facilitation of research meetings including A/V set-up/scheduling meetings via Zoom and taking meeting minutes· Preparing study materials for research visits· Facilitating protocol logistics· Organization and maintenance of study regulatory materialsPersonal Qualities:· Adherence to the highest standards of professional conduct, including both verbal, non-verbal and written (including email) forms of communication· Team-oriented attitude with ability to also work independently· Strong interpersonal aptitude for working with vulnerable and challenging mental health populations including those with serious mental illness (e.g. schizophrenia, major depression, bipolar disorder, etc…)· Extremely well-organized and detail-oriented· Ability to handle concurrent, competing and shifting priorities· Excellent writing and communication skillsDesirable Skills (not required):· Fluency in Spanish language· Basic knowledge of biostatistics including SPSS· Experience in human subjects research· Basic knowledge of qualitative data analysis· Basic knowledge of data management software (i.e. REDCAP)

Description: At UCB, we are committed to driving diversity, equity and inclusion and continue to do everything possible to drive sustainable change in our communities and to be agents of positive change.â€¯We put our heart, soul and skills into making a difference for people living with significant unmet needs. Will you join us in this pioneering adventure?We currently seeking amotivatedstudent scientist to join our Protein Expression and Purification group(PEP). This position will support the production of proteins that are used throughout UCB’s drug discovery pipeline to fueldevelopment of new therapeutics, from antibodies to novel chemicals matter.Over the course of your co-op with our PEP team you will learn about protein expression in different host cells and purification using chromatographic methods. The successful candidate will be a flexible and careful bench scientist who is eager to learn new technologies and excited by the challenges and rewards of working in a highly demanding environment.

Description: // OPENINGI know what you’re thinking. Perhaps the Orthodontics industry isn’t what you were looking for. If I am being honest, that’s what I initially thought. But the more I learned, the more I started to see the exciting and massive opportunity. Imagine an industry that hasn’t changed in 50 years. This space is old, slow, and ripe for a team of creative and passionate people to do something BIG. We have a very real and rare opportunity to truly build a company from the ground up and disrupt a $2B industry. There aren’t many startups in Boston that can honestly say that.// WHO WE ARELightForce Orthodontics is a digital platform providing orthodontists with fully customized, 3D printed tooth-moving tools.// WHY JOIN USLightForce Orthodontics is disrupting the multi-billion dollar braces market bringing the biggest change to braces since the introduction of modern braces in the 1970s. Our patented technology has already won us Gold prize at the 2016 Mass Challenge and allowed us to raise funds from top tier VC Matrix Partners. Join now us now as we bring this product to the market and take part of a once in a lifetime opportunity.We are seeking a talented and enthusiastic mechanical engineer to assist on a multitude of projects throughout product development phases. From designing and fabricating in R&D phases to running performance tests for FDA submission all the way through to validation and verification of final products, this individual will not only see all phases of a new technology but will be a vital part in decision making and product commercialization. The ideal candidate has experience in CAD modeling (preferably SolidWorks), testing protocol development, rapid prototyping, and 3D printing.// LOCATIONCurrently our headquarters is in Cambridge, MA and by the end of Q1 2021, we will be moving to Burlington, MA for a large expansion to support our rapid growth.

Description: Amazon Robotics Process Engineer Co-op January 2021 to June 2021 (Boston)Are you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to any of these and you’ll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even imagine yet. We invent new improvements every day. We are Amazon Robotics and we will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling and fun.Amazon Robotics, a wholly owned subsidiary of Amazon.com, empowers a smarter, faster, more consistent customer experience through automation. Amazon Robotics automates fulfilment center operations using various methods of robotic technology including autonomous mobile robots, sophisticated control software, language perception, power management, computer vision, depth sensing, machine learning, object recognition, and semantic understanding of commands. Amazon Robotics has a dedicated focus on research and development to continuously explore new opportunities to extend its product lines into new areas.The Process Engineer Co-op will be responsible for delivering and supporting operations and production projects by partnering with the Technical Operations Engineering and the Manufacturing Engineering team along with other cross-functional team members.This role is a 6 month co-op to join AR full time (40 hours/week) from January – June 2021. Amazon Robotics co-op opportunities will be based in the Greater Boston Area, in our two state-of-the-art facilities in Westborough and North Reading, MA. Both campuses provide a unique opportunity for interns to have direct access to robotics testing labs and manufacturing facilities.The Co-op will be responsible for:Basic Qualifications:Preferred Qualifications:Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Description: (REMOTE)Who isServiceNow?Imagine your workday dominated less by emails and spreadsheets and more time given back to you to do your actual job. At ServiceNow, we are making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud-based platform and products streamline and simplify how work gets done across the enterprise. We are the fastest growing enterprise cloud software company in the world and was recently recognized on Fortune’s Future 50 list (https://fortune.com/future-50/2019/) For us, this is just the start.Who is Marketing at ServiceNow?Marketing is the engine room for growth at ServiceNow. We fuel the success of our customers, sales, and products. We have a customer-first mindset in all that we do. As a Marketing team, we are laser-focused on how we can connect with our customers by creating simple, sweet spot targeting, and by the positioning and packaging of our products and solutions. We help our customers gain the most value from our products by providing best practices, business cases and trainings.We also partner closely with Sales to build high-quality pipeline through targeted Marketing activities ranging from thought leadership, strategic and executive events, webinars, digital acquisition, SEO, and more!About the team:ServiceNow’s growing communications team is searching for a versatile, creative, team-oriented public relations and social media co-op who is motivated to advance our position as an enterprise software leader and innovator in the media and with external constituents.We’re looking for a strategic, results-driven, and well-organized student of Communication Studies, Digital Communications, Digital Media Studies, Journalism, or other related academic fields with the ability to craft compelling messages and stories to help frame conversations with relevant media and external stakeholders resulting in meaningful coverage in business and industry media outlets and engagement on our social media channels. We are looking for an innovative communicator to help drive the PR and social media strategy and execution to raise awareness of ServiceNow, our platform and products, and deliver against the company’s strategic objectives. This person will be responsible for supporting the company’s platform and product workflows. In addition, the role will also work on our technical and strategic partner alliances and our industry solutions PR efforts across financial services, telecommunications and public sector. This person will also serve as an important partner to the broader global corporate communications team, business units and marketing teams.Successful Candidate/Student Will:· Support PR and Social Media teams in planning and execution of Knowledge 2021, ServiceNow’s annual customer conference. Specific activities will be engagement with strategic events team, logistical support for media and analyst on the digital experience platform, media and analyst engagement, writing of press releases and/or blogs, media pitching, briefing sheet development, social media event strategy and execution, etc. Additional social media activities include writing, editing and publishing posts, community listening and engagement, and social-first storytelling across different platforms (Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, and Instagram).Specific Responsibilities:· Communicate complex topics effectively and create a range of content, from press releases and blogs and social posts to executive briefing materials and creative briefs, within the enterprise technology landscape.· Expand relationships with media and influencers.· Manage complex, fast-moving and unexpected communications challenges.· Support PR strategies for driving media coverage, working closely with subject matter experts, executives, internal thought leaders and PR agency team.· Collaborate with global PR teams on driving successful launches, announcements, PR programs, and other awareness opportunities globally.· Monitor industry and market-related news and events to assess opportunities for rapid response and dedicated media outreach.· Support the partner ecosystem through announcements and campaigns.· Support ServiceNow’s annual user conference, Knowledge, which attracts 20,000+ attendees as well as industry events.· Lead, manage and execute Social Media programs.Role Requirements:· Student majoring in Communication Studies, Digital Communications, Digital Media Studies, Journalism, English, or other related academic fields.· Some type of public relations and/or social media experience would be a plus.· Highly collaborative, team-oriented, detailed and organized with ability to multi-task.· Excellent communications skills, both written and verbal, with attention to detail.· Passion for storytelling and identifying trends.· Ability to engage, face-to-face (or via Zoom), with cross-functional teams.· Can-do, scrappy, creative spirit, with a desire to own projects from start to finish.· Thrive in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.

Description: About Massachusetts General HospitalFounded in 1811, Mass General is the third oldest general hospital in the United States and the original and largest teaching hospital of Harvard Medical School, where nearly all our staff physicians serve on the faculty. We remain committed to the simple vow of service that our founders made in a letter seeking community support for Mass General's creation: "When in distress, every man becomes our neighbor." More than two centuries later, that promise sustains our commitment to deliver the most advanced and compassionate care to patients and their families.One of the world's top academic medical centers and home to the largest hospital-based research program in the United States, we continue to push the boundaries of what is possible in medicine. As we strive to make a difference today in the health of communities locally and around the world, we also prepare for the future by educating the next generation of healthcare providers and researchers.The Development OfficeThe Development Office is a vibrant and collaborative team focused on advancing the hospital's mission of healthcare excellence. Thanks to our dedicated volunteers and the generosity of our donors and employees, Mass General Hospital consistently raises over $300M annually and its most recent fundraising capital campaign surpassed its $1.5B goal a year ahead of schedule. Beyond these numbers is the major impact in the life of our institution. At Mass General, everything we do is motivated by our mission of excellence in patient care, research, education and community service.Duties and ResponsibilitiesSpecial Events:Assist with all administrative aspects of event planning, preparation, and execution of assigned Special Events. As well as provide general support to the Special Events Team.ResponsibilitiesEvent preparation assistance for the following events:Specific responsibilities for these events and other events may include:General Admin Support for Special Events Team as assigned by supervisor:Qualifications:Testimonial:During my time at Mass General Hospital, I developed valuable professional skills in a fast-paced, intellectually stimulating, and constantly evolving environment. I was able to experience the dynamics of a corporate office while participating in fulfilling day-to-day tasks and interacting with colleagues of different specialties. The special events team works closely with various other teams and departments both in the Development office and throughout the hospital itself to help foster a strong donor community and show appreciation for the donors, physicians, patients, faculty, and community members that allow MGH to be a leader in national healthcare.My role consisted of a lot of organizational upkeep including managing spreadsheets, maintaining continuity between manual trackers and the automated bookkeeping system (Raiser’s Edge), vendor interaction for specific events, and planning and attending various events to ensure they run smoothly. Overall, I enjoyed my time at Mass General and would highly recommend this fun, challenging, and unique, position to anyone looking to further their professional skills in a creative and fast-paced environment.- Carly, Northeastern University class of 2018

Description: Molecular & Vector Biology Co-Op/Full-Time InternABOUT THE NESTAt bluebird, only two things matter - patients and our people. When you join the nest, you're not just landing a new gig, you become a part of a flock that's soaring to new heights. Our innovation and sustainability are rooted in the diversity of our flock and results are achieved through cooperation and the incorporation of multiple points of view. As a part of our evolving and dynamic college program, you’ll have a chance to work with some of the brightest birds in the business, striving to make real impact for our patients and our people. Come gain experiential hands-on knowledge with a group of birds that loves rising to the challenge much as we do!HOW YOU’LL FLYAs a Molecular & Vector Biology Co-Op/Full-Time Intern bird reporting to Maggie Kwong, you'll help to bring more patients their bluebird days by:· Leading (Advancing single-cell assays for bbb)· Driving (Bringing in new and exciting single-cell technologies on the 10X single-cell platform)· Other related tasks as neededWHAT YOU’LL BRINGYou’re the bird we’re looking for if you:· Have (Currently enrolled in a degree program at an accredited college or university)· Are experienced in (cell culture and molecular biology)· Have experience (previous co-op or internship strongly preferred)· Possess the (Ability to work a six-month assignment, full-time – January 11 – June 25)· This role is lab-based and requires a minimum of three days per week on-site at our Cambridge, MA, location.All our birds embrace the principles of the bluebird bio culture: b colorful, b cooperative, b yourself.bluebird bio is deeply committed to fostering an environment where diversity and inclusion are not only valued, but prioritized. We believe a diverse and inclusive community empowers us to act courageously, care deeply, and dream boldly to impact people in big ways. Diverse viewpoints bring diverse capabilities which strengthen our focus and fuel our growth.bluebird is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or any other applicable legally protected characteristics.

The Program Coordinator works closely with entrepreneurs, industry experts, motivated volunteers, and partner organizations across the Northeast. The primary responsibilities include communications, event planning, and data analysis. The Program Coordinator gains insight on the latest clean energy technologies developing in the Northeast. This is an excellent opportunity to gain exposure to innovation, entrepreneurship, and sustainability efforts in the Northeast and to build your network.Key Responsibilities:CommunicationsEvent PlanningData AnalysisCandidates will have experience in the following areas:About Cleantech OpenCleantech Open is the world’s oldest and largest cleantech accelerator and is dedicated to providing entrepreneurs and technologists the resources needed to launch a successful cleantech company. Our mission is to find, fund and foster entrepreneurs with big ideas that address today’s most urgent energy, environmental, and economic challenges. A 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization, the Cleantech Open provides the infrastructure, expertise and strategic relationships that turn clever ideas into successful global cleantech companies. Over the past eight years, the Cleantech Open has awarded over $5 million in cash and services. During that time, our 1200 alumni companies have raised more than $1.2 billion in external funding. Fueled by a network of more than 2,000 volunteers, Cleantech Open unites the public and private sectors in a shared vision for making America’s cleantech sector a thriving economic engine. For more information, visit us at cleantechopen.org or follow us on Twitter.About NECECNECEC (Northeast Clean Energy Council & NECEC Institute) is the premier voice of businesses building a world-class clean energy hub in the Northeast, helping clean energy companies start, scale and succeed with our unique business, innovation, and policy leadership. NECEC is the Northeast regional affiliate for Cleantech Open, executing the Northeast accelerator and business plan competition and building the region’s innovation network with NECEC’s successor program for cleantech entrepreneurs, Cleantech Navigate Northeast. Learn more at www.necec.org.

Description: The US DOT Volpe Center is recruiting for a wide variety of Student Internship positions under the Pathways Internship Program. To qualify for an Internship, you MUST be a continuing student enrolled or accepted for enrollment for the current/upcoming semesters for the duration of the internship as a condition of employment, taking at least a half-time course load. You will be required to provide documentation to support eligibility. Students may be employed throughout the academic year.You must apply via USAJOBS:https://www.usajobs.gov/GetJob/ViewDetails/582282100This job is open for applications from 10/27-11/10.See the list of available internships here:https://www.volpe.dot.gov/sites/volpe.dot.gov/files/2020-10/Volpe-Internship-Positions-Available.pdfAs a student intern you will work as a member of one of Volpe’s organizational teams. Project work varies by division, to learn more visit: https://www.volpe.dot.gov/our-work. You will carry out specific assignments in accordance with defined work procedures outlined by your supervisor. Complexity of duties increases with experience.Major duties may include:Flexibility, creativity, curiosity, and a willingness to take initiative will help you to find—or to create—the projects that interest you the most. Good social skills will allow you to establish a close rapport with our clients both over the phone and in the field. Here is your opportunity to study trains, planes, automobiles, boats, buses, bicycles, traffic lights, pipelines, sidewalks, unmanned and autonomous systems, or hyperloops—yes, even hyperloops. To learn more about the work we do, please visit our website:www.volpe.dot.gov/our-work.This is a temporary internship to complete project work that is temporary in nature. The appointment is not-to-exceed September 25, 2021, and can be extended without further competition to a new temporary appointment at management’s discretion based on the need of the organization for the work to continue and provided the employee remains eligible for employment in the Pathways Intern Program. Internships are expected to begin in May 2021, however, applications will be accepted for a limited number of positions available as early as January 2021.Volpe is committed to fostering an all-inclusive diverse workforce where employees feel valued for their unique backgrounds and qualities and have a sense of belonging and engagement in helping to advance transportation for the public good.

A top priority for this growing company is the development and application of machine learning solutions to improve video review workflows.The Job:The UI/UX Designer Co-op will have responsibility for building an approach to improve the efficiency and scalability of NEMM’s Video Review process. NEMM has developed machine learning applications that create more efficient video review workflows. This position will work towards the visualization of machine learning outputs to improve the human/machine interaction. Description: The Future Talent Program features cooperative (co-op) opportunities that last for up to 6 months and will include one or more projects. These opportunities in our Research Division can provide you with great development and a chance to see if we are the right company for your long-term goals.We are seeking a 6-month co-op in bioinformatics/computational biology/data science, with passion and interest in single cell sequencing and/or spatial transcriptomics platforms, to join the Genome Sciences team within the Department of Genetics & Pharmacogenomics (GpGx) at our Research & Development Division in Boston. Our mission is to develop high-throughput cutting-edge technologies to better understand disease mechanism and to identify and validate new targets and biomarkers. Our group utilizes innovative genetic screening (i.e., Clustered Regularly Interspaced Short Palindromic Repeats - CRISPR) and multi-omics single cell approaches such as simultaneous Ribose Nucleic Acid (RNA) and protein profiling (i.e., RNA expression and protein sequencing - REAP-seq), immune repertoire profiling,CRISPR droplet sequencing - CROP-seq/Perturb-Seq, and Spatial Transcriptomics to impact all stages of the drug development pipeline from pre-clinical to clinical development. Genome Sciences collaborates closely with the discovery therapeutic areas (i.e., oncology, immunology, neuroscience, and cardiometabolic disease), pharmacology, and ChemBio groups within the Discovery, Preclinical and Early Development (DPED) organization to utilize these technologies to pursue key biological questions.The responsibilities of the candidate include but are not limited to:Required Education and Skills:Preferred Experience and Skills:We are a research-driven biopharmaceutical company. Our mission is built on the simple premise that if we “follow the science” that great medicines can make a significant impact to our world. We believe that a research-driven enterprise dedicated to world-class science can succeed by inventing medicine and vaccine innovations that make a difference for patients across the globe.Who we are …We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.What we look for …In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.INVENT.IMPACT.INSPIRE.

Description: CompanyMesodyne is a startup company commercializing a breakthrough technology initially developed at MIT. Mesodyne’s Light-Cell is a new class of power generator that provides efficient, silent, reliable, long-endurance power from any fuel and enables a 10X improvement in run time for UAVs, robots, wearables, and more. Mesodyne is developing products for the industrial, scientific, and defense sectors. Dr. Veronika Stelmakh, CEO and Dr. Walker Chan, CTO have been leading the company since they founded it in 2018. Based in Somerville MA, the company currently has 5 employees and you will be joining a growing, dynamic, and motivated team.Our engineering team has a strong maker/hacker culture: from blowing glass and forging knives to creating model airplanes, launching rockets, and restoring vintage analog synthesizers - we love building things and are excited to bring a new technology to the market that has the potential to revolutionize small power generation. If you have a portfolio of any DIY or fabrication projects, please share it in your application - we’d love to see your work!The company is co-located with several other companies at 15 Ward St. in Somerville, a 10-15 minute walk from the Green Line.JobYou will work closely with the founders and other scientists and engineers to take a novel technology from the lab to the commercial marketplace. You will contribute a unique skillset to the team and will take ownership over your project and aspect of the generator.You will be integrating and debugging early versions of our product. You will need to learn and adapt quickly to solve issues as they arise, and find creative solutions to get things working. For example, you may figure out how to fit an oversized blower into an existing UAV one week, and develop a process to fabricate a high temperature heat exchanger the next week.QualificationApplication ProcessAll interviews are conducted virtually.
