Description: Co-op Work-study or stipend We are looking for co-op students to join the Kids FACE FEARS (KFF) research team and the Boston Outpatient Assisted Treatment (BOAT) Program team. The co-op will work partly on the KFF team and partly on the BOAT team. For BOAT, the co-op will work with the Program Evaluators to monitor ongoing processes and progress toward meeting the goals and objectives of the program, assist in the reporting of formative findings to the BOAT program team, and enter participant data into the SAMHSA database, SPARS. For KFF, the co-op student will work with the Project Manager and Senior RA to provide administrative and research support to the KFF project at BMC primary care clinics, and will be involved with recruitment and enrollment; pre-screening; data collection; conducting data quality assurance checks; and electronic medical record data extraction. The co-ops main focus will be on recruitment efforts and patient data collection. The co-op student will also work closely with a variety of clinical staff, from primary care clinicians and psychiatry researchers, to social work and integrated behavioral health. It is also likely that co-ops on this research team will be working from home based on institutional and departmental policies.Kids FACE FEARS (KFF) is a clinical trial designed to evaluate the relative effectiveness of two methods of delivering cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) for treating childhood anxiety disorders in children ages 3-18 years in primary care settings. The two formats of interest for delivering CBT are online vs. face-to-face with a therapist. Given changing safety policies and procedures around COVID-19, face-to-face format may be in office, or via telehealth.This is a multi-site study recruiting English and Spanish speakers from primarily low-income and traditionally underserved populations, affiliated with four major academic medical centers: Boston Medical Center in Boston, MA; Nicklaus Children's Hospital in Miami, FL; John's Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore, MD, and Seattle Children's Hospital in Seattle, WA. The student will work closely with BMC's Pediatric clinic to recruit participants.Boston Outpatient Assisted Treatment (BOAT) will provide a fully integrated, multidisciplinary continuum of psychiatric care, addiction treatment, and medical services, as well as a host of wraparound and support services, including case management, peer support, recovery coaching, housing assistance, and employment support. Participants in the BOAT program will consist of individuals who are involved with pending charges who are on conditions of release and pre-trial probation as well as individuals who have been found guilty and are on supervised probation. Under the BOAT program, our participating Boston courts will require compliance by the participant to structured multi-disciplinary treatment plan with scheduled court monitoring and supervision. The goals and objectives of the BOAT program are to reduce the duration of psychiatric hospitalization, homelessness detention and interactions with police by providing court-ordered mental health treatment.The student will also be tasked with important responsibilities, which may include:KFF:· Preparation and facilitation of research meetings including meeting minutes· Preparing study materials for research visits· Preparing materials for meetings· Facilitating protocol logistics· Organization and maintenance of study regulatory materialsBOAT:· Collect qualitative and quantitative data for program evaluation· Assist with the reporting of key performance indicators to the funder, SAMHSA· Meet with the evaluation team on a regular basis to monitor progress toward program goals and objectives· In conjunction with the Program Evaluators, report findings to the team on a quarterly basisOther opportunities include:· Assisting with manuscript writing and publications· Attending weekly Department of Psychiatry Grand Rounds· Attending our Global Dinner Series (speakers involved in diverse global mental health initiatives)· Attending workshops hosted by BMC’s Research Professionals Network· Attending workshops and talks by the Young Professionals Brown Bag SeriesPersonal Qualities:· Adherence to the highest standards of professional conduct, including both verbal, non-verbal and written (including email) forms of communication· Team-oriented attitude with ability to also work independently· Strong interpersonal aptitude for working with families and children· Extremely well-organized and detail-oriented· Ability to handle concurrent, competing and shifting priorities· Excellent writing and communication skillsDesirable Skills (not required):· Bilingual English and Spanish· Experience in human subjects research and/or public health research· Basic knowledge of and/or experience with research methods and data management· Ability to communicate effectively (listen and build trust) and be non-judgmentally with people of different gender, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, ethnic, language and cultural backgrounds.· Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications (i.e. MS Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Outlook) and web browsers· Experience with research databases, such as REDCap

Position: Fungal profiling, Computational Microbiome Sciences Co-op
Targeted Academic Majors: College of Engineering, College of Science
Workplace Type: On-site work is preferred when public health concerns allow
Description: Seres Therapeutics is a dynamic biotechnology company in Cambridge MA pioneering innovative Ecobiotic® microbiome therapeutics. Seres recently had a successful Phase 3 clinical trial for treatment of recurrentClostridium difficileinfection, and has promising late clinical stage programs in Ulcerative Colitis. As such, we are well-positioned to become the first company to commercialize a new therapeutic modality comprising ecologies of commensal bacteria.Additionally, Seres has entered the clinic with multiple new product candidates in a range of therapeutic areas including immuno-oncology and inflammation to build upon its field-leading portfolio of intellectual property and know-how.Fungal profiling, Computational Microbiome Sciences Co-op Position:Growing evidence suggests that viral and fungal members of the microbiome also play important roles in host health and disease progression, through both ecological interactions with other members of the microbiome and by directly interfacing with the host. We are seeking a highly motivated co-op to assist in literature review, and developing and benchmarking tools for the characterization of fungi in shotgun metagenomics samples. These methods will then be applied to determine associations with disease, with the ultimate goal of determining the utility of fungal characterization across Seres’ portfolio. The motivated student may also expand efforts to include characterization of bacteriophage.This is an exciting opportunity for a co-op student to work closely with scientists in Bioinformatics and CMS to contribute impactfully to potential new research areas.Programming experience in R or python, statistical modeling experience, and familiarity with a unix environment, strongly preferred.Key Responsibilities· Read and interpret primary literature· Identify, understand, and apply relevant computational tools· Work closely with team members· Help collect, organize, analyze and interpret data· Keep a lab notebook of approaches, analyses, and results· Communicate findings with computational and lab scientistsQualifications· Currently enrolled in a STEM degree program at senior or master’s level· Strong interest in ecology of the gut microbiome and genomics· Experience with either python or R programming languages· Experience with a linux/unix environment· Experience with high performance computing clusters· Good record keeping, organizational, written and verbal communication skills· Team player

Description: Statistical Programming Co-Op/Full-Time InternABOUT THE NESTAt bluebird, only two things matter - patients and our people. When you join the nest, you're not just landing a new gig, you become a part of a flock that's soaring to new heights. We’re 1100+ doers, thinkers and collaborators across 7 countries with a strong sense of our values and our purpose. Our innovation and sustainability are rooted in the diversity of our flock and results are achieved through cooperation and the incorporation of multiple points of view. This is personal and we approach every challenge with radical care. The time is now to rise up and recode the science, the systems, and the status quo.ABOUT THE FLOCKThe Clinical Development Operations flock is all about getting stuff done, working collaboratively, and advancing our technology. As a part of our evolving and dynamic college program, you’ll have a chance to work with some of the brightest birds in the business, striving to make real impact for our patients and our people. Come gain experiential hands-on knowledge with a group of birds that loves rising to the challenge much as we do!HOW YOU’LL FLYAs a Statistical Programming Co-Op/Full-Time Intern bird reporting to Qiuling Shan, you'll help to bring more patients their bluebird days by:· Become familiar with statistical programming tools such as SAS, write code to analyze and report clinical trial data using SAS.· Apply statistical concepts learned in class to the clinical trial data to derive conclusions and deliver results to the teams.· Visualize the data to substantiate conclusions.· Write scripts or code either in SAS or any other software to develop macros and tools.· Prepare, maintain, and quality check clinical trial documents.· Learn about the needs of the statistical programming teams and understand the impact of the role in clinical research and development.· Other related tasks as neededWHAT YOU’LL BRINGYou’re the bird we’re looking for if you:· Have (Currently enrolled in a graduate-level (MS) degree program at an accredited college or university, studying math, computer programming, data analysis, and/or applied statistics through current or previous coursework)· Display creative thinking and interest in data analysis.· Good academic standing and strong analytical skills.· Familiar or prior experience using SAS software.· Knowledge of C++, VBA, Java, basic Python or R is a plus.· Excellent organizational skills, sufficient to multi-task in an extremely fast-paced environment with changing priorities.· Excellent communication skills and ability to influence across multiple functions.· Possess the (Ability to work a six-month assignment, full-time – January 11 – June 25)· This position is 100% REMOTE.All our birds embrace the principles of the bluebird bio culture: b colorful, b cooperative, b yourself.bluebird bio is deeply committed to fostering an environment where diversity and inclusion are not only valued, but prioritized. We believe a diverse and inclusive community empowers us to act courageously, care deeply, and dream boldly to impact people in big ways. Diverse viewpoints bring diverse capabilities which strengthen our focus and fuel our growth.bluebird is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or any other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Description: COMPANY OVERVIEWTakeda fosters a collaborative and stimulating work environment filled with opportunity and the chance to make a difference in people's lives. It is a workplace driven by integrity, one of Takeda’s long-held values that extends to both the patients we serve and our employees who develop and deliver medicines. Across our company, Takeda employees bring together diverse strengths that together create a stronger whole.As one of the world’s leading biopharmaceutical companies, Takeda is committed to bringing Better Health and a Brighter future to people worldwide. We aspire to bring our leadership in translating science into life-changing medicines to the next level, in our core focus areas; oncology, gastroenterology, neuroscience, rare diseases, plasma-derived therapies, and vaccines. The Greater Boston Area is headquarters to many of our Global and US business units.We are a passionate team doing important work that impacts patients’ lives. If you are driven to create better health and a brighter future, join us!Interested in early phase research in the pharmaceutical industry setting? Want a hands-on experience in the drug discovery process? This position in the Lead Discovery group within Global Biologics at Takeda Boston will involve performing high-throughput mammalian cell culture, expression, purification and optimization work in efforts to advancing early antibody discovery using the latest automation technologies.Cell and Molecular Biology, Biology, Biochemistry and Bioengineering majors are encouraged to apply.· Summarize and communicate results· Maintain good written records of laboratory procedures, results and conclusions· Participate in group meetings and contribute to scientific discussions· Minimum GPA of 3.3· Open to current sophomores, juniors or seniors (undergrad or graduate programs)· Previous laboratory-based research experience in biochemistry, cell biology, immunology, or cancer biology· Understanding and experience in protein purification principles and methods· Experience with mammalian cell culture· Self-motivated, curious, independent and eager to learnADDITIONAL INCENTIVES THAT TAKEDA PHARMACEUTICALS OFFER:· Opportunity to take part in a global organization with state-of-the-art capabilities· Lunch and Learns (Leadership team and other dept members to present topics)· Great Location, about 1.5 miles from Campus (few stops on Bus Route 1)· Mentoring to take a more direct, intentional role with each Coop· Quality Conversations (goals/career track)· Potential to extend to 8 months and part time work· Cross-training (across four groups in Global Biologics)· Opportunity for poster session/final presentationsBy Bus: Take the bus CT1 or bus 1, going towards Central square in Cambridge and get off at the "University Park" stop. Landsdowne street is across the streetBy T: Take the red line towards Alewife, get off at the "Central" stop. Walk on Mass Ave. towards Boston until youget toLandsdowne Street on the right.

Description: Please apply online and on NUWorksJoining HPE in an early career role is an excellent opportunity for a self-motivated, proactive individual to grow with us and help us drive our continued success globally. We are one of the largest technology companies in the world, operating in over 150 countries and market leading in several industries. We believe in partnership, innovation and taking action – our culture is what defines us as a company: how we act, how we treat others, and how we conduct business. In addition to working alongside great colleagues, you will have many opportunities to learn through coaching and stretch assignment opportunities. You’ll be guided by feedback and support to accelerate your learning and maximize your knowledge. We even have a “reverse mentoring” program which allows us to share our knowledge and strengths across our multi-generation workforce.Sounds like you? Then we have the right opportunity—we are looking for a Systems/ Software Engineering Intern to join us! Our engineers develop solutions using the latest technologies to ‘Make IT Simple’ for our customers. HPE is more than a hardware company, we are a global software development organization with a full suite of products ranging from an enterprise website getting millions of page views a week to a predictive analytics solution which can warn a customer of an issue before it happens. We're looking for hands-on, technically curious individuals that want to grow their abilities as software engineers in a large-scale, global development team with great opportunities to learn and develop. Peaked your interest? Apply today for this role!How you’ll make your mark:• You will work on a specific project critical to HPEs needs with opportunities to gain experience across a broad range of cutting edge technologies and across the full stack of software engineering challenges.• You can work within an existing Agile, software engineering project team and collaborate to help to solve problems within that team's focus• You'll learn about our software development practices and the latest tools used for software development and front-end technology - including Scrum and Kanban methodologies.• You can communicate effectively and be motivated to achieve results as part of your team.• You will be mentored by at least one senior member of the Engineering Team and will be working with a mix of IT professionals with a range of experienceAbout you:• You have a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology (or similar) or equivalent experience• You have knowledge of Programming Languages –Java, Java Script, Python, Infrastructure/Operating Systems/Virtualization such as Windows, Linux, Docker, Swarm, Ansible and also development tools such as GitHub, Jenkins, Selenium• You have a basic understanding of Scrum and Kanban methodologies·• You are customer focused with excellent problem-solving skills• You are a strong verbal and written communicator with the ability to work well in teamsWhat we can offer you:Extensive benefits, a competitive salary and participation in the shared values and purpose that make Hewlett Packard Enterprise one of the world´s most attractive employers! At HPE, our goal is to provide equal opportunities, flexible work-life balance, and constantly evolving career growth.If you are looking for challenges in an exciting, supportive and international work environment, then we definitely want to hear from you. Continue the conversation by clicking apply now below, or directly via our Careers Portal at www.hpe.com/careers.Join us and make your mark!Find out more about us and follow us on:https://www.facebook.com/HPECareershttps://twitter.com/HPE_CareersHPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to diversity and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We do not discriminate and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global diverse team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together.

Description: Electrical Engineer Co-opComputer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Systems EngineeringHasbro is currently recruiting enthusiastic, technically curious & creative engineering students to assist Applied Technology Group in the development of our products. You should be extremely intelligent and be able to learn quickly and work independently. This is the perfect job for someone who’s smart, driven, and skilled at creatively solving problems. You’ll learn programming, electronic engineering, product design, quality control, mechanical engineering - but you’ve got to start with what we can’t teach –intellectual sharpness, interpersonal skills and creativity.We also offer a unique opportunity to our students by participating in Hasbro’s Co-opEPIC group project.Co-ops work in teams to bring an idea for a Hasbro product to concept stage. This includes presenting the idea to business partners at various checkpoints in the process and prototyping the concept for presentation.We are looking for qualified EE/ECE/CE and we're open to other technology/Engineering majors based on skillset.Team Overview:Global Electronics & Technology Group• Research & present relevant new technologies for future Hasbro products• Evaluate competitive products & participate in product brainstorming sessions• Actively participate on cross functional project teams throughout development life-cycle• Provide technical advice & feasibility assessment for new concepts• Define product gameplay (flow charts & robotic routines) & program concept/development models• Technology Co-op’s Responsibilities:• Build, test, debug, & demonstrate electrical breadboard models• Prototype product concepts• Program microprocessors for control of animatronics, lights/sounds, R/C, & other technologies• Perform sound editing & SFX creation• Refine product game play for program development (i.e. writing flow charts or robotic routines)• Identify and troubleshoot issues with development models & work with overseas vendors to correct them• Assist in development and prototyping of Android/iOS apps to interface with external hardware components• Evaluate competitive products & perform research on new technologies for different applications• Must have basic programming skills & knowledge of basic electronics & transistor theory• Create electronic schematics using MultisimQualifications:• Must be a current undergraduate or graduate student, 2020 or earlier graduates are not eligible for our Co-op programand will not be considered for this position.• Must be available to work full-time as a co-op from January 2021 through June 2021• Co-op assignment can be either a mandatory or optional requirement for graduationPreference will be given to candidates with:• Completion of at least one year of study towards a BS in Electrical Engineering or Comp Eng• Arduino or similar platform is a plus!• Project work or co-op experience in product design engineering, robotics, electronic hacking• Excellent communication & interpersonal effectiveness skills• Strong time/project management skills & the desire to build/expand competency in this area• Intermediate-level skills in MS Excel, Word & Outlook & web-based applications• The ideal candidate can provide projects or products via an online portfolio/links/attachments showing Robotics, Arduino, electro-mechanical hacking, app development, creative projects outside of school• Candidates are responsible for their own housing & transportation (FREE Parking). Hasbro headquarters in Pawtucket, RI is 1.3 mi from the South Attleboro, MA commuter rail station.Hasbro (NASDAQ: HAS) is a global company committed to Creating the World’s Best Play Experiences, by leveraging its beloved brands, including LITTLEST PET SHOP, MAGIC: THE GATHERING, MONOPOLY, MY LITTLE PONY, NERF and TRANSFORMERS, and premier partner brands. From toys and games, television programming, motion pictures, digital gaming and a comprehensive lifestyle licensing program, Hasbro fulfills the fundamental need for play and connection for children and families around the world. The Company’s Hasbro Studios creates entertainment brand-driven storytelling across mediums, including television, film and more. Through the company's commitment to corporate social responsibility, including philanthropy, Hasbro is helping to build a safe and sustainable world and to positively impact the lives of millions of children and families every year. Learn more at www.hasbro.com and follow us on Twitter (@Hasbro & @HasbroNews)

The initial offering, Drinkworks Home Bar by Keurig®, is a first-of-its-kind Drinkmaker designed to prepare cocktails, beers, ciders, and more using proprietary Drinkworks Pods at the touch of a button. Description: Righteous Babe Radio is musician, activist, and feminist icon Ani DiFranco’s independent pirate radio station. It officially launched in April of this year and runs 24 hours a day, 7 days a week from the Righteous Babe Records website. RBR Radio features podcasts, music, bootleg show recordings, book talks, poetry readings, news updates, interviews and conversations with artists and activists, and so much more! It was Ani’s vision to create an inclusive, feminist, LGTBQ-friendly radio environment for and by the artist, a platform that allows the listener to be transported to a creative community on their own time, wherever they have access to the internet.Now that the station is in full swing, we could use another pair of hands on deck to make sure the station runs smoothly. We are searching for an innovative, creative intern who is passionate about music to help organize and edit content, assist the content director, and coordinate the production of new content. We are also seeing the potential for intern duties to include radio personality tasks. RBR continues to grow and expand constantly, adding new content and bringing in artists from all over. Knowledge of radio and podcast production, as well as audio editing would be applicable as well. It’s truly a diverse opportunity and will have something new every week. The station is unique and will combine many different elements — it needs someone who is willing to try their hand at anything and everything as there are always new projects to be working on.Internship will include:*Reviewing submissions from national promotion companies*Scheduling programming on the station*Reaching out to like-minded talk and podcast programs for rebroadcast*Producing talk radio statements*Potential on-air personality opportunities

Silicon Labs’ software and mixed-signal engineering teams create solutions for customers in diverse markets including theInternet of Things, (IoT), internet infrastructure, TV tuners, as well as automotive and consumer radios. Description: About the Role:Abcam’s Fireplex manufacturing team is looking for a 6-month co-op engineering student to participate equally in ongoing manufacturing activities and in process development activities.Abcam Fireplex manufacturing activities include: Ultraviolet initiated hydrogel polymerization in microfluidic channels (a.k.a. stop flow lithography); functionalization of hydrogel particles with fluorescent and biomolecule capture moieties; use of automated liquid handling robots as well as hydrogel particle measurements using flow cytometry and high content microscopy.Process development activities in Abcam’s Fireplex manufacturing team include the development of manufacturing process for new products, improvement of throughput of manufacturing processes, design and testing of new parts, tools and jigs and efficiency improvements of manufacturing processes such as time reduction and yield.This co-op would work closely with a team of 5-7 engineers and scientists, report to the Fireplex manufacturing manager and have exposure to a larger group of approximately 20. A suitable candidate would have experience and/or interest in all or some of the following areas: wet lab biochemical processes, microfluidics, mechanical design custom reagents for life science research, process automation.Abcam’s Boston facility plans a move from its’ current location in Kendall Square, Cambridge to Waltham in Spring 2021 so this co-op position will start in Kendall Square for approximately 3 months and then will move to Waltham for the final approximately 3 months.Roles & Responsibilities:Abcam Fireplex manufacturing activities include: Ultraviolet initiated hydrogel polymerization in microfluidic channels (a.k.a. stop flow lithography); functionalization of hydrogel particles with fluorescent and biomolecule capture moieties; use of automated liquid handling robots as well as hydrogel particle measurements using flow cytometry and high content microscopy.Process development activities in Abcam’s Fireplex manufacturing team include the development of manufacturing process for new products, improvement of throughput of manufacturing processes, design and testing of new parts, tools and jigs and efficiency improvements of manufacturing processes such as time reduction and yield. About You:A suitable candidate would have experience and/or interest in all or some of the following areas: wet lab biochemical processes, microfluidics, mechanical design custom reagents for life science research, process automation. A suitable candidate would work well in collaborative environment and would volunteer to help with a can-do attitude.If this sounds like you and you’d like to be a part of a fast-paced, growing business with thevision to become the most influential company and best-loved brand in life sciences, please apply now!Pay and Benefits:In addition to competitive salaries, we offer an attractive and flexible benefits package (including our award-winning share scheme, 18 weeks full paid maternity leave and 6 weeks full paid paternityleave), a culture focused on well-being and opportunities for growth and development, and a highly flexible working environment.What’s more, as a WORK180 Endorsed Employer, we are recognized globally as an organization that’s diverse, inclusive and supports women in the workplace.About Us:An idea conceived in a University of Cambridge laboratory in 1998, Abcam plc (www.abcamplc.com) began life as an innovative and entrepreneurial start-up, spearheaded by like-minded individuals who shared a common purpose of providing the scientific community with quality antibody reagents, as well as trustworthy and up-to-date information about their uses and limitations. Abcam has now grown to become a leading supplier of protein research tools to life scientists, whilst always maintaining the core collaborative values assumed at its inception.  Abcam now supports life science researchers in their quest to understand the cause of disease and ultimately offer improvements to diagnoses and treatments. To achieve this outcome, the company both develops andmanufactures its own products in specialist facilities across the globe, and sources from over 400 partners, offering scientists the newest, most innovative and highest quality research tools available globally, regardless of source. With a customer base of research scientists who require high performance products with detailed technical specifications, 64% of global researchers use Abcam products.  Inclusion & Diversity:Abcam is an Equal Opportunity Employer and makes all employment decisions without regard to age, national origin, race, ethnicity, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Description: We Grow Microgreens, LLC founded and operated by urban growers Lisa Evans and Tim Smith, specializes in growing highly nutritious microgreens, edible flowers and unique plants using sustainable growing practices.We Grow Microgreens, LLC expanded to almost an acre of land in Hyde Park conveyed by deed by the City of Boston in March of 2019. The couple built an aesthetically beautiful, water conserving and energy efficient glass greenhouse that melds into the fabric of a residential neighborhood. The couple selected a high-quality glass greenhouse for the farm that allows neighbors to see the lovely greenery during all months of the year. The glass greenhouse has translucent solar panels on part of the roof and two rainwater tanks collecting 7,000 gallons of rainwater so that the business can have a greater capacity of sustainable growing practices of microgreens, edible flower production and unique tropical plants resulting in increased yield and conservation of resources. The Farm includes a Community Preservation Act funded landscaped community walking path with wildlife attracting plantings designed by Landscape Architect Wes Wirth.The couple has been successful in winning eleven grants from the Massachusetts Department of Agriculture, the United States Department of Agriculture, Governor Baker and the City of Boston. They were awarded Microenterprise of the Year by the Small Business Administration in 2019.GENERAL JOB DESCRIPTIONThe farm is looking for an intern to assist in agricultural education in a hands-on environment at our Hyde Park, MA Farm which includes a glass greenhouse, two high tunnels, farmstand and soon to be constructed raised garden beds. Both Lisa and Tim have extensive experience teaching in the Boston Public School system. They plan to utilize these educational skills in expanding We Grow Microgreens, LLC to offer educational programming. Our newly constructed high tunnel provides a safe and comfortable environment for educational programming, year round. Proposed classes include “How to Grow Microgreens,” Yoga amongst the plants, and “Gardening Basics.”The intern would help with the creation of the lesson curriculum, assisting with teaching classes and overseeing both the marketing of and sign-up of all educational programs. Classes could range anywhere from kindergarten and elementary school students to adults hoping to learn more about microgreens growing.Lisa and Tim are currently teaching horticultural classes at the Department of Youth Services correctional facility a few hours a week. Lesson planning for these classes will also be needed. Due to COVID-19, participation for the intern in these classes will be remote until restrictions are lifted. Any class held at the Farm will be in person with social distancing measures put in place. The classes will take place in well ventilated high tunnels.The farm is looking for an Undergrad or Grad student studying in the field of education or who has a focused interest in pursuing a career in environmental education. The ideal candidate is outgoing, self-directed and creative and has a passion for sustainable agriculture. The intern will work both independently and as part of a team. The intern will also assist in other areas of the farm.ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIESThe farm is currently in the final stages of construction and business building. A grant for the construction of 200 raised beds has recently been awarded, and the assembly of these will begin in the winter months. The intern will be expected at times to help with basic construction projects like these.We are attending farmer's markets throughout the winter months and need assistance in marketing these markets and our online pick-up services. You will have the opportunity to learn about marketing through social media in the agricultural and horticultural realms. You will get first hand marketing experience at farmer’ market and the farm’s farmstand by promoting and selling the products. Lastly, you will learn about growing microgreens and harvesting techniques.This is a start-up farm, so you will wear many hats. We welcome any suggestions in building our budding business.1. Drafting of lesson curriculum for various environmental education programs2. Assist in leading educational programs3. Build raised stone beds2. Build raised wood beds5. Grow microgreens, edible flowers and unique plants6. Assist at Farmer's markets selling produce7. Assist at Farm-stand selling produce8. Collaborate with other individuals on the farm9. Be a role model for teen employees that already work on the farm10. Help with social media is always welcome11. Description: Company summary:Cellarity, Inc. is a privately held, well-funded, early-stage biotechnology company that is pioneering a novel transformative therapeutic approach. Cellarity was founded by Flagship Pioneering, a team of entrepreneurial scientists that conceives, creates, resources, and grows first-in-category life sciences companies. Since 2000, Flagship has created over 75 groundbreaking companies that are pioneering novel and proprietary biological, industrial, and engineering approaches to solve major needs in human health and sustainability. These companies include Moderna Therapeutics (NASDAQ: MRNA), Seres Therapeutics (MCRB), Syros Pharmaceuticals (SYRS), Rubius Therapeutics (RUBY), Evelo Biosciences (EVLO), Kaleido Biosciences (KLDO), and Indigo Agriculture. Cellarity is a highly dynamic, entrepreneurial, and innovation-driven organization seeking to hire an exceptional scientist to join our team.Position summary:We are looking for a motivated, talented Co-operative student to join the Biology team and play a vital and supportive role for existing and new drug discovery projects. This person will be responsible for performing and understanding cell-based assays and basic molecular biology techniques used to validate model predictions and report those findings to the larger team. Candidate must be excited to learn novel biology and become a master of cellular techniques; we are looking for driven, team players to join the group. The individual will work closely the scientists of the Cellarity team and will have the chance to make a profound impact on the company in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment.Key Responsibilities:Biology, biochemistry or related major preferred. Ideal candidate will have taken introductory course work (and accompanying laboratory classes), genetics, and cellular biology.Recruitment & Staffing Agencies: Flagship Pioneering and its affiliated Flagship Lab companies (collectively, “FSP”) do not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than candidates. The submission of unsolicited resumes by recruitment or staffing agencies to FSP or its employees is strictly prohibited unless contacted directly by Flagship Pioneering’s internal Talent Acquisition team. Any resume submitted by an agency in the absence of a signed agreement will automatically become the property of FSP, and FSP will not owe any referral or other fees with respect thereto.

Description: Office OverviewCome work for Attorney General Maura Healey and make a difference! Are you looking for more than just a great learning experience? At the Attorney General’s Office, you will be part of “The People’s Law Firm.” Whether working directly with our residents, or supporting our talented and dedicated staff, your work here will contribute to a higher mission of serving the public and making a difference in the lives of others.The Attorney General’s Office is the largest public sector legal office in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. Attorney General Maura Healey is the chief lawyer and law enforcement officer of the Commonwealth. Her office serves as an advocate and resource for the Commonwealth, its residents, and businesses in many areas, including protecting consumers, combating fraud and corruption, protecting civil rights, and promoting meaningful economic stability. The Attorney General's Office is organized into six bureaus. The divisions and teams within each bureau have distinct missions and work closely together to ensure the Attorney General’s Office provides the highest level of public protection. We invite you to explore the work of our office at www.mass.gov/agoWork CultureThe Attorney General’s Office is a professional, collaborative work environment. Our dedicated employees work together with a shared commitment to serving the interests of the Commonwealth. Students have shared these comments about the Office:· “A kind and welcoming atmosphere.”· “The positive energy was very infectious, and it made me strive to work harder, as well.”· “The most professional yet fun office I’ve yet to work in.”The Office supports and appreciates the diverse perspectives and backgrounds of our employees and strives to provide a welcoming and inclusive workplace environment for all. We offer a variety of co-op positions, and our co-op students are an integral part of the Office.Position DescriptionResponsibilities include providing general office support and clerical assistance throughout the Trial Division of the Attorney General’s Office. The Trial Division represents and defends the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, its agencies, and employees in a wide variety of civil lawsuits, including tort, contract, eminent domain, employment, and civil rights cases. Specific duties will include:· Mail processing – opening, date stamping and distributing mail received in the Trial Division each day, as well as keeping a spreadsheet of all invoices received.· Presentment work – The Trial Division receives approximately 600 presentments each year (tort claims against Commonwealth entities or its employees), and presentment work could include intake, responding to phone calls regarding presentments, drafting letters to agency counsel and forwarding the presentments to the proper agencies involved.· New Case Intake – Civil litigation cases received in the Trial Division would need to be entered into our case management system and forwarded to the Managing Attorney for assignment.· Outlook calendaring.· Various spreadsheets, scanning and copying.. Assisting the Managing Administrative Assistant with special projects such as case reassignments, public records information gathering and reporting, settlement paperwork, and contracts and invoices.· Overflow assistance for paralegals such as assisting with the assembly of trial binders, printing exhibits, redaction work, and archiving closed cases.· Other duties as needed.Desired QualificationsDependability, flexibility, discretion with sensitive matters, strong verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work effectively with the public are required. Familiarity with a professional office environment and previous writing and telephone experience are a plus. Professional and presentable office attire is required. Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Excel, Access, Word, Outlook) is recommended.Learning and Professional Take-AwaysStudents develop professional skills during their co-op experience while building self-confidence. You can expect to leave this co-op with:· Exposure to the inner workings of a busy government office.· Experience working in a professional office setting.· Exposure to the field of civil litigation in one of the largest divisions within Office.· Ability to multi-task, work under pressure, and prioritize tasks to meet deadlines.· An understanding of how the team that supports the chief lawyer and law enforcement officer of the Commonwealth operates.Location and AmenitiesLocation and convenience! We are centrally located at One Ashburton Place on Beacon Hill; close to the State House, Boston Common, and Faneuil Hall. We are easily accessible by public transportation, and accessible to the many cultural and social activities offered in the city. Enjoy the convenience of Metro Café, a cafeteria offering a wide variety of affordable food options, located on-site at One Ashburton Place.DURING COVID: The Office has not yet determined work arrangements for the spring, but co-op positions will likely be remote for some or all of the upcoming six-month co-op period. Some in-office work may be required and will be discussed at time of interview.Pay and Work HoursThis position is full-time and pays $14/hour. This is a non-benefitted position with paid earned sick time. The expected work hours are 9:00 to 5:00 with a half hour lunch (37.5 hours per week).The Attorney General’s Office is an Equal Opportunity Employer. As the representative of the Commonwealth and its residents, the Attorney General’s Office strives to ensure that those working in our office reflect the diversity of the communities we serve. The Office encourages applicants from a broad spectrum of backgrounds to apply for positions.

Description: All applicants must submit an application on the company's website to be considered.The next chapter of our future as an aerospace company is here, and we are excited about what this means for our employees and customers! In this dynamic environment, you will have the opportunity to network across our businesses and functions, all while improving the productivity, quality and efficiency of our operations worldwide.Position overviewThe diverse team of people on our Environment, Health and Safety (EH&S) team are motivated by an ambitious goal: to make Collins Aerospace the safest, healthiest aerospace company – with the smallest environmental footprint – on the planet. And the bonds we form – with our customers and with each other -- propel us all higher, again and again. Description: Clean Technology Innovation FellowshipPosition OverviewThe Clean Technology Innovation Fellow will be a part of the innovation team working to support the growth of the Massachusetts clean energy innovation economy and position the Commonwealth as a global leader in clean energy and cleantech innovation. The Technology Development team is charged with understanding the market climate for clean energy industry sectors, recognizing and supporting emerging technologies and market opportunities, and identifying market trends and barriers. The Technology Development team oversees a suite of grant programs to help researchers and emerging companies develop and commercialize their clean energy technologies. The Fellow is an important contributor to the team’s day-to-day operations.The Fellow will assist the Technology Development team with project tracking and management, communication with internal and external stakeholders, program administration, research and analysis activities, and event planning and logistics. The Fellow will contribute to program team meetings; collect and analyze project metrics; perform background research on technologies, companies, or initiatives; and may present results to the team and/or broader organization. The Fellow will have the opportunity to learn the fundamentals of the energy industry, including identifying market strengths and weaknesses of proposed new technologies; to write about and present research results; and to network with clean energy industry stakeholders.Pending reopening plans, the fellowship program at MassCEC includes various educational and networking opportunities, including:Job DutiesPosition QualificationsEducation:Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:SupervisionThe fellow will work under the supervision of the Program Managers in close coordination with staff on the innovation team at MassCEC.SalaryThe fellow will earn $16 per hour and be eligible to work for 35 hours per week.About the Massachusetts Clean Energy Center:The Massachusetts Clean Energy Center (MassCEC), as a quasi-public entity, plays a critical role in fostering the success of our state’s clean energy sector. MassCEC actively supports the Baker-Polito Administration’s commitment to addressing Massachusetts’ energy challenges, maintaining national leadership in clean energy, and meeting the requirements of the Global Warming Solutions Act.MassCEC undertakes targeted programmatic initiatives to accelerate cost reductions in clean energy, help consumers diversify their energy choices and address evolving energy needs, leverage public and private funds to drive investment into this rapidly-growing sector, and scale-up renewable energy deployment across the state.

We develop LIMS, automation, and data query & visualization software to support Translational Immunology, Biochemistry, Proteomics, Molecular Immunology and Cancer Immunology groups.· Programming experience in R, Python or Perl, SQL, JavaScript, web, Unix/Linux shell· Experience and knowledge on relational data model and database development
